Reviews.Title: “Short Trip - Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: nuffinnyc
Reviews.Content: Flew in for a long weekend to meet up with my family from San Diego. Check in was seamless and the room was ready at noon when I arrived. the room was clean and very comfortable - plenty of closet space and drawers. Front Desk very helpful when asking for recommendations on dining, housekeeping staff always had a friendly greeting and was very understanding when we forgot to put the privacy sign on the door - no problem will come back and they did. Check out was sad - didn't want to leave. bill was under the door and just dropped the keys in the bowl on the way out. took the hotel car service back to the airport and the ride was peaceful and relaxing. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding staff, exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: bruinbelle81
Reviews.Content: Omni SF is what every hotel should be. Consistently great service, central location, elegant rooms and a staff that goes above and beyond. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Only mom loves me more”
Reviews.Author: ChinaGilr2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for my birthday weekend. Not only did they accommodate us with an early check-in, they gave us an upgraded room! That evening, we returned to the hotel to find a piece of incredibly good chocolate birthday cake big enough to share, along with chocolate chip cookies milk on a personalized plate for our 11-y/o. I don't think anybody has made such a big fuss over my birthday since I was 11. The following morning - my actual birthday - when we walked into the lobby the front-desk manager sang out, "Happy Birthday!" The location of the hotel is great - within easy walking distance to Chinatown and the Ferry Building. We got excellent advice on restaurants and things to do, and all the staff was very friendly and helpful. This is definitely at the top of my list of places to stay while in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Autumn S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with unmatched customer service! My family accompanied me on a business trip to San Francisco. We were staying at the Omni for the first time because the other hotel(s) we typically stay at while in the city were booked. My husband arrived at noon to attempt to check in with our two children (ages 1 & 2) because the weather prohibited him from taking the kids to do anything else. The staff checked him in immediately, without question or extra charge, and provided backpacks with toys and activities to keep our children busy. Later in the afternoon they brought complimentary chocolate chip cookies & milk for our children. Any time we interacted with staff they were courteous and went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were nice and the hotel itself was very quiet. The hotel itself is in a very central location (financial district, china town, north beach - all walking distance) Because of the incredible customer service we received while there, we have recommended this hotel to all of our friends & colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laud767
Reviews.Content: Just needed a convenient location for a one night stay on our way up the coast. We reserved a night so we could have a nice dinner and see SF's amazing ballet. When Dara Stein found out it was our 40th anniversary she upgraded our room and sent up a very nice champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. She also helped us figure out how we could adjust our driving plans due to the Golden Gate Bridge closing( take the ferry to Sausalito for even more fun and get our car there- no city traffic!). Hotel was beautiful, staff extremely helpful, and it was just a quick walk to the Embercado to find speciality foods for a picnic the next day. Thank you, Dara. Thank you Omni. You got our celebration off to a great start.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea V
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 18-month old, and I stayed at the Omni this last weekend for a quick getaway. I have stayed at some amazing hotels and in beautiful suites but I have never experienced customer service like at the Omni. They really have their stuff together. Upon arrival at mid-day on Friday (in the crazy streets of the Financial District), there was plenty of space in front to park while transferring our car to the Valet. We were greeted warmly by a charming and friendly doorman who gave us quick instructions on how to check in and where to go. The helpful desk staff had us checked in within minutes, during which time we were offered an upgraded room, a mini fridge to hold any needs for our baby, a backpack full of treats and activities for the little one, a short menu to order complimentary breakfast beverages each day of our stay, waived fees for Wi-Fi in our room, a crib for the baby, maps of the city, and any additional needs such as extra pillows, towels, and blankets. Also, we were checking in three hours before 'check-in' time and it was not an issue! (I believe you have to sign up [free] as a member of their loyalty program for some of these benes) The room was amazingly clean with high ceilings that made the room feel even bigger than it is, and it was a good size. The bathroom was large and very clean. Marble floor and counter tops and luxury soaps and other amenities. There was also a hand written note from the housekeeping staff welcoming us to the hotel. After spending just a few minutes there, we left for a few hours to explore the city. Upon our return, the beds had been turned down and there was complimentary milk and cookies, two bottles of water, and another handwritten note from a staff member welcoming us to the hotel. Each time we stepped outside the front doors, we were greeted by a doorman who asked if we needed directions, a map, or suggestions on places to go. At one point, we were outside waiting for our car with at least 15 other people who were waiting for taxis, coming, going, or just standing around and we still received personalized friendly service. Those staff members must love their jobs because they are all so friendly (or they get paid very well)! it was a fantastic experience in customer service and I will definitely stay there again in the future. The room rate was incredibly reasonable at $215 per night which included valet for our car. That rate is almost unheard of in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: After a few days in Yosemite our family spend the weekend in San Francisco. This was our first time staying at an Omni property and we weren't disappointed. Staff was very attentive, hotel had a great locationi and we had a wonderful stay. The chocolate chip cookies and milk were a huge hit with our two boys! Great plan to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Makes All The Difference”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: Sure, there are plenty of beautiful hotels in this city but the Omni is not only beautiful, clean and comfortable but, hands down, has the best customer service I've ever received at any hotel in San Francisco. Everyone from the doorman to the Front Desk staff and the cleaning staff gave superior service. That makes all the difference to me. I needed 2 double beds instead of the 1 king bed I had reserved. No problem (and no charge). Extra pillows? Sure. But the best thing is their rewards program. Free in room wi-fi and coffee delivered to your room every morning. Sold. It's a great area, a few blocks from EVERYTHING. Oh, and sign up for their email offers because I got a great rate at this one and at their New York City hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Steven09
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel and was impressed with the service. The rooms are very comfortable, quite and clean but what makes the difference was the service. Arrived early for check in at around 10:30AM but they had a room ready for us. The concierge was very helpful and the porter did an outstanding job in sorting a minor issue. Well done to the manager which really has a great team.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Januarybride01
Reviews.Content: Superior service - all of the employees from the front desk to the doormen went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was perfect. Highly recommend Waterbar for dinner (overlooking the Bay Bridge) and if you are lucky enough to be there on a Saturday morning, take a quick walk to the Ferry Building for the market. We will surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: drif99
Reviews.Content: From the front of house staff, to bellboys, maids, drivers.. they're all accommodating, polite, friendly and BEST OF ALL, the hotel doesn't feel as much as a hotel like the big chains. For that very reason, I love the Omni SF. I stayed there for 9 nights for work and pleasure in April, and was not disappointed. It's reasonably accessable, but there is a little walk to Market St if all you want to do is shop 24/7. Sign up for their guest program for free wifi. Also make sure of the ciders or teas near the front reception to satisfy your parched mouth when you return from your day out. When I'm back in SF, this will be my hotel of choice without a doubt. Hopefully, this will be urs too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Doug G
Reviews.Content: We found our trip to the Omni to be nice, but nothing special. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful for the too nights we were there. The room was above average, but our view was of and office building on the 4th floor. The location of the Omni is right in the middle of the Financial District but there are no real touristy landmarks close and parking can be a little tough, so tough that we after the first day, we just let the valet park it and take the $10 per night extra charge. All in all, not a bad hotel, but perhaps, not exactly what we needed for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful respite in a large city”
Reviews.Author: GoodToGoGirl
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Omni. I was surprised, because traditional style is not my personal taste. But this one won my heart. The property is lovely, clean, cared for, and the service is top notch. Our deluxe room was spacious and comfortable, and the bed was excellent. I also liked the location downtown...so easy to get anywhere you want to go, either by cab or by foot. I would definitely stay here again! Well done, Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: Bhen
Reviews.Content: I travel to SF on business 4-5 times a year. I have tried several hotels and the Omni is my 1st choice. There is something special about the hotel and I feel good every time I walk into the lobby. The doormen are very friendly and often say,"welcome home" if you have been out for the evening. The front desk staff are warm and efficient and the rooms are very comfortable. I enjoy the restaurant for breakfast and the bar is very good in the evening for a cocktail. Love the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Great City, nice hotel.....leave the car at home.....”
Reviews.Author: Remy12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the weekend free while in town for a conference. We enjoyed this hotel, great location just a few blocks from the ferry building and all it has to offer and much more. The room was on the "backside" of the hotel so the view was limited but the room was very quiet. Nice firm mattress, nice amenities and in good clean repair.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: don't really get the other reviews - there is nothing wrong here at all just not special - rooms ok service ok very small entrance area - tiny bar - very average restaurant - its just ok

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Great service”
Reviews.Author: Silly_galoots
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love the OMNI hotel in San Francisco! Location was wonderful - really close to Chinatown/Nob Hill and a few minutes walk to Union Square. Having the cable car stop across from the hotel was great! The entire staff were so very helpful. This place totally ROCKS!!! Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in SF!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmanfrompompey
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the OMNI after reading the great reviews here on TA and we were not disappointed at all, From the moment we arrived until we left the service was first class, lovely and attentive staff, good size room which was very well decorated and cleaned The front desk staff and concierge were extremely helpful with directions etc and really helped us get our bearings; this was extremely useful as we were first time visitors to San Francisco I have to agree with just about all of the previous comments from other TA reviews that this is indeed a really nice hotel to stay in, just on the edge of the financial district and about a block away from China Town, the only slight down side would be the cost of eating at the hotel itself, especially breakfast which is just too much, that said there are plenty of places in San Francisco to eat so go and enjoy Would we stay here again? Most certainly yes

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location. Wonderful staff. Super baby friendly.”
Reviews.Author: zhenova
Reviews.Content: Only had the pleasure of staying the Omni for two nights. First impression was that the hotel is a bit old and lacks some modern and standard amenities such as bedside lighting control. However, it didn't take long for me to fall in love with the hotel. Excellent service and staff - everyone from the bell boy to front desk staff as well as the housekeeping staff are genuinely friendly and tries their best to provide the best service possible. Free wifi and wired internet and 2 free pressed laundry per day if you become a Select Member, which are close to non-existent in most hotels of this class. Oh and they serve free Starbucks brewed coffee in the morning and warm apple cider in the afternoon of a rainy day. Comfortable rooms - While a bit lacking, the bed is super comfy. Bathroom is roomy and well maintained. Robes in the bathroom are simply heavenly. Baby Friendly - we have an infant with us. While Omni didn't give us cookies and milk (as if she can eat it any way), we were able to get a crib immediately upon checking in and even a baby tub, which was unexpected! Location - Really can't complain. Cable car passes right in front of the hotel. Walking distance to chinatown, Union Square and public transportation that can take you anywhere in SF. When it comes to hotels, it's the details that make the experience, and Omni is all about the details. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Stay In Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Treelines
Reviews.Content: After a few hundred stays in hotels you become numb to most. Rarely you find an old fashion guest house that treats you like a king with impeccable service and amenities fit for a king. The Omni is one of those places. You will also get one of the best cups of coffee in San Francisco. This is a place you book your boss in before he makes the decision on who gets that empty vice presidency.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring SFO”
Reviews.Author: Tilley72
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed with husband for 4 night break in SFO. Booked Omni based on other trip advisor reviews and we were not disapointed. Great customer service on check in. One of the first checks they made was if we wanted to visit Alcatraz, explaining that the trips are booked up heavily in advance and suggesting they made a booking immediately for us to ensure we didn't miss out. We booked a signature room and found this to be a really good size with an extremely comfortable bed. The walls must be thick as for once we didn't hear any other guest noise which was impressive considering our room was immediately across from the lifts. Only improvements I would suggest to Omni is better bathroom products, fluffier towels and complimentary water on arrival. In terms of location, it's a short walk to the Ferry building (great spot for lunch) and its a 25 minute walk to Coit tower taking in China Town and Little Italy. The tram runs directly outside the Omni although it's only 15 min walk to Union Square. Top tip: have good walking shoes as it's so easy to explore a lot of SFO on foot from the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Hopo14
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, full of charm. The beds are so comfy with soft pillows and soft lighting. The bathrooms are spacious and clean, this is one of the most comfortable hotels I have stayed in on trips to the USA. Staff are curteous and polite and always willing to go the extra mile to help you.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: gotraveler86
Reviews.Content: this was the first stop on our honeymoon. had an amazing experience. staff is extremely friendly. room's are pretty. the have a character of there own n r not like typical "hotel rooms". we were given free champagne as it was our HONEYMOON..:):):)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very child/toddler friendly”
Reviews.Author: kazzzac
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful stay at the Omni with my family, consisting of a baby and a toddler. I cannot rave on enough about the staff that work there, from the doormen, the bellboys, front desk, conceirge and even the housekeeping. They were all were incredible, interacting with my children and making them feel welcome. They even provided milk and cookies every night for the kids, which was a very nice touch. The concierge also managed to get us a very last minute booking to a popular restaurant, which was fantastic. Location was good, although not quite in Union square (about a 10 min walk) but close to chinatown and great places for quick takeaways and food. The rooms were good, spacious and clean. And as most have already indicated, sign up to be a member of their frequent travellers program and get free wifi! Would definitely stay there again if we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Virginia S
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Omni SF. Every aspect of the accommodations met or exceeded our expectations. It's central location allowed us to easily walk...to the Giants game...to the Tadich Grill...to Union Square. Parking was on site, and, on the weekend, reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: CarinJK
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have stayed in in San Francisco. (I live in Northern California and often have business in the city). It is beautiful, clean, and well turned out-beautifully designed. The staff from the desk clerk, to the doorman, to the valet, to the house keeping personnel were all friendly and helpful and seemed to take pride in working at the hotel, as they should. The front desk gave us choices of rooms to fit our individual needs (quiet vs, view) and were efficient and helpful. While it is pricey as are all things in the city, we felt the rate was a great value for what we experienced. It is a block from the Pyramid building in the business district and there is easy transportation choices all around. It also is a safer area of the city. The parking fee was a bit steep, but not abnormal in San Francisco and there may be alternatives with this hotel-they are very accommodating. You do get some very good perks if you join the Omni preferred customer plan such as free internet services. Check it out for a beautiful stay!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: pzs200
Reviews.Content: This is a little late since this was a President's Day trip. The lobby is beautiful. The staff attentive. The rooms are comfortable. Ask for a higher room and try to get a view and avoid the noise of the cable car that runs in front of the hotel. Because it's in the financial district, it's pretty quiet on the weekends. Upgrade to the wifi, it's worth it. Spent some time in the bar. The food was ok and service decent. Expect at least 1-2 wedding parties there on any weekend. But you can walk to Chinatown, the Embarcadero and, if you dare, up to the Huntington (excellent bar/restaurant). I used to stay in J-town at Hotel kabuki because it's an area where there is plenty of street parking and generally quiet. So if you have a car, you will need to pay for parking at the omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, confortable”
Reviews.Author: Stripolias
Reviews.Content: Confortable and huge room, great room service. Definitely worth the price. At breakfast, try continental - great option for foreign people who want to enjoy fresh SF food. And great location - near Embarcadero and China Town.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ph03nix
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in omni hotel in Boston so chose another Omni as it was a safe bet it would also be good. The rooms are large and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, the location was great. All in all pretty much what you would want for the first visit somewhere

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything like the Ritz Carlton without the fancy name, fancy prices (Omni isn't cheap but not ridiculously priced for their services & ambiance), and staff is caring and much friendlier. The Omni in San Francisco was in itself an experience; the reason we had such a great time while visiting this city.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at Omni”
Reviews.Author: sfallsguy
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a great choice and we relied heavily on the reviews posted here on tripadvisor in making the decision to stay at this hotel. I would echo many of the prior reviews, staff was superb, location was excellent, view not so good from 4th floor...but who stays in the room anyway! California St Cable car right out the front door, which easlily connected to the Powell-Hyde line which drops you directly at Fishermans' Wharf. At the Wharf you can easily grab the F Line trolley and ride from the Wharf all the way to Castro area. The Ferry building is within a few blocks..very easy walk from the Omni. Two block walk drops you in the thick of Chinatown. Highly recommend!! Stayed four nights from April 4-8, 2012

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bobo-chan
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to stay in this hotel on past weekend. It is centrally located, facing financial district and backing to China town. So we enjoyed walking around, hopped on cable car to go to other areas. All of hotel staff were very nice. Vallet parking was a quite high, but I think that is what everyone else charge in the area. I want to give them 5 in rating. The reason of it is our car key was lost. They first had a hard time to locate the car (took a while), then realized a key is missing. We eneded up spending the whole day in SF instead of leaving to Napa ealier on that day, but it turned out OK. When we came back to stay 1 night after stayed in Napa, they gave us rooms in higher level and free breakfact bouchers to appologize for the trouble. We liked the hotel and we will come back to stay for next time in SF.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Muki59
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit our daughter for her college Spring break instead of flying her back home to NY. We booked the Omni for three nights. We were welcomed with warm smiles and cordial, pleasant greetings throughout our stay. Our room did not have a thing out of place and all amenities met our expectations. Our first day was rain from morning to night. We took the China town walking tour, then did our own exploration. The hotel provided umbrellas that day for all guests. The hotel is centrally located for walking to many of the sightseeing highlights. If walking is not to your liking, the public transportation is nearby which I must admit we used at the end of the day. Having traveled throughout Europe, USA, Mexico, Latin America, and Mexico, this was one of our best hotel visits. Our ages, 67, 52, &20.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit to a Favorite San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpb0344
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Omni again for a long Easter weekend. The Omni is in a convenient location on the California St. cable car line and getting around is easy. The hotel is comfortable, spotless and up-to-date. My highest regards are for the staff who universally went out of their way to be welcoming and helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: CAMurphthesurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni recently, third weekend in three years. Very nice, clean, and service oriented hotel. Good size rooms, especially if you get one of the suites. We've found over the years the weekend rates are quite good compared to other high-end SF hotels due to the Financial district location. We prefer this location as it is an easy walk to the Ferry Bldg, Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, SOMA, etc. All the staff are welcoming and friendly, rooms are ultra clean, good bar. Valet parking is a bit high, but you can park at the public garage overnight at California/Kearny, just up one block.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: _TL_68
Reviews.Content: We booked the Omni for a two-night weekend stopover. The location is quiet and ideal for easy walking to the main attractions. Very friendly and helpful staff. Not majorly impressed with the restaurant. Would stay here again if we ever return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Classical Feeling Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fettuchi
Reviews.Content: We traveled just after Christmas and just before the New Year. The hotel was beautifully decorated in a very classic style. The public space was very nice. The rooms were very nice, but the bathroom could have used a little bit of updating, but it matched the classic, almost vintage quality of the hotel. The service was great - whether in person or on the phone. They also did a nice job of having apple and hot cider available in the lobby for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlabate216
Reviews.Content: def a very business oriented hotel, but it still good for anyone heading on vacation to san fran. the hotel is in a business district, but also not very far from any attractions. the rooms are beautiful, well kept, and the staff is amazing. we stayed here for part of our honeymoon, and they upgraded us to one of the suites! great hotel and def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milo3056
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by my beautiful room upon arrival. Very spacious and furnished with high standards.The staff go out of their way to please and make you fell very welcome. I love having breakfast in the restarant every monring during my stay...as it filled me up until dinner. It's close to all great sigh seeing locations and is a step away from the famous cable car. I would definately stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to improve on perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I throughly enjoyed our recent stay at the OMNI Hotel San Francisco. The service, ambiance, staff consideration, and feeling of welcomeness, certainly enhanced our six day visit. This is our second OMNI, we stay at the OMNI Royal Orleans when ever in New Orleans and have never been disappointed there either. It's hard to go home after spending a week at an OMNI! Thanks to all for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: SJ S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quiet and well-appointed with marble bathrooms. The staff of both the hotel and restaurant are top notch from the valet to the clerks. The location is convenient to the financial district as well as Union Square and Chinatown. Sign up for their hotel guest reward program and receive complimentary beverage and newspaper in the morning delivered right to your door. You will feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Omni this weekend for a quick business meeting and brought my wife along. At first impression she absolutely loved it. The warm tea to cut through the cold SF weather was perfect service. The ambiance, the cleanliness, all up to usual Omni standards. You just cannot ask for much more than what the Omni provides. SF has a lot of hotel options for those in town for a quick getaway or for work purposes, but I would not hesitate to stay at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Wonderful Staff. Very Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Francisco Omni from 17th to 24th March. This was my second stay at the hotel and I am pleased to say that I found it as excellent as my first visit. Firstly, I have to thank Sarah Crown for her assistance in dealing with my room request prior to my stay. She gave first class customer service and it was an absolute pleasure to deal with her. Secondly I would like to comment on a couple of reviews below which I believe are unfair to the housekeeping staff. My experience at the Omni is that the same high standard of cleaning is carried out irrespective of whether a tip is left or not and housekeepers are certainly not noisy. I stayed for five nights on my first visit and seven nights this time. On each occasion I cannot fault anything about the way in which my room was maintained. As far as I am concerned the housekeepers are friendly, hard working and meticulous. I certainly did not hear any door slamming by them and I was in and out of my room at various times during the day. The only door slamming I heard was in the early hours of the morning by guests returning to their rooms. I very much doubt that the housekeepers are cleaning rooms at 02.47! As an aside, I fail to understand why some guests have no consideration for other people and seem incapable of shutting a door quietly rather than attempting to remove it from it’s hinges. Perhaps they live in door less houses and have not fully grasped the concept of how a door should be closed! OK, having gotten that off my chest, I will get to the review. Although I have previously reviewed this hotel it is a real pleasure to spend time preparing another review as the standard of the hotel warrants it. The location is great. An easy transfer from SFO by BART and short (flat) walk up Montgomery. It is only a short distance to Union Sq and an equally short distance to North Beach and my favourite bars! An excellent welcome and speedy check in from staff who really seem to want to go that extra mile to be helpful. All the staff I encountered were, in fact, first class in all respects. Rooms are a good size and, as aforementioned, well maintained. Beds are comfortable and there is a good selection of pillows. The Wi Fi signal is strong and I suggest joining the (free) Select Guest programme to avoid a $9.95 daily charge. Other benefits of the programme include complimentary water, beverages and turn down service. It is well worth spending the short time it takes to join. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room and also a mini bar. The large comfortable chair and footrest were particularly beneficial after a day negotiating the hills of San Francisco. I can’t comment on the bar or Bob’s Steak and Chop House as I haven’t used either. To be quite honest there are so many great places to eat and drink in this wonderful city it seems a shame not to get out and enjoy them. I have seriously lost count of the number of hotels I have stayed in over the years both for business and leisure. I have a lot of experience of the good and the bad and, take it from me, I am not easily pleased especially as regards noise and cleanliness. The San Francisco Omni is, without any shadow of doubt, one of the best hotels I have stayed in and ticks all the boxes. My next stay is already booked for September and I fully intend to return in 2013. My advice is to give it a try. I am certain you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZodiacHalifax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and we could walk to all the main sights. Fisherman's Wharf is about a half hour walk, Chinatown is right next door, Union Square about 15 minutes, the Ferry terminal 10 minutes and market Street shops about 20 minutes. The hotel is quiet, the rooms are very comfortable and the service is excellent. The restaurant and bar are not cheap but we enjoyed a good breakfast and friendly service in the bar. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler123
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Our room was large and comfortable. The bathroom was big and well appointed, with plenty of lighting. (I appreciate incandescent lights instead of those horrible CFL's.) The staff provides excellent service without hovering. This hotel is at the edge of the financial district--a wonderful location. The neighborhood is clean, safe and it was an easy walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, and Nob Hill. We easily used public buses to get to further parts of the city and the BART to get to the airport. I can't imagine finding a nicer and more convenient place to stay in San Francisco. Hint: join their loyalty program before booking so that you can enjoy member benefits, like morning coffee and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: docbroker
Reviews.Content: This is a great location! We were able to walk to Union Square, Ferry Terminal Building, shopping malls and more. The cable car is right out front as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful (yet chilly) city”
Reviews.Author: Astrobeemer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. Check in was a breeze, although we were checked in online and were supposed to have the keys on the board waiting for us, but they were not, but that was not a big problem as the check in at the desk was fast. Vallet was decently fast every time we called the car. The staff in general was exeptionally friendly and smiling. The room was clean and sifficiently spacious for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TN_Traveller_12
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent a week in SF and stayed at the Omni. We had the Kids Fantasy Suite, which is a pair of adjoining rooms. The adult room is a pretty typical hotel room. The kids' room is decorated with Pottery Barn Kids items and looks like the catalog. There are bunkbeds, beanbag chairs, lots of stuffed animals, and milk/cookies delivered every night. The hotel was very comfortable. We found the concierge and front desk staff to be extremely helpful in arranging things or making suggestions. The hotel's location, between the Financial District and Chinatown, was very convenient. We could easily walk to the Ferry Building along the Embarcadero. The California line cable car goes right in front of the hotel. There are many, many restaurants within easy walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: MoxieTripBuddy
Reviews.Content: Do not discount this hotel because it is not located in fisherman's wharf. This hotel is in the perfect location. We walked everywhere without difficulty. The service was great. Just be sure to sign up for the rewards program thing. Free coffee, tea, or juice in the AM and free wifi are so worth it. We paid extra to be on a higher floor with a better view. We were on the 9 th floor and could see out onto California street. The robes in the rooms are so soft and the beds are extra comfy. Large safe in the closet fits medium size objects nicely. There is a mini bar, but we avoided the temptation. You can catch the street car right outside the door and you are steps from great neighborhoods. The financial district does slow down a bit on the weekends and is all a buzz during the week with worker bee energy. The staff at the hotel are friendly and bend over backwards accommodating. Not if but when I return to SF I will definitely choose the Omni again. There is no pool, so this maybe a draw back for those with small children who enjoy such things.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Emurray910
Reviews.Content: The Omni is right across the street from 555 California Avenue, which is one of the tallest buildings in SF. It is extremely convenient to the cable cars and you can purchase Muni passes at the hotel. There are several quality restaurants nearby and it is a short cable car ride away from the shopping district at Union Square. The rooms are spacious and clean with decent views. Hotel staff is friendly and knowledgable of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: The property was very nicely furnished and spotless, but you can find that at any of a number of fine hotels in the area. What makes the Omni worth coming back to is the staff - every one of them was fantastic and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni just before Christmas and really enjoyed the experience. The rooms are nice, decor not to my taste but ticked all the boxes. The location was great although the immediate area was a bit dead at the weekend. One complaint was that you had to pay for WiFi, annoying when you get it free in most budget hotels! Luckily there are lots of coffee shops nearby to get it for free. By far the best bit of the stay was the staff - so friendly & attentive. One guy in particular stood out as an amazing ambassador for the hotel, Taen, who worked at the front desk/gave out champagne/escorted us to our room/acted as a tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “you must tip the cleaning stuff if you want a clean room, tea, or coffee every day”
Reviews.Author: lovebalancelife
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the room the first evening we found a hand written note wishing us a pleasant stay signed by the maid. The last time I saw this was in Cuba where the stuff is under paid. The maid (cleaning stuff) did not vacuum our room, sweep the bathroom floor, or replenish tea/coffee/sugar/ toiletries, unless we were to leave a tip. My “left over” hair (I have long hair) was left on the bathroom floor for the three days we had staid and so were the pillows we took of the beds the first night, and the Stair-stick I dropped on the carpet. The coffee machine was not put in place ( one has to take it out of the cupboard and place it on the desk to connect it to the electricity), and the old news-paper which I placed in the Trash Can, was spread open on the desk as if someone had let the room and will come back to finish reading the news. We had left one towel the floor, to be replaced, and the rest on the hangers to dry, as we were instructed in the note left by hotel management, claiming to be “green”. Nevertheless all towels were replaced. We were told that the stuff is instructed that if one towel is to be replaced all towels should be replaced. When we had asked for information from the front desk stuff, and truly they were very friendly and did their best to help us, we were told that the Head Concierge who strolls in (literally) at 11 knows best. True, he does know a lot, but he also knows how to make people feel very small by playing the "Educated Snob" with a 16 years old kid. The Door Man is very friendly, but for the life of me I do not understand how a Door Man can retire at 55, (three years from now), and can afford to buy a retirement property in South America, unless this is from the” tips policy” at Omni. He did tell us that a specific Coffee Shop is the best for breakfast ( he did not even hear about the one we were asking about) but forgot to mention that the time was 11 am and they do not serve breakfast nor lunch at that time, and we would we have to wait half an hour before we would to be able to order more than just pastry and coffee. When we booked in I asked for a quite room and indeed we got one. Except I do not understand why the garbage bins have to be emptied every night after 11pm and not before 10 pm which is the time most social etiquette agree as usual as down time. If one wants to stay at a hotel which is in a convenient location (and there are a lot of hotels which are in a convenient location like this Sheraton which is the hotel we moved to ) and where the stuff is a collection of snobs this is the hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sleepy38
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel in good downtown location. Really nice old building, excellent staff and service (especially John who checked us in). Up to date and clean rooms and very good value compared to other hotels of the same class in the city. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Omni has style and grace”
Reviews.Author: DonTomas333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in San Franciscos financial district with China town and the Italian North side in its backyard. The service is first class and the rooms are large, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: mobie0309
Reviews.Content: We will be back. Fantastic room (they upgraded us to a huge suite) and service. Easy walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the Embarcadero. Nice touch with the Nespresso machines in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scribble96
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Here's what we loved: the service from the staff is exceptional. Very warm, very genuine and they truly seem happy that you're staying at the Omni. The bed is very comfortable and the room was clean and large for San Francisco. We location is very central and you can walk to many good spots. Parking is expensive (that's a basic truth for SF) and you'll need to be an Omni member to enjoy the Wifi (sign up at their website and it's free). This is a great hotel and we felt the price was equal to the service, the quality and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: jeanniedc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Omni for 4 nights. I was at a business meeting a few blocks from the hotel, and he was sightseeing. We both felt this was an excellent hotel. The service was very efficient from a very friendly staff who went out of their way to please. The room was well designed with plenty of desk and drawer space, and a very comfortable bed. (only complaint was suboptimal shower pressure; not a big problem). My husband used the fitness center several times and said it was great. Being a member of the Omni rewards program was a big benefit, as others have described. Getting coffee and o.j. brought to the room in the morning with the NY Times was very nice! (as was free wifi). A comment about location. Yes, this hotel is not right at Union Square or near Fisherman's Wharf. But we found it very easy to walk everywhere from the hotel: close to the Ferry building at the Embarcadero, close to the Yerba Buena Gardens area/MOMA, very close to Chinatown. We walked to North Beach for dinner in 10 minutes. I agree that the area does get quiet on the weekend, but there are plenty of good restaurants nearby for dinner. (Tadich Grill, Boulevard, etc.) We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakob V
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice staff and a very nice room. I even got a really good deal on a 5 night stay, so I have no complaints what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “A true treat to stay here... great service!!”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastTravelr
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Omni, and it did not disappoint. When it comes to customer service, the entire staff is phenomenal. We received consistently good service from valet, bell service, front desk and housekeeping... everyone worked together seamlessly to make our stay a pleasant one. I arrived a bit stressed after a challenging drive, but the valet and bell staff quickly brought me back down to a peaceful calm with a kind welcome, prompt assistance with our bags and huge smiles. Our check-in was warm, quick and welcoming, and the desk agent offered great suggestions for dinner ideas without us even asking. A few moments later, our bellman welcomed us to our room where there were cold milks and cookies already waiting for our kids (that was SUPER impressive given we were not in the check-in area very long and gave no warning of arrival prior to walking in the door). Our room was clean and the furniture and carpeting was in great shape. We found the beds to be very comfortable (although because we are four to a room, queen beds would be very nice to have instead of just doubles). The second day of our stay we made a big oops and left the privacy sign on the door as we went out to explore the City. When we returned around dinner time, our room hadn't been cleaned, but we had a message from housekeeping explaining why. We requested our room be "freshened up" while we went out to dinner if possible, and it was cleaned and ready to go when we returned about an hour and a half later. We have stayed in the City many times before, and we love to walk and use public transportation, so we don't mind that much of the Financial District is quiet and closed on the weekends, but if you want something very close by, you should be aware that it can be a challenge. We love to walk and take public transportation -- we find that both are very easy to do from this location, even with kids. Chinatown is literally three blocks away, and Union Square and the Embarcadero are also quite easy to walk to. The cable car picks up right out front the hotel, and the front desk often has muni tickets for sale, which is super nice!!! We really do love the Omni and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: skitowin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my wife. I was on business and she tagged along to enjoy the best of SF. The room was spacious and comfortable. The mattress and pillows were good but not excellent. What excelled here was the staff. From the valet parking attendants forward we met great people who seemed happy in thier jobs and truly reached out to help us. The front desk staff told us about signing up for a free frequent traveler program that would give us free internet access. This was golden. We would come again. Two niggles that prevented top rating...one was the quality of the towels/linens. A lot of ground could be made up here. Second concerned our last day. We had originally scheduled a check out on Saturday but decided at the last moment to stay another night. I called to extend one day, and assumed that I would be connected with the front desk. I was sent to a call center and spent time winding through a menu of questions only to be asked where I wanted to stay....I was offered a different room and a different rate. I decided to try a different hotel. On the way out I asked if the hotel was near full, and they told me no, that they had plenty of rooms...this process could have been much more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ribbaz
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Great location; even though it was near the financial district it was still close to everything. The cable car is literally right out the front door. It was fabulous - like an 'E" ride at Disneyland (okay so I'm giving away my age). The service/staff were excellent - always polite and helpful. And the rooms very nice, plus the beds had 'fitted sheets'. Your bed doesn't come apart when you get in it. You are right below Nob Hill - took the cable car up and stopped at the Mark Hopkins and the Fairmont. Two outstanding properties in SF; but we liked the Omni better - beautiful lobby and comfortable; homey even.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: Remgirl1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Omni via a conference group rate for $175/night, two nights, Sat-Mon. While booking, there was an option to enroll in the hotel loyalty program, which I did because it was free. Laura, at the front desk checked us in and was wonderful. We anticipated not being able to check in because it was around noon, and leaving our luggage for a few hours. However, Laura explained to us that by joining the loyalty program we were awarded with early check-in, free in-room wi-fi, complementary pressing and shoe shine, and breakfast beverage service for each of us every morning of our stay. She tipped us off that if we order one coffee, there was enough in the pot for three cups, so it would be wise to order one coffee, and one juice to share. Made perfect sense to me and was probably not something I would think of myself, so that was nice of her (its the little things like that, that make me happy). We were given room #1108, which is a standard King. The hotel is in the financial district, so our room looked out immediately to other office buildings. Good location if you want a better chance of less night life street noise. I was a bit disappointed that the windows were not well sound-proofed, and what little street noise there was, we heard clearly. Unfortunately, the same could be said of the walls. For both nights of our stay we were sandwiched between guests with small children. We could tell exactly when the guests were in their rooms with the children playing, crying, whining, and the age-old argument between a wife complaining to her husband about not being able to shower because she had to watch the kids. The bed was very comfortable, even when we were shaken awake by the small earthquake that Monday morning :) The wi-fi was actually decent!!! Both my husband and I were able to go wi-fi only at the same time, a rarity it seems at hotels. Although I don't use it, I liked that the hotel provided spray starch for ironing. Good business hotel touch. The bathroom was spacious for a standard size room, the products were customized via Sysco but still nice, the shower pressure good, and well lit. I always appreciate it when hotels provide robes. The cons: Few. Aside from the "thin" walls and windows, if you stay on the weekend, all the really close-by breakfast food places are closed. I'm not a big breakfast eater, but I do like to be able to quickly run out, grab a pastry, and then come back to the hotel to get ready for the day. On weekdays this isn't a problem because there are many cafes that cater to the business crowd. La Boulange is right across the street and is probably the best option. Overall, a very pleasant experience and I would recommend the Omni easily for the business traveler. I was immediately impressed by the loyalty program providing exceptional perks on only the first stay. A free pot of coffee is definitely a cheap way for a hotel to make a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite SF hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in San Francisco and so far I think this is my favourite. At first I was a little leery of staying in the financial district but when I realized how close I was to everything (my preferred mode of transportation is walking), I was thrilled. It's easy to walk to the Ferry Building (Farmers' Market on Saturday), to Chinatown & North Beach and even to SOMA. Our room was large and the king size bed was very comfortable with great pilllows and sheets. Two robes were provided (hotels that only provide one drive me nuts). There is nothing trendy about the decor but it's inobtrusive and very comfortable. The bathroom was very large with a separate and spacious shower and nice amenities. Maid service was sympathetic and inobtrusive. The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful, with the exception of one person (who helped lose the fifth star in this review). All in a all, a great stay and I can easily recommend this hotel. Why did it lose a star? The gentleman who checked us in was okay at first but when he found out where we were from, not that pleasant. I guess he didn't like a city in our country. Wow. That was WEIRD, dude! When we asked him for restaurant recommendations for lunch (we had just flown in and were tired) he just vaguely waved his arms and said "there are hundreds around here, take your pick". Unhelpful. However, subsequent front desk staff were lovely. Low battery in our in-room safe. Lodgenet was terrible quality. I don't like paying for Wi-Fi. I find it cheap on the hotel's part. Overall however, I like the hotel and I'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “i left my heart in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: barbadosluv
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great location. Steps from fisherman wharf, union square, and any mode of public transportation. My room had two flat screen tvs, sofa, and huge bathroom. The lobby had fresh hot apple cider and apples to enjoy. I would definitely stay at this omni again. One note, I have been craving the oven roasted garlic crabs since returning back to dc area. Please do not miss out on ths s.f treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year on business trips and love it. The service is great, and the rooms are very nice. The cable car runs right outside the front door and Chinatown is just 2 blocks up the hill. One of my favorites in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Very good location (near financial district, but also walking distance to great shopping -- speaking of which, Westfields shopping centre on Market has the most plentiful shops, plus the Embarcadero has good shopping as well). My room on the 7th floor appeared to have been recently renovated. Was a little loud, though, with the window open as the cable car was right outside. I thought the front desk staff were great. My air conditioning wouldn't work and as a result I had a poor night's sleep, but I should have let the hotel know and asked them to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PippaJA
Reviews.Content: We've been to San Francisco before and this was our first stay at the Omni. The location is great, loads of things to do and see within walking distance. The hotel service is exceptional and the rooms clean and nicely furnished. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Room without a View”
Reviews.Author: puttvin
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service from all employees except for checkin which was hectic. My superior city view turned out to be of the air conditioning units of the building across Montgomery st. Do not stay there if a view is important as I looked at 3 other rooms with equal or slightly better views.The restaurant has an outstanding breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the weekend, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Melina619
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely helpful and positive. The hotel was beautiful, especially the lobby. Didn't spend much time at the hotel but would go there again, the convenient location in the Financial District is great! Just a few blocks away from Montgomery BART station. Hardly slept at all because the neighbors were having a porn fest or something, but I guess that isn't really the hotels fault. :/

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.....great location”
Reviews.Author: TerriK55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed here for one night, but would have been very happy to stay longer. We were pleased from the minute we pulled up in front of the hotel until the moment we left. We were greeted by a very helpful and eager doorman who immediately helped us with our luggage. The lobby is large and elegant with a magnificent floral arrangement sitting on a table front and center. The staff was very gracious and helpful. The rooms are a little larger than average and the bathroom was marble with nice amenities. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel to take you to all the main attractions. The hotel is also within a short walk to Chinatown, although I believe its location would be considered in the financial district. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but it was quite crowded, so I'm guessing that it must be good. When we checked out, we asked the doorman to call us a cab, but instead, he escorted us to a Lincoln town car that was sitting right in front of the hotel, which took us to the airport for the same cost as a cab, but a much more comfortable ride. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmelcpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel on a Saturday evening in February. Valet parking was efficient, and check-in was quite efficient as well. The room we got was nicely appointed, and very comfortable. While we did not have a view of anything other than into the windows of office buildings behind the hotel, it was definitely quiet, with no hint of street noise. We had a formal event to attend, and when we indicated that we wanted to get a cab, the doorman put us in the hotel limo. That was very nice, although the driver was not familiar enough with other hotels in the city, and had to ask directions twice for a 4-block ride from the OMNI to the Ritz Carlton. He was mortified, and very apologetic, and we basically giggled about it after we got to the Ritz. We did not use any of the restaurants, but did have a cocktail at the bar. Drinks had the expected hefty price tag, but the bartender provided hefty pours for the price. Check-out was smooth, and the staff very efficient. Valet parking advertises a 15-minute lead time for retreival of the car, but ours was up in about 5 minutes. Valet parking on the weekend was only $27, which is a decent deal in downtown San Francisco. We were very pleased with the OMNI, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason the Omni SF is one of the top ten romantic hotels!”
Reviews.Author: cnsmama
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Omni SF, our hotel of choice for our 'date nights' away from the kids. As always, service was amazing and is what truly sets the Omni apart from other chains. The room cost is comparable to a Mariott yet the experience is like a Ritz. This time they upgraded us to the presidential suite (see photos)! Rest assured, we'll keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “upscale”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Classically appointed hotel within walking distance of union square. Only a few blocks from the Saturday farmer's market in the Ferry Building - a must do weekend experience. The room was beautifully furnished with a super comfortable mattress

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Elaine T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary and to see the Chinese New Year's Parade. The location was perfect for walking to Chinatown and North Beach. Our room was spacious and so comfortable; very quiet too. We were pleasantly surprised when the staff delivered 6 chocolate covered strawberries and a large bottle of champagne to help us celebrate our anniversary. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend a visit to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Class act in the Financial Center”
Reviews.Author: zarkmud
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Hotwire.com. It was discounted as a 4-Star and if anything, it was a five star. It was impossible to find any dirt...ANYWHERE and I looked. The rooms were perfect, the staff helpful and to be so close to the financial center, B O A Building, Transamerica Building and so many great restaurants not to mention the nearby cable cars...well, try it. Remember, San Franciscans try to ignore the fare collector on the cable cars-locals believe tourists should pay. Sometimes they get away with it but it is fun to watch them hide from the cable car operator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good service.”
Reviews.Author: kidstogo
Reviews.Content: Central location, lovely rooms, well equipped not the cheapest place to stay but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, Great Staff, Good Location for Car”
Reviews.Author: Meenanall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the spur of the moment due to a funeral. Huge rooms and bath. Great welcome, great valet (taught me how to turn off and start new Volvo S80!). Great access to restaurants across street, wharf and minutes from Union Square. Their breakfast was one of the best I have ever eaten. Would stay again for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: 321Trainfan321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the financial district, not in one of the most trendy or touristy spots but that makes it very liveable especially on the weekends. The cable car is right outside the door (worth the wait), the farmer's market 5 minutes away is a must-see and then a historic streetcar will take you to Fishermans' Wharf (if you must go). The hotel is very clean and in excellent condition, we were given a nice upgrade without asking. It's the staff that makes it such a great spot, from the door staff to the front desk and housekeeping, it seems they couldn't do enough for us. Our concierge Juan deserves an extra mention, he was very helpful to first time visitors. Don't underestimate the value of helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect dependablility”
Reviews.Author: Martha Jane S
Reviews.Content: The Omni is our choice when we visit our son in San Francisco. The higher floors are so wonderfully quite. The location is perfect for us on lower California Street. The Omni has never been a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaMoira
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a fabulous stay from the reviews, but really it was just ok. The only exceptional part of the stay is the free wifi and morning coffee for joining their rewards program, otherwise it's pretty average. Yes, the staff is friendly, but there is really nothing special here that makes it better than other up market hotels. The decor is average, the beds are soft and saggy and I'm pretty sure I could hear the doorman sneeze 17 floors below because while the in hotel sound proofing is pretty good, you can hear everything outside the hotel. Disappointing and not very restful.

Reviews.Title: “large hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: Living in the Bay Area it is fun to spend the occasional weekend in the City. Checking tripadvisor I first learned of the existence of the Omni Hotel and noted the positive write-ups. Just back from a three-day stay, I am impressed in the way this hotel is run and must give kudos to the hotel manager. It is smaller than the usual four-star chain hotel and the experience of staying there is much more personal. The hotel is very well run as all the staff greets you with a smile and a pleasantry - from the door man, to the front desk, to the security guard and to the housekeeping. The employees seemed to enjoy working at the hotel and with each other and appeared to be pleased to see me there as a guest. This was very different than the anonymous feeling one gets at the larger hotels. The hotel itself is what one would expect for this category of a hotel - rooms were larger than normal size, smartly decorated with a flat-screen television. If you are a tourist the negative of the hotel is its location, as it is in the financial area, where very few restaurants and shops are open other than during the weekdays and also there are few amenities in the hotel for families with young children. Although the location in the financial area has its advantage, with the absence of what seems to be the ever-present panhandlers in the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Omni staff made our stay even more memorable”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom103
Reviews.Content: We have many memories from our 4-day getaway to Frisco, yes, the city is everything you expect and more, that is for another review. However, this one is for the hotel, which was a glorious surprise. We booked an expedia travel deal, hotel/flight and car - all in one. The hotel staff made our stay a very special one; they greeted us by name upon each door opening. Let us start by saying this property is beautiful, the wood paneling, crystal chandeliers and grandeur on a scale that you would expect from bank building in the twenties. We booked a suite, which was quite spacious and very well appointed. I always pay extra for the upgrade, it's your vacation, why go cheap?The walk-in closet was room in itself. Our bathroom was designed for luxury, with marble from floor to its high 1920's + height ceiling. Our room was immaculate, extremely clean, with a kind welcome note upon entry. Proximity to Chinatown is just two or three blocks. The waterfront restaurants (the non-touristy high-end, interesting and delicious ones) are a short 3 to 4 block walk. Being a hotel-snob, with very high expectations, this hotel is on my A list for Frisco. We will return, and next time, with our adult children.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun”
Reviews.Author: EskimoAbroad
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in the financial district, don't let that stop you from bringing your family here... For us, it was a great central location to try a lot of what San Francisco has to offer! We had the kids sensory suite on the 10th floor and thought it was so incredible! My kids could not have been happier. They loved all of the stuffed animals, toys and books, and we loved the privacy of getting our own adjoining room! Easy access to the California street cable car, walking distance to China Town and Market Street, to catch other public transportation and away from the hustle and bustle of the wharf... A little pricey, but it was worth it! The Select guest beverage service and free wifi were great too! Everyone was very helpful at the front desk as well as housekeeping and room service...

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful but dark rooms, watch for any extra!!”
Reviews.Author: pp_cd_11
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good. It is in the financial district but easy walking distance to Nob Hill, 10 minutes, or Union Square, 15 minutes, and with the cable car right in front of the hotel. The lobby is good. The rooms are beautiful and sufficiently spacious but unfortunately very dark; you must insistently ask for a light room in other case the hotel tries to give you an interior dark one. The desk and bell staff is extremely polite and gentle, they helped us with directions, restaurants, recommendations and so on… as many times as we asked for. But if you don’t want to be worry about your bill evaluating any extra, definitively this is not your hotel, they try to get money from any extra with prices absolutely out of the market: $10 one day internet connection, we had to make an emergency international call and it was $88 for 4 minutes, even they tried to charged us a valet parking though we did not have car.

Reviews.Title: “The best so far”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews and I am glad that I did so. The location is very good, with access to public transport and taxi any time. The desk and bell staff are extremely polite and gentle compared to many hotels I have been to in the US. The rooms are sufficiently spacious and greatly decorated. Everything looked new as of early 2012. The lobby is clean and shiny, and guests receive a personal attention. The room keeping staff would leave you hand written messages of greetings everyday, which is an excellent idea to make you feel at home.I didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant but I think I wish there were more restaurants inside the hotel. Of course many bars and restaurants are within walking distance.Overall I had a pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing deal here over president's weekend, and stayed with the husband. He has so enjoyed his time at the San Diego Omni, that we went here the following year. In my opinion, this place was even better. First, it has a grand and really impressive lobby that makes you think of the 1920s. The rooms were nice, and large by San Fran standards. Some of the decor was a little dated, but I felt this lent to its old world charm. The concierge was AMAZING! We talked to them several times for directions, food recommendations, and more! The other great thing is that this hotel offers free walking tours. We took a free walking tour of Chinatown that was one of the highlights of our trip. The location was...interesting. Close to Chinatown, with great shopping and food, it is far from Union Square and Fisherman's Warf. The Omni is in the financial district, and what is nice about that is that on the weekends its really quiet and empty. We walked to Fisherman's Warf and after 20 minutes, so we gave up and hailed a cab. Not a big deal, but be aware. I wouldn't necessarily want to stay by the Warf beacuse its loud and dirty. Staying by Union Square would have been nice, but for the price, the nice large rooms and GREAT service, I would choose the Omni. There is also a trolly stop RIGHT in fromt of the hotel, so you can use this for transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 days after Xmas and had a nice spacious room! Good view out our window of one of the Christmas trees in a plaza next door. The Omni was very decently priced and conveniently located. The staff were attentive and fast (much better than the Kimpton chain staff)! I liked the free hot apple cider in the lobby, the free breakfast drinks, and the inexpensive town car ride to the SFO airport. Free Wifi if you join their free guest club. We would definitely stay here again if the price was similar!

Reviews.Title: “JUST AS GREAT THE SECOND TIME!”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: I stayed here again six months after my first stay. It is still my favorite hotel in my favorite city! The front desk staff, housekeeping, doormen - all are A+. The lobby is gorgeous, and the rooms well appointed with lots of room in the bathroom for your girl stuff. Beds are comfy. Its location in the financial district can't be beat - you can walk everywhere! And if you're an Omni member (you can join for free) they'll deliver a pot of coffee and your newspaper of choice (even the Sunday New York Times!) to your room for free every morning. This hotel is really customer friendly - as I said in my first review six months ago, I'll never stay anywhere else in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill - they may cheat you”
Reviews.Author: Kendmv
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend for the NFC championship game. The room was nice. The staff at the hotel are great. Valet parking charge is high, food and drinks at Bob's are overly priced. Watch your bill. I bought two rounds of drinks at the bar for my wife and NY giants fans we met at the bar. Charged the bill to my room. When I viewed my account from the room TV, saw three charges from the bar. I called the front desk, they checked and told me someone did not fill out the charge slip for their drinks, so they charged it to my room. They were knowingly trying to cheat me. Later my wife had soup, $9, and tea, $6, and they charged her $11 for the soup. They did not correct this mistake. They do not give customer copies of the bills at the bar or restaurant. Really read your bills if you are charging to your room.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisc Omni”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Freyne
Reviews.Content: Late spring saw my wife and I arrive in San Francisco and we joined the roll call of those people who chose the Omni for our place to stay and felt very pleased with ourselves for doing so. The location was perfect for what we were doing on our stay. From the moment we arrived we were made incredibly welcome by the reception team. Our room was always very clean The maid service was excellent and I would have to be extermely picky to find anything to fault (apart from a certain restaurant manager). Apat from him, the staff were a pleasure to speak to, the service was always excellent and It goes without saying that I would certainly use this charming hotel again if in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TripTex
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is located in the heart of the financial district in San Francisco right on the cable car line and easy walking distance to Nob Hill. The lobby speaks of a stately, luxury hotel but the rooms don't. I would classify the rooms as fairly avearge both in terms of size as well as decor. The bathroom in my room was on the small side. Generally speaking, I found the hotel and rooms very clean, loved the location but glad that my stay was not extended.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in SF in style”
Reviews.Author: frequentfiler
Reviews.Content: You know that feeling when you get into a hotel room for the first time, close the door, and go "aaaah - this is a good place"? The Omni has that in spades. The ability to make you feel like the most important guest in the place (without fawning) and all the extra touches (from the front desk onwards and upwards) that say class. Old world charm doesn't always mix with high tech facilities, but here the blend is perfect. And anyway, a hotel that delivered milk and cookies on a silver salver each evening to my 9 year old was always going to get my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Lex excellent!”
Reviews.Author: trojanlili
Reviews.Content: I will be staying at the Omni in February, and I called just now to ask about tours in the wine country. The concierge, Lex, is very knowledgeable and courteous. He spent about 10 min on the phone with me to help me plan the perfect trip. The hotel is about a 15min walk to the Ferry Landing Building which has a delicious Farmer's Market on Saturday with food trucks too! I am excited to be staying at the Omni because I know the service will be stellar!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary San Francisco Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one short night at the Omni San Francisco Hotel. We're locals but attended a wine tasting dinner in the city and decided to spend the night. After reading many reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to give the Omni San Francisco a try and couldn't have been more pleased. Check in went smoothly. We had a very nice room on the 16th floor with one of the most comfortable hotel beds we'd ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. Prior to making our reservation, we joined their Select Guest program. What a great thing to do! Because we were members (membership is free) we were given a beverage of our choice (coffee, tea, juice or milk) delivered to our room at our preferred time in the morning along with two newspapers--all complimentary! We had breakfast at the hotel's on-site restaurant and were pleased with our breakfast. We also had an appetizer and drinks in the hotel's bar. Internet access is also complimentary. The only negative is that the valet parking rate is steep--$55! We walked a half block to a local garage and paid $39 for the night. Next time we'll take BART into the city. Great hotel! Great staff! We'll definitely be back! Thanks Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dxhastie
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I was expecting first class service, sadly this was not the case. The after service support is not great either. Rooms good, hotel clean, location pretty good, front desk pushy, food average. If you are a select member make sure they know on arrival or else like me you will see your card picking up charges up to 4 days after you thought you had settled your final bill! I would recommend the Galleria Park Hotel every time over the Omni. Feel a little disappointed with the experience of the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Abejo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni in San Francisco for a business trip. Used the place as a home base for one week. I had training across the street but my wife did sightseeing. The hotel is very clean and the location is excellent. If you have free time, just hop on the trolley and enjoy the view. Did some morning runs from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf. Nice view. Overall the hotel was nice and I would even use an Omni Hotel if it was out of pocket.

Reviews.Title: “I Keep Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: Eric1004
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. I'm in SF on business 3/4 times a year. I've stayed at the JW Marriott, the Renaissance (I'm a Marriott Elite Status), the Mandarin. I haven't liked the Marriott/Renaissance as much as I like the Omni. The Mandarin is lovely, but pricier and stuffier. The staff at the Omni couldn't be nicer. Rooms are pretty much all the same. "Courtyard" views are quieter but unattractive. Higher floors are quiet enough for me. Rooms are a bit uninspired, but comfortable and sufficiently spacious. Beds/linens are all quite comfortable. Amenities/robes are also quite nice. Complimentary beverage delivery in the a.m. is a nice touch. If the location works for you (it does for me), then you won't be disappointed with this property. Rates fluctuate a lot, but you get a real value comapred to other top-tier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.”
Reviews.Author: travelchicks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni twice in the last year. Both times it has exceeded our expectations. The service is awesome,it is quiet and in a great central location. A little pricey but well worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Delight with Kids”
Reviews.Author: emeraldhillstraveler
Reviews.Content: Magnificent stay. Service is incredible. Myself and my 3 kids ages 6,8 and10 for a stay in the city for fun. So welcoming with cider, great room on top floor, gave kids fun activity backpacks filled with fun things to do. Great room with view of transamerica building. Not ridiculous price for city (approx $200 a night) but add on valet parking and taxes and it was over $300. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was delicious. They sent up different cookies each night for kids with milk. Very grand decorated lobby. Walked to union square to shop and see lights and no problems walking back late at night (10). We took cab to pier 39 and fishermans wharf the next day for more sightseeing and fun. Great trip. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker0811
Reviews.Content: We spent some of the Christmas period in SF and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are magnificent. We stayed with our ten month old and were delivered milk and cookies every evening - which Mummy and Daddy also enjoyed! The front desk staff make you feel very welcome and housekeeping and all staff do everything to help with a smile. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for 2 nights to enjoy San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: anya672
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, including the friendly service. Hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. My only complaint is that the room temp. was set at about 72, so we had to open the windows when we were in the room. Trolley noise not an issue on the 14th floor. Great location for Chinatown, Union Square, even walked to Fisherman's Wharf and back seeing Lombard St. on our return. Used Montgomery St. trains to get to Haight Ashbury area and SFO.
