Tripadvisor recommends some great local restaurants - don't miss Sotto 'Mare Oysteria & Seafood and Sanraku Japanese Restaurant - picked up car and headed to Marin Headlands.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we've stayed in the USA”
Reviews.Author: Kat05g
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after following a bad stay in the Warwick San Francisco last minute. Following reviews from tripadvisor we booked this hotel from their website and received a 25% discount. The staff is extremely helpful, we came straight from another hotel and were able to book in 3 hrs before check in. The rooms are clean, have a great range of products and facilities and the service 1st class. The omni is in the business district and we found it easy to get to the harbour and union square. Following the bad experience we had at the Warwick we welcome the safety of the Omni and the helpfulness and knowledge of the staff. I will recommend this hotel to anyone I k ow going to San Fran in the future.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience during ORACLE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: dennis u
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel and bellhops (special mention to FERNANDO) made this short stay quite memorable. It was drizzling during our stay, and the hotel provided much needed umbrellas and assistance during the wet days.

Reviews.Title: “Omni SF - First Class Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: blkcats
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni San Francisco fulfilled our expectations beyond what we think a great hotel should aspire to be. Their customer service is superb. The staff eagerly and fondly anticipates questions in a skillful and knowledgeable manner. Beyond that, the location is fantastic. It is several blocks to North Beach, Chinatown, Union Square or a little further to the Embarcadero and the Ferry Building. If you have a vehicle to park, they have valet parking and it was handled in a very professional manner. Our room was clean and comfortable and nicely appointed with plush towels, crisp linens and plump pillows. The bathroom was a good size and the shower / tub combination was quite large. Both of us would definitely recommend the Omni San Francisco as a first-class hotel to our friends and family. And, the next time we are planning a return trip to San Francisco, we will certainly make a reservation at the Omni. It is worth it for the customer service and the LOCATION alone...and of course, it is in San Francisco (my favorite city)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsATrip5
Reviews.Content: Great location with a cable car stop right outside. The staff is excellent and the historic feel is very San Francisco. The rooms are extremely clean and large, for a city hotel Our kids LOVED the attention from the staff and the cookies, cider and milk was a great touch. Price was right, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: Orugco
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a mid price range hotel with adequate but not great accomodations, this may be what you are looking for. The room I stayed in was small and oddly narrow and long with a window that provided a very limited view of the outside world. In fact I would call it a "room without a view". Two double beds were requsted and were provided but the beds did not seem to be truly double beds. They looked and felt to be smaller. The best part however,was the bath room which was large and, even though tubless, had a large shower stall with nice tile work, a good shower head and a great drain. I emphasize the drain because we all have had some bad experience with a slow drain. Other good points about accomodations in this hotel include cleanliness and great service. Every one is extremely friendly and all issues are resolved immidiately. Case in point was my disappointment with an out of order safe. Upon complaining a repair man was sent to my room who fixed the problem in no time. Hotel laundry is quick and professional even though expensive. The restaurant is not great and the service only adequate. Breakfast was good but expensive. Fitness center was clean with equipment that, even though not new, were in good working condition. Hotel location is excellent, close to many great restaurants, few walking minutes to embarcoder, the ferry building, union square, north beach, cable cars and the BART.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a great find for our short stay in San Francisco. Being in the business area, the parking was cheaper. Staff were very friendly and helpful in recommending us somewhere to eat. They also told us about the market down on the pier which we were glad we didn't miss. They made our room special as we'd told them we were on our honeymoon - coming straight from the Bellagio where they'd done nothing special, it was really, really sweet. Location was good; a short walk to the market on the pier. They also gave us a room with a view (there can't have been many of those rooms given where the hotel was situated). Would definitely stay with Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with lots of nice touches”
Reviews.Author: melb101
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel you have! Your staff are a wonderful asset to you. Loved the little touches such as hot apple cider in the beautiful lobby and cookies and milk with the turn down service. Nice, clean rooms and a location too. Would definitely recommend to family and friend's who visit your beautiful city :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent down-town SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donch47
Reviews.Content: Among the many choices to stay in San Francisco, the Omni stood out in the reviews. That prompted me to book a night there for a quick trip my wife and I had planned. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by every single hotel staff person we encountered, with offers of help and welcome. This was not done in any overbearing way and felt quite genuine. Our room was on the 14th floor. The room was very nice, clean, and very quiet. We hadn't opted for a view and indeed were given the opportunity to look into office windows of the three buildings surrounding the alley courtyard behind our side of the hotel. The TransAmerica Building could be seen soaring high above one of them. It was sunny and well-lit, so we weren't disappointed by that. A little background: Our last hotel, two weeks earlier, had been in Beijing, China. The contrast couldn't have been greater. A 4-star hotel, it looked very fancy at first glance (and from 20 feet away). A closer inspection was almost horrifying. The place was absolutely filthy. In the 8 days we stayed there, our sheets were never changed, the bathroom always smelled like a sewer, and our clean fingernails at night were dirty upon getting up in the morning. The bed must have been made of concrete, and the lock on the entry door didn't work. So by contrast, the Omni was absolutely a wonderful place. Mind you, this comparison is quite unfair, in that the Omni should not be described with any association with the other hotel. The Omni stands in its own right as a fine hotel, a world-class hotel, with a staff that went out of its way at every opportunity to serve us with a smile and no hesitation. Location-wise, it is terrific. Sited at the intersection of Montgomery and California, it is about 6-blocks from the Ferry Building, next door to China Town, the California Cable Car runs by the front door, and Nob Hill is just to the west, up the street. All the major cultural and performance centers are within easy walking access and restaurants are all over the place. We slept soundly, enjoyed the lovely clean, nicely scented bathroom, and comfortable clean (did I say clean?) bed. There was a large safe in the closet and a locking refrigerator where we kept snacks bought at a nearby deli. I highly recommend the Omni and will stay there again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in SF”
Reviews.Author: elderc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but good. Great location, next to Market Street, Chinatown, Financial District and the Ferry Building. It's an easy walk to the cable car or the BART. Service is helpful and the people at the frontdesk were nice. There's no free wifi, which is a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Unbeatable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco in September for our honeymoon and it was fantastic!! We upgraded to the Omni Select which allowed for daily morning beverage selection delivered to the room which was a great way to start the day! It also allowed for WiFi access in the room. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. All staff went out of their way to make us feel at home, helped us find great places to eat and even booked our trip to Alcatraz for us! Location is unbeatable!! Public transportation is accessible from right in front of the hotel or within a block away. We would not hesitate to recommended this hotel to anyone! We plan on staying here when we return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice when staying in SanFran”
Reviews.Author: bonanzabugs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights on our recent trip to San Francisco. The rooms are very well appointed and clean, the bed was King size and very comfortable. The location is an easy walk to most parts of town, centrally located with cable car out the front. There are some great places to eat within walking distance in all directions. The staff are very attentive and helpful. We stayed during Halloween so it was great to see the staff get into the spirit by dressing up. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby is a great way to do your research on Trip Advisor to find some great restaurants etc while in town. We will stay again at Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SandraMom
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay ... great location ... great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with exceptional customer services.”
Reviews.Author: barruca
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was perfect and the room was very nice. The best thing about the Omni is the customer service. They are so great. Everyone goes out of their way to be helpful and friendly. My daughter was given a backpack with lots of great treats. Cookies and milk were waiting in the room for her. I cant say enough how helpful they were. It was great! I would recomend this hotel to anyone staying in SF. Parking is expensive but that is SF. We are select guest members and were already checked in when we arrived. We got free wifi and free beverage service every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, comfortable surrounds, and a touch of elegance”
Reviews.Author: taotei
Reviews.Content: Nothing is over the top except the service at the Omni Hotel. We had a very clean, very comfortable room - nice linens, flat screen, plenty of fluffy towels...everything you'd need for a restful base. Room service is tasty and prompt. Even the housekeepers are super friendly - and they have a turn down service with nice local chocolates for your pillow. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: trevor k
Reviews.Content: My family spent 6 nights at this hotel a few weeks ago and we could not fault it. Hotel executives should send their staff here to learn the art of personable and professional service. We have stayed in hotels around the world but none compare. The complementary gingerbread men and hot apple cider were wonderful Christmas touches - every day without fail. Go and stay there now!

Reviews.Title: “Classy without being over the top”
Reviews.Author: chrissytina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick trip before a business trip in Pleasanton. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful with whatever I needed and were happy to keep my bags before and after my "official" stay (while I wandered the city). Felt like I was in the middle of everything- literally walked everywhere (though definitely a bit of a treck, most people will probably want to take a taxi to get around). The room was extremely comfortable and "ornate" while still being warm. Lots of room- didn't feel claustrophobic (like some city hotel rooms can be). Overall, very happy with the Omni and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: Was planning a trip for wife's "big" birthday so we decided on San Francisco and other parts of Northern California. Looked on TripAdvisor and other sites for good reviews and good value. Always like staying in in Omni's and price was reasonable (for San Francisco). Made reservations and was all set. Staff was very friendly and accommodating upon arrival and throughout the stay. When we got in delivered a cake plate other items in recognition of her birthday. Room was a little small but well appointed and very nice. Location turned out to be very good neutral site, in the heart of the financial district with easy walking access to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and transportation around other parts of Bay Area. Fun time, nice place and highly recommend for nice luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: Hubby likes it! When we checked in we were offered Gingerbread Men Cookies and hot apple cider! The staff was pleasant and very efficient. Our room was kind of old-fashioned, but elegant with 9 foot high ceilings. Very clean and very quiet even though we faced the street. There was a letter on the desk explaining that they were undergoing renovation and re-decorating that would be completed in Feb 2012. Nice robes, great location, and good coffee. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds and Linens!”
Reviews.Author: Joan88
Reviews.Content: Truly comfortable bed and luxe linens add to the elegance on this hotel. Excellent 24 hour, large fitness center is great too! Quite rooms on the side not on California St. make for a most pleasant stay. Location is perfect for walking....down to the Ferry Building, over to Union Square or Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Refinement+Humility”
Reviews.Author: travelin_runner
Reviews.Content: The usual hotel that I stay at for business was sold out, so I stayed at the Omni San Francisco instead. And now this is where I'll be staying when I come in the future. As other reviewers mention, the staff is not just friendly and helpful but competent. When checking in, I asked about where the local markets were. The front desk person proceeded to show me in great detail on the map exactly where each of them were - Safeway, Trader Joes, Whole foods. Wow! When I needed to mail something out after checking out, the front desk person got me the forms and hunted around for a suitable sized box that I could use. There was no subtle sense that I was "imposing" on them which I have experienced at other hotels. On to the rooms: they were super clean and shiny and the lighting was really nice. Nothing in the room seemed worn out or run down. The bathroom amenities were products that I would actually use outside of the hotel. They have turndown service with great chocolates. I was able to use the refrigerator to store some leftovers and food items without any hassle (there's no sensor-type system which automatically charges you) so I didn't have to order a refrigerator. When I needed a cab, the door man efficiently called one right away. All these small details really add up to a pleasant stay. The staff is attentive and the accomodations are elegant, but there's never a sense of it being over-the-top or ostentatious. The place has just the right combination of refinement and humility. The one thing that wasn't quite up to the high standard was the fitness center. The cardio machines were good and the room had windows, so that's a plus. But only one of the TVs worked and the sound system on the machines didn't work well at all. The treadmills had individual screens but I could not for the life of me find a headphone jack. And there were no magazines provided. So if you work out there, be prepared to bring your own entertainment. All in all, the Omni gets two thumbs up and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything everyone said it was...”
Reviews.Author: Leah217
Reviews.Content: Everyone working at the Omni were extremely friendly and helpful, just as the reviews said they were. The rooms were very nice and plush and clean and comfortable. We first were going to stay in a room facing the courtyard, as was recommended for the noise but we found it somewhat closterphobic and noisy from the vents as well as not private and lacking a view... so we switched to a room with a view and did not find the noise from the trolleys a problem at all. It was in a great central location and we walked from North Beach back to the hotel and then on to Union Sqare all in one night. The Cafe La Presse, which was recommended by the hotel staff was an excellent place for breakfast and was within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend at the Omni on business. This is a very well located hotel right in the heart of the financial district. It is also well located to access Union Square and other tourist locations. The staff seemed very on top of things from check in right to the end of the stay. The entire hotel is designed in a pretty traditional style - think Ritz Carlton, early American revival type furnishings and you've got it. So if you want comfort, quiet and good food, this is your place. If you want a happening scene, you may want to look elsewhere. Over all I was very impressed and would put it up there with the more well known brands in the city. There is evidently a renovation underway which will be a good thing as some of the furniture is looking a little worn. However, this did not detract from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Reputable San Fran Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akuragrl
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to San Fran, this time as a solo female traveler. Comfort and security were top priorities and the Omni delivered. The Omni is located in the Financial district; pretty quiet, and mostly low laying (not hilly). I was able to reserve a premier room and it was amazing. The bed is super soft and the room was extremely clean. Amenities were plenty and this room was part of a renovated set the hotel recently completed. My understanding is that the hotel is still under renovation, and this floor was probably one of those completed thus far. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially the doormen. They were able to point out the closest restaurants and (starbucks!) if you needed one. Major attractions are pretty close by: Ferry Building / Embarcadero is +/- 10 mins walking distance (great food / scenery), +/- 10 mins to BART/MUNI (public transport - handy if you need to go to SFO), +/- 10 mins to Chinatown, and +/- 10 mins to Museum of Modern Art. Overall my stay was fantastic. The only reason I didn't rank with 5 stars was because while reserving, I asked for an extra amenity which should have been delivered upon my arrival. It was a couple hours late, but the staff followed up and rectified the problem. Will stay again :) _Sam S.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in SF”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTravelors
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, excellent staff, great location. We walked mostly and took cabs home in the evening. The staff got us all set up with reservations and day trips. Top notch stay.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxLittleton
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Omni Hotel in San Francisco. The staff I give 5 stars to and would give more if I could. They were all amazing. I loved the bed and the bedding. Walked to Embarcadero and then on to Pier 39. This is by far my favorite hotel. I stayed in the Hyatt Embarcadero last year to see Peter Pan at the 360 theather. Which is a great hotel too. Really nothing bad to say about that hotel, but with this hotel customer service is really what stood out. They were so good to us. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAEA-Family
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying here and seeing SF again after 11 years - back then I was 20 now I'm with my kids. This hotel was fantastic, the friendliest most helpful and kid friendly I have ever encountered in such a nice hotel. The rooms are nice, food in the resturant was great- especially the steak. Hot apple cider daily in the lobby with gingerbread and apples was enjoyed by my kids 3 & 4 and us parents also. Milk and cookies every night when we got back to our room was such a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lawguy22
Reviews.Content: We spent a quick weekend here, and the price was good for this hotel that was very convenient to the City. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: likecomfy
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby and nice staff welcome you with friendly, quick check-in. Gingerbread cookies and cider (it was near Christmas) are also in the lobby. Although we were upgraded to a higher level room, it was small. The decor was very nice and upscale, and the room was clean. The bed was very comfortable. There was a nice desk in the room well equipped for working. The bathroom was also clean, lots of marble and high end finishes. Our room faced the street, so we did have some street noise which made it a little difficult for me to sleep, my husband had no problem. Checkout was equally as quick, and the valets for parking were quick and friendly as well. They had complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning with paper cups for take-away. Overall a very nice stay. We got free internet by signing up for their frequent customer program.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Homan K
Reviews.Content: I wanted so much to like this hotel, the staff was very friendly/accommodating, rooms were nice/clean, great rewards program (complimentary water on arrival, free water, instant check-in/out), however as other people have noted there are two issues for my poor rating. One which is understandable and nothing can be done and the other is just unacceptable for a hotel of this quality. The first, as others have noted, there are no good views from any room as the hotel is on the smaller side and it is surrounded by much larger buildings. This only accounts for .5 of my negative rating because it should be fairly obvious prior to booking what you are getting into. The other 1.5 of my negative review, is completely unacceptable. The morning maid service is extremely loud, between door slamming and hallway chatter (I mean seriously?), this has to be managed better. I left a poor review on this very item after check out, and management replied the next day with an apology/promise to improve, but after reading many posts on this exact issue (dating back years), I will not be returning any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Isobelsophia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We are Omni members and enjoyed all the treats like coffee delivered in the morning (and it's GOOD coffee) and cookies for the kids. The apple cider and gingerbread men in the foyer were a lovely touch. The reception and valet parking staff were friendly and efficient. We had the kids fantasy suite and our room adjoined theirs - highly recommend this, our kids loved it and so did we.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: stuigi4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for one week in October. The good: Great location, immaculately clean, very friendly staff. The bad: the standard room is very small and there are virtually no good views from any room, we had to ask for our complimentary water many times, if you book the room from an outside company like American Express the Omni will not be able to find your reservation for several hours (this happened twice), the toilet tissue they use is of the cheapest quality- totally unsuitable for a luxury hotel, the lobby steps and floor are dangerously slippery and a man fell and hit his head right in front of us, Bob's Steakhouse is insanely expensive, much more so than any other high end steak house we have ever been to and we have been to the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Cave66man
Reviews.Content: Great service and very nice rooms. The decor was formal but nice. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Great location and very close to many great restaurants. The view was a standard city view. The service was just great. Every person I came in contact with was nice and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: Check in process was very smooth and fast. Rooms are decent sized but decor is bland and didn't have a view. Bathroom was bright and well appointed. Overall room was clean. Location is great for business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby & Walking Tour.”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for our 5th anniversary through Hotels.com & got a smoking deal. Lobby was beautiful when we walked in. The room was nice as well; however, there was construction happening outside our window across the street. Guess that was reason for the low price. The hotel provided a free walking tour of China Town in conjunction with a local non-profit historical society. Was informative and worth going on. Few negatives: 1. Slowest...elevators...ever. 2. Location was in the middle of business district. While it was walking distance to most points of interest (china town, pier, etc.), there were limited places to eat nearby. 3. Service was good; however, a few of their front desk people were a little full of themselves. We requested a place for lunch after our arrival. One desk employee called a friend a nearby eatery stating he was sending two over for lunch. He told us they were saving a table for us and would make food available upon our arrival. We arrived and spoke with the same employee at the eatery, who had no idea we were coming or who the person at the Omni was. Weird. And dissappointing. 4. WiFi costs money, except for airline check-in. Just reread my review and noticed it comes off as very negative. The hotel overall was nice, and I wouldn't have a problem staying there again. Just wanted to point out some negatives I had not read previous to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: After all the remarkable reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to stay at the Omni when we visited San Francisco for the weekend. The good news was fast check in, unbelievable friendly and efficient staff, cookies in the lobby and a convenient location. Also, the room was spacious, clean and the windows open a little for fresh air. The bad news was the room and bathroom were very depressing and in much need of a facelift. The furniture was very old and the fabrics looked worn and outdated. Even the towels were threadbare and needed replacing. Fortunately, they have started a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fivethreezero
Reviews.Content: Rooms is very spacious and comfortable. Service is excellent! All the staff were amazing. We have the fastest check in, in less than 2 minutes. Literally, keys are ready already once you mention your name. They would suggest place to eat, shop and they even have estimated taxi fare of each location you'll be visiting. Love their breakfast. Everything taste so good. Only negative is their price, a little bit pricey considing the location. You still need to take around15-20 minute walk to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: murray9000
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Omni SF with my family, and the entire experience was way beyond our expectations. Not that I've had any bad stays in Omnis elsewhere, but the SF location was the nicest one I've been in by far. The vibe overall is very homey, classic without being stuffy, and a pleasant contrast to the many too-hip trendy boutique hotels around the city. Every employee we encountered at the Omni was genuinely friendly and accommodating, and the service was great in all respects. I understand the floor we stayed in was subjected to a recent remodel, which was done very tastefully. The rooms were decent sized and very comfortable once we got the A/C dialed in. The location is great - being in the Financial District, it is a bit removed from the tourist hubbub, a positive or negative depending on your point of view. It is only a couple of blocks from the eastern edge of Chinatown, an easy walk to North Beach, the Moscone Center and Union Square, and more ambitious walking distance to the Embarcadero, Nob Hill and SOMA. Since the Omni is in a fairly busy area, street noise would be hard to avoid. We were on the top floor on the California St. side and it was fairly noticeable but livable - with the exception of a very annoying and constant clacking sound from the cable car tracks on California just west of Montgomery. If possible, I would ask for a room facing another direction, where I imagine it wouldn't be as much of an issue. Thankfully, it goes away during the hours that the cable cars are not operating.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific!”
Reviews.Author: sweetnneka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over the Thanksgiving holiday for a total of four nights. From check-in, the service was exceptional. All of our preferences were noted and attended to. Our room was tidy and spacious, the gym was outfitted quite well with the newest equipment. We enjoyed the nice touches, like gingerbread cookies and hot cider in the evenings. The location is in excellent proximity to downtown and Chinatown, which worked well for us. It is also directly on the California cablecar line, for those who are interested in taking in a view of Nob Hill at the top. Overall, we would gladly stay at the Omni again during a visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: dallas12345
Reviews.Content: There are many lovely hotel buildings in the world; what sets this one apart is the uber-accommodating staff. From restaurant recommendations to directions to points of interest, this staff performed routine tasks with a welcoming touch that reflected an understanding of how to make a couple feel like valued guests. Tips include leaving the mini-bar key at the desk and bringing you own snacks. The prices are crazy, and if you get rolling you can do a lot of damage. There are some brands of goodies that we didn't recognize and looked very tempting. Another suggestion is to be sure to log on to the Omni web site and sign up or the loyalty program. Free wifi! We enjoyed staying there so much that we plan to look for Omni Hotels first whenever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: citetapirep
Reviews.Content: We travel to SF several times a year and stay in different venues from rental of homes/apartments, to boutique hotels to large chains. This was our first time to the Omni and we loved it. Quiet, elegant hotel with excellent service from friendly staff, bellhops, and maid service. Every greeting was with a smile. We were travelling with 6 girls, all eleven years old, and they were very well treated. The milk and cookies in the evening were a big hit. The beds are a bit soft but comfortable. Occasionally, the late evening noise or a loud passing party of "happy" people would filter thru the windows from the streets but that was rare. Every effort was made to accomodate our needs. When something didn't go according to plan (sometimes a door key didn't work, or the check out was delayed because of a computer glitch) the staff made every effort to rectify it. Depending on your preferences, it might be a bit of a walk to some places (such as Union Square, ACT Theater, Golden Gate Theater) but China Town, the Ferry Building, Embarcadero Center, restaurants such as Taddich Grill, Perbacco, Barbacco, Boulevard, R&G Lounge ( and of course Bob's Steak House) were all near by with easy, quick walks. The California Cable Car line was in front of the hotel and we used it to get to Van Ness for the movies. I will definitely fit this hotel into my list of return places. By the way, the hotel was scented from the lobby to the elevator to the hallways and it was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: nunce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and it's stunning! Our room was beautiful, though the view wasn't much because of all the other tall buildings around it. But it's within a short walk of the water and there are tons of great restaurants right near the hotel. Breakfast was the only meal we had at the restaurant on site, but it was great (though like most/all Omni's it's rather expensive). The concierge was outstanding with a thorough knowledge of the area and great recommendations on dinner options. The whole place is very up-to-date with a modern luxurious feel to it. We have come to really enjoy Omni properties and this one did not disappoint! The customer service was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hollybelle210
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was lovely. We had a 5 night stay, and it was very comfortable. The room decor is a little tired, but they are beginning renovations. Housekeeping did a great job. The staff was awesome, and very helpful. I don't know if anything was over the top memorable, but you wouldn't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, But Not Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: WalnutBaron
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an extended holiday weekend at this beautiful hotel in the Financial District of San Francisco. The service was absolutely superb and uniformly friendly. From the bellmen at the door to the front desk staff to the chambermaids to the bartender in the sumptuous lounge downstairs, we were just taken in by how welcoming the Omni was for us. If you belong to the Omni's frequent guest program, there are many little extras for you that you don't get with other hotel chains, including free juice or coffee brought to your room in the morning, free ironing of suits, shirts, or dresses, and a free shoeshine. Our room was beautifully appointed with a wonderful view overlooking California Street and the cable cars as they went by. The room was quiet, comfortable, and the bed felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. All in all, just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Babara W
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four night and got a fantastic room in a fantastic hotel placed in the middle of some of the most peaceful tranquil and fascinating you can imagine. Great staff, great service, all the best of San Francisco just outside the hotel door. The hotel maintains a very good standard. This is my new San Francisco home in the future.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...with a little room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ataylor1215
Reviews.Content: We just spent 1 night at The Omni in their Kids Fantasy Suite. It is a gorgeous King suite attached to a fun room with bunkbeds, bean bag chairs, toys and books. I need to start by saying that we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again. However there is a little room for improvement. When we made the reservation we asked if we could get an early check-in at noon. The reservations assistant said they would put in the request. We got there later than expected at 2pm, and the room wasn't ready and that was kind of a bummer. They said they would put a rush on it, but I wish they had done this earlier. When we got into the rooms we were very impressed. My kids loved that the room was catered to them. Now here come my small complaints. The movies were like $11 to rent, the video games were $6.95/hour, and they had a little fridge and basket in the room with outrageously priced snacks. Snacks that were VERY tempting to my kids. Bags of skittles, cookies, M&M's, etc. In the fridge they had yogurts, drinks, etc. Actually, some of the snacks weren't exorbitant, but I still didn't want my kids drooling over them. The snacks in our room (the King bed side) had insane prices. A candy bar was $5. A large bottle of water was $7. Needless to say we didn't partake in any of these foods. More than the foods though, the kids were really bummed they couldn't play the video games. It seemed like such a tease to have a game controller there that they had to pay to play. So my biggest suggestion would be to include the use of the video games (and if possible some kid movies too) in the cost of the $350/night room. Also, maybe bring the prices down a bit on the snacks. I thought we were going to receive a newspaper and juice/coffee in the morning as being Select Members, but they did not come. Maybe we were supposed to request them? Now back to the good. The rooms were really quiet, clean, tastefully decorated, and spacious. The bed was soooo comfortable. All the staff was exceptionally nice and attentive. They did give the kids little backpacks upon arrival with a few coloring items and small toys. They did also bring them cookies and milk in the evening which was really sweet. Overall I thought this was a quality hotel in a great location. We easily walked to China Town and jumped on the cable car line for lots of other destinations. We will go back to The Omni, maybe without kids next time for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place!”
Reviews.Author: fionita
Reviews.Content: I like very much this hotel, is a wonderfull place to stay in SF! Despite this is a 4 star hotel, all the amenities, personal, meals, position are for a 5 star plus hotel. The rooms are various dimensions, at 17th floor are smallest than the others floor, but this is not a problem! This is a very clean hotel, all the people from the staff are very friendly and helpfull, and the breakfast are delicious. Every day, in the lobby, the cakes, apples and apple cider expect us to return at home! Delicious and familiar! If is possibile, I advise you to stay, maybe only for a day, at this special hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection and Location”
Reviews.Author: breti
Reviews.Content: Simply put, one of the best choices in San Francisco. From the moment you walk in, you are not only treated like you belong, but like you are returning home. This feeling is enhanced when you see the tray of cookies (in this case, gingerbread) and pot of hot, mules apple cider waiting for you in the lobby. I you are a Select Guest (and if you aren't, you should be) checking in is as easy as finding your packet on the rack near the concierge desk. The rooms are fairly big by SF standards, and the bathrooms are wonderful: bright, spacious, marble. As a select guest, it is nice to have water waiting for you, and our preferences for pillows and towels (extra for both) already in the room. Each night, a tray of cookies and milk is brought to the room (again, for members of Select Guest), and the beds turned down perfectly. The wifi works flawlessly (free for Select Guests) and the morning coffee is delivered exactly on time (again, for Spmembers of Select Guest...you **really** should join). The hotel staff are warm and friendly, and give great advice. The bellman even has umbrellas waiting for you to use when it is raining (which, unfortunately, it has been doing). And the location is perfect...right in the heart of the financial district and the start of Chinatown, and a few blocks from North Beach. Do yourself a favor and get a Muni pass. The California cable car stops right in front of the hotel. It is then a quick ride down to the Ferry Building (which has an amazing farmers market) where you can then catch the F street car to Fishermans Wharf. Or take the cable car up the hill where you can swift to either o fine Powell street cars to head to the wharf or downtown. And the hotel is only 4 blocks from Market street, where you can catch Bart or any number of buses and cable cars. All of this is free (except Bart) with a Muni pass. So, this is or new base camp when in San Francisco. You will love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: BridgeGal1947
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great service. Concierge was incredibly helpful. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, small rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: gmcc127
Reviews.Content: Good location on the edge of Chinatown and 10 minute walk to downtown. I stayed while at a conference and after taxes the room rate was almost $500 a night for a 7 night stay. Smaller rooms than most american hotels and toiletries were never added to over the 7 nights

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a trip to SF”
Reviews.Author: Destination360
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice: Centrally located with easy access to Union Square, Market Street, the Embarcadero ... the list goes on. You're also very close to bus stops and right by the BART, which goes out to the airport and across the bay to Oakland. (Skip the rental car on a trip here, if you can.) The Omni was a lovely hotel and very comfortable, and we spent a couple of evenings relaxing in the bar after a busy day and were very pleased with the food & atmosphere. One thing that's especially great about the Omni's location is that it's in the financial district, meaning it's clean and quiet, and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. SF is so compact that it's easy to get anywhere, so you can stay in this area without feeling isolated; even if you're not on a business trip, this neighborhood is a great place to go for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: SueZ80202
Reviews.Content: The room and amenities were first rate, but the thoughtful recommendation by the concierge for our dinner in Chinatown was right on! Perhaps the best meal I have eaten this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jbtraveler63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I liked the Omni. It was a great location and the staff were helpful. Our room was clean, had an ok view but we weren't in the room much. There was a letter in the room saying that they would be updating the rooms (I think beginning in February.) Although, the room was comfortable, updating is a good idea. Carpet, drapes needed a lift. One gripe, the guests next to us had a dog. I knew this because it barked a couple times. In the morning when my husband and I left, it barked several times. It was early and I thought that was rude for other people who may have still been sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, this is the place you want to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: Been to San Francisco twice over the course of two weeks. The first was a business trip that was picked up through our company. I was placed at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental a few blocks up California street from the Omni. What a boring hotel. Seemed everyone there was very snobby and that if you didn't conform to a certain dress code you were frowned upon. So, imagine my surprise when I came back to San Francisco on a pleasure trip and stayed at the Omni. What a totally different animal this place is compared to the "stiffs" at Mark Hopkins. I have always loved the Omni brand. I stay at their hotels across the country often during business conventions. Every single Omni hotel I have stayed at has been a class-act from the staff, to the rooms and the food. Coming to San Francisco was reward travel for being a member of their loyalty program. When I built up enough credits for 2 free nights, I decided to come out to my favorite city in the United States. From the moment I arrived, I felt like family. The rental company upgraded me to a huge Lincoln Town Car. So, when I arrive in front of the hotel, the valet ignored me thinking I was car service dropping off passengers. It took a while, but the doorman recognized that I was just sitting there waiting and he came over and made certain I was taken care of. I don't know who the portly doorman was, but he as incredibly charming and funny. You could not have been wanted to be met by anyone more personable than this guy and I wish I had the opportunity to have talked to him more. He was gone by the end of Friday afternoon,and I am guessing off for the weekend I was there. When I got inside I was also greeted very warmly by the gentleman at the front desk who asked me where I was from. When I told him I was from New Jersey, he told me a story of a sub shop he remembers from Princeton, a town not too far from where I lived. Just one of those really nice exchanges that makes you feel welcomed. And, even though the hotel was sold out the day before and rooms were scarce at the point of my early check-in, the clerk went out of his way to get me into a room. I had a room on the 8th floor, facing the middle of the hotel center. This means it didn't have a view of the street. That was fine. The room was actually very quiet. That evening, I got a knock on the door from room service and was handed a bottle of water and a bag of vegetarian granola (which was really good), as a loyalty program "welcome back" gift. In addition, as a loyalty member, I get free WiFi and my choice of free beverage delivered to my door every morning. And you know what? All it takes to become a loyalty member is to sign up on the Omni website prior to your stay. I think Omni has the best loyalty benefits of any hotel I have stayed with. Free Internet and beverages? How can you not be happy staying at the Omni. And, for the two days I spent at the hotel, you couldn't walk inside without a staff member smiling at you with a "hello" or "welcome back." Step in the lobby and there is this faint perfume smell that really warmes the senses. ....and, while valet parking is about expensive as any other hotel in the city (at least $50 per night), there is a substantial discount on Friday and Saturday nights. Valet Parking only cost me $30 each night which I thought was great. By the way, the valets did a superb job in getting me my vehicle in a short timeframe. I don't think I have anything negative to say about this hotel. I don't think I'll ever stay at another hotel when travling to San Francisco. The people here seem much happier than they do at the Mark Hopkins. Much more smiling and the sounds of "hello" in the elevator. Clean, comfortable, inviting. This is the place you want to stay and where you will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Luxurious accommodation, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: tomszack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni SF for two nights on the way to our Napa Valley wine expedition and found this hotel to be just lovely. From the incredibly friendly greeting we received when checking in, to the immaculately clean and extremely comfortable room, to the terrific breakfast in the Omni's restaurant, we simply could not have had a better stay. The Omni is in a great spot as well, situated in a central location for exploring pretty much all of the eastern San Francisco neighborhoods: North Beach, Chinatown, FiDi, Union Square, Tenderloin, and SoMa. Even Fisherman’s Wharf is walk-able from the Omni along the Embarcadero. We would definitely stay again, and most likely would not stay any place else!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Seathyme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Omni in San Francisco. the location is terrific -- on the border of Chinatown and the Financial district. We walked almost everywhere. The staff was very helpful with directions, restaurants suggestions, reservations, etc. the room was clean comfortable and appealing. No view, but we were not in the room much. we had the breakfast plan which worked well for us since we like to have a breakfast and get going. We did not eat any other meals there. I would stay there again and can honestly give it an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Simply loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: California_momofsix
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here, accompanying my husband on a business trip. The hotel was in a great central location, the room was large and very clean. Our room overlooked California street and was still remarkably quiet (I could hear the faintest ringing of the bells from the streetcars which I actually loved). The bed was huge and so, so comfortable. But what made this hotel an amazing experience was the customer service. I have never stayed in a hotel where everyone on the staff was so friendly and helpful. When we checked in, and the desk clerk found out I was traveling with my husband to take a rare break from my 6 kids at home, he instantly upgraded our room and offered me shopping coupons and spa services. Sitting in the lobby, it looked like everyone asking a question received great service and advice. The clerk also sent beverages up to our room also. Every employee we passed would greet us, starting with the doorman and even when we returned to the hotel in the middle of the night. We loved the many small touches, like the fresh fruit in bowls in the lobby and the handwritten notes from the maids. If you are a member or sign up for their select club (not sure exactly what it is called), you can get free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jinxy17
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5nights at Omni Hotel . Check-in was very rapid and without problems, the room was very clean and cosy with excellent service. I had breackfast at Bob's steak house - the restaurant inside the hotel- and I dislike the fact that was not open buffet. It was a la carte and just some american dishes all of them too heavy for breackfast and consist minimum 3eggs. Fresh juice was very good, and a very special remark for the bowl with fresh berries; like everywhere in America coffee was owfull. I could recommend this hotel for all travelers in San Francisco but, eat otherwhere.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is always a nice place to stay in SFO”
Reviews.Author: DaveCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the omni for 4 nites in October 2011. We find the service at the hotel to be very good. Also they have the most comfortable beds anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: cathy_b_62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni hotel for 2 nights during Fleet Week in October. We found the service to be excellent and the location perfect. Our room was spotless and we appreciated the turn down service at night. We would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Temuka
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the hotel and there was roadworks close by, the hotel did everything they could to keep the inconvenience of the roadworks noise away from the hotel guests. The location is perfect, close to where all the restaurants and bars, but far enough away to not to be too noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandbuilder
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late our first night, and after having dinner, we went to our room. Our first impression wasn't good. It was obvious that some stains had been removed from the carpet, leaving discolorations in the fabric. As it was late we decided to just go to bed and address it in the morning. However, we actually didn't even bring it up to the staff until our fourth day because we were overwhelmed with the quality of the service we received. We experienced the best room service ever based on the accuracy of the order, quality of the food and the delightful delivery. It was obvious they were always trying to provide little surprises with each order. From the muffins at breakfast to the imported bottled water at dinner they always "went the extra mile" to satisfy. Housekeeping was also outstanding. Our room was spotless every day. So when we finally did mention our first impression it wasn't such a big deal to us. Of course the manager assured us they would have moved us that first night if we had told them, but we were glad we didn't move. We loved the spaciousness and location of our room overlooking the Cable Car line on California St. We stayed 8 nights at the hotel and had a wonderful experience. The location is outstanding and the staff makes the experience exceptional. We will definitely stay at the Omni when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous financial district setting”
Reviews.Author: italygoodness
Reviews.Content: The SFO Omni is more beautiful than most I've seen. Rooms are large and regal. Bathrooms feel spacious and lovely. Lobby is posh, feels opulent. We could tell that the doormen were shocked when we said we were taking the BART to the airport upon check out...probably not their typical clientele. Ryan Hurd in Catering/Events is amazing! I would send any of my friends or business affiliates to him for a wedding or special event. Front desk team all very friendly, helpful, and happy. Bell team - on it, fast, friendly, and very eager to please. The Champagne upon arrival was a delightful surprise, but my husband felt even more excited with the warm cider & gingerbread men cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SarahandPaolo
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with king size bed. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful and we were given a glass of champagne on arrival, which was much appreciated after a long flight. The only downside to our stay, which was not the hotel's fault, was that we were woken up around 4am by other guests returning drunk and shouting loudly in the corridor. The hotel is well located for seeing the sights and we bought a three-day travel passport, which was excellent value, as it gave us unlimited travel on the trams, buses and trolley buses. The older trams, one of which travels up California Street, cost 6 dollars for a single journey and the passport costs 21 so you soon make your money back. We loved the food market at the Ferry Building on a Saturday morning (we also found places in the building for breakfast) and we also had a brilliant time visiting Alcatraz - just make sure you buy your tickets a few days in advance. For dinner, we found some great restaurants with outside seating just a short walk away from the hotel in Belden Place, which is tucked away in a quiet alley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: AYinEP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a wedding and were very pleased with the choice. As others have said, this is a terrific location for seeing the city. We parked our car and never took it out. It's an easy walk to the places you'll want to see: Chinatown, Nob Hill, Union Square, North Beach, Coit Tower, etc. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. The beds are very comfortable and the linens are crisp. Our room was bright and sunny and, though it faced California, I was never bothered by any noise, inside or out. In fact, it was hard to imagine that anyone else was in the hotel. The only negative that I can find is that, because it's in the Financial District, a lot of places are closed on the weekend. But, that's a very minor issue with this wonderful hotel. One hint is to join their loyalty club. It doesn't cost anything and affords you advantages like free wi-fi in your room and free newspapers delivered to your door.

Reviews.Title: “Best is SF”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this Omni because of it's great central location and keep coming back because of the friendly service. If you want a particularly restful stay, ask for a room facing the back of the property, away from California and Montgomery. The cable cars running up and down California can make quite a racket at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, attentive staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is considered to be in the financial district, it is convenient to key tourist sites -with the added benefit of being in a less crowded area. I personally think walkable to key sites, however, public transportation readily available if desired. For me, location is key & I prefer this area to right in the middle of Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf area. Rooms are nice with expected amenities for a hotel of this class. Service is above par - everyone I encountered couldn't do enough to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: JonTx
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. The Omni is great as usual. It is a bit old but it was very clean. The beds are great and we had a very nice suite. The staff could not be better including the desk, doorman, bellman, and maids. I will definitely return and the location is walking distance to everything. Perfect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan R
Reviews.Content: What a great find! This hotel has it all. Rooms are quiet, comfortable and very clean. All the staff were courteous and efficient. The desk staff were especially helpful with directions for getting around San Francisco. Hotel location is good with transport handy. It was easy to get transport to the world famous Fisherman's Wharf. Everything about the Omni says high quality for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Buckwilli
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here and had a great time. Easy walk to Union Square and Chinatown. I read where people said they walked to Fisherman's Wharf. I believe it, but I didn't walk that far. Trolley car runs right in front of the hotel. Be sure to sign up for the Omni Select thing before you go so you get free wi-fi and complimentary morning beverages brought to your room. Rooms were very nice, but in an "older people" type of way: wallpaper, flat screen television in an old-school looking entertainment center, etc. Everyone we encountered was very helpful, especially doorman/bellman/concierge Darryl. Just FYI, for some reason, it is difficult to hail a cab in San Francisco. There is no "line-up runway" for taxis in front of the hotel, so it was occasionally hard to get a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Hong_Kong_Star
Reviews.Content: Wow, we are very impressed !!! - highly efficient and extremely kind service (reservation, front desk, door men). These people are working hard to please the guests in a relaxed atmosphere, - the rooms (we had 2 rooms), very clean & comfy and so quiet, - easy late check-out, - loved the location (close to Chinatown and the cable car right there + plenty of restaurants and small cafes and shops), - delicious and healthy "a la carte" breafast. Quality and quantity.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldBear
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night stay was superb from the minute we arrived to the final minute of our stay. The staff, from Richard (front desk) to Barny (doorman) were all so polite, friendly and knowledgable. The Hotel room had a courtyard view, so no noise was heard from outside. It had a very comfortable bed and the room was spacious with good quality furniture.The location is good and is less than a 15 - 20 minute walk to Market Street, The Ferry Building or Little Italy,5 mins walk to China Town. Everywhere else is a $2.00 streetcar ride away( Pier 39, Alcatraz Ferry) The historic cable car which runs past the hotel at the cost of $6.00 single trip. Additional points to note: Join as an 'OMNI Select Guest' for free before or when you arrive. This entitles you to free Wi-Fi, free water on first night, free daily newspaper and either juice of coffee delivered to your room each morning at a time you request. Very pleased with this hotel and would not hesitate to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: fsublume
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the rooms clean. Very nice bathroom/shower. 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard, nice location”
Reviews.Author: nako51
Reviews.Content: Nice, but small rooms. Attendant and friendly staff...very service oriented and helpful. Their parking during the week is close to $50/day!!! Suggest parking across the street at Bank of America. Didn't appreciate the tall doorman ogling my daughter as we walked out. Overall, a nice place, but nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not cheap tho”
Reviews.Author: Luke R
Reviews.Content: Me and my missus stayed here for 3 nights in October this year Here are my comments: great service, friendly staff clean hotel, well polished very comfy beds quite expensive at over £300 per night good location right next to a tram stop and chinatown just up the hill nice gym shame it has no pool the breakfast is good but should be at $30 per person I would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jisten1
Reviews.Content: Celebrated 3 days at Omni for our honeymoon! What a perfect location in San Francisco, a short walk from everything. On arrival we were greeted by Paul, and his exceptional level of service and helpfulness was outstanding. We were upgraded to a beautiful 14th floor suite, and could not have been happier. The room was spotless, huge, and well appointed. The bed was absolutely perfect, as was the shower, towels, and robes. The door staff was friendly, and a taxi or town car was always available out front when we needed one. We will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Hotel... Just has the best smell”
Reviews.Author: Bee2979
Reviews.Content: Hey travelers...first timer to San Fran and this was a great place to stay. The room was super nice and clean. I could have gotten a better view, but not complaining. The shower WAS TO DIE FOR... OMG. I spent most of my time in it. The Bed slept like heaven...better than my own. I had an accident the second day (fell off my bike). It still did not change how good I slept in that bed...and I had scrapped up my hands. Oh and speaking of...the hotel gave me a ton of bandaids and was super nice about my injuries. It was close to a ton of stuff. I ended up walking around to a lot of spots just by going a few blocks. Anytime I asked directions the people were happy to help and oh the smell. I am not sure what they clean that place with, but I swear, it was the best smelling hotel I have ever been in. I mean a Hotel, smelled like obsessively clean. I mean talk about sparkle and shine. I love it, go there, nice folks, clean spot, great bathrooms, nice smell, If you want fresh and clean and high standards without breaking the bank. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MacGIlligorilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our family of four and enjoyed the hotel very much. Ideally located - 3 blocks to shopping district, 1 block to china town, 3 blocks to italian restaurants on Columbus. Felt very safe in area which is mostly business people during the weekdays. Nice to be a bit away from crowds at Union Square area. Staff was very friendly, especially doormen who always had a smile and welcome back for our kids. Cookies and milk were delivered nightly to our room for our kids which they also loved. Room was very comfortable with complementary coffee in morning and bottled water in evening. Our room overlooked California street and cable cars but we didn't hear the traffic at all. Did not eat at the restaurant downstairs as was too fancy and pricey. Lots of other choices around the hotel for food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MJMJONCape
Reviews.Content: Tough to tell what the "right" location is, but this is as good as it gets. The OMNI is right on the cable car route...just step outside. It's also walkable to Union Square and even the Embarcardero (maybe 20 minutes). Plenty of eating options in the area as well. If you are a AAA member, they offer some great deals well below listed prices. First stop after checking in should be to see Lex, the concierge. He knows everything there is to know about SF...period, and is fun to listen to. He made a big difference in our visit ! This hotel provides first class luxury at less than half the price of the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, excellent staff, spacious 4 star rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tvl_bluepass
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Francisco as a solo traveler to celebrate a special occasion. It was a great trip. I explored the city (tourist and neighborhoods) with great shopping and meals in a long weekend. I'd go again without hesitation. The Omni was a nice hotel and in retrospect, I was glad it was away from the crowded touristy attractions (think lots of people and a push to get into the hotel lobby-ugh). The hotel is located in the financial district and is 4 blocks from the metro. I took it at 7pm in the evening and had no problems. Only do this if you're traveling light- there are stairs going up at your arrival location. Rooms are styled in typical Omni style (think conservative colonial) but are well appointed with luxury details. Service is outstanding- the front desk is to be commended for true 5 star service. You can trust the staff for excellent food recommendations. Front of the building has better 'views' (street scene). For me, it was quiet but a very light sleeper might be bothered by the street car that runs in front of the hotel. Join the loyalty program before you go and you will receive free wifi. The lobby bar is a good (but expensive) hangout if you're coming in from a redeye flight. You are around the corner from Chinatown (good eats), 2 blocks from the Pier/Waterfront. I felt safe walking during the day and early evening. It is not a neighborhood hopping with nightlife- you'll have to taxi out but it is very nice to return and recharge from the crowds. In this location, you can explore a street fair, take a short zip line (over the open area in front of the pier- it looked fun), walk along the Pier and browse a smaller open air stalls (think upscale gift shops) in the pier building a few blocks from the hotel. Although the street car runs in front of the hotel, it is not your best option. It is expensive, ($8.00) and there is no on and off. Each time you come on, you pay. One on and off stop could cost a family of four enough for dinner. No wonder they only had a few unsuspecting tourists during my stay. With that said, San Francisco is not a walkable city. One look at the steep streets will quickly force you to go to plan B. As I did not want the bother of renting a car, my plan B was to purchase a 2 day pass ($50- all access) on one of the sightseeing buses that run on loop in the various SF neighborhoods (Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Haight-Ashbury, Chinatown). Depending upon your package, you have the opportunity to go to other destinations outside of the city. I used this package to tour the bridge, shop the neighborhoods throughout the day and tour a small waterfront town just outside of the city throughout the weekend. No charge for getting on and off. I took one loop to get a feel for the city and spent the rest of the time getting on and off to explore and shop in the different neighborhoods. Haight-Ashbury was a blast (think retro 60's) with nice shopping and cheap eat restaurants for lunch. Union Square was shopping and Fisherman's Wharf was tons of crowds but a great area for young children (small parks to run around, stroller friendly streets, people watching bars for the parents to chill out at). Other things to do... take a ferry to Saucilito, a small waterfront town to browse the art galleries. Rent a bike and take a guided tour across the Bridge (bike over, ferry back). Take a Segway tour of the neighborhoods. Best shopping (think funky shops, not national malls) is in Haight-Ashbury neighborhoods. There is a nice Macy's and Bloomingdales in Union Square for the mall deprived. The hotel front staff is excellent and extremely well versed about the city, but if you're looking for neighborhood nightlife, (jazz, clubs, brunch), I'd use your 'free' wifi to browse Yelp and find recommendations to plan your non-touristy excursions. This worked well for me and allowed me to find an amazing small, neighborhood jazz brunch for Sunday morning and fun evening out. As an experienced (and hopefully smart) traveler, I used the internet for choices and then vetted transportation/neighborhoods/reputation with the front desk after to make sure I was informed with the best choice as a solo traveler. In summary: Upscale luxury hotel, excellent staff and service. Good location- away from the crowds but close enough to Chinatown to explore. Be sure to use your AAA card (best rate) and sign up for the loyalty program (free wifi) for the best experience. The TripAdvisor community has been great. Thanks for your reviews- hope this was helpful in return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A_and_B_from_PA
Reviews.Content: Please note that we were fortunate to be able to stay here at a pretty reduced rate, so I am reviewing this as a bit of a bargain given the location. If I had paid $500/night, I might be thinking a bit differently. But with that said, we thoroughly enjoyed the extremely clean, quiet and comfortable environment at the Omni and the service was even better. Rainy day? They can't wait to provide an umbrella. Want directions? They can't wait to bring them. Need a restaurant that delivers late at night? No problem! The coffee, tea and newspaper service was right on time. This is not the place for those seeking a Residence Inn-type free breakfast or separate dining area, so keep that in mind. But for a couple seeking a great stay in a terrific location - it would be tough to beat. We are very veteran San Francisco travelers and this was at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Shey07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, central and a decent price. Fisherman's Wharf is a 20 min walk. Coit tower and lombard street are all within walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again. There are a couple of nice cafes for breakfast near the hotel, however note that on the weekends these are all closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ the Omni SF”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco Hotel for 2 nights in early Oct 2011. Originally this hotel was outside our price range though after a rather unpleasant night at another hotel near Fisherman's Wharf I called to see if they had a room. They did (and at a great price) so 30 minutes later the four of use (me, wife, 9yo & 5yo) were moving in. Our room was ready at 11am which was great, we had two double bed which worked for us. Our stay was over a Friday & Saturday, I suspect their less busy nights. The rooms were a good size and quite reflective of what was advertised on their website. The hotel is in what they call the Financial District which is a ghost town on the weekend for 1km in any direction. That said Union Square and Chinatown are within easy walking distance - 10 to 15 min. The restaurant was very expensive so we ate at a great steakhouse just down the road Tadish Grill (they claim to be SF oldest restaurant) which was excellent. We had breakfast included in our package which was 4 x $30 vouchers which easily fed the four of us. I can recommend at stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni aims to please”
Reviews.Author: JWimmer74
Reviews.Content: What a classy hotel. The Omni is in a great location, walking distance from China Town, North Beach and Union Square. The California line cable car runs right out the front doors of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, from the doorman to the check in, and the concierge to the housekeeping, everyone said hi and asked if there was anything we needed. We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival when they found out we were celebrating our anniversary. The room was very spacious, had a good view of the city and nice bathroom. Having stayed in other hotels in San Francisco, I felt that the value of The Omni was great. If you sign up for their free Select Guest program you get free wi-fi, complimentary morning beverage, express check out, etc. We will definitely be visiting The Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “concierge is the best”
Reviews.Author: calendergirl
Reviews.Content: Concierge is the best. Lex, Head of Concierge is a legend.We hadn't planned this part of our trip very well but we needn't of worried as he was a mined of information. Bit of advice, if you want to go to Alcatraz book before you go. The trips were booked up for three weeks in advance. The location is excellent with the street cars going straight past this lovely hotel. Some stop on the corner opposite. The staff at the Omni were some of the friendliest we have ever encountered from one of the 'big chains' of hotels. Great comfortable base.

Reviews.Title: “Super location in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Scroggie
Reviews.Content: A gracious hotel that went out of their way to see to our needs during our stay in San Francisco. Staff was outstanding- quite helpful for our 1st SF visit of places to see & dine. Always had fresh fruit & drink in the lobby. Enjoyed the bar where they made excellent mixed drinks. Trolley line was right outside the door, F line at waterfront was only several blocks and the BART was only 2 blocks away. Buy their 3-day pass to save money on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “San Fransisco in the fall!”
Reviews.Author: Robinkennedyoshio
Reviews.Content: One o fthe best weekens of my life! Began our journey on an overnight floght from Hawaii forgetting that asking for an early check in might have been a good idea. The staff at The Omni were so gracious and accomodating! They gave is a room by ten am and what a room it was. Beautiful bathrooms, bedding and decor. The hotel lobby and restaurant were very nice as well. The bar was a good time any tme of the day. The hotel is centrally located just blocks a way frm Chinatown and Little Italy. The hotel even knows the restaurants that will deliver! You can get anywhere with pubic transportation. Suggest buying the three day mini pass that allows you to jump on the Bart, The Muni, The Cable cars or the Bus. No rental car needed. Parking is expensive and hard to come by. I would stay at this hotel every time. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: sscc0404
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears to be a well oiled machine Everything works well and smoothly. I arrived and I had already my check-in prepared. The rooms are comfortable - we took 2 connected rooms and they were spotless. Free wireless is also something I appreciated (I just had to register as omni member to be entitle to it) The view from the room was a bit depressing as we got a room only on the 8th floor. They also offered walk city tours with a free of charge guide (which we did not take.) Reception and concierge staff extremely friendly. The staff at the Bar is not very accommodating and customer oriented: we arrived at 23:50 and wanted to have a quick drink but they refused to take the order. Apparently even if the bar closes at midnight they have the last call at 11:45. We were 5 minutes too late! would be good to informe customers about the last call rule. While leaving I hit a car in front of the hotel. They took care of all the paper-work, which was nice of them. So I cannot really say anything bad about the hotel - it is spotless.. it just misses the special touch to make it exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: ajpickard
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Omni it is a first class place. Bob's is a great spot especially the bar. We got special treatment because it was our anniversary! They sent up chocolate covered strawberries and a special turn down service with a rose. It is also is a great location you can jump on the cable car right in front of the hotel. Short walk to several great spots including China Town and the Ferry building. We ate at Wayfare Tavern and Bix both within a short walk. Also great views of the Transamerican Pyramid. Only down side was I couldn't get good wireless on the 17th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon couple from Scotland”
Reviews.Author: jane p
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel as part of out honeymoon. After a 3hr delay at the airport it was great to arrive at our room to bottles of water and Strawberries covered in chocolate. Hotel staff couldnt do enough for you. Hotel was amazing would definatley stay here again if we are back in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: JudyJudyJudyH
Reviews.Content: I knew of the Omni from "Oprah". "Guests on the Oprah show stay at the Omni". I stayed her with my husband for three nights. The front desk staff were amazing and ZAW was especially helpful and made us feel right away we chose the right place. The concierge LEX was so helpful in finding a restaurant for us for our anniversary as well as getting theater tickets. We just asked and he delivered. I don't know the name of the maids but they were so meticulous and left everything spotless and they even wrote us a personal note wishing us well. I would highly recommend The OMNI for those visiting San Francisco on business or leisure. I have stayed at the W, the Fairmont and the Palace. The Omni wins for service and the total package.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JamesBeswick
Reviews.Content: Apart from the impeccable service, the rooms are extremely comfortable and there is a full set of amenities throughout the hotel. There's simply no comparison to similarly priced hotels in the area in terms of quality and this is the first hotel I try to book whenever I'm in the city. The concierge at this hotel is especially helpful if you need any advice for restaurants or things to do. Don't forget to join the free Select Guest program for free wifi, morning beverages and other perks. Also, weekday valet parking is a bargain at $26 given the price of local parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel with A Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: sscroggs311
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Omni was first rate all the way. Easy check in and express check out made the business end a breeze. The room was top flight, yet California Street is a busy street so expect some noise, it wasn't distracting. Right next to the trolley, movement around town was easy and it was only five blocks to the Embarcadaro and Bart was even closer. Most impressive was the staff. The front desk was helpful to a fault. There was no request to small, either Muni passes or tours, I just had to ask and it was done. The room was spotless and kept that way. The Ferry market is walkable as is the "F" line is to Fishermans Wharf. The Front Desk even had the tree day passport that works on the trolley, "F" line and all the buses. Bob's Steakhouse and Bob's Bar are also first rate. weekend rates are a steal. Put this place on your bucket list, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, superb location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olatina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni on aug 4th for 3 nights, and our choice couldnt be better!!! amazing staff, family friendly and spotless, chic, great location(close to Chinatown, montgomery subway st. and to the ferry building), and particularly great service!
