My daughter received a backpack with toys and amenities and she loved feeling welcome, we got cookies and milk every evening, and the turndown service every evening is brilliant, you feel pampered and treated like a queen. The rooms are bit small, althouth we booked for a deluxe room, the decorations are classic and european style, we got a room with an amazing view,at the top of the hotel. They have complementary tea and fruits at the lobby, and the hotel is very silent, the beds are ultracomfy and thepillows and bedding are so clean and divine. The only cons i founded in this hotel is the restaurant,the food is very good but ultra expensive, no worthy to throw the money that way in only breakfast, there are many places around that are cheaper, but yet,not that cheap, its always San Francisco,an expensive city. anyway, we loved it and it's really close to the Ferry building and tourist attractions, also to chinatown and its colorful life and good restaurants. I recommend it to families because its totally suitalbe for childrens, not easy to find in the city!!! We miss you Omni!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel staff member is extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: We decided on July 3rd to fly to San Francisco on July 6th for an eight day trip down the California coast leaving out of Los Angeles. There was no time to plan for anything, other than a rental car and a hotel for the first couple of nights. Randomly chose the Omni after reading some reviews and what a great choice. Yes, this is more of a business hotel because of the location, but honestly, staying down by the piers would just be too touristy for us. The hotel has a very helpful and knowledgeable concierge, but honestly, every staff member knows their "stuff" and is more than willing to spend time informing you. The doorman would ask "where are you headed? Do you need directions? Ideas?" etc. Perfect for us Floridians who had no idea other than the Frommers book I read on the plane there. The hotel is spotless, the rooms are very nice, the decorations (fresh flowers huge bouquets, chandelier, etc.) are wonderful. Took the train from the airport, and with their help via phone, walked the two blocks at nine p.m. and found the hotel. Called before hand asking for a roll away bed for my daughter and they had the bed all set up and room waiting for us. Starving, the front desk recommended Tadich Grill which is a half block to your left out the front door. Wonderful historical restaurant with great seafood. You are very close to China Town here, but better than that, get up at 7 a.m. Saturday morning and head left out the door to the Farmers Market before the crowds show up. Best market I've been to in a long time, and bring your camera! Fresh flowers, produce, types of tomatoes I've never heard of, seafood, organic poultry, crafts, muscisians, breakfast and all right on the water. On the way, past hundreds of women in pink for a breast cancer walk along with a bike cop assisting the walk. He wore his cop uniform with a pink tutu and pink rabbit ears! Only in San Francisco. It was great. The cable car runs right outside the hotel and there is a public parking garage for the church on the corner to park at that is much cheaper than the hotel parking. Great start for a wonderful last minute vacation before we sent our daughter off to college! Highly recommend the Omni and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: fhennessy
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Omni. The customer service and staff are excellent and only too willing to offer assistance. The rooms are large with all amenities. It does make sense to sign up for the free loyalty program before travelling to avail of free wifi inthe room and morning paper. With an excellent location for most of the main city sights it is a good location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Damian D
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Every member of staff we encountered from the doorman and reception staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Laura Campi, who was on Reception upon our arrival gave excellent service, including giving advice on local restaurants, printing off some menus and also handing over a business card to our 4 yr old son and informing him to hand it over to a Policeman if he ever got separated from us. This hotel also provided our 4 yr old son with a welcome backpack full of goodies. Our son wore the backpack contstantly until we got back home from our trip and the items in the pack kept him entertained. The hotel also sent up each night a couple of cookies and a glass of milk for him and it is touches like this which will forever make this hotel a standout. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The location was excellent, near the Ferry Building and the BART station + also being able to pick up a cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Staff reflects customer-centric focus. Rooms and beds are comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco represents an ideal choice for business travelers who happen to have a meeting or a satellite office in the financial district. Focused on providing responsive customer service, the Omni staff is friendly and pro-active in addressing the needs of guests. You will find the rooms are sufficiently large and the beds are of high quality - with thick, soft comforters. The bathrooms are more than adequate in size and quality. From a location perspective, the Omni is well situated in the heart of downtown and within easy walking distance to Chinatown, the Bay, and Pac Bell Park (the San Francisco Giants stadium). One recommendation for those wanting to save a few $. The subway (BART) runs from the airport to Montgomery station for $8, which is only about 5 blocks from the hotel (a comfortable walk). This is much cheaper than the $40 you will pay for a cab, for those who cannot expense their travel. While I can offer no drawbacks to the rooms or staff, there is some street noise that filters into the rooms, esp when sirens go off or horns are used. This is not unique to the Omni, but since it is situated on a busy corner of downtown, you get a lot of traffic - even in the evening. I will also point out that the rooms do not have particularly nice views. You can see other tall buildings and the streets of the city, but not the Bay nor the broader skyline. Not a big deal, but definitely not a romantic setting. Speaking of romance, this is not the hotel to bring your spouse for that special occassion. While a perfect stay, in many ways, for the business traveler, there is nothing about this hotel that lends itself to romance or having a memorable experience with your true-love. A steak restaurant is housed on the main floor of the hotel, and provides a solid, though not spectacular, dining option for those who arrive late and do not want to go out for dinner. The steaks come with side dishes (do not need to purchase ala carte), and are offered at a reasonable price. Other dining options include several high quality and authentic Asian restaurants in nearby Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city visit”
Reviews.Author: LesleyLu
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff greeted us and the hotel is very impressive when you arrive. We were given an upgraded room but it had a view of the side of a building and the sink was cracked. Overall we were very pleased, but it was let down by the small details

Reviews.Title: “*Lurved* this hotel”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: Great city hotel. Such a lovely, comfortable and well maintained room and helpful staff. I'm often disappointed in hotels in SF and NYC - quality to value ratios are very hard to get right but this hotel does it perfectly. I'm more and more a fan of the Omni brand. Select Guest perks alone (free room service coffee!) will make me pick Omni over the competition. Room is classic in design, bed is comfortable, bathroom was large and well designed. My only negative is that the food in the bar/restaurant area is not up to the standard of the hotel. Very expensive with mediocre quality. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service”
Reviews.Author: ysuindy
Reviews.Content: My 16 year-old son and I spent four nights in early August at the Omni on our summer baseball trip. The Omni was easily the favorite of our five hotel, 12 night trip. The customer service at The Omni was unparalleled and sets it apart from other hotels, both on this trip and in my overall travel. It was nice to show my son what world class hotel service looks like. Reservations staff, front desk personnel, the bell staff and most prominently the concierges were all great to work with. The excellent customer service started even before we checked in. I had been checking various websites for several months before we left on our trip, looking for bargains and good deals. When I saw a reference to a $199 per night rate for The Omni, with full cancellation rights up until the day before check-in, I immediately made the reservation, recognizing this was a great price for a highly rated hotel in San Francisco. I was quite surprised when my credit card bill arrived about 7 weeks later with a charge for the full four night cost of my reservation. I made a call to the hotel and left a message with the reservations staff. Within an hour they had called back to tell me that the rate I had booked was a full prepayment rate with no cancellation rights. They immediately told me that I had apparently booked the first day the rate was on the website and that it originally had been erroneously set up without prepayment requirements. The offer was corrected the day after I made my reservation and an automated billing program searching for the package I bought without a charge, billed me for it. I was told that a full credit had already been issued to my account and the package name was changed to keep me from being charged again, but the price and all other components of my package would be honored. I had expected a fight, but The Omni clearly recognized my reservation did not state prepayment and they immediately admitted it. It was nice to not only receive information that my credit was issued, but to also be told how it happened and what was done to make sure it did not happen again - for me that is very important and is a sign of good policies. We flew in to SFO around Noon on a Saturday. We foolishly took BART from the airport in to The City. I say foolishly simply because we spent too much time getting to the BART station and then waiting for the train. We should have taken a cab. We lost an hour of sight-seeing opportunities. Having said that, the walk from the Montgomery Street BART/Muni station was easy, even with our 12 days of luggage. The walk was generally flat. The Omni sits at the base of the climb up California Street that eventually reaches Nob Hill. Our request was for a room on a high floor away from the elevator. Because we arrived prior to check-in time, not all rooms had been cleaned. We were offerered and took a room on the 9th floor, near the elevator. Our concerns about noise near the elevator were unfounded. The room was very quiet and we enjoyed the convenience of being close to the elevators. We joined the Select Guest program when I made the reservation. Members receive free wireless internet in the room as well as free morning beverages. We had orange juice delivered each morning – very nice to have. Cookies and milk were brought each evening – a nice touch although we were rarely in the room when they were delivered. Maintaining a comfortable temperature in the room was easy, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was appropriately sized, towels were plush, toiletries were very nice. The in room safe was large enough for my netbook and my son’s Mac. As I noted above the concierges were incredible to work with. All of the concierges were very helpful with directions (to the Golden Gate Bridge, AT&T Park, Alcatraz Cruise, etc) and dining recommendations. We want to single out Juan in particular for his assistance and interest in what we were doing. Juan even recognized us on the street and called to us by name as we were returning to the hotel and he was heading home for the night. After a poor experience with a concierge in San Diego, it was nice to deal with competent, engaging staff at The Omni. We enjoyed the location of The Omni – an easy walk from BART/Muni, right on the California line cable car and within a few blocks of many bus routes. You can buy a Muni pass in the baggage claim areas at SFO - we used the passes often. We walked to Union Square as well as to the Ferry Building. The primary purpose of our trip was baseball – we saw three Giants games. AT&T Park was about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. We took the Muni to the games, walked back. The area around the hotel was not busy late night after the games. We did not feel threatened at all, but we did have our wits about us – paying attention to where we were going, watching who else was out and on at least one occasion crossing the street to the other side just to be safe. There are not many restaurants near the hotel – ask for recommendations from the concierge staff. We did not do this the first few nights we were there, we wish we did. Consider the Royal Exchange, a few blocks away. We had an excellent early dinner before a Giants game there. We rented a car at the Budget counter in the Hyatt Embarcadero after checking out of the hotel. The bell staff held our bags until we could get back with the car – we loaded up in front of the hotel and set off for Santa Cruz. I really do not have anything negative to say about our stay. I have stayed in more luxurious hotels and in larger rooms and suites – some may stay the physical plant of The Omni is not a five star hotel and I don’t think I could argue the point. But the service is most assuredly five star quality. I would absolutely try to stay at The Omni if I returned to San Francisco – but price would be a consideration. I am not sure how much I would pay to stay here – I would pay more to stay here – but I can’t say for sure how much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TxTxAustin
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely fabulous location in the city. The room was clean and the concierge was always spot-on with recommendations for restaurants and museums. The only problem I had was my card was charged too much, but the mistake was promptly corrected. Everyone from the doormen, front desk staff, to the housekeeping dept. were incredibly friendly and helpful! Will return for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lana2004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, but pretty walkable to many points of interest. It's also a few blocs from the BART, so you can get anywhere in the City pretty quickly. Beds were so comfortable! The staff was extremely helpful and polite. It's not a boutique hotel, so it doesn't feel terribly unique, but it's an Omni, so what can you expect? Overall, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: smercury
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for July 4th weekend. It is in the financial district, but we were able to easily walk to Chinatown around the corner, and the Ferry building several blocks down. The valets were very efficient. The concierge was not as helpful for late-night recommendations for food, but we were able to find a nice restaurant close by online. The room was clean, and the bathroom was large and excellent furnishings. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with comfort”
Reviews.Author: RitaTS
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay right at edge of financial district. Hotel staff was quite friendly and helpful. Room clean and bed quite comfortable. Trolley service right outside door, though you might be waiting awhile for it to arrive. Location is on California Ave. which is convenient to Union Square & short walk to BART and F-line. No need for taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and location”
Reviews.Author: MYF1007
Reviews.Content: I took my 9-yr-old son there for a weekend getaway and the staff treated him like a VIP. He received an Omni Kid's Pack upon arrival and they delivered milk and cookies to our room that evening. He was so excited! The staff, especially the concierge, spent extra time giving us pointers on places to visit and drew everything out on a map, including how to use the trains and trolleys. We probably would have been lost without it! The hotel is beautiful and centrally located in the downtown area, just a short ride away from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. It was perfect so that we weren't around all the crowds and traffic. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and big room. Watch out for parking charges”
Reviews.Author: MPTO
Reviews.Content: Great location, big room and friendly staff (thanks to Lex for the history lesson). However, if you are parking the costs are high, $48 per day during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cnsmama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend sans kids. Terrific service from the moment we pulled up. The doorman was incredibly welcoming and helpful, offering suggestions on where to dine & even calling to try and get us a table. We have enough dinner suggestions from him for three more weekend getaways! We were upgraded to a suite, and it was fabulous! Nice living room, spacious bedroom and swanky bath. We returned from dinner to find slippers by our bed, robes out and-get this-two roses on our pillows! Definitely recommend joining the free Omni reward program as you get lots of goodies that make you feel totally pampered...they brought us chocolates when we checked in, and free morning beverage and pastry of your choice the next morning. Location is terrific...easy walking distance to all of downtown. Whole interior is gorgeous. But what makes it really top notch is the friendly, professional service and little personal touches. Not to mention rates are very reasonable for a big city hotel! We'll be back...hopefully at least every other month if the babysitting gods are good to us!

Reviews.Title: “Delivered”
Reviews.Author: grimes921
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the financial district and we were able to get a $290/night room for $200/night due to a " Labor Day Weekend " sale. The hotel staff was exceptional from the maids to the concierge. The famed cable cars run right in front of the hotel and add a nice touch to the atmosphere. My wife and I walked everywhere. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes. Chinatown and the North Beach Italian sections are a short walk away and the restaurant options are great.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Guest”
Reviews.Author: 1CrazyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I want to start of by saying we have stayed at the Omni in San Diego (newer) so I was a little (a lot) weary of staying at this location. I am a complete germaphobe and typically travel with my own sheets and towel, but I didn't this time around. We stayed in room 1305, no view of anything interesting (unless you want to stare into offices) but overall the room was clean (which is very important). The only exception were a few things I didn't notice until the last day (strange dripping on wall by desk, dirty lamp shade and mold on shower curtain). On the upside, housekeeping was very good during our stay and we love the little perks of being Omni Select Guests ie. free internet, coffee/juice in AM, local paper! Overall a pleasant trip and staff was really friendly, we would stay again (just request a room with a view)! Additional side note: don't go to bar, very expensive and bartender did not know how to make drinks listed in menu! At least not well!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: irina089
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on good reviews from trip advisor. Stayed for 2 nights with toddler. On our 2nd night they brought complimentary milk & cookies for my daughter, this was a very nice touch. Overall a nice place to stay. Highly recommended. The only drawback are very small windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cheezel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Omni for its location. It is a comfortable walk to most of the attractions (including the Wharf) we wanted to visit and for those further away the cable car stops almost outside the front door. The front desk staff were informative and helpful. Fresh fruit was also available in the entry (a nice touch). Our room was on the 17th floor and had an attractive city and small harbor view. The room was comfortable, clean and well serviced. We had one in room meal which was very good (creme brulee' was excellent). Breakfast was good with window tables giving an interesting street view. One waiter (male) did not seem to fully understand our requests. However he was the only staff member that was not overly helpful or did not seem very friendly. Although the Omni is not a cheap option it is close to many tourist attractions and shopping. I would not hesitate stay in this hotel again when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: italnbull
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with chocolate covered strawberries, a yellow rose on the bed and a nice note welcoming us! That being said the customer service was fabulous! Welcoming, friendly, very accommodating! The only drawback was trying to eat after 8-9, and the room service charges. But I DO recommend the Greek yogurt with honey in the morning. If you are a loyalty member you will get free wifi and a free morning beverage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishPaddy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for a few nights as part of our trip in August 2011. All in all, this is a wonderful hotel. We got upgraded to a suite on checkin, which was very pleasant and the Nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. Every staff member gave impeccable service, from the front desk, to the valet parker, to the restaurant and bar staff. I have only ever seen such a cohesive bunch of hotel workers in one hotel proir to this. We had dinner in both Bob's steak and chop house and the bar on different nights. Again, the food and service were superb. The Omni is not cheap, but then again, you certainly get what you pay for. One disappointment is the rather pokey business centre (Yes they do offer free boarding card printing) but the cost of using the internet borders on extortion.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't give it an 'average,' but very good isn't quite right, either!”
Reviews.Author: ASM1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni a total of five nights. We were traveling with young children, and had requested a connecting room. As always, we would not have booked there if this wasn't a possibility. During our first leg of the journey, there was no problem. We had two lovely, connecting rooms, and the service was genial. We were struck by how expensive the restaurant was; we decided right away not to eat there if we could avoid it (and with the culinary delights of San Fran beckoning, didn't mind that too much). However, the one breakfast we did eat there was no fun. It took a while just to get water, and even longer to place our order (and even longer to get the food!). Our sweet waitress apologized profusely, and even management admitted to being very busy. (Please remember this was the week Hurricane Irene was traveling up the E. Coast, and many people were stranded.) When the food did arrive, it was wrong--my daughter's order was completely different, and mine was not what I'd been told it would be, even after very specific questioning. We also had a dinner there after being delayed one night, and it was okay. If you DO go to the restaurant (and you probably shouldn't), stick with the steaks, which are very good. Anyway, we had plans to check back in to the Omni on our return leg--like our initial reservations, these had been made two months in advance. Because of the hurricane (we live in NJ), we had to add another night to our reservation. That was all done with no problem. But when we checked back in, we were informed (after a lot of hemming and hawing) that we did not have connecting rooms. I asked why, and was told that it was OUR fault, that when we'd extended our stay, we'd forfeited our rooms--though no one told us this upfront, and it seemed really weird, like we were somehow being penalized for booking an extra night!!! At any rate, they offered to pay for one of the room, and told us we'd be moved to connecting rooms the next day (after having to pack and repack for our trip so often, by then, I could barely imagine doing it again). So, while i was far from happy, I took that as a gesture of good will... Then we got into our non-connecting rooms (meaning one adult would, of course, have to stay with one child). And guess what? One of those rooms had only a King bed--meaning an adult would have to sleep with one of the kids. Not only that, but the room we were given was pretty bad--right above the street, right above the entrance to the restaurant, dirty carpeting, cramped, etc. (NOTE: If you stay here, request high floors. Though the financial district is pretty dead at night and on weekends, it sits at the intersection of two very busy streets.) Again, after the manager did initially blame us for the problem, the hotel in general did try to make it up to us. They even paid for that regrettable breakfast mentioned above. But it felt pretty bad to be spending so much money there, to have done all OUR homework, and to be treated so badly. Furthermore, there wasn't a lot of value-added to this hotel. It would have been nice to have, for instance, an alternative, more casual, LESS expensive dining alternative (and forget about room service--it was absurd). I see they are trying to lure more families with the cookies and milk at night and the little backpacks (which, frankly, were kind of babyish for my 7 and 10 year old).

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: Jeni49
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here at the start of a recent trip down the coast. It was a great start to our holiday. The staff were excellent, the room - whilst not overly large - was clean and well furnished and we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast each day in Bobs Grill. We found the hotel to be in an excellent location, close to China Town and a short walk from the Embarcadero and Union Square. If you prefer to take local transport you can hop on a cable car almost right outside the hotel and ride down to the piers. My eldest son enjoyed using the hotel gym which is well equipped. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hard on the chequebook if you have a family”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryfamily65
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay here. The service was outstanding, perhaps the friendliest non-obsequious staff we have ever encountered. Without exception, they were pleasant to deal with.The rooms are clean, quiet and nicely appointed. Free internet and the usual trappings if you join their customer loyalty program. We have three children and had to get two rooms which made for an expensive trip. It would have been nice to have a family option that was a little cheaper. Otherwise it is an elegant hotel, well located, with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni because of past trip advisor reviews. Everything was correct the location was near to Union Square, near to the Ferry Buildings right in the cente of the city. We had a room on the upper floors and it was very quiet, a great size and very comfortable bed. 5 out of 5 stars for me and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: TO-ski-mom
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Omni for 6 nights in August 2011. The hotel staff was attentive, VERY friendly and quite helpful. The location could not be better! It is a much better location than staying in Union Square where the construction during the day makes it noisy and the crowds at night make it noisy. That being said, the OMNI (and our room) was directly across the street from buildings doing MAJOR construction and jackhammering very early in the morning...and on a SATURDAY morning (like 6am!!!|). But other than a few early morning wake-ups we had a lovely time. Just try and ask for a room on a high floor or not facing the construction. Also, bar fridge is very small and in inconvenient place -- makes it difficult to have your own water bottles, etc, Also, if you are travelling with a few other family members, drawer space is limited. **Suggestion: If you need a cab they are sometimes hard to find as SF is definitely NOT NYC!! But the nice OMNI doormen are amazing at getting one for you! Never met such friendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but I wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: notaworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in August 2011. Cons: I wasn't crazy about the decor of the rooms - it was generic and from the 90's. There was only a mini fridge, but we couldn't access it to keep leftovers in or chill beverages, and we didn't have an ice bucket either. The room looked out on a cement "courtyard" and into office building windows 20-30 feet away. When we requested pillows, they brought them up to our room right away. It never got cold enough in our room. Pros: The shining spot was the large room, large bathroom and large closet. The bathroom had a large marble shower and really high ceilings. The doormen were very friendly and called cabs for us. There were only 2 pillows on the king sized bed, and they were feather pillows, so it was not enough for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: PattiS108
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband to spend s quick weekend with my husband. I had never been to SF and did a lot of research on hotels. I finally decided on the Omni based mostly on the reviews here. We were not disappointed. I did request an upper level room, which did cut down on potential street noise, but don't open the windows at night! The street cleaners are still very loud, but with the windows closed it was completely quiet and we slept well. The room was clean and completely adequate for our short weekend. We werent going to spend much tine there anyway. We arrived late on were hungry and dressed very casually from our flight. The concierge was able to help us with a fantastic local place to eat just a block away. The little alley is filled with restaurants, a real hidden gem! We were able to walk to the train, the bus, Chinatown, and Union Square. There may not have been as much right at the front door, versus staying right in Union Square, but we found we were happy with the quiet location, and everything was still easy accessible. The hotel restaurant, Bob's Steak and Chop House, is very good. You can't go wrong there. If we ever return to SF I won't have to do all that research, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location and services”
Reviews.Author: Em70
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in San Francisco Omni Hotel. The location is only 3 blocks from Union Square and the shopping area, and just in front the business.financial district. Room was spacious but a bit "old" and probably will need to renovate rooms . Concierge was very supportive. Wifi is complimentary if you become "omni selected guest" member. For breakfast, there are several starbucks around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestFans
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in a fun part of town. I received a great rate for a Friday night stay through jetsetter.com. The door men and desk personnel were quite friendly. Rooms were clean and warmly decorated. Comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't have was a guest book or menu in the room that describes the amenities of the hotel, in-room dining, etc. So, I wasn't sure if they even offered room service, until I called the front desk - which they did. It was delivered within 30 minutes - their guarantee. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday trip!”
Reviews.Author: gina7167
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in San Francisco's financial district and loved it. They offer quite a few deals, but if you can afford it, it's defintely worth the stay. Staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. The hotel itself is beautiful and near some amazing restaurants (look for Beldon Place). We walked to Union Square, walked to great restaurants, came back to our room and there was a piece of decadent chocolate cake with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written on it. We will defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not as perfect as expected”
Reviews.Author: ks_bazhenova
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in SF for the 2-night stay after Hawaii getaway, before flying home. It was rated as Best Luxury hotel by Tripadvisor at this time, so I expected something special. The location of the hotel is very good - close to the center and main attractions, but the hotel itself is not as perfect. The interior does not look brand new & fresh, the room was quite small (compared to Fairmont Heritage hotel we stayed in before the trip to Hawaii = for the same price we got 5 times more space there). The view we got from the room - was a brick wall. There were no slippers & bathrobes (in a 5-star hotel!) in our room and it took ages for the staff to bring them, when we asked. We were waken up at 7am every morning, because the cleaning staff was talking loudly in the corridor outside our room in chinese - there is very bad noise isolation. But the thing we liked least is the service: not personalized, not attentive, long queues. The concierge was gone each day at 6 or 7 pm - and there was no one to help us with the restaurant booking, etc. in the eve. And finally, when we asked the staff to check us in for our flight - they've sent us to the PC in the corner of the lobby with a queue. no comments. I would recommend to choose Fairmont hotel instead - for almost the same price you will surely get a better room & service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and welcoming hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Glucan
Reviews.Content: My travels have taken me to San Francisco many times in the past, but this is the first time that I stayed in the Omni. Tripadviser reviews for the Omni pretty much say it all. It's an excellent hotel, ideally located in the heart of San Francisco. The hotel staff are warm and welcoming. Juan was particularly helpful. All of his recommendations were spot on. The room was spotless and well appointed. I particularly liked the convenience of the Omni. It's a short walk from the Omni to Chinatown or Union Square with easy access to just about any place in San Francisco via taxi or cable car. There's not much more to say other than I'll stay at the Omni on my next trip to Frisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfrotable rooms"”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye37
Reviews.Content: I had two rooms for a weekend trip with some friends for my 40th birthday. Rooms are very clean, updated, and stylish. Average size rooms, but quite and comfy. The staff was great and very helpful. Bob's Steakhouse has a nice bar if you want to catch a couple innings of your favorite team or grab a snack. Location is perfect. Right in the middle of all the areas. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: K8MN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two kids for 3 nights. From the minute we pulled up to the door, the staff was welcoming and helpful and made my kids laugh, even though it was 9 p.m. and we'd been driving all day. Our entire stay was lovely and worry-free. The housekeeping staff is on top of everything (they even bring cookies and milk for the kids every day) and the doormen are great. You can order off the restaurant menu in the lobby, which was nice with the kids. It was just a really pleasant experience and definitely a good example of getting what you pay for. We traveled from Seattle to LA and my kids talk about the Omni as their favorite stop. Tip: Sign up for their loyalty program before you arrive and you'll get free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Explrjunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I tend to prefer staying at Omni Hotels because they genrally offer comfortable accomodations and, most importantly, spectacular service. The Omni San Fran was no exception: the friendliness of the staff is what made this stay such a special one, particularly as we celebrated our anniversary. The hotel rooms are pretty standard, though extremely comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel (in the Financial District) was excellent as we could walk to many of the popular neighborhoods: we could get to the Embarcadero (and the all the yummy foods and the Ferry Building and awesome chocolates at Tcho on Pier 17), AT&T Park, North Beach (for Beach Blanket Babylon and TONS of coffee-a caffeine addict's paradise!), and Chinatown, no need for a car! What made this Omni so great (and why we continue to return to Omni Hotels) was the incredible service. The bellhops, front desk staff, and housekeeping were all so friendly. They answered tons of questions for us, directed us to restaurants, had nice treats for us at turndown, and even held our luggage for us on the day we checked out. We were even treated to a walking tour through Chinatown! My husband was trying to track down an old friend who he thought lived in the area and the front desk staff worked so hard to help him get phonebooks, do online searches, and call for information. We truly enjoyed our time in San Francisco and whenever we travel, one of the first things we research is whether or not an Omni hotel is located nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Just as many others on Trip Advisor have stated!”
Reviews.Author: sunspotman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the the Omni for an overnight stay in San Francisco. As many others have mentioned, this is a great place to stay in the City. It is right in the Financial District of San Francisco, in a nice part of town. The cable cars go up the hills of San Francisco on California St., right in front of the hotel. BART, the "F-line", and other mass transit are four blocks away at Market St. and Montgomery St.. We stayed to enjoy one of the "off-Broadway" shows on Market St., took the "F-line", ($2.00 each way), and felt very comfortable. We observed no security or rough passenger issues and the show ended at 11:00 PM. All the staff at the Omni are very helpful and all had great positive personalities. One just needs to ask the Concierge, or Clerk behind the front desk what your plans are, and you will be giving a map, informed how to get to where you want to go, and informed of the best ways to get there. Restaurants, coffee shops, and interesting sites are all walking distance from the Omni. At $48/night, (plus $6.25 tax), parking is costly on a weekday, but parking in S.F is limited. One does not have to be concerned about ones vehicle using their valet parking. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Horizon3
Reviews.Content: Although it's a fairly big hotel, it felt very cozy and warm. Everyone at the front desk were so helpful with restaurant and tours suggestions, listen to them they know what they're talking about! I loved the complementary morning coffee, they also have a nice selection of newspapers, but we felt breakfast was pricey. This hotel has the best location; especially for families! Walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Ferry Building Marketplace, great restaurants, etc. Also you can take the cable cars that run on california st. We're definitively confident recommending the Omni Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlillesand
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a very good in most aspects. We asked to have a room high up, and that is what we got. As soon as we arrived with the car, it was taken care of by the valets. The receptionists were great, the concierge also good - but again, we did not really feel that the breakfast was quite what we wanted. We were given vouchers for a certain amount of US dollars to spend on the in-house breakfast, which had a menu from which to choose items. The room was very good, although rustic and not modern - this was OK though, considering that the hotel is in a very prestigious and old area of San Francisco. The area gave us the possibilites to step straight out onto the California Tram, and to experience everything in San Francisco just by walking. We almost did not take our car out at all, we just used public transport. The hotel is great, but addinga real buffet to the breakfast would make it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again next time back in SF”
Reviews.Author: Ssleepy
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to relate back to readers during our 3 day stay at the Omni! We did online check -in the day before our arrival, which worked out well.....having arrived at midnight it was nice to see an envelope with our name on it beside the front desk. inside was our room key and all other pertinent need-to-know info....we simply took the envelope and went straight up to our room. A huge slice of delicious Chocolate Birthday Cake with card, was waiting for us in the room.....nice touch. Hotel staff and service here at the Omni are professional, helpful and friendly. Rooms are very clean and all furnishings are in great shape with no signs of wear. Bathroom had more than enought towels and amenities, as well as good shower pressure. Internet (wired & wireless) works well and easy to connect. We were on the 16th floor which was quiet. Location was great for us. 5 min walk to Chinatown, 15 min walk to Ferry Building, 20 min walk to Union Square. We discovered some nice little cafe's and pubs hidden in the alleyways (Belden Place) between the office buildings extemely close to the hotel. Tadich Grill, Michael Mina, Perbacco, One Market restaurants all within 5-15 min walk from hotel. It's true what others have said about the Financial District being a bit dead at night but there are still people milling about and we felt quite safe waliking late at night. Would definitely stay here again when in SF. This hotel had what we needed, good location, clean, great service, and a reasonable price for a great quality hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: scheevers
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and have everything you need. The lobby is pretty and the staff is helpful. The best thing is the location! You are a hop, skip and a jump from anything you would want to see. Would stay again. None of us had any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: saeedfakh
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Omni during the July 4th weekend. We weree immediately impressed by the hospitality of the staff. As a fisrt time Select members we were offered amenities that other luxury chains charge. Complimentary morning coffee and wi-fi is always a bonus.The concierge was exceptonally helpful. The entire staff went out of their way to make guests feel comfrtable. I would highly recommend this hotel. Saeed Fakhruddin MD

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Great location near Chinatown and within walking distance of the Embarcadero. Very friendly, gracious, helpful staff. Very comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: lrtague
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great service, fantastic location. We had a great time here. Our room was lovely with the exception of a dirty ottoman. It had several large what seemed to be grease spots on it. Maybe someone put a greasy pizza box on it??? When I called the front desk they seemed legitimately horrified and apologized profusely. Overall, our stay was wonderful and the staff was fantastic. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience, terrific location in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: CabinJohners
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Omni in early August. Lovely and comfortable hotel; extremely helpful and un-rushed service from front desk and concierges; all staff friendly; great facilities - spacious, clean, luxurious bedroom and full fitness center. Easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Embarcadero, Market St and Union Square;and just a little farther walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Safe even at night. We took Bart from airport and just walked 4 blocks with luggage to Omni. I did a lot of research to pick hotel - less than 2 weeks notice, so many rooms already booked - but the price per night at the Omni was best value around! Well worth the price; we're very glad we stayed there. (As Omni Select member - membership is free - we had complimentary hi-speed internet access and morning beverages)

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SHADDACalifornia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Beautiful posh room with comfy robes without the truly posh price. The front desk is so efficient that they anticipate your question and virtually finish your sentence for you! During our 1-night stay, a security guard or a chambermaid greeted us upon each exit from our room, inquiring of our satisfaction with the room/hotel. On Sunday morning the restaurant was set to close at 10:30. At 10:25, 24 of us were greeted with a smile, tables were aligned and we were seated! The mere fly in the proverbial ointment was valet parking. Street parking is very difficult so you do need to leave your car with the valet. Car retrieval on that Sunday was terribly slow; some waited almost an hour. But the front desk came to the rescue! Customer Service walked about the crowd apologizing and noting room numbers. The $25 overnight stay was removed from our bills before we even pulled away from the curb heading home. Plus an email arrived the following morning apologizing once again for the inconvenience of waiting for our cars, and asking for feedback regarding any aspect of our stay. The OMNI management know how to run a hotel - and certainly realize the happiness of their fan base is more important than lost revenue from valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for both biz travelers and families”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot05
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is in the Financial District on California Street, with a cable car stop just outside its door. You can get around the city easily from this spot, either by walking or using public transportation or taxis. Everyone at the Omni is friendly and cheerful, and they cater equally well to business travelers and vacationing families. There is free Starbucks coffee available in the lobby from very early throughout the morning, and fruit and iced tea are offered in the afternoon. Rooms are pleasant if a little boring (the wall art really should be re-thought) and are clean and well appointed, with espresso makers and tea supplied, as well as an iron and ironing board. The bed was very comfortable. The steak house in the hotel is excellent, with steak house prices! The one complaint I have is how this Omni handles their "elite level" loyalty members. My husband is at the Black, or highest level of the GHA group (of which Omni is a prominent member) and as such is entitled to a double up-grade, based on availability, as well as some other special amenity, such as a sailing trip (which is offered at the level below his). When we checked in there was no mention of an upgrade. We had to ask about it, and the woman at the desk cheerfully announced that they had no upgrade for a 5-night stay. Turned out they did have upgrades available after the weekend, but we had to ask about that in order to be upgraded for the last 3 nights. No one ever mentioned the "special amenity" and we didn't push the issue. Since Omni is touting this loyalty program, with all the details in a brochure they put on the room desk, we found it odd that there was no effort to fulfill the two biggest rewards. Otherwise, no complaints and we'd recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMNI- LOVE.”
Reviews.Author: Marlena88
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel- it was not just a hotel, it was an experience. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were roomy and very comfortable. I had a big comfortable chair right by the window to relax in. They brought complimentary hot coffe every am and set it outside my door without having to deal with payment, tips, etc. and the coffee was very good. I was there on business, but felt like I was on vacation. The bed was very comfortable, the room and bathroom were very clean. It was in a great location- the waterfront is within walking distance- great restaurants everywhere. I would definitely go back, and am now interested in staying at other OMNI's if they are half as nice as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Inner City Gem”
Reviews.Author: maspeek
Reviews.Content: Who says that city hotels have to be small and overpriced? This hotel has a beautiful lobby AND beautiful, spacious rooms at a great price. The conceirge is delightful and will fill you in on any and everything doing in San Francisco. The only drawback to its central location is some middle of the night street noise. But after a day hiking the hills and a night partying, who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in SFO”
Reviews.Author: HermanG
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in SFO, and the front desk and concierge could not be any nicer. Very informative and accomodating. They even upgraded us to the top foloor for a better view. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaWallygirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Omni in San Francisco which was absolute delightful. The room was well appointed. Bed was so comfortable, we ordered a mattress and box springs from Omni after we returned home. Location was within walking distance of many attractions and the staff were very helpful in suggestions for places to go and the best way to get there. There are good restaurants close by and the steak house in the Omni was excellent. Parking was somewhat expensive, but not out of line with area. Great stay in a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: meo
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Omni San Francisco! Service was excellent, location convenient, rooms and amenities were to be expected from an Omni…first rate. Traveling with a 10 and 7 yr old can be daunting, but the attention paid to us by the attentive staff made theirs and our stay memorable. They were greeted with Kid backpacks filled with fun activities and milk and cookies every evening. Be prepared to pay for parking, it can get pricey. If you’re the type to exercise during vacation, the gym is clean, easily accessible and has the latest cardio and gym equipment. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and honest staff”
Reviews.Author: JFrancesShreveport
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two nights at this wonderful Omni. The staff was very friendly and always willing to give personalized advice about the city. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was also comfortable as was a roll a way. I had lost a sapphire earring and housekeeping had it when I called two days later. WOW! Great location also, on cable car line downtown. It is close enough to the tourist destinations but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jj9598
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I expected.The location was great.You're close to China Town,The Embarcadero and the Financial District.Other then that,I thought it was very over priced.They comped us a piece of cake for my birthday,but that was the only free thing there.Our view was of the back of a building.The room was ok,but I've stayed at nicer hotels in Reno and Las Vegas for way less.There are price tags on every beverage and bag of chips in the room.Not really a family hotel.My fiance got lost looking for the fitness room.The staff wasn't very helpful.I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: romandun
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful place to stay .Lovely big room immaculatey furnished. Super friendly and helpful staff. Good position for visiting all the sights and on a tram route.Breakfast was included in our deal and it was great. Recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dwayner
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Omni in San Francisco. Well situated in the Financial District --Service was great -- staff was very helpful. Would stay again in a heart beat !!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SSLtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for the first leg of our delayed honeymoon. The hotel itself is located in a great part of San Fran - very convenient to many attractions. The room was very nice and super clean, and the lobby was attractive. The hotel staff could not have been more pleasant - very helpful and friendly. We ran into some bad weather on the way out to California and they were very accommodating with our travel plans. When we arrived there were chocolate covered strawberries and roses in our room. We are preferred members at this hotel and as a result, received complimentary beverages each morning, among other perks. In sum, great location, great place. My husband and I will definitely be returning to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blairbeth
Reviews.Content: My family and I looked forward to our trip to San Francisco but we never expected that one of the best parts of our trip was the hotel where we stayed. The service was impeccable and they responded to our every need. Even little things like the remote in our room not working, they had someone at our door within five minutes from when I called. We have just returned home but for the first time we felt must write a review to say thanks too.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Day Getaway At the Omni”
Reviews.Author: SanJoseMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Omni for a mid week get away/anniversary celebration to San Francisco. We chose the Omni because of the high recommendations on Trip Advisor. We were very happy with the selection. We have been to the city a few times and have stayed in Union Square but we loved the Omni. What stood out the most was the amazing service. They were so friendly and welcomed us with open arms from the moment we pulled up in the car. We had a really nice king suite which gave us more room than we needed but it was nice. Though we did hear some street traffic during rush hour. We could have probably got a better deal if we had chosen a smaller room or had a different week (for some reason our week was heavily booked). But I've seen great deals on priceline which would make this selection of hotels even better and would have given it 5 stars for value but instead gave it 4. Since we were celebrating our anniversary they gave us an amazing (best ever) plate of chocolate covered strawberries the first evening. Our turndown service had a rose on the bed with robes and houseslippers. There were always nectarines in the lobby to eat as well as tea. The gym was new and had plenty of machines/tv's. I think the concierge was by far the best as we had reservations at amazing restaurants with great seating. I highly recommend the Waterbar.. fresh seafood daily, great ambiance and a beautiful view of the bay and bay bridge ( the concierge will get you a seat by the window). They also recommended the show Billy Elliott at the Orpheum which was fantastic. You have to get a cab there.. I didn't miss not staying in Union Square.. I can shop at all those stores in a mall. The embarcadero is a quick walk and really nice to go to eat, see the bay and relax. The Omni was a lovely hotel and very comfortable.. The beds were luxurious and we'd go again!.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, and made up for their service errors.”
Reviews.Author: offshore8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas Eve as part of a family anniversary celebration. Rooms awesome (of a $250/night calibre), nice lobby, excellent location. Easily would get 5 stars if not for numerous surprising mistakes handling the treatment of the anniversary couple whose room was to be charged to us. Put wrong name on welcome card in room, delivered comp food and gifts to wrong room, couldn't correct it, forgot to provide treats to pet dog even though they were included in the pet charge and we were charged for them. Concierge was mixed with excellent guidance on sightseeing, but couldn't call a house car or taxi for us in less than 30 min. In the end, they made up for all this by apologizing repeatedly, comp'ing parking, and comp'ing a large Christmas brunch for 8 family members, which was very nice of them. All those gestures brought them back to 4 stars even though all the mistakes were annoying at the time. Given everything, I would try them again and go back there because of their efforts and the otherwise great property.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by this older hotel...had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OldDogsRule
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco frequently and had not stayed at the Omni before, though I had attended business meetings there. I was genuinely surprised at my experience there. I was expecting an older, slightly rundown/dated hotel with noisy, small rooms (as the older hotels tend to have). Instead, I found a well-kept/maintained room with plenty of room, and some very nice amenities. I was also able to get a very quiet room (if you are a light sleeper like me), ask for a room that does not face California (cable cars, doormen calling taxis) and slept very well during my stay because the drapes were very effective in keeping the light out. In the mornings, I would have to check my phone to figure out if it was light outside. I only ate room service while there and it was very good. Great location, very courteous/accommodating staff (especially the doormen/valets)...I will stay there again. P.S. their breakfast burrito is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Planettraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. It is a lovely, historic hotel, very comfortable lobby. The lobby was decorated for Christmas. It is a good central location, easy to walk to many sights and fantastic restaurants. Of course, parking is always a nightmare in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Will return!”
Reviews.Author: taggsSydney
Reviews.Content: Overnighted in San Francisco on our way to Chicago from Sydney. Great location. Easy walking distance to Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. Staff at hotel showed us a walking route from hotel to Fisherman's Wharf back up through Chinatown and on to Union Square. After a long flight from Sydney we decided to eat at Bob's Lounge in the hotel. Great food. Would recommend the Omni for a stopover or longer stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: canadianvisi2r
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Reasonable walk to everything. You gotta walk in San Fran. Financial district so short walk to north beach, market street etc. Staff wonderful, especially Joey who booked all our tours. Short walk to restaurants. Will go again and stay there

Reviews.Title: “Children's Fantasy Suite”
Reviews.Author: edcsmpmom
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved, loved our stay at the Omni San Francisco from the moment we arrived. The bell hops were so friendly & welcoming. Our 2 children received back packs with toys (explorer type stuff). We had the adjoining room next to the children's fantasy suite, which was adorable and had bunk beds, child sized robes, step stool & rubber duckys in the bathroom, stuffed animals, games, books, toys, a "mini fridge" filled with milk, choc milk & yogurt. The snacks were above the fridge (just high enough to be out of sight of our little ones) and included cereal, skittles, m&ms. The drinks were 50 cents & the snacks $1.00. That was a pleasant surprise. Each afternoon, fresh cookies & milk were also delivered to our room. The kids loved the stay too & it took some coaxing to even get them to leave so we could explore the city. Fantastic stay & highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Old elegance, attention to the little details, great staff”
Reviews.Author: beasttraveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, just a block away from Chinatown. Our three year old was treated to milk and cookies minutes after being taken to our very cute room. Beautiful old-world elegance without the stuffiness. Smaller rooms, very nicely appointed. Marble tops in the bathroom, huge tub and nice fixtures, where's the vent though? Some construction going on next door, only in the afternoon though, and not in the morning, as I had feared. If we had stayed longer, a successful naptime might have been an issue for our toddler. Without fail, every single person on the staff was friendly and took extra time to chat, give tips, and make us feel like our comfort was very important to them, from the front desk reception, to the bellhop, to the valet, to the manager, to the host at the restaurant as we were walking through to access the entrance from the east side! If you're not an Omni member, join immediately, and get free internet and other perks. It's free, so why not?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: keeselily
Reviews.Content: I went here with 3 of my girlfriends and we had so much fun! The staff were so friendly and accommodating. The concierge gave us great advice on where to eat. One day we took a trip to Sonoma County and visited the Ferrari-Carano Winery-also fabulous and fun! Super clean rooms, great staff, great bar for a late night drink. Loved it and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: allblacks99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. Good location for easy walking to Ferry Building, Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square. Amazingly good and friendly service. Room nice. Minor negatives: lifts slow, wifi slow, not very good and expensive breakfast (go elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason this is ranked so high on TripAdvisor! Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTexans
Reviews.Content: This hotel know how to treat their guests! We stayed here in July of 2011 and were treated like family. The front desk is great. The concierge is excellent. If it looked like I even thought about asking a question someone was there to help. The guys at the front door were super friendly too! We were here on a family vacation and we would stay here again. I love the location on California St. The cable cars come right by so you can hop on them and go. My kids were impressed with the hill and before stopping at the hotel we had to drive up California to the top of Nob Hill. Super steep and I was a little scared at first but after a while the streets didn't seem so bad. My husband drove them like an expert even though we are from the Dallas area and there is nothing like that here! I really liked the area. I had been looking at hotels in the Union Square area but after we settled in at our hotel we drove by there and it was so congested I was happy to be where we were. Stay here and you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: omarvomdakota
Reviews.Content: I travel on business to San Francisco about twice a month. I have stayed at other hotels, but I truly prefer the Omni. The charm, the great loyalty program, and the excellent service make it the place that I prefer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an excellent location with friendly & efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: The_Global_Citizen
Reviews.Content: Our family (incl 3 kids aged 16, 14 & 9) enjoyed 4 great nights at the Omni in San Francisco and we wish we could have stayed longer. The style of the hotel is very traditional but extremely comfortable and meticulously maintained. The rooms are a good size with wonderfully comfortable beds. The location is great with the traditional San Fran trams going right past the front door. However it is the staff that take this hotel up a notch and make it a place that you want to come back to again! The Reception staff, Valet parking attendants and Concierge (especially Lex) are extremely helpful and take a genuine interest in each guest. I had previously stayed in the Omni Berkshire (New York) which is also a great hotel, but the Omni in San Fran created a wonderful environment for a business traveler or a family holiday-maker to really enjoy their stay. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “HOW DO I LOVE THEE, LET ME COUNT THE WAYS”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel! (1) great staff - wonderfully friendly, very attentive (2)rooms immaculately clean (3) wonderful location - can walk to North Beach, China Town, Union Square, Market St. (4)bathroom has a lot of room for toiletries (5) big soft towels (6) fresh fruit & ice tea in the lobby (7) it was my birthday, and they brought up a piece of yummy chocolate cake & strawberries & grapes to my room. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in San Francisco (usually dependent on which is offering the best deal) but I'll never stay anywhere else in San Francisco, and I go once or twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: awhitesides
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco treated us so nice. I am a light sleeper and I slept like a baby. Bathrooms are so clean. After a long day of walking the city, it was nice to come back to the bar and have a light supper with good wine. They also had coffee at the bar for those of us who get up early and need more than one cup of coffee. The bellmen were oh so special giving us directions and getting us transportation. The hotel is in a good location as the street car runs right in front. All of the staff were professional but not stuffy. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: foodtrekker34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a "girls' weekend" and it was perfect. The hotel staff are the friendliest and most helpful I have seen yet and the hotel was beautiful. I recommend signing up for the hote'ls preferred guest program (it is free) and you get free morning beverage service, a paper, evening turn-down, free bottled water, wi-fi, and clothes pressing. There is a high-end steak house in the hotel (we did not try but should have) and a great ally about 1 block up that houses several local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hurleyhny209
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to many of the locations we were interested in seeing including the ferry building, market street and chinatown. The trolley also stops very close to the hotel. Our room was great! Clean and had great amenities. We were welcomed with complimentary water and chocolates. The staff was very friendly and more than willing to help with anything that we needed for our stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for customer service and families.”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter-wannabee
Reviews.Content: Debated over if to stay here or the Renaissance and Omni won over with all the great reviews. Stayed for 3 nts with husband and kids ages 13, 11, and 3. Everyone from doormen, to front desk, to maids were all so happy and delighted to help throughout our stay. Kids loved the goody bags(even gave them another round of bags next day cause they had a new and improved version). The cookies and milk waiting for us when we came back each night after a day of adventure was just pure perfect! Drinks each morning waiting outside our door was another extra. Kids loved all these lil' surprises! Location was great. Away from all the nightlife noise but centrally located between Union Square, China Town, Fishermans Wharf, and Ferry Bldg. Kids loved taking the trollies up and down all the slopes. Felt very safe in the area. Our last evening we ventured out a lil' too far and think we ended up in the Tenderloin area. Heard about this "do not go" area and let me just say...we made a u-turn quickly. Lol Overall, GREAT say. Will definitely stay again. Best customer service we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: castlefan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni for 5 nights. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great for walking to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Bldg., and Union Square. One day we took a cab to the marina, walked to fishermans wharf and then walked back to the hotel. The only thing I did not like was that the room service meals would sit outside guest rooms for hours. Once, we even called the front desk to have a tray with half eaten food that was in the hall between our door and the room next door to be picked up. When we checked into the hotel, there was a tray of leftover food in the hall outside our door and I had to ask the maid service to remove it. This definitely needs to be take care of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca60745
Reviews.Content: We loved the Omni Hotel in San Francisco. We were there over July 4th weekend. The service was outstanding and the price was very reasonable for a downtown hotel. Not only was wireless internet included, but there was a lovely bowl of free fruit and ice tea in the lobby in the afternoons. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The bathroom was quite nice. The location was very convenient. My only criticism was the cost of parking, which I felt was very high. I would definitely recommend the hotel to business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back here on our next trip”
Reviews.Author: Bonosgirl
Reviews.Content: The Omni was the perfect choice for our three-night stay in San Francisco. It was centrally located, and the fact that it was in the Financial District made it a quiet oasis to return to in the evenings. I have to echo previous reviewers when I say that the service at this hotel is the best in the business. As a result, I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel -- well, it would have been nice if there was a spa on-site, but that's splitting hairs. We will without a doubt stay here on our next visit. Every person we interacted with was friendly, courteous and beyond helpful. Our chambermaid left a sweet, handwritten note thanking us for our patronage, and upon checkout, the gentleman behind the front desk did not hesitate to give us brochures and coupons for Napa Valley vineyards when he learned that was our next destination. As other reviewers have mentioned, it's worth it to join the Omni's Select Guest program prior to your arrival. The complimentary morning beverages and newspapers and bottled water in the room were a VERY nice touch. Plus Select Guests receive free Wi-Fi, among other perks. The Omni also allowed us to check in online 24 hours before we arrived, which is something I truly hope other hotels have begun doing. When we got to the hotel, we simply picked up our room keys and went straight to our rooms. Very streamlined. I also recommend purchasing a Bed and Breakfast package if it's available. When you do the math, you ultimately end up saving a considerable amount of money -- and the breakfasts at Bob's Steak and Chop House were consistently delicious.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind a 30 min walk to anywhere...*”
Reviews.Author: Shazzarinski
Reviews.Content: Would deffo recommend this hotel. We loved the location in the very quiet financial district esp over the holiday weekend. We really like exploring cities and everywhere bar perhaps the Castro area was easily walkable and easy to find. Made our stay in San Fran super easy*

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nantucketdreamer
Reviews.Content: No worries about staying here--this is a small luxury hotel that treats it's customers in a grand way. Rooms are clean, updated and roomy enough. Bathrooms are fine. Smallish fitness center, but adequate with new equipment. Good, fast room service, and Bob's restaurant served a good, if pricey, breakfast. The key to it's greatness is the staff--always smiling and seeking to please, Iced Tea and fruit always in the lobby. Lex, the concierge, is one of the best we have dealt with. No question or request is too mundane, and his suggestions were always on point for restaurants, day trips, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Hotel With Faultless Service”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for five nights and without the slightest hesitation will certainly return there next time I am in San Francisco. I only write a review for Tripadvisor if I feel a hotel merits five stars. I know this is probably totally wrong as I should also review those of poorer quality. The problem is that I simply don’t have the time! Without any shadow of doubt the Omni merits five stars. It raises the bar in terms of customer service. From the moment I walked in to the moment I left I felt totally at home. I arrived after an eleven hour flight and transferred to the hotel from SFO by BART. The hotel is an easy and flat five block walk up Montgomery St from the BART station. Check in was very smooth and I was quickly in my room. It was spotlessly clean with a welcome note and complimentary bottle of water as I joined the Select Guest programme. I suggest that anyone staying at an Omni joins this. Complimentary Wi Fi, newspapers and morning beverages are just some of the benefits. It costs nothing to join and is well worth it. I had emailed ahead to request a quiet room and was allocated one overlooking the courtyard without any traffic noise at all. Not a great view but who cares? A quiet nights sleep is more important to me. The room did, however, back onto the elevator shafts so I was woken early whilst they were being used more frequently. The noise was not, however, that loud and most people would have taken absolutely no notice at all but I am obsessive about noise and a difficult person to please. The term “Grumpy Old Man” fits me perfectly or so my wife says! I asked at reception if the elevator noise always started around 6.00 and without me even asking I was immediately offered another room. The second room again overlooked the back and was so unbelievably quiet that I slept like a log for the next four nights. Facilities in the room were excellent. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. A big armchair and footrest were welcome after a day of San Francisco hill climbing! Wi Fi was fast and easy to connect. I was quite impressed with the workstation which had plug sockets built into it. Little things please little minds! All too often in other hotels I have had to scrabble round the floor looking for them. One thing that really impressed me was that the maid left a handwritten note to thank me for the tip I left her. I think it was a really nice touch. I always tip maids and this is the first time I have been thanked for it. I very much appreciated it. The hotel is located in the financial district which was very quiet over the weekend. Just a short walk to North Beach, Market Street and Embarcadero. I didn’t eat or drink in the hotel so can’t comment on that side of things. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants nearby especially North Beach. Finally, I cannot complete the review without mentioning the standard of customer service again. This was exceptional in all respects. I have stayed in countless hotels over the years and the Omni is in a league of it’s own. All the staff I encountered had a smile on their face and were amazingly polite. I never had to open the front entrance door or call for the elevator as one of the staff always rushed to do these. I originally planned to stay for ten nights but couldn’t make the first five nights in view of illness in the family. It was such a delight to stay there that I really wish I could have made the full ten nights. Will I be back? Without any shadow of doubt. I am planning my next SF trip now. Would I recommend a friend? Certainly not. This place is way way too good for them!

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel at home.”
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a family reunion in San Francisco. I booked this hotel after reading the comments and the rating here on Tripadvisor, I sure glad I did. Omni SF locates between the financial district and Union square shopping district, next to Chinatown and south of North Beach. Good for business, shopping and eating-out. Ferry building and Market Street is within walking distance in about 10 minutes, and Tenderloin area is in the other side of town where you prefer to stay away, so it is safe and convenience. Cable car’s California line operates in front of the hotel; it was cool to see the cable car passing by while you run on a treadmill in the 3rd floor gym. We arrived at the hotel late, but valet-parking and check-in went smoothly; the young front desk lady is extremely helpful, she did the check-in process efficiently while answering questions from me and my wife continuously about where to go and eat in detail, even made a reservation for us like a concierge. The bell staffs are friendly and helpful, after a day outside it were them who made you feel welcomed. The thing that impressed me most is that they tried to remember your names instead of just saying sir or ma’am. The room is spacious and clear, much better than other hotel chains, more like a boutique hotel, very comfortable and relaxing. There are complementary tea and fruits in the lobby, milk and cookies in the room every day. There are reasons that they are #3 in the hotel ranking; this hotel makes you feel at home and wants to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the lovely Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bils81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni at the end of May 2011 for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay! The room was a good size and very clean and all the staff we friendly and helpful. The location was good also and we were able to walk to most attractions. Would highly recommend and would defintely book again if we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Visiting Families”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGina
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Omni with our two children. Straddling Chinatown and the Financial district, Omni's location is also located on the California St. cable car line. Friendly, helpful, readily available staff. Concierge and desk personnel are well-trained, and had excellent local restaurant recommendations. Though our reserved room was not yet available upon our arrival (we had been emailed that an early arrival was possible) desk staff immediately upgraded us to an available and very roomy suite.
