No wait for the better room was an awesome surprise after travelling across the country with two children! Complimentary iced tea in lobby is a welcome touch when returning from a day of touring. Ample bath supplies for the entire family. Quick and efficient (though pricey!) valet car service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: long4travel
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a posh hotel in the financial district, very near Chinatown and the Embarcadero. The lobby is beautiful and smelled wonderful. The staff, from the doormen to the front desk, were friendly and very accomodating. The beds were very comfortable, and room service was very quick.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and special attention”
Reviews.Author: justdadNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Took my college graduate daughter to SF from NC for her gift. Front desk staff, door staff, and ambassadors reached out in many special ways to greet us and congratulate her. We found chocolate covered strawberries with a congratulatory note when we came back from our first outing! We also loved the fresh fruit in the mornings and the jelly beans in the afternoon - just the right snacks pre and post touring.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: CONLNPPR
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and attentive, clean and quiet. Walk down to the lobby for some complimentary Starbuck's coffee in the morning and whoever is at the front desk will greet you with more than just a smile. They will spend tons of time with you and help you in whatever way they can. Love the sheets, the shower curtain looked brand new, and the drinking glasses in the bathroom were actually clean. (I always look and I'm disgusted when they are wiped, usually still with lip marks and lint.). Loved our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience of my USA trip”
Reviews.Author: Mongkut
Reviews.Content: Everything was so good that there is not so much to say but ... STAY THERE !!! The welcoming is perfect from the doorman to the reception. The hotel is beautiful, clean, the amenities are great (just try on a bathrobe, they are fantastic !), there is a big TV, internet (not free unfortunately), the location is perfect, the check-out quick and efficient. I just regret not to have stayed in SFO longer. Such a nice experience. I will be back, sure ! :)

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kievit
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the excellent reviews in Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. My family and I were visiting San Francisco for the first time on our way back to the east coast from Yosemite. The location is excellent , walking distance from china town and the Ferry building. The Hotel is elegantly decorated, sort of "old world" european style, but by far the best part of the experience at the hotel was the helpful and friendly staff. Truly, I have never been at a hotel where the staff really went out of their way to be so pleasant and knowledgeable about the local area. Everyone ,from the doorman who serenaded my 8 year old daughter with Sinatra ballads to the concierge, was wonderful. I would especially recommend this hotel to families, the hotel goes out of its way to make the kids feel welcome, which is unusual for a 4 or 5 star hotel...we will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the service at Omni”
Reviews.Author: Jemom68
Reviews.Content: We were here for a business trip with my husband. While he attended his conference, my daughters and I explored San Francisco. We were taken by how helpful every single member of the staff was at this hotel, from the doorman, to the concierge, to the maid. They even supplied us with umbrellas when San Francisco had a very unseasonable rainy day. We never left the hotel without someone making sure that we knew where we were going and how to get there. And the hotel's location in the city is perfect for getting around. The California cable car line runs directly in front of the hotel and can get you to most of the places you would like to visit. We also took part in the free tour of Chinatown that the hotel offers on Saturday morning. My kids are charmed by the cookies every evening and my husband and I enjoy the beverage service each morning. Our only regret is that we ran out of time to see everything this beautiful city has to offer. Valet parking is very expensive but less than some other hotels we looked at in San Francisco. We decided not to rent a car and had no trouble getting around on MUNI transport.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was beautiful and wonderfully located!”
Reviews.Author: EPgirl6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location and beautiful. We were able to walk to everything or take the trolley. The views were wonderful too and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, tiny room...awesome location”
Reviews.Author: OtisNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni June 25-27, and will be back July 4-7. We arrived at midnight and got what I guess was one of the last rooms left...right next to the elevators and facing the street. We were worried about noise, but it was surprisingly quiet. The beds were very comfy, and the room and amenities were nice. We stopped at the front desk on out way out our first morning and were absolutely blesses to have met Stephen...he was SO helpful with breakfast and sight seeing recommendations. He was patient and took plenty of time to answer our questions and draw all over our map to help us figure out where to go. Thank you! Because of Stephen, we are very much looking forward to our return tom the Omni next week! Julie and Peter Hans

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and were not disappointed. The very well-trained staff provided exemplary service from the moment we walked in to when we left, and even after we checked out. You couldn't open the front door without someone rushing ahead to open it for you. The room is fairly spacious - not huge but ample for two people. Room decor was upscale - not top-end luxury but at $245 a night in San Francisco, very good value. Bed was very comfortable, and they provide robes and slippers. Bathroom was quite nice, not super luxury but very comfortable. The one flaw has been mentioned in other reviews: a single switch turns on the fairly bright lighting, which is not pleasant if you get up at night to use the bathroom. Hint: the lighted make-up mirror works great for that. The hotel is 2 block from Chinatown and a 10-minute walk from the Ferry Building - very good location. Parking, like everywhere in SF, is terribly expensive, but you can save a few bucks by parking across the street in the Bank of America garage. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LeiaR
Reviews.Content: I'm in San Francisco a couple of times a year and this was the first time I stayed at the Omni San Francisco and from my experience it's most likely I will stay there again. I liked the ambiance and decor of the hotel. The rooms were a good size, comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. No complains whatsoever. It's located in the financial district which is great if you have business in the area. At night it tends to be more on the quiet side.

Reviews.Title: “Expense account property”
Reviews.Author: DandCCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very polite and helpful; however, the management seems to have borrowed a page from the airlines playbook. Reasonable room prices (for San Francisco) were offset by $7 water, $28/hour internet access when using the hotel computer, and restraurant prices that were over the top. Fortunately, there were other food options nearby. The room was clean and of adequate size, but it's a shame that so-called high end hotels have to charge for things that a free in many of the lower priced properties.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Faultless for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: relatedtothequeen
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel is in a superb location. Extremely welcoming and helpful staff. Pleasant surroundings. Clean and spacious room. Quiet at night. The only possible improvement we could suggest would be free Wi-Fi. Highly recommended and if we were staying in San Francisco again we would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: Service was impeccable. The hotel was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. Room very spacious (13th floor) and bathroom was lovely. Stayed for 7 nights. The hotel is ideally located to the Embarcadero, muni stations, Chinatown, shopping, and restaurants. We even walked from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square one evening. Would definitely stay again for business and pleasure. The San Francisco CityPass represents an amazing deal/value.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AlexaFox
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience at the hotel. We went for a pleasure trip to SF and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was so nice and smelled so good when we walked in. The room was very clean and the bed was AMAZING! In fact, it was so good I just bough a feather bed topper for my mattress. The decor was nice, sheets were great, and even the restaurant in the hotel was decent, though breakfast is not worth the money. Dinner was good though (loved the lamb chops). Overall, I totally recommend it. The staff was so friendly too. You get what you pay for here. And...its location is PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Sue88
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. A very warm welcome on arrival by the doormen and the reception staff also made you feel special by being very attentive without being over the top, we did get the immediate feeling that if there was anything you needed they would be more than glad to help. We had requested a quiet room with a view if available as this was a trip for our wedding anniversary and they certainly matched our request with a great room on the 17th floor. This is a city where a couple of the main features (as there are many parts to San Francisco) are a fantastic bay area & many steep slopes, but if you can cope with the slopes you get the payoff of great views. This is a great city, I love New York & I love Boston, but this is right up there and I'm still deciding if this has just gone to the top of the list. We stayed for 6 nights and in all honesty could have stayed more. If you are a tourist coming here you just have to do Alcatraz which we thought was brilliant, but be warned you need to book this before you get to the city as the trip is very busy and you cannot guarantee getting on a trip by just turning up on the day. We also did a Napa Valley tour (through Viator) which was also a great trip. The people in this city, and seemingley in California as a whole are warm, friendly and welcoming people who are glad to help and have a chat with you. The location of this hotel we felt was excellent. Nice area & turn left out of the main front door (not up the hill) and you are heading to the Ferry Building / Embarcadero & the many piers of the bay. Approx 10 minute flat stroll and you are at the Ferry Building & turn left when you get there and you are heading towards Pier 39 / Fishermans Wharf and the sea lions etc. This hotel is also only short walk to Union Square and the shops that are there. If you are up to it, biking over the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito is well worth the effort. My wife and I (45 & 50 years old) managed it and the it will be a memory that stays forever as to view this iconic structure from such a close up and personal viewpoint is just awesome. We stopped frequently to take hundreds of photos, had lunch in Sausalito and then caught the ferry back which is really easy, as through Blazing Saddles they give you a ferry ticket ready for use in the morning, which you can either use or not. You pay for the bikes at the end of the trip & hence if you don't come back on the ferry you don't get charged for the ticket so long as you return it in full. We will definately return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “So children-friendly!!! we loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexey_Barinov
Reviews.Content: everybody at this hotel made our 4-night stay pleasant! Children received gifts from the hotel and the whole backpack with books and toys to play. the hotel is very conveniently located close to all the sites. The room was nicely decorated, with modern bath facilities. Stay at this hotel if you have children - you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lftexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 9 - 12. Great accomodations. Staff was fabulous, rooms very spacious. Very close to China Town and Ferry Building. Not very close to Union Square. Trolley directly in front on California.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe & Refined”
Reviews.Author: nats-md
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel in SF. Good service, elegant rooms (e.g. pocket doors), omni amenities. Enjoyed the bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macsydney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni on three separate occasions now and would definitely stay again. Old world style and charm is so under rated these days. Great service from housekeeping, doormen, valets and bar staff. The Omni has become a home away from home for us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: GilbertMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in many ways and it has been said in previous reviews but the employees make the difference here whatever their job is. They are just amazing - after 5 nights you don't want to quit this hotel. They make you feel so good.They must have terrefic managers for being so engaged and happy. If only we could get a breakfast for a reasonnable price!

Reviews.Title: “Business traveler and kid-friendly alike”
Reviews.Author: iron_monkey_fist666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights. I enjoyed the great service by staff. When I checked in there was a problem with my door. An engineer was upstairs to fix it very quickly. The staff at the front desk is very courteous and efficient. I needed to borrow an umbrella-- they handed me one with a smile. The wifi in the room is free if you're an Omni Select Guest (which I am), otherwise, it's about $10 per night. The bathroom is nice, but the water pressure in the shower was not as great as I would have preferred for the rate charged for this hotel. The room was adequately sized. Note that some rooms have city views, and others have "courtyard" views. Courtyard views look directly across into an office building. I would strongly recommend avoiding this! The gym is good-- they have free weights, about 6 treadmills and 4 elliptical machines. It is crowded in the mornings, but well-maintained and clean. One other slight negative-- there are only 2 elevators for the whole hotel. They are slow. In busy times, one can spend a lot of time waiting for an elevator. Lastly-- go to Baladie while you're there and order a "Sultan's Iron Bowl." Awesome lunch or dinner option!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service - this hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: ljn_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over a weekend. On arrival valet / hotel was busy but our car was dealt with very quickly by polite valet staff. As this hotel caters for business travellers mostly the valet is discouted at weekends so was around $20 day which is good by San Fransisco standards. Front desk were very welcoming. I am a member of the Omni loyalty club & my room had been pre asigned, so I was welcomed,asked my name & for a credit card and was checked in in about 1-2 mins - very efficient (we didnt feel rushed just that the staff were on top of their game) As am Omni member there are benefit such as free beverage delivered in morning & internet etc - all the information related to these benefits was in my check in paperwork. Room: We were assigned an inner view room which was super quiet. Room (1207) was spacious, King bed, desk & chair, flatscreen. bed was very comfortable with good qualiity/thread count linens. Room was super clean and housekeeping are doing a great job. Bathroom had a shower/bath combo but shower had good water pressure. Toiletries were just ok - but thats persoanl preference Coffee was delivered promptly each morning & was delicious. Staff: Every single staff member we encountered were first rate - they all seemed genuinely friendly and welcoming - very impressive. Bellman was very prompt & polite Doorman super helpful Valet very quick and friendly Housekeeping friendly & working to a high standard Front desk welcoming & efficient And add to the fact the hotel was very busy as it was hosting a large wedding - the staff were great- as all too often when a hotel is busy customer service can slip Location: We liked being based on California Street we walked up the hill to the cable car stop, on sat AM we walked down to the ferry building for the fantastic farmers market. Jut a block or 2 away are great chinese restaurants (Recomend R&G Lounge), we walked to union square. So overall being in the financial/business district was no bad thing - also it means on weekends there are good values to be found in terms of hotel prices. We would be more than happy to return when we are next in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “First class reception”
Reviews.Author: Bendbiz
Reviews.Content: On a side trip during our annual spring break drive to Southern California we decided to detour to San Fran. On our way across the Bay Bridge we checked on-line reviews (via Trip Advisor) and decided to make a reservation. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the Valet who went out of his way to make our 3 daughter feel welcomed. Upon entering the Hotel lobby the doorman announced - "Girl's welcome to the Omni Hotel" - the girls received applause from guests and staff members a like and our daughters felt like royalty. The rest of the staff was extremely accommodating and we had an awesome stay. The location is great - walked to Farmers Market at the Embarcadero Center - great Italian Restaurant (Perbacco) down the street. Well done Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MIZZOU1986
Reviews.Content: Great location for our two nights in San Francisco. Chinatown and Union Square are very close. Gorgeous common area and the staff was very helpful and super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Tried It"”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for one night while on business. I usually stay elsewhere when in town but thought I would try the Omni as the location was very close to my business appointments for the next day. Turned out to be an excellent location for business travel. Very, very nice. Public areas are nothing short of beautiful. My king bed room and bathroom were absolutely spotless. The desk in the room had really handy outlets right on the front of the desk, no crawling aroung looking for an outlet! Bed was comfortable, but just two flimsy pillows on the bed just doesn't cut it. I like a bed with lots of comfy pillows great for propping up to watch TV. That's really the only thing here that was anything but superlative. Not a deal killer. Front desk staff were very pleasant and aimed to please. Bob's Steakhouse located in the hotel was so good I ate there twice in 24 hours. The bar looked like a fun place to watch a game with colleagues. It's safe to say I will be back at the Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: ladytryon
Reviews.Content: Our stay was impeccable from start to finish. The staff are always there to help with a smile, the room was perfectly clean and spacious, the bed comfortable. We will definitely stay again when returning to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: JLM73TX
Reviews.Content: I must say that staying at the Omni San Francisco is quite comfortable for a business traveler. The hotel feels small and intimate not in the way that a country inn is small and intimate but in that you can come downstairs at 7:00 AM and get a seat at Bob's Steak and Chop House for breakfast without having a reservation. The staff is perfectly professional, correct and helpful as if you were staying at your sister's house. Of course, San Francisco is quite a setting. The only complaint? The $7 bottled water --- not complaining about the concept of bottled water but the price. I would drink swamp water before I would pay that much for a single bottle of water. That is a ridiculous price and shows a complete disconnect w/ the times. But then , I adore their tap water, so who really cares? I like the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Stands Out”
Reviews.Author: therlp
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni is exceptional. I've stayed here a few times on business trips. The hotel, itself, is ornate, in a Shaker Heights, early century palatial kind of way. The rooms are large and quiet, the bathrooms are huge and well-appointed, the furnishings are well-maintained and, again, ornate, the TVs are new and the wireless Internet is quick and always seems to work. But it is the staff here that stands out. This has to be part of their training, but everyone you speak with is exceptionally patient, never scoffs at a question or inquiry and goes out of the way to make sure guests are taken care of. Whether that means stowing luggage themselves, giving restaurant suggestions or literally running down the street to get you a cab, the staff hearkens back to what I assume - or what is purveyed as the standards of luxury travel in the 1950s. In a way, this hotel feels like a time capsule back to a more refined era of travel - and I mean that in the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: skhs
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Omni property I've stayed in, and again its the staff that make the hotel. We were staying here for 3 nights of which 2 were free due to the omni loyalty scheme. The rooms are pretty spacious, beds are exceptionally comfy, I wish they had proper baths in the bathroom though! the hotel is spotlessly clean, my only slight complaint that the hotel itself was freezing!! I know we came during freak weather conditions but the aircon was blasting out in every public area!!!! I was slightly confused with our package as I thought I'd included breakfast as part of our rate, so I went and asked the manager, who informed me that breakfast was not part of our complimentary nights, however as a goodwill gesture for returning guests he comped us breakfast for these nights, which I thought was amazing I didn't even need to ask! Concierge were fantastic for restaurant recommendations and got it right everytime. Whenever we left the hotel to get cabs if we were not going to far they allowed us to use the town car service that they have outside the hotel. I can not rate the service at this hotel highly enough, you really are treated like an important guest. What the Omni seem to get right where other hotels fail, is that they realise problems can happen, but it's how they are dealt with that matters. I will return to this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: yarsi78
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to SF and decided to stay at the OMNI given its good reviews and ratings. But never again would I come back - first night due to street construction we were not able to sleep (noise was unbearable), the next morning I jumped into the shower to find out NO HOT WATER !!!?? Then to top it off, I had to call housekeeping twice to find out they were out of slippers ?? !!!! From my experience, I never had to call couple of times to get through at any hotel I have stayed in. Having travelling extensive across the globe, this was by far the worst serviced hotel. It is ashame as city of SF is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most hotels in its price range!”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelA12
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was in town so i decided to splurge a little and stay at this hotel and wasn't really too sure how nice it was really going to be. I knew it had good reviews, but i wasn't sure how nice the rooms were going to be. Once I arrived there, all my negative thoughts were gone because the rooms were amazing, from the bathroom to the beds-very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with professional staff and lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, having previously spent 3 nights at the Orchard Hotel on Bush Street, as we fancied trying somewhere else. I have to say that this hotel is the epitomy of professionalism. The door staff are polite and helpful, and the reception staff even more so. The room we had was probably the best we stayed in during our trip to Vegas and SF. It's got a very distinct touch of class about it (though not austentatious or showy like some hotels). The bed was large and comfortable, with a large flat screen TV and coffee machine (which didn't work properly). It had a nice big desk in the room as well as sofa chair and foot stool, and the bathroom was perfectly nice enough. We didn't see hide nor hair of the cleaners which was a complete contrast to the other hotel we stayed in where we were woken up early. It seemed as if they were invisible until the time when you left your room and came back and everything has been cleaned to perfection! The only slight annoyance (if you can call it that) was the turn down service, where they fold a corner of the bed and angle your pillows to face the window. Seemed a bit odd to me and rather pointless. If someone needs the corner of the bed to be folded down in order for them to get in, they probably need a psychiatric home and not a hotel! We got a really good deal through Expedia and paid less than £100 per night, which I thought was good value for the quality of the hotel. We didn't eat in the Steak House restaurant as it was a tad pricey, and also be aware that room service can be expensive as well. It's fine if you arrive late and need some food, but there are plenty of other places to eat and it is within 5 minutes of Chinatown. The hotel location was good but not excellent. It's near to Market Street, but is a good 10 minute walk to Union Square as it is located in the Financial District. This also means that there aren't a lot of eateries nearby or shops like Walgreen's if you need to dash out for something. You'd be surprised how early things shut in SF! Also worth noting, if you want to get on the internet (i.e. you don't have a laptop in your room) there are several computers in the lobby you can use but you have to pay $5.95 for 15 mins to use them via credit card, but they are perfectly secure and delete all your web history on exiting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great everything”
Reviews.Author: Thereza_B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a wonderful home away from home. The staff is very professional, friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Walking distance from the waterfront. The bar serves wonderful food and a mean martini. I can recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyme
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed in an Omni before, I somehow had the impression that it was going to be a run of the mill experience, bit I was so wrong. Fabulous locaton, impeccable rooms (more Ritz-y than the Ritz) and warm, extending service. And to think the night before I stayed in a horrible touristy, "boutique hotel" for about $50 less that in no way compared. I was so relieved to get to the Omni. I was given early check-in even though I didn't book it, the room really was beautiful and so comfortable, and you can't beat the location. Highly recommend. Everyone was so nice, smiling, friendly and helpful. Even a little handwritten note from housekeeping in the room to welcome me. Makes a difference. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Omni hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Gayle32
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop of our honeymoon & we booked this hotel as we'd styed in the Omni Shoreham in DC & loved it & we were certainly not disappointed with this one either. The hotel was lovely & the staff are extremely helpful. Its in a great location - 10 minutes walk to Union Square, 5 minutes walk to Chinatown & short tram ride to Fishermans Wharf. I really rate the Omni chain & would not hesitate in staying in one of their hotels again. Top tip - join the select guest programme & you get complimentary WiFi & free coffee & juice delivered to your room but if you want your drink at 8am mark 8.30am on the card as it was always early! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Davo_Fido
Reviews.Content: You now how some good looking girls have terrible personalities because they don't have to try hard? Well the Omni SFO is the stunning looking girl with the terrific, friendly personality. In short, it's great. I can't imagine staff trying harder to please in such a friendly, unobtrusive manner. The hotel itself is very luxurious - everything, and I mean everything, is top notch. It's also well located, just ten minutes walk to Union Square, the Ferry terminal and little Italy. We even walked to Fisherman's Wharf (20 minutes). And you have to have a steak from Bob's - the one I had was easily the best I've ever had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Charged Credit Card Twice the Amount of One Night's Stay”
Reviews.Author: simbalarue
Reviews.Content: When I called the Omni hotel in SF to say they charged my credit card over twice the amount for a one night's stay, they said I would have to contact my bank and work it out with them to find out what happened. I said that was not covenient for me and that they should correct it from their end. The money has already been taken out of my account and they said I would have to wait 5 days before the charge will be corrected. I am NOT happy with this place and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahe26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and my only complaint was the rainwater shower head. Not that it was bad, just that it didn't give out the water pressure that I wanted...other than that, the hotel is great! The service staff was exceptional. Got a great deal on priceline, and I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the 16th floor. The room was very comfortable and had everything we could have needed - even a view ! We were very impressed by how helpful and friendly the hotel staff were. Answering questions, and then anticipating the next question. Happy to chat and make sure that there was nothing further you needed. Very refreshing for a city centre hotel. There was a wedding going on when we arrived, but we got plenty of attention, and our room was made ready. The hotel has a restaurant and a separate bar. The location is very central to the main areas, and its easy to take the cable car to Fishermans Wharf if you need to. Excellent choice for a 4 star hotel. For a romantic evening, try BIX, which is a short walk away and has live music. Michael Mina is also worth a visit and close by on California. Neither rush you through your meal ! If youre from the UK, avoid House of Prime Rib. If you have time, go to Napa Valley - wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Impecible customer service, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrieon
Reviews.Content: Initial welcome was great, and did'nt disapoint our expectations. Location was great to explore all areas of Frisco, tram stop directly outside the hotel. City line, buses & bart also located in all areas close to hotel. Tram line currently being improved outside hotel but this did not spoil our stay. Did'nt eat at hotel as it was quite pridcey. But again this did not spoil ourstay in anyway as the choices of eatery are in abundance.Chinatown very close, and Northbeach. Always light refreshments; warm cider or iced tea and fruit in reception. Sign in to guessed services, it takes to minutes, and is free. You can have tea, coffee, or hot chocolate for free delivered to your room, plus internet access. Would go back to the Omni again. All were welcomed, from business people to families :)

Reviews.Title: “Omni Review”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveller12345
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, well maintained, centrally located business hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There were no unpleasant surprises during my stay except for the $50 breakfast for 2 in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance, well run and well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnailspaceToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on business in April,I was very pleased with the Omni. It is perfectly situated to all amenities and the great shopping of Union Square, great food and restaurants nearby, and close to financial district for work. I was greeted by name, made to feel welcome, and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel amenities. Comfy beds, luxuriously appointed rooms, this is one of the better San Francisco hotels, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GonzoTheGreatLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of days in SF in this hotel. Just excellent. We also got a good price through Expedia. Super friendly staff. Great location. Walking distance to BART. 10 min walk to Union square and 2 min walk to china town. 30 minutes stroll along the water to pier 33 for Alkatraz. If you can stay in this hotel, just do. We will do again next time! We signed up with the loyalty scheme over the internet as someone here suggested. This was great, we got free internet and 2 drinks per person free in the morning delivered to the room. Try their orange and tomato juice! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mess0277
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very good choice for downtown. A few blocks from the Ferry building, Union Square, Nob Hill & North Beach. Neighborhood is quieter than Union Square, although you can hear every noise from nearby rooms. Complimentary coffee with steamed milk and various newspapers are a nice touch, and the workout room is better than at most similarly-priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed at on our recent trip to the USA. We booked based on the good reviews, location and low price. Our room was ready when we arrived and we were given lots of helpful information by reception for our stay in San Francisco. The rooms are nice, not massive but big enough for two people. The hotel has an old fashioned luxurious feeling to it, different to the usual chains we have stayed at. We were disappointed slightly that the cable car was not running on California Street right outside the hotel, closed for refurbishment of the line. We would have liked to seen them running instead of the roadworks, but this was not the hotels fault. I do think Thomas Cook could have let us know about this before booking though. It was only a small inconvenience to our stay with there being trams a short walk away or another cable car at the top of the steep hill. We went all over in San Francisco and bought a 3 day travel pass from reception. We also went to see a Giants game which was good fun, concierge were very helpful sorting out the tickets for us. The hotel is in a good location in the financial district and a short walk to Union Square and all the shops, although being in the financial district did mean a few coffee shops and restaurants were closed over the weekend. We ate nearby at restaurants recommended by concierge and also in the hotel for lunch and dinner. The onion rings in the hotel restaurant show as a starter ($12) and look amazing. Be warned, the portions are massive and we struggled to eat them all, along with steaks for main course. My only small complaint is that I struggled to get english tea. There is fruit and earl grey tea in the rooms and free coffee downstairs for guests in the morning. They did get me english tea in the morning when I asked but made a point of saying I should really be charged as only coffee is free. The maid did her best to get me english tea for the room but I ended up with more earl grey! On our last day, they kindly stored the luggage for us until the afternoon when we left and then arranged for a hotel car to take us to the airport in style, rather than a taxi. We would happily recommend the hotel to others and stay again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishnRic
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The doorman was incredibly nice, Paul at the front desk assisted us in finding places to see and eat, and on the last day Jessica gave us more information on how to quickly get around. We booked the room thru Cheap Tickets and could not beat the price. I would have expected to pay at least twice per night. Pros: Location is convenient to everything. Comfortable, friendly, all personel seems to have extreme knowledge on the area and attractions, clean beyond even my expections! We would shower in the evening, go to dinner and come back to find clean towels again! Cons: The thermostat only goes down to 67. For me it was still a tad bit warm. I like it to be a little colder at night. I would recommend it to anyone. And, try the chop house downstairs. Their salmon was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff - what a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cuttingblade
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. From the very first moment everyone we met was so welcoming. Stephen on reception took at least 15 minutes to go over the map with us, recommending places to visit/eat/transport tips etc. all of which we found to be excellent. Every time we came back to the hotel the staff met us with a sincere and friendly "Welcome back!". It was raining during our stay but umbrellas were handed out as we went out and there was always someone on the door to help you in with bags/relieve you of wet umbrellas etc. The warm cider in reception and the bowl of shiny apples was a homely touch. The hotel's location is perfect - near Chinatown and Little Italy - and a pleasant walk from the Ferry building - with good transport options nearby if you don't walk. We spent a month touring Australia and this was our stopover on the way home - what a lovely way to end a perfect trip! Thanks to all at the Omni for a delightful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip/ Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: nrzermd
Reviews.Content: We traveled to SF for delayed anniversary. Initial room was nice but problems with TV. John from Engineering tried for hours but was unable to resolve issue. We were promptly moved to another room, but again with TV issues. Zaw at front desk personally upgraded and came to move us with John . As it turns out, the TV issues were a result of the service not the hotel. The staff went above and beyond what is expected to ensure customer satisfaction. The hotel itself is very good, but it is the sincere effort of staff that we encountered made it a great experience. From the outstanding directions/guidance from the concierge, to the attentiveness and service recovery of John and Zaw.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great value.”
Reviews.Author: ace8726872
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel in San Francisco, I noticed that the hotels were expensive and parking at the hotel was outrageously expensive as well. I didn't even look at Omni at first because I figured that I would not be able to afford it, Omni being a 4 star hotel and all. To my surprise, Omni rate was very reasonable even the parking included. The room was small but that is the only complain I have about Omni. Everything else exceeded our expectations. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. The room was very clean and well furnished. Upon chech-in, the hotel gave my kids goodie-bags full of neat toys. As turn-down service, they gave us cookies and milk for the kids every night. The location was unbeatable as well, situated in the heart of financial district with the cable car right in front of the hotel @ California street. This is a great hotel with exceptional service at a extraordinary value. Thank you Omni for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is welcoming, confortable, clean and well located.”
Reviews.Author: placerite
Reviews.Content: The scale of this hotel suits San Francisco perfectly. Not too vast, not too over done, but elegant in the traditional style. The staff was very endearing and earnest and the rooms were quiet with really, really comfortable beds. The cleanliness standards were high as well. The only negative I can say, is it's high time to clean their carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay and Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DB41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omini for 3 nights. We had 2 rooms - one for us with a king bed, the other for our adult children - 2 queens (or double) beds. The hotel was good enough to give us adjoining rooms. We paid $175 and $185 for each room and the rate included breakfast. (Breakfast was served at Bob's Steak House on the ground floor of the hotel. Each guest is given a $30 credit and there is full service.) The room was modern (flat screen tv, marble bathroom, climate controlled), quiet, and comfortable. (Hint: Join their club before you stay. It's free and you'll get free Wi-FI, a daily newspaper, and morning beverage service.) The hotel is centrally located - convenient to all parts of San Francisco, The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for the price, but no Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental, but good for Business.”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown San Francisco with lots of do and see nearby. Bob's Steak and Chophouse is a restaurant off the lobby and the hotel is upscale. Rooms are adequate, nothing fancy, but service basic needs well. In-room mini-bar is key if you want a beverage! Room service was solid, both for breakfast and dinner. Internet was a bit slow, but worked well ($10 a day). Hotel staff is above average, pleasant, all over and helpful. For about $200 a night, this is a VERY GOOD hotel for the business traveler who has expense limits. SF is EXPENSIVE when you get to the nicer hotels like Ritz, Four Seasons and Mandarin, which run $400-$650 a night. For $200 you have what you need and have a great location. If you are looking for first class, consider one of the other three mentioned, but I think the Omni is a good option on a moderate budget. Also, consider the Fairmount and Westin St. Francis, similar rates and scale. Here's why Omni is no Four Seasons/Ritz: Space under door meant I could hear way too much of hallway noise, both EARLY AM and Late Night. Light in 2X mirror in bathroom burnt out. Nobody checks it. Wireless phone in room was dead--nobody checks this. Mini-bar not re-filled each day. Took a while to get room service tray removed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrscorrad
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the time we left, everyone was so nice, helpful, pleasant. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms/beds/pillows are extremely comfortable. We are in their rewards program (it's free) so we got free wireless and beverages at our door each morning. The hotel is well located - 2 blocks from the TransAmerica building, 4 blocks from Market Street, short walk to Chinatown, the Italian section, Union Square and the Ferry building. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Omni; we booked on Hotels.ca and followed up with Tripadvisor to check reviews. This is a great hotel, fabulous service, great location, excellent rate. The concierge was a wealth of information. We'll definitely return to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from ALL staff...from the doorman, to the cleaners, to the concierge! GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: travellerofplaces
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco, but the hotel staff made the experience. They were all very helpful with anything we needed. Front desk staff gave us the best places to eat in the city...their local favorites. The hotel was in the financial district which was a quick walk to everything...it was busy with people, but not too busy like the main touristy area. I would stay there again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable, relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: lyssSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 4 nights with our 2 children, ages 4 and 1. We booked the Omni because they offered a Kids Fantasy Suite, enabling us to have much more space than a standard hotel room. The kids room was fantastic! It was essentially a room connected to ours, but decked out with bunk beds, toys and bean bags. Both the kids loved it. They also provided milk and cookies at night, which our 4 year old thought was just brilliant. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and willing to help. There was a restaurant downstairs which was child friendly and had a very good kids menu. The hotel also has very good room service, which can often be needed with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: KFM9275
Reviews.Content: Since my husband is a member of Omni's selectguest program, we choose Omni if at all possible. We were certainly not disappointed with our weekend in San Francisco. From the doorman, to the valet parking staff, to the Concierge, Lex, everyone is top notch. Unfortunately my husband got food poisoning from a local restaurant, which ruined our stay. But the kitchen staff was nice enough to send up chicken borth and crackers (neither on the menu, of course) when he was up to eating.

Reviews.Title: “Omni-ficent!”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller9569
Reviews.Content: Great location for business and pleasure - helpful staff, great breakfasts, great bar...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: luvsgolf71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to the top ratings from Trip advisor and others. Spent extra for a breakfast package and upper floor to have a good view. Had to ask for the breakfast vouchers at check-in and nothing was explained. We got ready to have breakfast on our only day to sightsee we saw they were for a room service breakfast. We received a nice breakfast but it took 1 hour for the food to arrive. I am not a fan of eating in a hotel room. I asked could we eat in the restaurant for our 2nd day and was told ABSOLUTELY NOT! We were packing to leave that morning and on a 2 week journey so had a mess everywhere, making the room breakfast even more undesirable. Our 15th floor view was of a roof top and taller buildings. Be sure you are not on the California Street side of the building, if you want a view. I spent a lot of time picking the right hotel because it has been 28 years since I had a chance to visit San Francisco. The Omni did not live up to the high expectations from all the 5.0 reviews. The staff was friendly and doormen and Valet were helpful. The room was small and disappointing. I had to dry my hair in the hall while my husband showered due to the only sink area being in the bathroom. This is not my idea of what a 4.5 STAR Hotel should be

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: jcmadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on route to LA and had a near perfect stay. Very comfortable rooms, with all the extras you´d expect. Excellent reception staff very willing to help and lovely breakfasts with fast and efficient service. Recommended! One note: The valeting does not apply to motorbikes, and as we were on a hired Harley we had to find our own parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanrovesrions
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a pleasant stay for us. On Fridays and Saturdays the valet parking is half the price at I believe $23, which for San Fran is a good deal! Check in went smooth and room was very nice and luxurious. There is a mini bar in the room, with prices exactly where you would expect. The hotel is in a great location but our room faced the interior facing side of the building not the street, so we saw only into other people's offices. The room was very basic, but small details are what separate Omni rooms from other hotel chains. The crown molding, wallpaper, service phone in bathroom, silk lined robes, sliding bathroom door, etc..Nonetheless it was great and the Omni is always a classic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel If You Get Food Poisoning”
Reviews.Author: TRSpiller
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is the best hotel to recover in if you ever catch food poisoning! Let me explain, the Omni definitely didn't give me food poisoning, a grocery store hot bar in San Fran did. By the time I checked into the Omni, I was feeling the full effects of nausea and stabbing stomach pains. The wonderful woman who checked us in pretended that I was fine even though I'm sure she could see the pain etched across my face. Even through the stabbing haze and the chills, I was able to appreciate one of the most comfortable beds I had ever slept in as far as hotel beds. The appropriate number of covers/duvets cradled me to sleep and more than enough luxurious fluffy pillows to lulled me to sleep. Throughout the night, I was awakened several times from knife like pains in my abdomen from the poisoning and was more annoyed at not being able to lay in that bed and sleep than the actual pain itself. The room was very quiet even though we had checked in during the Chinese New Year celebration. The hotel was very busy with celebration participants checking in who were still feeling the effects of a lively celebration that was still happening just a few blocks away. Of course you get some sound, but it was more of a sporadic far away conversation than a blaring and lively debate right outside of your door. I also attribute the levels to the fact that a celebration was happening. I didn't get a chance to venture out into San Fran as I was recovering, however, the room was clean, comfortable and an oasis away from home. I didn’t get to see much of the hotel, but when I was feeling better, I did make it a point to order room service (which I got free as part of my hotel deal). The room service was fast (special note since the hotel was so full that day), the food was pleasant enough and the staff was very friendly and professional. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: chowc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in the past and I have to admit that the service provided by the staff at this hotel is top notch. Service - 5 stars I was greeted with my name and always got a smile and a greeting from every staff member. They always made an effort to connect with you. Even the maids left personalized note in your room, nice touch. Requested a birthday celebration for my sister during the stay and it was accommodated. The staff sent a slice of beautiful chocolate cake and a small bottle of champagne to my sister's room on her birthday! Got good recommendation for restaurant. The staff are just wonderful! Rooms - 5 stars Just like all other Omni hotels, it is beautiful, clean and comfortable. Location - 5 stars walkable distance to Chinatown, cable car stops in front of the hotel I have stayed at Le Meridien and Grand Hyatt in San Francisco and Omni is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarnaD
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels in San Fransisco that let us stay with our 3 kids in a Deluxe room with 2 double beds. At check in the staff provided the kids with backpacks full of fun stuff. We were already enrolled in their loyalty program (which is free)-so we got free wifi , complimentary water, complimentary hot beverage in the morning and milk-cookies for the kids at night. The staff were always friendly. The room and the bathroom were both celan and spacious. We were on the 17th floor but still could hear some street noise but that is part of staying in the city. Loved Omni and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with the best staff”
Reviews.Author: awey33388
Reviews.Content: We loved our getaway to the Omni San Francisco. Great location, wonderful rooms but the staff sets the hotel apart. The hotel has a true guest service culture. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort, Classic Styling”
Reviews.Author: imanahan
Reviews.Content: The Omni is elegant yet comfortable. The neighborhood is safe, but still trendy and convenient. The staff is just incredible. The price is reasonable, about $155/night (we booked through Expedia). It's everything you'd want from a luxury hotel. Warm first impressions: My boyfriend and I came for a romantic Valentine's Day weekend. We arrived late in the evening (11 p.m.) and were warmly greeted. We were recommended late night dinner options (we went to Brandy Ho's for Chinese a few blocks away), as well as fun morning activities (they offer free walking tours at 10 a.m., but we went to the farmer's market - see below). Classy, comfortable room: The housekeeper left a lovely hand written personalized note on our office table welcoming us to the hotel. Our bodies sank into the pillow top mattress and our heads sank into the soft down pillows. Prime location: In the morning we went to the farmer's market at the Ferry Building about a quarter mile away where the concierge recommended we have brunch. The Bart is also just four blocks away (only $8.10 to SFO), and the folks at the front desk looked up the schedule for us. Hardworking and sincere staff: The employees were polite and helpful. I've mentioned a few of their recommendations already, but they also let us keep our rental bikes stored inside overnight, and hailed our taxis for us when we needed them. TIPS: When you get in, look on the desk for a application to the loyalty program. After signing up, WiFi is free, plus some other nice services like clothes pressing. After 10 nights, you get one free! http://www.omnihotels.com/selectguestprogram.aspx

Reviews.Title: “We stay no where else in SF”
Reviews.Author: CarmelDoug
Reviews.Content: We went to the Omni SF to celebrate my wife's birthday. I paid the lowest posted price on line and asked for an upgrade. We got a suite! Plus they gave my wife a big slice of birthday cake with "Happy Birthday" with her name on the plate. As usual, the staff was the best. We stay here every time we visit SF. The biggest surprise: They held two bags while we ate lunch and waited for check in. I wanted to tip the front desk guy a couple bucks for getting the bags out of storage. He refused and said it was unnecessary. Every time we come to the Omni we get a perfect experience. Very consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! felt like we mattered and important. LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: Kereni
Reviews.Content: VERY fency (though the rooms are a bit too "old fasion" great location and great serivce They took care of everything for us. VERY kids friendly despite it is a more business like hotle. they got us a kids activity pack and kids' menu - expensive, but worth it - very tasty If you have some money to spare and want to be spolit - go there Register as a member before booking as you will get some nice treats :)

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton, great atmosphere, great service, great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlrb07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni and really enjoyed it. It is in a geat location near Chinatown, Nob Hill, the Embarcadero, and the Wharf. A cable car line runs right in front of hotel and can get you around easily. The hotel has a luxurious feel and the staff was very accommodating. Surprisingly quiet given the location. Definitely would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - with character”
Reviews.Author: Barry888
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in December and I'm looking forward to being able to stay again. For those who can't be bothered to read long reviews, my summary: - Great sleep (quiet and comfortable) - Characterful and friendly - Good price - Good location - Don't eat the carrots For those with more time on their hands: How very, very nice it was to stay in a hotel with some character, rather than the bland formula of an hotel like a Hya-lto-rriott. I found the general feel of the Omni very comforting - like they've been taking care of important people for years and I was in good hands. I might not be considered that important by many other people - but they appeared to find me so, and I enjoyed going along with it. A huge positive point for me was the fact that I slept like a baby. Like a baby asleep in a beautifully quiet room, in fact. This hotel is made out of good, solid materials, not the usual plasterboard and echo-ey corridors of an ant hotel. I wasn't once kept awake by frisky neighbours, or woken early by the splash of showers or slamming doors of hastily abandoned rooms. Good sleep = good mood and good work. In comparison to other business district hotels I found it very reasonably priced. I loved the morning delivery of coffee and juice that was included as part of their rewards programme. Oh, how such small things make such a difference to the way you start your day. Other than that ... friendly, helpful staff and great location for the business district. Although it's a little way from the tourist hotspots, it's no big deal to jump in a cab for five minutes or travel by public transport ... or, (heaven forbid) use your legs! The one and only issue I stumbled across in my stay was in the steak restaurant - so maybe it's not that fair to post here ... but since the restuarant is affiliated, and there's a pretty good chance that guests will gravitate towards it, I will! The issue? The gigantic phallus of a carrot that was delivered on my plate, reclining in its self-satisfied way against my mightily over-priced and, presumably, very embarrassed steak. That long, lone carrot was, quite honestly, the most revolting vegetable I've ever eaten - and that includes the times I've accidentally bitten into renegade pieces of celery (food of the devil) in a salad. I can't believe the carrot had come from anything other than a huge tin of brine and a ten year wait in a dusty warehouse somewhere. If you're a beef aficionado - or even just someone who likes good food - just don't bother. Yes, the steak tasted good ... but not an eye-rolling, conversation-stopping, stress-sapping, umami-ridden explosion of great that I'd expect from a steakhouse charging that much per pound of beef. Oh, and that carrot. Gack!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: The Omni hotel is, quite simply, one of the best places I've ever stayed. From the time you arrive you are treated with tremendous service. There is no line to wait on when you arrive and no lengthy check-in process...simply tell the front desk your name and your key is waiting for you. Once in your room, a warm note awaits along with a bucket full of ice and two complimentary bottled waters. For Omni awards members (free to sign up), wi-fi is free, as are two complimetary beverages each morning (I chose a pot of coffee and an OJ). These two conveniences alone saved me over $50 over the course of my four days there. As mentioned at the outset, customer service could not be better. The staff is attentive to your every need. I booked tow tours through the concierge and both were great. As for location, the Omni is located downtown, about 4 blocks north or Market Street and about eight blocks from the Embarcadro. It is about two blocks from the TransAmerica Building. Needless to say, this is an excellent location to explore virtually any part of the city. Union Square is probably a slightly better location, but this is a close second. I will look to stay at the Omni every time I'm in SF in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: RobiWa
Reviews.Content: From the moment you get to the hotel you are greeted with the best service I have ever experienced. Check-in was perfect, my kids got their own back-packs with games and chocolate chip cookies with milk every night. Little touches like having morning drinks delivered to your door every morning completed the experience. Location is very central to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Omni SFO Service is still ouystanding.”
Reviews.Author: willy77055
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff went out of their way to be of assistance with many small details and local reservations. They gave us excellent choices and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ahetzel
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in San Francisco tired and ill after an international business trip for a few days stopover, I really appreciated the genuinely friendly service and comfortable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Omni because of the reviews we read in Trip Advisor. And I am so glad we did it! A perfect choice! The hotel is very nice and charming, the location is very good but most of all I have never stayed in a Hotel with such a friendly staff. From the doormen, the concierge, reception, every single employee is kind and always ready to help you with good tips and a friendly smile in their faces. The rooms are not that big, but are nicely decorated and very clean. They are a bit noisy though, internal noise from the corridors and also external from the street. The hotel is walking distance to Market Street and Union Square and the nice shops around. I definetly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas while on my honeymoon, I had mentioned the occasion on the booking form and there was a note delivered from the accommodation manger wishing us a lovely stay and some complementary strawberries following our arrival. The room was fairly large and comfortable. The hotel is well located close to most attractions and the California street cable car runs along outside the door. The only negative is the cost of Valet parking is quite high $48 plus taxes per night ut otherwise it's an excellent hotel. Don't forget to sign up to the Select guest program. It's free and provides complementary Wifi and a Coffee/Juice each morning of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great value!”
Reviews.Author: PamEqualsCool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in SF back in May when we visited the Bay Area. It was an excellent hotel and we were surprised by the great value. It is also in a nice location. Not a whole lot happening at night, but walking distance to many nice restaurants and tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Wonderful Staff, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RCFChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni San Francisco for 9 nights over the Christmas-New Year’s holiday. This is a lovely hotel. As so many of the other reviewers have mentioned, all of the people who work at this hotel (from the doormen to the housekeepers to the front desk people) are as helpful and accommodating as can be. Even though this is a big hotel, it has a small, elegant hotel feeling about it. The rooms are very nice, impeccably clean, large (and we had a standard size room), and the showers are great. In the lobby on each day of our stay, there was delicious hot apple cider and yummy Christmas cookies. I agonized over the decision as to which area to stay in. A lot of the locals suggested that the hotels right around Union Square were better for a tourist. Well, I am so happy that I did not follow that advice. First of all, I didn’t find Union Square to be all that exciting. Sure, there are a lot of dept. stores and bright lights, but I was not really interested in shopping opportunities. I found the location of the Omni to be great – 2 blocks from Chinatown and close to the Ferry Building (with all sorts of great food gathering opportunities-Blue Bottle coffee and waffles, Frog Hollow pastries, Cowgirl Creamery’s cheese, Acme bread) and the Embarcadero (which we enjoyed strolling along). Also, out of curiosity, I walked into some of the recommended hotels in Union Square and didn’t find them nearly as inviting as the Omni. There are a number of restaurants close to the Omni, although we tended not to eat in the immediate area (and some of the breakfast/lunch places are closed on non-business days). Also, there are tons of other restaurants within easy walking/public transportation access. I have no doubt that we will be staying at the Omni for our next trip to San Francisco. (Free Internet and morning beverages with Omni Select Guest membership; membership is free)

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel with the best service you could imagine”
Reviews.Author: Peppersita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights whilst on our honeymoon. The first moment we walked into the hotel we knew that it would be special. The front desk staff were very courteous the concierge was extremely helpful in giving us directions to a restaurant we had a booking at and also giving us advice on good places to shop. The hotel room itself was clean and cosy, with the most comfortable, softest bed that I have ever slept on. Signing up to the hotel's Select Guest program we were provided with complimentary wifi in the room as well as 2 free bottles of water and 2 coffee/juice options each day. My husband and I found this wonderful, to wake up to find complimentary drinks at the door. What made this hotel more special was the fact that the housekeeping staff wrote a handwritten note to us on the first night wishing us a enjoyable stay. It's small touches like this that makes guests like us feel welcomed and at home. During our stay, the Omni Hotel had complimentary hot apple cider and Christmas cookies on offer near the lifts. The apple cider was simply delicious and Christmas cookies scrumptious. The hotel itself is about a 10 minute walk from the nearest underground metro station and a short stroll from Union Square. The hotel also offers walking tours around China Town which is a short stroll away. Overall, during our 5 week stay in the US (around various cities and hotels), my husband and I both agreed that the Omni Hotel in SF was the best and most memorable hotel that we stayed at. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to return here on my next trip back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: lorrie-n-john
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous old hotel right on the trolley line, right next to Chinatown and within walking distance of many good spots. We signed up to be members of the Omni group, and as a perk to members they will bring you free coffee, tea and newspaper up to your room! It's elegant, clean, and lovely. The only place we stay in San Francisco nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Right ON”
Reviews.Author: luv2golfDenver
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Centrally located. Incredible friendly staff everywhere. Great rooms. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staffs”
Reviews.Author: MVagusta
Reviews.Content: The highlight of the stay was the overall performance of the hotel staffs, they really go out of their way to be gracious, welcoming and helpful; from the doormen, to the front desk, dining room servers. The hotel and rooms are nice but nothing stands out, it's standard decent hotel-level type of decor and finishing. The hotel is only a few blocks from the Ferry Building (near the Bay Bridge), 2 blocks away from Chinatown, and a few blocks north of the nicer part of Market Street (with plenty of nice shops) The downside of the hotel are twofold, one is temporary, the cable car was not working while we were there, it was highlighted on their website that it runs right outside the hotel, and no one from the hotel notified us until we had asked about it. The second is other than Chinatown, there aren't a lot of activities around the hotel because it's in the financial district, so if you want a decent meals (other than Chinatown and not the tourist traps or fast foods) you will need to get in a cab, which we didn't have trouble finding, even when it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience”
Reviews.Author: mtoon
Reviews.Content: We’ve travelled quite a bit but this has been the best hotel experience we have encountered. The hotel itself was clean with a warm and welcoming lobby, and cider is offered daily. Each staff member was very friendly and enthusiastic, from check-in until we got on the taxi for the airport. We were always greeted warmly and offered assistance. The front door staff members were always courteous and smiling. The front desk staff offered great information, sometimes even without our request. The only area for improvement is that perhaps concierge staff could be a bit more knowledgeable about the sightseeing areas. Joining the complimentary Select Guest program is a must. You get free wifi which would otherwise be a $10/day charge. Two bottled waters are delivered on your first day, and two beverages per guest are promptly delivered to your room each morning at your chosen time. There is the option that room service will knock at your door and leave the tray there. When we requested a 4am delivery due to an early flight (not included the hotel’s given options), our tray was still delivered exactly when we needed it for a great start to the day. The room was spacious and clean. When we found a spot on the bed sheets and wanted them replaced, housekeeping came within minutes and was incredibly friendly, even giving us sightseeing advice. It was quiet, with no noise from the streets or the hallways during the nights. The location was great and within walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, and Union Square. We felt safe walking around early morning and in the evenings. Breakfast places and convenience stores were nearby, which was handy. We will definitely return to this hotel should we visit San Francisco again. From this wonderful experience, we will be looking forward to staying in Omni hotels in other cities around the world in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive to your every need”
Reviews.Author: cbmm
Reviews.Content: We live 1 hr. away from San Francisco, so when we get the opportunity for a getaway, I always check the recommendations here before I book a hotel. It's fun to try a new place each time. We were impressed with the level of attentiveness as soon as we pulled up to the curb. We were greeted with smiles and help at every turn. We walked to Union Square, Nob Hill, and the Embarcadero from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again, I wish we could of stayed more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay during the holidays”
Reviews.Author: tripleflip
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is excellent value for money, especially if you can get a great room rate. I cancelled my reservation at another hotel when I saw the Omni had a $99 rate over the Christmas holidays. From check-in to check-out, I had very friendly interactions with every staff member l encountered. I was especially impressed that the housekeeping staff communicated to me via the notepad on the writing desk on a daily basis. The room itself was nicely appointed and a good size. I had an interior courtyard "view", but I didn't mind as there was no traffic noise whatsoever. I didn't hear other guests through the walls either. This was my first time staying at an Omni hotel, so based on recommendations I signed up for their frequent guest program. This entitled me to free wifi during my stay, and a daily choice of newspaper delivered in the morning alongside two breakfast drinks. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would not hesitate in returning to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_Jamie
Reviews.Content: Location in business area. Extremely expensive valet parking with tax! Stayed with young kids. Very high beds. My son knocked on the edge of a side table and had a bruise bump on his forehead. Will recommend this hotel for its fantastic service and for business travelers. For family, should try to find a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf or at Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retrohippie
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lovely hotel. We didn't use room service and never had to call housekeeping, so I can't review that. Robes were provided, and the tub is extra deep, which I loved after getting caught in a downpour down at Fisherman's Wharf. The bathroom is all marble, with Kohler fixtures, but watch those sink handles! They unscrew easily after being turned on and off, and will drop off onto the counter, or if you're unlucky, onto the glass soap dish or q-tip holder. The handles are heavy, and it's possible something could be broken. The two windows only open about six inches, for safety purposes. Street noise is minimal as long as the windows are kept closed. The heating unit in the room worked great and was not loud at all. We didn't try the A/C, of course. The king-sized bed was very comfortable, but firmer than we're used to. A good quality blow dryer in a drawstring bag hung in the bathroom, and an iron and board in the closet and a 32-inch flat screen tv for bedside viewing. A small coffeepot with quality coffee is provided. There is also a small portable fridge in the television armoir, to which you are given a key at check-in. You can use the fridge to store your own stuff if you want, but don't try to store too much. The fridge has a small amount of liquor, beer, wine, soda and sparkling water that the maid checks every day to see if you've used anything. If you don't want her digging through all your stuff to find their stuff, don't cram it full of your stuff. Unless you want to pay top dollar, don't drink the bottled water they leave out for you and don't eat any of their candy or drink anything from their fridge. Bring your own snacks and keep a six-pack of your favorite soda in the fridge. The restaurant in the hotel, Bob's Steak and Chop House is a fine restaurant. A little pricey, but worth it. If you want breakfast, you must be there before 10 am. Not easy for late risers like us. But if you miss it, the Subway right across the street next to the Wells Fargo serves breakfast sandwiches and has fresh hot coffee. Also, I highly recommend the Wells Fargo History Museum, since it's right there. The very site of the very first Wells Fargo. The cable cars were not running on California Street. That's the main reason I chose a hotel on a cable car line, so we could step out the front door and catch one. I checked SFMTA's website, and it said that due to construction, the entire California line will be shut down from January 3rd, 2011 until June 2011, so it should have been running while we were there. The hotel staff did not know why it was not. The hotel is non-smoking, so you'll have to go outside the hotel to do that, if you smoke. The windows don't open far enough to be of any use, and although you can remove the plastic stops to open the window all the way, there is a very real chance you would fall if you leaned out even a little, so I do not recommend this to smoke, or for any other reason. No, we did not try this. Parking at the hotel is valet only, and costs $48 a day. Outrageous! Do yourself a favor and find another garage. There are a couple nearby on Kearney. You can find web coupons if you're really into saving extra money. Lastly, do yourself a favor and leave your car parked. Buy a 3 or 7-day muni pass at the hotel desk. It's good for all types of bus, cable car and trolley car transportation throughout the city. There's also a discount at the Ghirardeli square chocolate store and the SF Zoo if you show your muni pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: French_Australian
Reviews.Content: We just checked-out from the hotel where we stayed 3 nights in San Francisco, the Omni. The hotel was very comfortable and luxurious and all the staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and genuinely interested in making our stay a pleasant one. The beds were very comfortable, everything was clean. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: Outstanding accommodations, friendly staff, and a great location. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Techielawyermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni largely due to the ratings but also the very close proximity to the Julian Morgan Ballroom, where we attended a Christmas Party. The Omni was a terrific value. Book on their website for the bed and breakfast package, which was only $10/night more per person but give you $30/person breakfast voucher in their restaurant. We had a great breakfast! Very nice fitness room. Room was clean and well equipped with a very nice bathroom. Friendly staff too. Will definitely stay here again the next time we are in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Cordial, classy, comfortable, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: The Omni is on a quiet block of a busy neighborhood. Each member of the staff was 100% welcoming and helpful day and night. The hotel is an elegant and calm universe to enter after walking amidst the kinetic energy of downtown SF. The decor is understated and classic. The room was comfortable, meticulously clean and inviting. Our rate included breakfast which was served in a lovely white napkin restaurant. My croissant had perfect butter crunch and the segmented grapefruit was served with an orchid decor. The Omni makes a weekend getaway very special indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free apple cider, elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dantebouchot
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed one night in the Omni San Francisco Hotel. It is a very nice and elegant hotel located on the corner of California and Montgomery, in the financial district of San Francisco. The location is great because it is a five minute (flat) walk to the Montgomery BART station, and a ten minute (flat) walk to the Ferry Building. Also, the California Street cable car line runs right in front of the hotel. The other two cable car lines are just a short walk away (a steep uphill walk though). So overall, its very easy to get to most tourist attractions in the city using public transportation. And of course, you can always just take a cab, as it only costs around $10 to get to Fisherman's Wharf. The service was great, the hotel staff was always willing to give advice on how to get from one place to another, and they seemed very knowledgable. The rooms themselves were big and clean. We had a standard room, with a king size bed, two LCD TVs and a desk. One other thing my fiancee liked was that in the afternoon they offer free apple cider in the lobby, which she loves and thought it was really good (I can't personally vouch for it since I don't like apple cider in general).
