Overall, we were extremely satisfied with the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Omni could not have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: Tally42
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in an Omni Hotel. From the moment that we arrived, we were welcomed and greeted by the most gracious hotel staff. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are nice, quiet and well equipped. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough. From the moment you walk in the beautiful lobby you feel totally pampered by the most incredible staff members, always with a smile on their face. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, the beds super comfortable, and everything works seamlessly while also silently (no noise of vacuuming or cleaning staff in the mornings). In fact, one of the best qualities of the hotel is how quiet it is. If you are looking for a good night sleep, the Omni won't disappoint you. Being a member of their Select Guest program is a must. It's free and it comes with many perks. I absolutely loved this hotel and my only regret was not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: z_portland
Reviews.Content: Went here because of the ratings here on Trip Advisor, and happy we did. We took Amtrak and it was within walking distance from the drop off. As many others have said, the location is great. We got a very good price on the room thru the Omni web site, better than the ones linked via this site. The staff was so friendly and kind to our kids and they accommodated a late check out, which was great. The room was fine. Nothing that made it exceptional, but it was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: supermom91
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of days before Thanksgiving. The Hotel staff was very professional. Location was great and price was very good due to a holiday special from the Omni website. We look forward to visiting this hotel again on future visits. Only wishes are for rooms with 2 queen beds, (only doubles are available) and a quick service restaurant or gift shop for snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Hobiz2
Reviews.Content: We have been to quite a few SF hotels as our daughter went to USF. We always enjoy our stay at the Omni. Great Service, Great rooms, and all around great experience. It can be pricey, but deals can be had. There frequent guest program is one f the best we have found. No reservations in highly recommending this outstanding property

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uh2239
Reviews.Content: We actually used trip advisor when looking for a San Francisco hotel ..... The Omni came highly recommended and we were not disappointed. Given the hotel is not cheap.... you would expect good food and service. Bobs Steak House was top rate, breakfasts were excellent and the rooms well appointed and comfy. Les the concierge put us right in regard to restaurants and the front door staff very entertaining and could not do enough to help in very inclement weather last week.

Reviews.Title: “OmniTASTIC IN the city”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkienj
Reviews.Content: !My preference is to book directly with the hotel, however, Expedia offered a deal I could not refuse. Airfare and hotel for 1200 (for two!!), we stayed three nights (not enough). This hotel is perfectly situated for the business traveler, surprisingly we enjoyed the location due to its proximity to Chinatown and shopping. Renting a car for the day gave us the freedom to tour wine country (lovely) and coast (WOW). Be sure to have lots of space on your camera; you could take a thousand pics in Frisco. Highlights were: dinner at Jacquelin's - souffle supreme, haunting the bookstores in the North side and steak dinner at Harris' (must do), the Japanese botanical My preference is to book directly with the hotel, however, Expedia offered a deal I could not refuse. Airfare and hotel for 1200 (for two!!), we stayed three nights (not enough). This hotel is perfectly situated for the business traveler, surprisingly we enjoyed the location due to its proximity to Chinatown and shopping. Renting a car for the day gave us the freedom to tour wine country (lovely) and coast (WOW). Be sure to have lots of space on your camera; you could take a thousand pics in Frisco. Highlights were: dinner at Jacquelin's - souffle supreme, haunting the bookstores in the North side and steak dinner at Harris' (must do), the Japanese botanical garden. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We were in SF over a long weekend in August and couldn't have been happier with the Omni. The service was great from all staff and the hotel was in a very good location. While not directly in Union Square, it is just a short walk (10min). We enjoy walking, so this hotel was also perfect proximity to Chinatown (2min), Fisherman's Wharf (20min), and anywhere else you need to go. As with anywhere in SF, if you have trouble walking or with hills, it is difficult to walk everywhere, but we love it. There's also a cable car directly in front of the hotel. Omni is a nice, high end hotel without being stuck up like some others in the area. We will definitely stay there again whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mamaria
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business, but it would also be convenient for a pleasure trip. It is walking distance to the Embarcadero, Union Square and Chinatown. It is convenient to the BART and the Muni Montgomery station. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly. It is very beneficial to sign up for their rewards program - it's free and the perks are nice. The only minor complaints I had were that the wireless internet was a bit slow sometimes. All in all, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most wonderful hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: amilatie
Reviews.Content: Although this is a gorgeous hotel with luxurious amenities, the service is what this made this Omni a step above many others. We were welcomed from the moment we dropped our car off with the valet and were made to feel very special for the entire trip. I have already began to plan my next stay at the Omni San Francisco. I have tried to think of something negative to ensure that I am giving a thorough overview and I cannot think of one thing. Also, the location is fabulous. It is right in the heart of downtown SF and on the streetcar line.

Reviews.Title: “Superior and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Jeslynns
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to San Francisco, I highly recommend the Omni, specifically if you are looking for a romantic getaway. The staff, from the valet to the maid service, is superior. The front desk personnel went out of their way to provide my spouse and I an amazing getaway. The Romance package provides the guest with champagne, robes, soft music, and rose petals across the bed. The trip was a surprise for my anniversary and my husband explained to me how helpful the staff was in setting up the perfect trip. Additionally, the location was perfect! It is an easy walk to Chinatown and North Beach, and only a trolley ride away from the piers. I highly recommend this hotel and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Road Noise Kept Me Up All Night”
Reviews.Author: accidentaltrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stay more than 60 nights a year in hotels. I have the top frequent guest status at the Omni, Starwood and Hyatt. The Omni is an older hotel on a busy corner. The lobby is nice. The staff is helpful. The rooms themselves are the size of usual hotel rooms and are in B+ condition. The reason I checked out early and will not be staying at this Omni again is I did not get a good night's sleep because of the noise from the cars, buses, cable cars and sirens. I had a suite (which is just a very small sitting area connected to a standard-sized room). All of the suites have the same noise problem because all of them are on the corner of the hotel, overlooking the busy intersection. If you do not want a suite, the hotel (which footprint is shaped like the letter L), does have interior rooms that do not face either street. However, those rooms are small and have views of only the backs of neighboring buildings. I looked at an interior room on the highest floor; its view was of the massive air conditioning unit of a neighboring building. Finally, the hotel's restaurant and parking are overpriced. For example, the American Breakfast (2 eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns, toast, coffee and juice) is $25.95; the Cobb Salad is $19.95; the burger is $18.95; dinner entrees start at $30.95 and do not include any side dishes. Add to those prices California sales tax, 18% service charge and a $3.00 "guest dining charge." The only parking is valet, which costs $48.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kcmrjm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great. The hotel and our was beautiful. The service at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The doormen were very welcoming and the house keepers did a great job servicing our room. The hotel was very clean. The location is a bit off the most travelled paths but the cable car is a block away and we could get to most places via cable car, bus, trolley easily. We could easily walk to Chinatown and Union Square. We ate at the hotel restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We were very pleased with the breakfast. The quality of the food and prices were good. We were a bit disappointed with the dinner. We thought the food was average and the prices too high. But overall, we would definitely stay at the San Francisco Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skigrrl
Reviews.Content: we spent a night there on a layover and it was a great experience. service and location were great, superclean, and all amenites we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Omni”
Reviews.Author: barneybanana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Omni for 6 nights for a business trip and the whole stay was great and seemless. The staff is really great and helpful, check-in and out was easy and quick. This hotel is decored in an older style (both lobby and rooms) and is in the heart of the financial district, while being about a 15 min walk to Union Square and 15 min to the Embarcadero. The cable is also outside the door, but it is not very frequent (comes around every 20 min or so). My room was an average size looking onto the Wells Fargo Museum on Montgomery Street (which is worth a quick visit). I has a hand written note waiting in my room from the housekeeping lady to welcome me, which I thought was a very nice and personal touch. I have never seen this an any other hotel before. The bathroom was very clean and with a full bathtub and plenty of towels (I find hotels can sometimes be a bit stingy with towels) and good toiletries (the shampoo and conditioner was great). The only downside I have to report is that the internet access is $10 a day, I really wish it was free everywhere nowadays. I realised on the last day that from my room I could actually connect to the wifi connection from the Subway across the street. Overall, an excellent stay - however the location may be better for business travellers than for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nights of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: snuggleybum
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Fran after a long drive from Carmel! The dtaff were amazing, couldnt have been more helpful. Our room was massive and so comfy. We had a gorgeous bathroom. The hotel was for us where they had put us very quiet indeed. 2 nights was not long enough for San Fran, we made the most of it, we hired bikes and rode over the golden gate bridge, then rook the ferry back. I highly recommend the night tour of Alcatraz. We had a great meal in China town. Hotel was in a perfect location, easy to find. Very very happy with the OMNI!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for seeing San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: BBunbun
Reviews.Content: Spent first two night in US in San Francisco Omni, hotel was nice, clean and comfortable with helpful staff. The room itself looked over onto the tram line which was a slight issue with late night noise, but not a significant issue. Would have had 5 stars but spending the first two nights in a different country where lots of items seemed to have price tickets on (bottled water in bath room) although helpful was a little bugging. We would however stay here again if we visit San Francisco again and were very glad we didn't stay in Fishermans Wharf Area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLYINGDOC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this summer. The staff are just wonderful. So polite and helpful . We were intially given a top floor room but these are a bit cramped and claustrophobic as the ceiling is really low and the windows are too small. We asked to be moved and were helped to do so with extreme politeness and helpfullness, the Bellman raced up to help us to do that . He and the doorman were great , gave us loads of helpful tips on where to eat , especially breakfast ( which is expensive at the hotel itslef ) . Sears is a local restuarant ten mins away and does a massive tasty good value breakfast. PArking no more expensive than any other local hotel. The California line cable car runs right outside and its a great way to get around. The room was very clean and modern but I would book two rooms if staying with older kids. The beds were so comfortable. It was just great staying here. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni welcomed us like family”
Reviews.Author: bigcanoe2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days before beginning our Alaska cruise. It was the perfect beginning. Our room was large, clean and ready when we arrived. The staff remembered we were celebrating a birthday and generously provided us with treats and bubbly. The location is perfect for getting up and down the Nob Hill area ( do enjoy a cocktail at the Top Of The Mark ) the cable car is right out the door. We were provided with umbrellas as needed and always given good advice as to where we could dine, etc. We will always be glad to reccomend this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels_10
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night weekend stay at the Omni based on TA reviews for a getaway weekend with my family (kids 8,10) . I had high expectations given its TA ratings and was not disappointed- in fact, it exceeded my expectations. The hotel is well located - not right in the middle of the "action" but close to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square and the Ferry Building. It also helps having the cable car line right outside. I have stayed at many nicer SF hotels and the Omni met or exceeded the service at any of them. They were especially nice to my kids - welcoming them by name, giving them backpacks, cookies at night, etc. Their service is clearly a differentiator for them at all levels - housekeepping, bellman, valet, front desk - all of it was exceptional. Rooms were clean and decent size (we had 2 double beds). We ordered the morning beverage service and it arrived moments before our selected time both mornings. I cannot think of anything I would change and will definitely stay here on return trips and recommend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “They made our 10th Wedding Anniversary so special!”
Reviews.Author: KweenBee74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in northern California to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The first half we were in Napa Valley. The last half we were in San Francisco where we stayed at the Omni. We had a great stay at this hotel! Upon check-in we were greeted by Jake who made us feel welcome immediately! He had us cracking up and offered us complimentary champagne! We were told that our room was being upgraded. We were on the top floor with an amazing view of San Francisco. Also, in our room were complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries, a bottle of champagne, and yellow roses on the bed, accompanied by a note from the hotel staff congratulating us on our anniversary. The location is great because there is a cable car stop right in front of the hotel. Plus we were able to walk just a couple of blocks in one direction to reach the Marketplace, and a couple of blocks in the other direction to reach Chinatown. The only complaint I have about the hotel is the bar and the restaurant. We were in each once, and on both occasions we felt the prices were WAY too high, and the service WAY too low! Other than that the hotel is a complete gem!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & courteous staff - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzaNsw
Reviews.Content: Due to unavailability of rooms at the Fairmont and having stayed previously at the Omni for business, when I had a pleasant experience, we decided to stay at the Omni this time around as well. It was a straightforward & pleasant experience right from booking online to check-in. At check-in, the staff (particularly Mika) were extremely friendly, courteous & eager to help. (We were able to get 3-day transport tickets right at the check-in desk - USD 20 ea., valid on all forms of local transport including the cable cars - great value for money!) The general friendliness of staff included almost all levels from room service to housekeeping to front desk staff. The room was adequate for our needs and well furnished and very clean - except for the carpet, though clean, it was quite worn out and with some stains. Beds were nice and comfortable (2 doubles). Bathroom was beautiful with all amenities one would expect from a hotel of this standard. Great shower pressure too - one thing which has been decreasing in quite a lot of hotels these days. Lovely location within walking distance from the Montgomery BART station, with the cable car stops just outside the front door and easy walking to Chinatown and Union Square shopping and restaurants. Be aware though, if the room faces California St. there will be quite some noise until around 11pm - it did bother us a bit. Would definitely put Omni high on the list when we visit San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights last month with my wife and adult daughter. We had selected it carefully following research on TA and were not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the room was extremely comfortable. I liked having one of the 3 Cable Car routes right outside the front door but be sure to get a MUNI Visitors Pass ($20 for 3 days) as they are expensive. I joined the 'Select Guest' scheme with OMNI hotels so got free internet and the early morning beverage which was excellent. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skintbint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in August. A lovely hotel, friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever come across. They recommended restaurants which we tried two ( one in Chinatown) and had lovely meals at both- not cheap though ! We also ate at Bob's steak and Chop house in the hotel which was amazing. We both had fillet steak which just melted in our mouths, the best steaks ever, along with a huge loaf of warm bread. We were a bit worried that this hotel may have been too far out but there was a tram stop right across the road so was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more pleased. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: ESS_lover
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor, I booked our stay at the omni and was very glad that I did. Curb side assistance was easy, checking in at the front desk was a breeze, our rooms were spacious and clean and the layout was good. Room service was friendly and very prompt. They even gave us a small backpack full of toys for our little one and he was delighted. I recommend joining their "Select Guest" program when you book your room. It doesn't cost anything extra and provides you with nice perks. We especially liked the free morning beverage sevice delivered to our room since we had joined the program. Nothing starts a day better than caffeine! The hotel is also in a very good location. We were walking distance from union square, but not smack in the middle of it. Cannot say enough about how nice the staff at the hotel were. We've stayed at other hotels in San Francisco that weren't even half as nice and cost more. Now we know better.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: stratte
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni for 6 nights as part of a Kuoni tailormade package having chosen it specifically after having read other reviews on Tripadvisor. To say we weren't disappointed is an understatement. Centrally located in the Financial District, the Omni is elegant and beautifully decorated and our room itself was simply excellent - every comfort you could wish for including THE most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. We'd signed up on-line for Omni Rewards before leaving the UK which meant we enjoyed a free daily newspaper, turndown service and wireless internet access in our room which was great for keeping in touch with the folks at home etc. By far the most memorable aspect of our stay, however, was the staff. From the bellhops and the receptionists to the barstaff, the concierge and the chambermaids - all were welcoming, friendly, courteous and incredibly helpful. Next time I visit the States I'll be booking an Omni!

Reviews.Title: “süper”
Reviews.Author: brgur
Reviews.Content: perfect location , perfect hotel ever been. perfect service, perfect king size bed,

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Francisco sets the bar high.”
Reviews.Author: destination55
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time I'd stayed at the Omni San Francisco, but I just had to repeat the experience. This hotel and the staff are a rare combination. Friendly, courteous, knowlegeable, attention to detail, excellent restaurant and bar; and walking distance to Market Street, Chinatown and the Ferry Building, even Pier 39 if you have on good walking shoes. There are several packages to choose from and since I was driving this trip, I was able to get a "park and play" package. This included valet parking and as a "select guest" I got free internet. The rooms are elegant and comfortable, room service is available. Very classy hotel and staff. Doors are opened for you and you are welcomed back every time you walk in the door. Beautiful lobby with a huge fresh flower arrangement. A complimentary selection of fresh fruit available near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Talk with the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: fansmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for a week's vacation, and really enjoyed it. The location is excellent for culinary sightseeing; the Ferry Building and its magnificent farm market are a five minute walk, as are Chinatown and the Italian area of North Beach. The California Line streetcar (the easiest to get on, since it is not too popular with the tourists) runs in front of the building, but fortunately we didn't hear the clang-clang of the bells at night. The hotel had all the usual amenities (but breakfast was not included) plus a large bowl of fruit (pears, apples, plums) and a decanter of citrus water in the lobby. So refreshing after a day walking the hills of SF! If you stay more than a few days, make sure to enroll in their loyalty program, which entitles you to free wifi, plus coffee, juice, and a newspaper delivered to your door daily. The front desk staff was incredibly accomodating, with recommendations of what to see and do and eat throughout the city and beyond. I had done some internet research on tours of wine country and Muir Woods before I left home, but ended up deciding that the tour company recommended by the hotel offered a better deal, and was easier to book since the front desk clerk took care of it. The tour company picked us up at the front door. Downsides: Parking is very expensive (as it is in any city), and the plush bathrobes are too heavy to walk around the room in. They weigh a ton!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni San Francisco was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBell74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 7 nights in September. Firstly we travelled to the hotel using the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) with the stop only 6 blocks away from the hotel along Montgomery Street (6 blocks is nothing when you realise the scale of San Francisco!) On arrival at the hotel we were given a wonderful welcome from Sarah at reception who efficiently dealt with our check-in and also provided us with useful information about the hotel and gave us a map of the area. Marlon then took our bags to the room and again was very helpful in providing local knowledge. We booked a Deluxe Room for the 7 nights as we had read from other reviews that these rooms were quieter and this is very true. We didn’t have a view but for the time we were in the room this did not matter. The room was very spacious and the bed was lovely and comfortable with great pillows. There was loads of wardrobe space and a lovely big bathroom. We could quite happily have stayed there indefinitely! On our last night we arrived back to find an ice bucket with wine glasses and our bed had been turned down which was a nice touch. We would definitely recommend staying at the Omni. There is a cable car line right outside the hotel which was great fun to go on at night. During the week the streets are busy with business people coming and going as the Omni is in the financial district but this made it nice and quiet at night and very quiet at the weekends. We had previously thought about staying in Fishermans Wharf but we are so glad we didn’t (it is just a tacky tourist trap). A lot of the attractions are very close to the Omni - Chinatown, the Transamerica Pyramid, Coit Tower and the Ferry Building which we went to every morning for a coffee and a pastry. If we were going to stay in San Francisco again we would definitely stay at the Omni – their service is second to none. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I stayed on the 17th floor...”
Reviews.Author: Cathaca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the 17th floor for two nights. Excellent room with a fantastic view if the city and the Bay Bridge. A real treat. Given how great the hotel is, I found that their floor staff is a bit clueless, people who work there every day barely know where they are themselves ... A bit ov the "I just work here" attitude. This us to be expected in most places but it looks particularly badly in a great place like this hotel. In all, though, we were VERY happy there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arkatz
Reviews.Content: I'm an ex-road warrior who only travels a few times a year now, but have had my life's share of bad hotel stays...happy to say this was not one of them. Stayed 6 nights and was extremely pleased. All staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was huge, shower water pressure OK, but the spout's so high got a rain shower effect more than high pressure blast. Elevators were fast and seemed readily available. Not a lot of dining right out the door as it's in the Financial district which shuts down at nights/weekends, but SF is so small you're not far away from a great restaurant somewhere. Tip: sign up on-line for their Select Guest loyalty program, then link your reservation number to your new account (or call into the hotel as I did and have them link it up). It's free and you get free internet access (vs $9.95/day when I was there), plus a host of other freeby amenities (like 2 free beverages of choice delivered every morning, rapid check-in)...well worth the 3 minutes to sign up. Minor issues: - glass-topped desk not best for optical mouse for laptop - wireless internet got a little congested at times - AC plugs were there (for chargers, etc) but not easily accessible or usable at one time

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, Omni's service is the best.”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndMui
Reviews.Content: I've walked into more beautiful buildings, slept in more comfortable beds, but I have never stayed in a hotel with better service. Over the years I've tried all of the best in San Francisco; Ritz Carlton, Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons. Now I only stay at Omni and price doesn't have anything to do with it. The doorman, I think his name is Darryl, is amazing. I don't know what the hotel is paying this guy, but it's not enough. The housekeeping staff is top notch. During my last visit the maid came in for a turndown service while I was making love with my wife. It didn't even phase her. She just said, "Excuse me Mr. Miller, I'll come back later." I was impressed she remembered my name.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Hotel-Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: erin032
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Hotel in every way.The Standard of the staff in this hotel was superb.They could not do enough for you.The location was excellent as you were about 10 mins fron Union square,stop for cable car outside hotel.excellent Irish pub (the Irish Times) nearby,15 mins to ferry building.Huge bowl of fresh fruit in lobby-nice touch.We will definitely use the Omni hotels again after our excellent time in San Francisco. Thanks to everyone in the hotel for making our stay so good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: williamsm
Reviews.Content: Loved the Omni. Easy to get to from the Bart, cable car out front, easy walking distance to Union Square, Ferry Building, Embarcadero Center, shopping on Market. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Don't usually stay at the same hotel in SF since there are so many to choose from but would definitely stay here again and/or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “World-class service without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: whenna
Reviews.Content: What I like about Omni hotels is the fact that their service is consistently good from the moment you check in to the time you leave. We signed for the loyalty program ahead of time and mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived after a long drive from Napa, a beautiful plate of chocolate-covered strawberries and a chilled bottle of champagne with a personal note from the manager to wish us a happy anniversary were waiting for us. It was a very pleasant surprise! When we checked in, the front desk people were not only pleasant but truly made us feel welcomed along with the doormen who went out of their way to make sure that we were accommodated throughout our entire trip. The room was immaculate and the gym was top-notch --- all of these amenities without having to pay an arm and a leg unlike many other hotels in the area. This was our second stay with Omni hotels and I have to say that we will forever be loyal to this hotel and will ensure that we only stay here. Thanks for an excellent effort in providing top-notch service! You are the standard that all hotels should measure itself to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLew
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Omni in New Orleans but never at this one and decided to give it a try. We were there for our anniversary, so we may have gotten a little better than average room, but the Omni was probably the nicest place I've ever stayed in San Francisco. Our room was great and had a small view of North Beach and the bay. The hotel is more or less surrounded by buildings so we got the best you could hope for there. The staff was so nice and friendly, always saying hello and wishing us a good day/evening. It's close to bus lines and right on a cable car line. After dinner one night we took the cable car back and it dropped us right in front of our hotel. All around, a great stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: scruffybags
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and loved it. The hotel has fantastic staff who are all amazingly friendly and helpful. The rooms are lovely with solid high quality furniture and a nice powerful shower. Good flat screen TV. We were very impressed by the amenities provided by joining the select guest programme - coffee and orange juice brought to our room every morning, and free wi-fi in the hotel. This was a fantastic touch. We found the location very good - it was next to the tram stop and also the open top bus tour stops immediately outside the hotel - handy for some turbo sightseeing! Would have liked to have tried their steakhouse but it is VERY expensive. Recommended to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Alcahols
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and am so glad I did. From the moment we arrived it felt right. The welcome from reception staff (particularly Jake) was wonderful and nothing was too much trouble. The doormen were always so polite and always smiling and unlike many places in San Francisco, I didn't feel they were only being nice just to get a tip out of you. We stayed here for 3 nights initially on floor 5 and had a great view of California Street and the cable cars. The cable cars never disturbed us at all as they stop at a reasonable hour in the evenings and pass by the hotel quickly. Our room was fantastic, large, clean and comfortable and the bathroom had that wow factor with lots of marble and complimentary toiletries & lots of fluffy towels. In the wardrobe (closet), there were luxurious bathrobes to use during your stay, an iron and ironing board (useful as the airport luggage handlers squash your cases so much your clothes have creases where you didn't think they could have creases), plus a safe to keep your valuables in. The beds were soooo comfortable I wanted to take one back home with me - clean crisp sheets, clean crisp duvets and covers and lots of comfy pillows. After spending a few days out of town travelling other states we returned to the same hotel for the last few nights of our stay in San Francisco. This time we were on the top floor (floor 17) where the room was exactly the same layout but being so high you only had little windows and this slightly lost the fun of being on California Street as we couldn't see the street - only the buildings opposite. Being in the financial district had its pros and cons. Cons being there weren't that many places to eat around the hotel however there is a lovely new Irish bar just opened on Sacramento Street (about 2 minutes walk away) plus another restaurant next to it (can't remember the name but recommended by hotel staff). Also, as someone else mentioned, I felt a little out of place in casual wear when most other people were in business suits but this was mostly apparant during the day rather than at night. The pros of this hotel's location is that it's only 3 short blocks from the Montgommery Street BART stop and took us only 10 minutes to walk from the BART to the hotel. Another good point about the hotel being in the financial district is that (unlike every other part we went to - particularly the tourist parts) you didn't get any 'down-and-outs' hassling you for money as the businesses and hotels in the area don't take kindly to the down-and-outs hassling their clients. It all felt very safe around the area. I don't know if it's a sign of the financial downturn at the moment, but be warned if you are out and about in general San Fran - there are a LOT of beggers / down-and-outs / homeless / drunks constantly trying to get money out of you and it gets a bit tiring after a while. If you are going to San Fran, stay here - it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, nicely furnished and very clean. They provide free wireless internet to Omni members, as well as complementary morning beverages delivered to the room. The overall service of the hotel was very good. We were at the Omni on a weekend, and obviously it's the business district, so we had some trouble finding a restaurant nearby. The concierge suggested the Wayfare Tavern, which was great. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: First stop on our 14 day tour of Napa / Sonoma. What a great hotel. The first thing that hits you is that everyone is SO friendly! These people seem genuinely happy to see you and do whatever they can to make your stay the best. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world and have to say these folks take the gold star for friendliness. Our room was everything you expect in a luxury hotel - nice high ceilings, very clean, nice sized bathroom with marble and such, soft white bath towels and all the amenities. Even a sewing kit. Even though we faced California street the hotel was ultra quiet, with a great bed and therefore excellent sleeping quarters. No hint that you had neighbors at all !! Inside Tip - join the Omni member thing and you automatically get free coffee and other drink (OJ or AJ) delivered to your room every morning - really cool !! Also, you can buy the 3 or 5 day MUNI passes right at the hotel - what could be better. I don't know. Oh yea - great location, this has it. You are probably 10-15 min walk from Union Square, and of course being on California there is a cable car that run right in front of the hotel. I would not hesitate to go back or recommend to anyone. Great hotel, great people, great stay. And I am a Fairmont President Club member!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: mindyrob
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Omni and were very pleased with our choice. Check-in was welcoming, all staff very friendly/helpful. While location is in Financial District, we found walking or taking public transportation to and from locations easy. Easy walk to Embarcadero, Chinatown and North Beach. Cable car stop out front. Bed was very comfortable with nice linens. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous67
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of August 2010 with my wife and 28yr son.We had just flew in from England after a total 20 hr journey. We took the Bart rail system from the airport which stops 3 blocks away and walked to the hotel with our cases which only took a few minutes. On arrival we were tired with the long journey and there was a hiccup with our room as we had booked our room through Hotels.com. I had booked a room with 2 double beds some months earlier . We were told straightaway on arrival at the hotel that when you make such a booking through the internet the spec.of the room cannot be guaranteed. We were shown to a room with just one king bed in and were told a fold away bed would have to be added for my son which we weren't happy about. This was going to be a 4 night stay. The desk manager quickly found a double bed room for us which needed cleaning and were given a complimentary drink in the bar while the room was being cleaned. I tipped the bell hop Marlin to take our bags to the room for us while we were having our drink but after 3 hrs the bags never arrived. I went back downstairs to find Marlin had gone home without delivering my bags and his relief had to deliver my bags without any further tip being given which I felt awkward about but I didn't see why I should have to tip again. After this our stay was problem free and we found this hotel was placed fantasticaly to tour the surrounding area. The trams on Knob Hill are just outside the hotel, Chinatown just a couple of streets away and the fishermans wharf areas are a nice 10 minute stroll away. The hotel itself tends to be occupied by well dressed business type people and at times I felt a bit out of place dressed in shorts/"t" shirt . This hotel is sitauted in the Banking district with very tall high rise office blocks nearby. Fresh fruit and a drinks urn containing water with lemons in were available every evening next to the lift. Free wi=fi is available in the reception area. The hotel is spotlessly clean and cannot be faulted. San Francisco was found to be cold most times with the cold Pacific breeze from the sea and we had to wear light fleeces most of the time which I didn't expect in August. We done the normal Alcatraz tour and city bus tour which is a must do. We walked all around the area and despite the high number of homeless tramps in the town we felt safe. Having said that a German female tourist celebrating her silver wedding was accidently shot dead a couple of blocks away as the result of being caught in crossfire from some youths who had fallen out at a nearby disco ! This made us cautious but appears to have been a one off incident. But after our 4 day stay we moved onto Las Vegas and then onto New York. The Hotel Omni turned out to be a really good hotel and if I ever return to San Fran I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Place to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: The Omni, San Francisco was the first stop on our honeymoon and after our 11 hour flight to San Francisco it was a joy to be able to check-in in less than 2 minutes. We had one of the Suites on the very top floor of the hotel and on arrival the hotel had left a bottle of champagne and strawberries as a gift for our honeymoon, nice touch! The hotel room was one of the largest we've ever been in with a sitting room (with desk, entertainment cabinet) which led to a large bedroom with a huge double bed and another entertainment cabinet. Being on the top floor we didn't hear any traffic noise and we never heard a sound from the neighbouring rooms. As we had joined their loyalty program the internet was free and we had complimentary drinks delivered to our room each morning. You can also order croissants, muffins, etc with your morning drink which was a great start to the day. We were in San Francisco for sightseeing and a lot of guide books etc tell you to choose between Fishermans Wharf or Union Square as a location for your stay. We're very glad we choose the Omni as we found both Fishermans Wharf and Union Square a bit busy and a bit too touristy. We enjoyed the peace and quiet from the location and everywhere was within easy walking distance from the hotel. The Omni was a great start to our honeymooon, thanks Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel - Good Location and Good Price”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 day weekend and had a lovely time. We got this fantastic suite that was very classy looking and had a lot of room. The front desk was always helpful and we asked the concierge some questions as well. We were in town for a baseball game and it is about a 15-20 minute walk to the stadium. It is right by Chinatown and also the Italian part of town. We walked one night to go to dinner and see Beach Blanket Babylon. We never did eat breakfast in the hotel, we went out to a couple of places I found on yelp.

Reviews.Title: “Musee d'Orsay visit”
Reviews.Author: deyoungmuseum
Reviews.Content: We took a quick weekend trip to see the Musee d'Orsay exhibit at the DeYoung in San Fran. The package deal with vip tickets, valet parking and breakfast made the stay carefree and excellent. The hotel front desk and Concierge were so friendly and helpful beyond any hotel we've ever stayed at and that says a lot since we are travellers. I highly recommend this hotel for its exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: pisces411
Reviews.Content: We chose the Omni as our honeymoon hotel after a lot of research, and the previous TripAdvisor reviews did not steer us wrong. Once the bellman, Marlon, found out it was our honeymoon, we returned to champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a rose petal strewn bed. The concierges were super helpful with any and all recommendations, and every direction was accompanied with the route(s) outlined on a pocket map. The hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of many attractions and several blocks from the BART, MUNI and cable cars. It was obvious that everyone who worked there took pride in their jobs and in their workplace.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAFF LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: UkField
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in OMNI's before we love the hotels they are of a very high standard. We hadnt stayed in this one before, it was absolutely perfect, when arriving the door man, bell man, front desk everyone was fantastic, i have never known a hotel with such lovely staff working there, whenever you returned or left the hotel they always acknowledged you and asked if everything was ok etc, when being so many thousand miles away from home its nice to feel safe and feel if you had any problems they would be there and sort everything out. The room was lovely reminded us very much of the standard of the Waldorf in new York, i can only praise them, thanks. I can advise others to join the Omni hotels group as a Select Guest, its great you get an upgraded room (if available) and each morning you receive drinks to your room (complimentary) by leaving out a little card on your door nob at bed time ticking which drinks you would like, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, coke, orange loads of drinks (FREE). There are other benefits too i would really advise you to join you just fill in the details on the Omni Website (free). We will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gcac_10
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop after 2 weeks and 8 hotels. The staff were extremely friendly, professional and helpful. The room was big, spotless and very comfortable. A touch of class. The restaurant was OK, but not top notch, but there are so many other places to eat, it didn't matter. Thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as luxurious as the Omni brand suggests”
Reviews.Author: lizzybeth42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in a block reserved for a wedding party. We chose this hotel over another in the city based on great experiences at the Omni in Los Angeles. The location is great, an easy 10 minute walk to Union Square, and one incredibly steep block to Chinatown. The cable cars run up and down the street for easy transport across the city. We had a room with two double beds, and we fit OK, but there was not a lot of extra space. Shower/tub were big and nice. Other Omni hotels I've stayed at were much more spacious, and had nicer furnishings. The beds were not particularly comfortable, but they were clean and the linens were updated (down comforter rather than nasty hotel blankets). The service was also not what I expected. Very friendly, but either they were understaffed, or they did not care about a small group of 20-somethings at their hotel. We had trouble coordinating with the valet and bellhop both upon arrival and departure. Overall, there are no problems with this hotel, but we chose it expecting a particularly relaxing experience with great customer service, and instead got services slightly above a budget hotel for a much higher price. I probably would not stay there again based on this stay, but would try other Omni properties.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: B0ilermaker
Reviews.Content: Just finished 4 days at the Omni and it was outstanding. We had a deluxe king room, which was lovely, well appointed, and very clean. What really makes this hotel outstanding is the staff. From the concierge who gave us excellent restaurant recommendations, travel tips, and directions every morning to the bellmen who chatted with us while we were waiting for our tour bus to the housekeeper who gave me an extra coffee packet when I was desperate for some extra coffee in the morning, the staff of the Omni went above and beyond to make our stay fantastic. It is very well located - in a quiter part of downtown but walking distance to the Embarcadero, AT&T Park, Fisherman's Wharf, and Chinatown. It is right on the cable car line. We had an anniversary dinner at Bob's Steakhouse. Bob's is very expensive but it was probably the best steak I have ever had! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “first class stay, service and location”
Reviews.Author: syph
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. The front desk is unbelievably helpful. Rooms are clean and generous in size. Every single person we encountered from front desk to wait staff to valet and bellmen were friendly, happy and eager to help. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is in the financial district and pretty quiet, which we liked. On the other hand it was close to everything, a short walk to chinatown and union square shopping or a short cab ride to everything else. We will return to the Omni next time in san francisco and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyRedd
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a double queen room for 3 nights. The hotel is excellent: in a good downtown location but walking distance to the Embarcadero (10 mins) and from there to Fisherman's Wharf etc. Staff were lovely and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business travelers in the business district.”
Reviews.Author: purplypooh
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you are there for work, and that your office is close to Embarcadero, California, Market street (nearer to the pier), China Town. Very close walking distances to those streets. However, it's a few blocks from the shopping area, union square etc. Hotel staff, especially the front desk, concierge, bell-boy/man are very helpful, always with a smile and willing to help. Housekeeping staff gave me the impression that they are trying to avoid me....although it's not to say they are unfriendly. It's not a large hotel, but feels cozy. The room size is average, and the bed is comfortably big. The air-con unit seems to be rather loud, with this humming sound that goes louder if turn the air flow higher. Housekeeping was rather disappointing. We left the room with some tissue papers and arm chair pillows accidentally on the floor, and when they were still on the floor when we came back. We were there for almost 9 days, and the standard of tidiness didn't seem to improve too much. For some reason, doors were constantly slamming shut whenever the housekeeping staff went from room to room to clean them. Wasn't that much of a pain since we were not in most of the time they did that, but they could just close it more gently. We made it a point to eat outside of the hotel as much as we could, but one night we tried the salad from Bob's Steak House, and they were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel i have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: amadeu1
Reviews.Content: Yes, I finally found the hotel with the nicest staff. I am a frequent traveller and this hotel is outstanding in terms of employees. They are super helpful and friendly. They and their management are doing a great job and thats one of the main reasons they are on top of the list in SF at this forum. The rooms are spacious and nice . The location is walking distance to china town but some ways away from Pier 39. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel. Free internet is another plus. Overall i can highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel Execellent Service Friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: smop8ter
Reviews.Content: Went to spend the weekend in the City to celebrate my daughter's 8th birthday. The staff at the hotel provided excellent friendly service. From the doorman to the bellhop to the front desk. You are cheerful greeted and offered some fresh fruit and water. My two girl's received little backpacks filled with toys. When we returned from tooling around the town, the staff left a chocolate birthday cake and chocolate covered strawberries in the room to my daughter's suprise. In the morning, they left complimentary drinks: coffee, hot chocolate, and orange juice. Special thanks to Steven and Marlion.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fieldfamily
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. The staff went out of their way to help. The conciege was a fountain of knowledge, on what to do in such a fabulous city. Had stayed in the Omni Shoreham in Washington, and thought that was good, but San Fransisco was even better. The staff were just so pleasant and helpful. Wished we could have stayed longer. Excellent location with some good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Francisco delivers in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Ricardamundo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Omni and have nothing but good things to say. The location of the hotel was ideal with many attractions within walking distance and the cable car running right outside the hotel. The welcome from the staff was top notch and the lobby and reception area were well appointed. Our room was at the end of the hall and we had plenty of space and the room was very quiet so we had a good night's sleep every night. The maid service was friendly and unobtrusively efficient. The concierge was very helpful each and every day and was a wealth of information on SF. He sensed what kinds of things were were looking for and gave us good advice always. The hotel restaurant was expensive but very good. Bob's bar was a great spot with excellent service. There were many little extras included too so I would plan on staying here again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the kids”
Reviews.Author: tree888
Reviews.Content: We took adjoining King and twin rooms for our family of 4 and stayed for 4 nights using the 4 for 3 summer offer with one night free. Arriving off a 15 hour heavily delayed flight we were greeted with warm genuine smiles, kids backpacks filled with goodies and, 10 minutes after getting into the room, cookies and milk for the children. A great start. The hotel is very well situated being on the California Street Cable car (much less busy than the other cable car lines) which takes you down to the F line tram (with rolling stock from all round the world) which goes along the quays to the Alcatraz ferry and then on to Fisherman's Wharf. This is a true 5 star hotel with friendly concierge and faultless service. If I were to pick one small point - it would have been great if the breakfast had been a buffet rather than a la carte. Whilst the food was very good the menu is quite limited and one of the waiters was curt, bordering on rude. $80 a day for breakfast gets a little steep after a few days! There are plenty of other places around to get breakfast so not a big issue. The beds are really comfortable, the rooms large, the towels soft and the staff attentive. Would I stay here gain....absolutely. Was it good value for what you get.....yes. Final tip.....eat at Uncle Vito's Pizza, 700 Bush Street, excellent authentic Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: EasternCanada
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Omni San Francisco Hotel on July 30 and the staff was nice and extremely welcoming. Check-in was quick and friendly and I was given a nice room with a view on California Street and cable cars. The room its self was elegant and clean with upscale decor and larger than some at other comparable hotels. The bathroom was marble and there was ample closet space. The room featured a flat screen TV which I guess is the standard now. Little details made the difference. For instance, in the lobby fresh peaches and prunes were available at the end of the day with iced water in the lobby... Perfect after walking around the city during the day. The location of the hotel is perfect where Nob Hill and the financial district meet. Walk to the Ferry Tower at night to see the Bay Bridge, etc. was easy. The Hotel is close to the main SF attractions, shopping, The Embarcadero, ATT Park, etc. The staff really goes out of its way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Check-out in August was also quick and friendly and you sort of felt like you were leaving home!! All and all, it was the perfect hotel for a great San Francisco vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...staff was super friendly”
Reviews.Author: Condiment_King
Reviews.Content: My family recently traveled to San Francisco for a business trip>long weekend of sightseeing, and we couldn't have been happier with the experience we had the Omni. Location was great for walking to the Ferry Building and to North Beach. The Omni had everything we needed in terms of accomodations and services. A special thank you to a young woman at the front desk named Sarah Crown (?), who recommended a wonderful restaurant, Tadich Grille for our first a dinner. One call out is the front desk and doorman staff. They were so friendly, and took time to know our family's name, especially my sons. We were made to feel like VIP's. The staff also provided a kids kit with game and activity books to keep him entertained. Perks like this make us continually stay at Omni properties. The only downside is the cost of parking. Having a rental car was a necessity for work, but it did cost a pretty penny for a several days. The upside was that similar hotels charge for internet access, and Omni does not as long as you are member of their loyalty program. So that was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: jenniep51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the omni for a week in August as part of our summer vacation. We booked as a result of reading all the great reviews on this site. We were not in the least disappointed The service is amazing: the staff couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful Our room was large and well-furnished as well as spotlessly clean. All in all we felt that we wee given 5 star treatment at a very reasonable rate

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service and Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: Bob41154
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch Hotel with service to match. Great location within reasonable walking distance to china town and short cab / trolley ride to fisherman's wharf. Would definitely stay here again on next trip to SF!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan58
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not have been better. The hotel itself is very nice, especially for being in the business district. Rooms were very comfortable and nicely updated bathrooms. Joining the OMNI club gets you free internet and juice/coffee every morning. We made this reservation about 6 months before, the person taking the reservation asked the reason for coming (business/pleasure). I told them it was stopping back in San Francisco for anniversary after being there years ago. The first night they had a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries in our room with a card. Parking is expensive both in the hotel and nearby but it is in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except parking and view”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTimes
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during mid-week at the U-Suite at this hotel. The staff was wonderful, the room was clean (flowers in the bathroom, nice!), comfortable bed, robes, two TVs which we did not even turn on. In the morning, we asked for coffee to be brought to our room (coffee, newspaper and wifi are included with the room if you join the Omni hotel club - free signup). The hotel sits among office skyscrapers so there really isn't a view of anything except of the the surrounding buildings. Had a very good night's sleep and the drapes are heavy enough to block out early morning light so I could sleep in. The next morning, we enjoyed fresh fruit in the lobby - plums, peaches, apples. We had two cars and parking at the hotel for both would come to $120.00! The overnight parking fee in the nearby garages during the week were not much cheaper so be prepared if you need to bring a car with you. Aside from that, this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed and Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: unlimitedfaith
Reviews.Content: Let me say, we stayed at the Omni on our second night of our trip.We were here unfortunately for my sister"s funeral.Although my sister's funeral was in Richmond, the short drive was well worth the experience. Upon arriving at the front of the hotel the valet and doorman eagerly(with such warm smiles)welcomed us to Omni/San Francisco.We were escorted to the front desk,where we received great service again. The rooms were warm and inviting,not to mention very clean.There was a hand written note from the service staff,extending a warm welcome and a pleasant stay.Wait, did I mention the turn down service and warm cookies?Or the bellman,who by the way give directions to local stores/restaurants and made sure we had all the extras we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like stars, but we were not dressed like stars!!”
Reviews.Author: gvrdman
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in our dirty mini-van, we knew we found a special hotel. The Doorman acknowledged us immediately. And even though the valet attendant was busy he took care us very fast. We were very tired after having drove over 7 hours down the twisty-turny Northern California rugged coastline, and our clothes showed it. Check-in was a breeze, kids were even given ''loot bags''. Would highly recommend this hotel to young familys' as the sound proofing is fantastic; you can't hear anyone around you which helps you get a great nights sleep. Somewhat pricey, but well worth it considering you step out the front door and onto a cablecar. My only concern is the price of parking, its really too bad that parking is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ammenities!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler31323
Reviews.Content: I have traveled on business to S.F. at least quarterly for several years. After trying a few of the top hotels, I discovered The Omni and have stayed there every time for about four years now. What I love the most are the ammenities that are offered at little or no additional cost. Each evening I complete a door-hanger menu, check the time I want service the next morning, and I wake up to fresh coffee, orange juice and an english muffin, along with USA Today. The Hotel keeps my profile and always provides a room on the interior where there is no traffic noise, so I sleep really well. The check-in takes no more than one minute, and the same is true of my check-out. The service is exceptional and friendly. The beds are very comfortable. I also use their fitness center while I'm there. It is a good one The only slight "ding" I would give the hotel is not having HD televisions. But overall I would give The Omni very high marks!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was exceptionally helpful”
Reviews.Author: SWarner_10
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni was incredible. Everyone you ran into bent over backwards to make you feel welcome and they were very helpful in places to go/directions. When we arrived we had a rollout bed in our room which took up a lot of space, we called to have it removed and within 2 minutes they were knocking on the door to remove it. The rooms were great and the food at Bob's Chop house was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely different”
Reviews.Author: james_patching
Reviews.Content: Makes a difference to be different from your standard hotel chain. Very friendly staff and good location but the best thing was the two free drinks in the morning for anyone signing up to their frequent stayer scheme. Good location as well although it could get slightly noisy on the main road especially with the tram going past and taxis being whistled down all night.

Reviews.Title: “I can not say enough about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Torcdor
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel! The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. However, what will always leave a lastingimpression with me is how well they handled a problem. My gps went missing from the car that I had parked using the valet service (my stupidity for leaving it in the car). Rather than being made to feel like I was trying to falsly report something they not only handled it professionally and courteously but they are sending me a replacement. They just got not only a customer for life but I would recommend a the omni to anyone who wants exceptional service and a great room.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni San Francisco is the perfect hotel for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: MikeNutter
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco on business 3-4 times per year and the Omni San Francisco is my hotel of choice. The service is impeccable each and every time and the location is perfect if you conduct business in the financial district. I highly recommend this hotel to the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: runner725
Reviews.Content: I did not have reservations and walked right in. I was greeted by a very nice gentleman who was able to assist me in making a reservation for that night. This was also my birthday weekend and I was upgraded to suite. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is very clean, organized, friendly staff and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bronto1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unsurpassed in our experience in staff professionalism and service, in the beautiful decor of the hotel foyer, the absolute quietness of the rooms and the quality and reasonable (for SF) prices at the Omni restaurant, Bob's. The bathrooms were the cleanest and most finely finished we have seen anywhere. A wonderful lobster dish was only $79 at Bob's was a good value, a similar dish at the Phoenician in Phoenix was over twice the price. You might not be able to afford eating at Bob's every night, we ate there once and felt it was worth the cost (steaks around $40-50). Sign up online (and make sure the desk knows you did at check-in) for the no-charge 'Select Guest' program to get free wireless internet that works smoothly, 2 free drinks per person (max-2 people)in the morning delivered to your door, and snack and drink in the afternoon. We used the valet service and felt it was worth the $50 as the valets are fast and our car was not 'dinged' like a rental car was in a lot in downtown Chicago a few years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: gtravels2010
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience we've had when it comes to service. Every single person on staff was friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. They never steered us wrong with their recommendations on restaurant and entertainment options. The only negative was the 2:30 AM garbage truck wake-up call, which is obviously not the fault of the hotel. We had a blast in SF, and our teenagers especially appreciated the evening service of milk & cookies!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: 3DJs_dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late July with our 2 young children. Booked two rooms and requested close proximity. Checked that request again the day prior to arrival and were pleasantly surprised to find that our rooms were adjacent. Worked well for our family of four. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Rates competitive. Staff was very friendly throughout. We tried Bob's Steakhouse (the hotel's restaurant) for breakfast once. Wouldn't recommend it with so many excellent breakfast alternatives all around. By contrast, we once ordered in room dining after a long day exploring and found that service to be very good. Location of the hotel is great. Many of the major sites are within walking distance. If you want to explore SF and appreciate your city dweller comforts, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: csfeir
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Omni for 2 days and it was a great experience, I had a beautiful big room (for a goog price) and the hotel is located in a location from which you can walk or take the cable cars to the turistic spots.. Completely recomendable for a SF visit...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Juliagolia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was walking distance to Ferry Landing, Chinatown, Little Italy and more. Cable cars ran right up and down in case we were tired. Hotel staff from Door Men to Receptionist to Housekeeping Service was way above all expectations. Very friendly, very helpful, very personal and welcoming. By far the best hotel I have stayed at. I never ate food at hotel due to us being out quite a bit, but smelled yummy. Our room was right on California Street and never heard any traffic which was a plus. Beds were unbelievably comfy and I as a female loved the deep bathtub. All well cleaned. Wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, phenomenal staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dailycuppa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to San Francisco so I could run the S.F. Marathon. We are both in our early 40's and are quite active and love to travel. We decided to try out a hotel that was within walking distance to the Ferry Building, which would help getting to the race and also provide lots of sightseeing options. The Omni was the perfect choice and had a great deal going for 2 weekend nights at around $150 a night (which we got from Expedia.) I later read on Omni's website that they will match and beat any published price as long as you first book your stay on their own website. That's pretty cool. Getting back to the important stuff...the hotel is beautiful. It's not huge compared to other high end places around Union Square or the Embarcadero area, but 'just right' in our book. The lobby, elevators and general interior is impeccably clean. The room we stayed in wasn't huge, but it worked just perfectly for the 2 of us. The bed was comfortable and pillows were ample and of the highest quality. Needless to say, we both got great nights sleep during our stay. Probably the most impressive aspect of the hotel is the staff. They are truly wonderful people, very friendly without being overbearing (I can't stand dealing with hotel staff that act snobbish and just go through the motions solely to get that tip). The staff at the Omni are genuinely friendly, and seem to relish in sharing any information they find on new and fun things to do in the city. It was almost as if we were around good friends than your typical hotel staff. Another important thing is to go on the Omni website and sign up for their free 'Select Guest' program, which will automatically allow you to customize your room preferences, free WiFi (great!), complimentary morning beverages (2 per person), complimentary pressing (2 items) and shoe shine, express check in/check out, and an evening turn-down service as well. All that for the grand total of $0.00. Don't forget to sign up! We did not use room service, nor did we eat at the Steak house that is inside the hotel. We were on a bit of a budget, so we chose not to splurge that way. While I didn't run my best marathon this year, I'll certainly be back in 2011, and there is only one place we intend to stay...The Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service experience - anywhere”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler01
Reviews.Content: The hotel has elegance, comfort and old world charm in a convenient financial district location, but what sets it apart is the staff. They are unparalleled in terms of friendliness, caring and quality service. The trolley runs in front of the hotel, so recommend requesting a room on the quiet side.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable staff and luxurious stay! Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: FLYJETS101
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference last week at the SFO Omni. We were treated like kings and queens the whole stay. This was my first trip to SFO and what a fabulous first trip it was! The SFO Omni staff, food, conference rooms, location and best of all hospitality were enough to keep me coming back. It was so awesome I can't stop talking about it to my coworkers. SFO is a little on the pricey side but you get exactly what you pay for when you stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's everything they say it is!”
Reviews.Author: icemanjr
Reviews.Content: The reviews are dead on. This hotel is in a premier location in San Francisco with 5 star service and clean quiet rooms. And the price can't be beat. Heck I've stayed in rooms in Oklahoma City that cost as much as our room's price. 2 blocks to Chinatown. 3 blocks to Union Square. If you're up for a 20 minute walk, you can walk to the Wharf. Try La Mar for some incredible Peruvian seafood in the Wharf on Pier 1.5.

Reviews.Title: “High-quality service, convenient location, clean rooms. Old-world elegance in a modern setting.”
Reviews.Author: dlehman
Reviews.Content: My family was immediately impressed by the professionalism and warmth of Joey Nubla, concierge extraordinaire! He took us under his wing (we had just endured an awful evening at a hotel from hell on lower Mason St.) and directed us to the best bus tours and restaurants. I highly recommend the Omni for its old-world elegance, impeccable staff (Juan was also wonderful and efficient) and prime location for walking to Chinatown, Union Square and North Beach. Internet access was free. The other hotels we stayed at in Napa and LA charged $10.00 a day. The Hyatt Regency in LA was a lovely place, but lacked the personal touch and classic furnishings of the Omni. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “ask at the desk!”
Reviews.Author: kateynorth
Reviews.Content: We plagued them with questions and they answered every one with charm, politeness and good advice Great location, easy walk to chinatown and the ferrybuilding and saturday market, lovely rooms, but restaurant and bar both expensive and wouldnt recommend for breakfast, + $5.99 charge for a bottle of water in the room!

Reviews.Title: “A definite highlight of our trip...”
Reviews.Author: WeeScot
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Omni Hotel for three nights in July. After reading about this hotel on Trip Advisor I signed up in advance for their Select Guest programme which allows guests to enjoy complimentary services such as in room wifi, newspapers, cookies and milk at night for kids and morning drinks delivered to your room or door at a time of your choosing. Upon arrival were we greeted warmly by Mika who kindly changed our room to the quieter side of the hotel on Montgomery Street away from the trams which run late into the evening. Parking is expensive at $48 per day (we decided to return our hire car early as San Francisco is walk able as a city) and chose to eat outside of the hotel for our meals given the large number of restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel (China town is only a couple of blocks away). The hotel is also a few blocks away from the BART on Market Street which has a regular train service running to San Francisco Airport. Having stayed in seven different hotels during our two week vacation covering Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Yosemite and San Francisco the Omni was the definite highlight of our trip. A great stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply exceeding expectations...!”
Reviews.Author: Ölli
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend on a roadtrip for two night July 8th to July 10th in the Omni. And I simply have to repeat what most of the revievers said: It was a great stay! I did choose the Omni based on the reviews here so my expectations where quite high from the beginning given all these good reviews. But it has completely paid out. We had a good rate for a spacious & very clean room on 13th floor. Hotel had received and remembered all the preferences I have given through HRS as travel agent: High Floor, Two Queens, Non-Smoking. Incredible staff. Funny & Helpful all the way from door keeper over valet, bell desk, front desk, guest service and room staff. Valet Parking was quite expensive (48$ a night), but they lowered it for the second night (to whatever reason). That was the only thing to mention. Really good tip I originally did read in this forum but which was advertised in the rooms themselve: Become a member of the Omni Guest Programme. It gives you instantly on signing lots of benefits from the very first day. Great hotel, magnificent stay! Will definitely come back whenever hitting S.F. again...

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Had Hoped and MORE.....”
Reviews.Author: jeremywregan
Reviews.Content: As I arrived back into LAX I realized the one thing I had left in my experience was how incredibly nice and courteous the people of San Francisco were to us. The highlight and most memorable of this experience of the people of San Francisco was the entire staff of the Omni San Francisco located at 500 California Street. The entire hotel experience was one that I will always place in the top of the heap. Every detail of the hotel carefully and thoughtfully thought out to ensure the guest having an experience that leaves them never wanting or needing anything for more than a few minutes. You walk into the lobby and at that moment you realize you made an excellent choice. From check in to checking out you could not ask for a more comfortable stay. I had the best nights sleep that I have had in a long time. The Omni reminds you why a quality high thread count with your linens are important. I cannot say enough. So just let me finish with telling you that even with a life of traveling and staying at the Omni will always be remembered as that great hotel we stayed while in San Francisco during a very special vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canigiani
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the place to be. It is a good value and a great location. The lobby and rooms are all very nice. The staff is great and helpful. I thing the other reviews kind of say it all. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what service excellance is all about.”
Reviews.Author: fdpamedic
Reviews.Content: Chose Omni because I have stayed at two other locations and this was exactly in the center of the city, close to all sights. Exemplary staff;housekeeping, bell staff, doorman and check-in counter all knowledgeable and helpful at all times. Concierge-Lex - was so pleasant, easy to follow and understood exactly what we wanted (every time we visited him) Great routes to sights, excellent restaurant choices and very informative regarding the city and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: roxdon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 40th anniversary at the Omni. We had champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us.Staff were extreemly helpful. The Cal cable car line runs directly in front of the hotel so convenient. Plenty of toiletries and towels delivered every day. Turn down service each evening. Located in the heart of the financial district plenty to do and see right around the corner..Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: BobandHannah
Reviews.Content: Flew to San Francisco for 2 nights prior to a hiking/horse riding holiday in the south west (having previously holidayed in SF).
