We had not stayed in an Omni hotel before and had chosen it chiefly because it appeared to be very reasonable for what we wanted. Upon our arrival we were struck by how friendly and personable the staff were, both on the door and the reception. We were also very impressed by the room. Later, when making enquiries with the concierge about local restaurants, we were pleasantly surprised to be offered a glass of champagne in the lobby. The concierge was extremely helpful and gave us several recommendations within walking distance. We followed his recommendatons on both nights and were very happy with both meals. (The 2nd night we ate at the TADICH GRILL, which is apparently the oldest restaurant in SF and a 2 minute stroll from the hotel. Specialises in sea food and was fantastic). The hotel is walkng distance from the Wharf, China Town, Little Italy and Union Square. Facilities include a very good gym, but should be noted does not have a swimming pool if that is something people require. Had cocktails in the bar, far from cheap, but very good quality and service excellent. Had breakast one morning, nice enough, but fairly expensive. To sum up how we felt about the Omni, having flown to SFas a jump off point for our holiday, our stay at the Omni had us wondering if we should have stayed longer in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA_tao
Reviews.Content: The Omni offered exceptional service and accommodations. Although the location is not as central as those in close proximity to Union Square, the quality of the Omni is definitely superior to some of those hotels. And having signed up for the rewards program, I had a great rate for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bikeit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni SF on an anniversary trip to northern CA. The staff and the accommodations were top-notch. Like others have reported, the staff greets you by name every time you enter the hotel. Also as others have reported, they treated us to chocolates, champagne, and other goodies to celebrate our anniversary. My husband joined the guest program so bottled water and internet service were no problem. Our room looked out onto the front entrance, which was fine. We weren't looking for a view, but chose the hotel based on its ratings and location. One of the best things about its location is that it's only a couple of blocks from the Ferry Building, which is food porn central! Luscious fruits, pastries, coffee, cheese, anything you want to eat, it's there. And it's the best of the best. The concierge had terrific suggestions for other meals. I used to be a fan of the Ritz-Carleton chain--love the hot chocolate! But the service there is obsequious to the point of being ridiculous. At the Omni the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive and the accommodations are comfortable, spic-and-span, and in excellent condition. What more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hospitality; Excellent Concierge Service: the rooms were very comfortable and nice; location was great!”
Reviews.Author: bpp55
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, July 1st and 2nd. Our stay could not have been better. The location was great. We were able to use all modes of transportation to go all over the city without spending money on taxis. The concierge was the best....I called ahead of our stay and he made reservations for us along with recommendations of the tours to take of the city. When we arrived the reservations were made for both dining and tours. Our room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. Everyone at the Omni could not have been nicer or more helpful! I look forward to another stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Omni SF”
Reviews.Author: angelo885
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff are a class act. Friendly staff, clean, well appointed rooms. Comfortable bed. We had previously joined the Select Guest program so had free WiFi and morning coffee, juice and paper. The coffee was excellent, piping hot and strong, just what was needed to get the day of sightseeing going! Several juice selections also. Not mentioned previously by TA members was the room service for breakfast. I had originally looked at the Bob's Steakhouse menu online and thought no way, too costly. There are less expensive alternatives through room service. Bagel and cream cheese was $5 and bacon, egg and cheese sandwich was $8. A few other things too. Obviously you could run out to get those for less but it was nice to have the breakfast delivered with the free beverages and just relax and eat in your pj's. Right on time at the time requested too! The gym was a good size also. Towels, water and earphones available. The lobby has a bowl of fresh fruit and citrus water out in the afternoons which was a nice pick me up after all of our sight seeing. Did a lot of walking! As previously mentioned in other reviews, hotel is in a good location if you are a fit walker. We went to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and even walked to and from Fisherman's Wharf at least one time each way. We booked their Linger Longer package which was great, pay for two nights get the third for free. I would say the only issue would be that I booked, and was going to pay with a debit card. When you do that, the hotel holds $200 on your account for incidentals and credits it back in a couple of days. That was never mentioned during the booking session. All in all a great stay and I would definitely stay again. One other tip, eat at the Tadich Grill about two blocks away, excellent chioppino!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: UNLVforme
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer service from this hotel - from the minute you walk in the door. Front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms/hallways are a bit outdated and need to be renovated. The bathrooms were large which was nice. I was hoping for some restaurants within a close distance of the hotel so that I could venture out for one meal but nothing really in close proximity ... just a Subway from what I could find. I would certainly suggest this hotel as the staff was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Overall 4 Star rating strictly for Customer Service alone”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: The customer service in this hotel is amazing. From the time you enter the hotel you will experience the best customer service you cold hope for at a hotel. Now for the hotel itself- The lobby is beautiful. The citrus water is a great touch after a long day. However we picked up the keys to our room on the 10th floor and was so disappointed. The room was small as I expected (no different from NYC), but what i wasn't prepared for was the NASTY carpet. This carpet was dirty outside the room in the hall and so nasty on the inside I would not have walked on it without my shoes. The ottoman on the chair was frayed and had dirty spots on it. I went back to the front desk. Received an apology and was given a different room. We went to our room on the 12th floor and it was better but not much. The furniture is cherry wood with nicks on it. The lamps do not have built in electrical plugs so if I want to use my computer while in bed, I have to unplug the clock. The desk has outlets for internet and electricity, but again the lamp on the desk does not have an electrical outlet. The chair and ottoman are in better shape than the room on the 10th floor, but one can tell it could use a good steam cleaning as well. The beds are comfortable. The sheets are clean and white. But the duvet cover does not have the same crisp white look or smell. Nice flat screen TVs and large bathrooms with a pocket door. San Francisico is definitely cooler than the South, but the room goes from stuffy to cool. I cut the temperature to 71 but it still is rather warm. Another thing, I used the iron board and had to run because we were late, but when we returned to the room the iron board was right were we had left it even though the room had been made up. I have never had that happen not even in a Days Inn. One more thing. I signed up for their loyalty program and received free internet. However, I am going to have to remind them at checkout that I shouldn't have to pay for the internet. But get this, I was having trouble getting on the internet and called the internet help line. I got a voicemail and was told to leave my name and number and she would call back. Not good service for the internet. Again, the customer service at this hotel is outstanding from the front desk and other employees. The location is in the financial district so it is away from the touristy Union Square. Also, there is a great restaurant down the street called Tadick Grill. It's the oldest restaurant in San Francisco and the food (especially the seafood) is the best!! Honestly, I received a great rate on this hotel and love the customer service, but I don't think I will stay here again until they make some changes in cleanliness. BTW, the front desk told me they would have the carpeting cleaned by end of July. That doesn't help me much right now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service...you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc614
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and we're very happy with our choice. The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance to Union Square and North Beach. Probably the friendliest hotel staff and best service I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: EMtravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel! The service was amazing, the rooms clean and well appointed and the price was reasonable for the area. The staff - well lets just say we got a note every day from the woman cleaning our room to say hi and thanks. We got to meet her as we left and she was so sweet- shook our hands and wished us well. Joey at the front desk was wonderful- gave us such amazing service. The location was perfect- except as others have noted there is not much open in the area for breakfast on the weekends. During the week, however, you have the advantage of great places for lunch geared to the workers in the financial district. Chez Carla was a great spot on Pine street. Bob's restaurant is quite pricey- the menu in the room service book are the same prices downstairs. But we did try it one night and found the food good and the staff friendly. They give you free access to print your boarding passes (great idea). We would not want to stay anywhere else in San Francisco- good job to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Rosannejerdon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week...it was a wonderful and cozy place to stay. I can not say enough about the staff..they are really nice and make you feel like a family member. Especially, Sarah Crown the Asst, Front Office Manager-she goes above and beyond to make you feel like you are their number one guest! They offer fresh fruit in the lobby and citrus water..which is great after a long day of touring! They also have milk and cookies sent up in the evening for the kids! If you join the Select Guest program, they offer free internet and 2 laundry items to be pressed and you get a free drink (coffee, ice tea) sent to the room in the morning~you choose the time you want it brought up to you...it is really a good thing! My husband needed maint. to help him with his camera tripod (Both Mike & Frank) were a great help to him and very nice. We all loved it there and can't wait to to back...the Omni truly made our vacation a restful and relaxing time! Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Omni outdistances all the rest!”
Reviews.Author: travelerNevada
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how wonderful the Omni SF is!! We started out trying to use our points to stay at one of our 'preferred' chains in SF but were disappointed with the reviews in TA. I decided to check out other hotels even if I had to pay for a room. Boy, am I glad I did!! I looked at the Omni's reviews and then their website. We were celebrating a 20th anniversary and I wanted to see the new Impressionists Exhibit at the DeYoung (DON'T miss it). The Omni had a fabulous package available with room, parking, breakfast & VIP DeYoung tickets at a bargain price, $287...I snapped it up. Then I called as I forgot to put a note in the reservation regarding room preferences. I spoke with Tofique at the front desk and asked about my preference, after some chatting he asked was their any 'special' reason we were coming that weekend. I said 'Yes, it's our 20th anniversary'. He then asked if he could upgrade us as a surprise for my spouse, of course I said Yes, Please!. When we arrived we found ourselves in the Pony Express Suite on the 14th floor, it doesn't give sweeping views of the city but it was lovely and very, very plush AND to make everything even better we had champagne & choc covered strawberries awaiting us!! We had dinner out in the city but had breakfast downstairs in Bob's. Although there was only 1 waiter and he was a bit overwhelmed (staff had called in sick), he made me the best hot choc and rec a wonderful breakfast which was more suitable for two! The food was mouthwatering and we went to the DeYoung thoroughly rested and satisfied! The Omni has moved to the top of my list as my favorite pick in SF to stay. From the time you arrive and are greeted by the doorman until he bids you a good-bye you will feel quite regal! Oh, and don't forget to request the turndown service & have your hot beverage delivered to your room in the morning (all complementary), it will finish your evening and start your day off RIGHT! I did forget a pair of earrings in the room and housekeeping had them safely tucked away and returned to me! Thank you Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...no water, air conditioning, bad service”
Reviews.Author: aaafoods
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on Expedia for the Omni. It still was not worth the money. If you are traveling with teenagers, I would highly recommend staying down by the Wharf. The water went out the morning we were leaving and two of us missed showering and they did not care. Parking was 50.00 a night. The beds were small a uncomfortable and the air conditioning only worked part of the time. The room was always stuffy. The front desk people were only helpful part of the time. I called down three times for help and only one person there was efficient and called back. The TV went out and we had to wait to get it fixed. The hotel is old and the rooms are small. We couldn't see out our window because they were small and up high. I was just very disappointed. Not what you would expect from an Omni. The housekeeper we had was very good and friendly. That is about the only positive thing I can think of. Oh, the doorman gave excellent recommendations for brunch. The front desk just told me that people didn't do brunch anymore-didn't want to be bothered I guess. I would not stay here unless you don't mind small and hot rooms with bad service.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AT A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: jgross1
Reviews.Content: Six of us from Seattle, including two teen-age boys and one very picky adult traveler, just spent three nights and four days at the Omni, and our experience was perfect in every way. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, well-maintained and, most importantly, immaculate; the staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and enormously helpful; and we were thrilled with the price (we booked our rooms through Alaska Airlines and received our third night free), having stayed in hotels that cost twice as much and provide far less in the way of comfort, cleanliness, and service. The Omni is centrally located and offers easy access, either on foot or public transportation, to many cultural attractions, interesting neighborhoods, and great cafes and restaurants. Not only would I recommend the Omni to friends and family, but from now on, I will never stay anyplace else in San Francisco. By the way, another highlight of our trip was the San Francisco Movie Tour--a must if you are travelling with teenage movie buffs.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for, location, trams and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlighter92
Reviews.Content: Daryl made the first good impression at the front entrance and it remained good from there on for three lovely days. Breakfasts were very good, both restaurant choices are great and it is just a brisk walk to the ferry terminal for some more great places. The passing cable cars add to the atmosphere of a bye-gone era and the Wells Fargo Museum across the road is fun to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Another stellar review...”
Reviews.Author: foodists
Reviews.Content: for the Omni-San Francisco. What sells this hotel is the unparalleled service provided by the entire staff. Special recognition to Juan and Jake at the front desk and Sam, the bellhop. When shown our assigned room, the bellhop intuited that we were not happy with the size. He voluntarily (without our prompting) called the front desk to inquire if a larger room was available. As for room size, amenities, and overall hotel luxury, the Omni is a solid 4-star hotel; however, the service more than compensates for that missing 5th star. The service was personable (the valets repeatedly addressed us by name), generous, unpretentious and sincere throughout our stay. The drawbacks of the Omni should be mentioned: (1) there's little to no view from any of the rooms; the hotel is unfortunately surrounded by tall(er) buildings -- so if you're looking for a grand view of the Golden Gate or Bay bridge, this is probably not the hotel for you; (2) we had to pay for bottled water in the room whereas many top hotels provide 2 bottles of free water/day (pet peeve: if a hotel is not going to provide drinkable/filtered tap water, then it shouldn't charge for bottled water); (3) internet access was not free -- we ended up joining the Omni frequent guest program (no charge) just so we could get the free internet. Otherwise, I cannot emphasize how wonderful the Omni staff was. They truly made our vacation more enjoyable. (PS: got a great rate via hotel website that included valet parking and tickets to the de Young museum -- definitely a bargain!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on the OMNI San Francisco several times on business, and each stay has been wonderful. After staying in excellent hotels just about everywhere, I can truly say that the Omni staff is one of the very best. Courteous and attentive without being fawning, and truly helpful. Lovely lobby and rooms are well appointed and immaculate. Even if you're going to stay here one night, it's a good idea to sign up for the Omni Rewards program, as it gives you complimentary Internet service and other perks, including coffee service, newspaper of your choice, etc. Also: on one of my trips, I brought along my two children. Was a little apprehensive about that, but they were treated beautifully. Complimentary milk and cookies, packets of kid stuff (also comp) and staff was very gracious with them. They also helped me find a reliable professional babysitter, who was also excellent. In sum, this is one of my favorite hotels and I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PNWAdventurers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels around the world (most of them higher end) and the Omni San Francisco was the very best hotel experience. Not only were the front desk staff attentive and helpful (and always smiling - genuinely happy) but the maids were amazing (one of them saw us with our hands full and came jogging over to help us push the elevator button - totally OTT). Equally impressive were the doormen. Their greetings each morning and evening (as we left and returned) were delightful. The price is right, the hotel is clean and luxuorious, and it was QUIET and peaceful (no listening to other people's televisions, no running water from early morning travellers taking their showers, no door's slamming) Truly a wonderful experience and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: blackcornish1964
Reviews.Content: I recently had a week here with my son and daughter. Our room was brilliant although we had booked a two bed room and had been given a double bed. Reception changed this very quickly. It is a lovely hotel although very expensive. It says there are tea making facilities in the room but there are not, only a coffee maker and our chambermaid was a bit stingy giving tea/coffee and sugar in the room. I thought the area was a bit out of the way and would have preferred to stay in Union Square but the hotel is lovely and staff are second to none. We had breakfast elswhere because it was expensive in the hotel, so cannot comment on the food, but we did have room service one night and it was very good. Barney the doorman is just charming and everyone we met was fantastic. I loved San Francisco and the people even if it did rain the whole time. Make sure you sign up to their card scheme before you go, this will give you free internet while you are there and a complimentary tea/coffee or hot chocolate every morning

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service at the Omni San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTrish
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend to SFO for our Aniversary and stayed at the Omni. WOW - from the minute we checked in to the final checkout we experienced nothing but 5 star service. Daryl the Bell Captain took an interest in creating a great night for us and gave us suggestions for a dance venue. Found out it was our Aniversary and advocated for us with the front desk for a better room. Check-in included a champange welcome and a very friendly front desk pro - WOW again. The room was very spacious and the bed was comfy. Furniture was a little outdated but did not impair the stay at all. Bathroom was glistening and fancy. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a perfect location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: David56W
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for its location alone, however the rooms and service were superb too. The cable car stops outside, the BART rail service from the airport is 5 minutes walk, and there are excellent public transport links to all parts of the city including Fisherman's Wharf. There are many excellent bars and restaurants nearby, Union Square and Chinatown are just a short walk. It is worth signing up to the Select Guest scheme, this is free and you get coffee and fruit juice delivered to your room in the morning, free wifi and other benefits. All the staff were great, especially those on the door who are friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable about the area. Will certainly stay again if I return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely classy”
Reviews.Author: decampanilla
Reviews.Content: I was checked in less than 5 minutes after I handed over my car keys to the valet attendant. The gentleman at the front desk had an English accent and welcomed me to the hotel with a firm and sincere handshake. I felt like I was a VIP. I did not have to wait long for my luggage to be brought up to the room. The valet and bellhop did not seem to be waiting for a tip but I gave them 2 bucks each anyway for the very courteous service. The apples and citrus water in the lobby were charming refreshments after touring the nearby attractions like Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Turned me into an Omni Hotel Fan!”
Reviews.Author: MightyCipher
Reviews.Content: Had such a great time there, I wrote an email to the Front Office Manager at the hotel. I don't like the location as much as some other hotels, but it's still close by. Email below: I believe I've stayed at an Omni hotel (not the SF one) in the past, but definitely not since I became a regular business traveler, as I have been for the past 3.5 years. I usually travel 2 to 8 times per month, and I've stayed at a variety of 4 stars around the country (primarily SF, NYC, Boston, Dallas, Chicago, LA and Seattle). As one of two partners in my firm, I will admit cost is a large driving factor in choosing hotels (since T&E comes straight out of my pocket), so I'm a member of nearly all Hotel reward programs out there. For some reason, however, it's taken until this week before I joined Omni's Select Guest program. I can say with absolute certainty that it is the best hotel rewards program out there for any "chain" hotel. While I've seen one or two of the benefits you offer (free wireless and free water bottles) at other hotels, but the total combination of items that I care about as a business traveler (free clothes pressing, free shoe shine, free beverages in the morning, free water bottle in the evening, and pre-check-in/guaranteed room) make the Select Guest program almost too good to be true. On top of that, the fact that it's only 5 stays or 10 nights to get a free room AND only 6 (I think) nights before I move up to the next tier in your program DOES make it too good to be true. I've already sung praises of your program to 3 people, and I just checked out of the hotel this morning. In addition, another pleasant surprise was a gentlemen at the front desk named Stephen (a caucasian, bald man around 6ft tall), who was not just friendly, but one of the most informative front desk people I have come across. He also clearly remembered me the next morning and was just as helpful. I've never written an email to a hotel manager to praise their hotel, but the combination of the two topics above drove me to do so. It looks like I'll be in San Francisco 1 to 2 nights per week for the next 3 months, and as long as I can make it fit in our budget, I look forward to staying at your hotel. In fact, I booked a night at the Omni in Dallas (even though it was 15 minutes further away than other options) this upcoming Sunday night based solely on my experience at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every possible way”
Reviews.Author: classy123
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. Clean rooms, impeccable service, and every inch of the hotel is gorgeous. I honestly don't think it can get any better! I hope I get the chance to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: golem191
Reviews.Content: Room was big, clean, well maintained, modern, new. Great location, easy access to Union Square, 10 min walk -up the hil on the way there, 5 min walk to Chinatown, close to the cable car. Housekeeping was superb. Reception staff was helpful and polite. The restaurtant met all our expectations. We'll go there again. Be sure you sign for omni memebership, it's free and you get free wifi internet, coffee in the morining and softdrinks.

Reviews.Title: “Hits the Spot”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: Having just got off the California Zephyr (Amtrak from Chicago) we needed an all boxes ticked hotel and returning for the 2nd time to the Omni in San Fran did not disappoint. Yes, it is corporate but the decor is good, the staff is on the ball, good location and.........if you get the right price.......a great hotel. I paid less than $150 per night, booked well in advance, and for that price one cannot quibble. You can join the Gold level membership on arrival and receive free wireless and complimentary tea/coffee/juice in the morning. I'll be back! PS - ok, not very PC, but The Occidental Cigar Club (it is not private - just a bar you can walk in) is around the corner - one of the best I have ever frequented.

Reviews.Title: “worst 4 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rstyc
Reviews.Content: stayed at omni may 29, 2010... 4 star hotel according to travelocity.com. spent 299 plus tax for 1 night. hallway and room smelled like someone just smoked a cigerette when we got there. requsted non-smoking. Called the front desk and they said they would "ionize my room" but 5 hours later still smelled like an ash tray. offered me a kids room with bunk beds?!?!?!?!lobby is a 4 star, location is a 4 star, staff is a 4 star... rooms area 2 star... dont let their pictures fool you. not a 4 star hotel at all. I have stayed at many hotels in sf.. all have a good location and good staff. this place sucks. I will upload pics fo the room soon. We had a view of a wall. carpet and bed set up looks like 15 years old. faded, and old looking. Do not recommend at all. Web site said free wi-fi. When u get there , only free wi-fi free in lobby, $10 additional charge if you connect from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: reb2411
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Omni Hotel for 3 nights..was really pleased with the hotel and all of it's facilities and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. Spent ages deliberating over hotels and am so pleased that we chose this one. Omni Hotel is a very elegant and high quality hotel but not in a pretentious way (like some others I could mention on the strip!!), the staff are friendly and very helpful. I was very impressed at the quality of the whole interior, it's very well maintained and very clean. Our room and its facilities were great; maids did any excellent job cleaning our room, offering free turn down and ice service each evening. Omni hotel is in a prime location with excellent transport links (bus & cable car right stops on its doors step). Lots of shops and restaurants on it’s door step also. All key Visitors attractions are within walking distance and/ or easily accessible via the transport links on Omni Hotels door step. Stay here and you won't be disappointed, I'll definitely be staying on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: ethanalfie
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the hotel to stay in San Francisco. The staff cannot do enough for you, in addition the hotel is simply beautiful. Great location, easy access to shopping and transportation. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Leshaface
Reviews.Content: My stay here at the Omni was so wonderful!!! My husband and I arrived for a weekend to celebrate our anniversary and must say they fulfilled any needs I had! When we first arrived, we were greeted by several men who welcomed us and told us where to go...Carmen at the front desk was extremely helpful about their hotel restaurant and told me that my request for a king sized bed on a high floor had been all set which was awesome!!! (normally through a third party reservation, you can not specify what type of bed you want, but called a month before and had put in my request!) The rooms were so comfortable yet had some flair to it!! The bathrooms were surprisingly big and had some great toiletries!! My husband pointed out to me that the housekeeping left a handwritten note, welcoming us, which was very thoughtful to hand write! I did have the opportunity to go work out in their gym, which was fully loaded!! Had bottled water, towels, and fruit available (self-serve) for your workout, and their equipment is very new and not withered. Not busy at all and was pretty big for a hotel gym!! I really enjoyed it!!! We were in and out of the hotel the entire weekend, but every time we left or entered, someone was always there to greet us!!! I suggest parking at a self-parking garage, because the valet was like 50 bucks a day! We went to the st. marys parking garage up on California about one block away!! This exceeded all my expectations and would most definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Hokie67
Reviews.Content: We had a pre-paid week-end rate, which made this one of the best values we've had at a major chain hotel in a mjor city. But it wasn't the price value that made our stay so special... nor was it the great location. It was the absolute friendliness of the professional staff. They acted liked they really, really were happy that you were staying with them. And it was everyone... from the doormen, the desk staff, the concierge, the cleaning staff... everyone. The rooms are large, the beds extra comfy and the bathroom well supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as always”
Reviews.Author: nitehawk
Reviews.Content: 5th stay at the beautiful Omni for the wife and myself. San Francisco, and the Omni Hotel are like a drug.....we always want more. Sublime and understated, The Omni San Francisco Hotel exemplifies a true luxury business class hotel. Which may not be to everyones liking, but is exactly why we always come back. Staff, at all levels are courteous and helpful, the rooms (we stayed in a California suite, this time), are clean and very comfortable. And at night, the only noise, is the clang-clang of the cable cars running on California St. The sounds of San Francisco, and by no means intrusive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebbieSha
Reviews.Content: The Omni has a great location with easy access to the cable cars. The staff is friendly and ready to help in any way possible. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANT HOTEL WITH A VERY FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: jpkar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Omni to be beyond what we had expected. I had gotten a good deal booking on line, pay for two nights-get the third night free.. We found the hotel to be a very classy hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. They treated us like we were important to them. From the doormen to the room attendant, all were polite and helpfull.. The hotel is located in the Financila District of SF. Therefore it is pretty quiet at night and on the weekend. Most of the local eateries are closed after business hours. However, the location is great as a central point to travel from, especially on foot. Chinatown, Nob HIll, North Beach, Union Square, Fisherman's Warf and the Ferry Building are all walkable, although you might have to negociate some hills. The California Street Cable Car line stops in front of the hotel. The B.A.R.T. station is a short four blocks away. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “great for downtown sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: NoVaTripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do (see the city, etc.). It's easy to walk to the Ferry Terminal and Embarcadero and the cable cars pick up right out front. The room was outstanding. The bed/shower/towels/etc. were all good. The TV didn't get many channels, but that wasn't what we were there for, so it didn't bother us. The safe wasn't quite big enough for a medium-size laptop but that wasn't a big issue. Internet wasn't free which was a little annoying, but the connection was good once we logged on. The gym was very good as well and had enough equipment that it wasn't overcrowded. They also don't charge extra for the gym, which was a plus. The bar downstairs is nice but somewhat small and was crowded enough with business people on weekdays that we went elsewhere to grab a quick drink. They kept our luggage for us a few hours after we checked out without any trouble so we were able to go out and have fun for a few hours before our flight. The only really annoying thing was that the elevators, while surprisingly quick when you are finally in one, take forever to show up. We were only on the 5th floor and would have gladly taken the stairs...if we could only find them. Certainly wasn't a huge issue, but it became even more annoying on the weekend when the hotel got more crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location at Omni”
Reviews.Author: MWB65
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to San Francisco my wife and I spent 6 days in early May at the Omni and we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful beyond our expectations and helped us find and book excursions. The hotel was very quiet, clean and well maintained. The location of the Omni is excellent for walking to restaurants, shopping (beyond your imagination) and Chinatown. The cable car right outside the Omni was fun and convenient as was their courtesy shuttle to Pier 39 and area. We highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, except the chef”
Reviews.Author: madeJane
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night for the location. Talk about swanky! It was beautiful. The guy at the front desk (I wish I could remember his name) was wonderful. Friendly, helpful, a real pleasure. The room was clean, the bathroom was immaculate. Comfy bed and lots of interesting extras. Wi-fi if you signed up for it on their site. However, the breakfast was not so great. $15 for blueberry pancakes? I've made better pancakes myself. Beer selection was bad at the bar, but the sandwich I bought for dinner was 100% better than the breakfast. A bit pricey for my young-adult wallet, but I would recommend it and would stay again if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Omni was great”
Reviews.Author: kewlniks
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I was going to US. After a long flight first to UK and then to US I was very tired. We had a prebooking in Hotel Omni. First of all it was very easy to locate the Hotel. Thanks to the SF radio taxis. The Hotel Omni was a great experience. We are welcomed by the staff and they were very cooperative. The rooms were very cosy and luxurious. Ther room service was great. We also had a great time in Swimming pool after the hectic schedule of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in San Francisco for 3 nights in late March 2010 as part of our honeymoon across the U.S west coast and Hawaii. Upon arrival, we were treated to a glass of champagne, which we thought was a very nice touch. Imagine our surprise when, after settling into our rooms (which wee upgraded to a suite), we were then served a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate strawberries as a congratulations for our honeymoon! The fabulous service at this hotel didn't end there. All of the front desk and concierge staff were wonderfully helpful in every way - they had some great recommendations for places to eat and things to do, and their suggestions were always spot on. Particular mention to Juan on the front desk who went out of his way to make sure that our stay was memorable. This hotel is also very well located, in the financial district but only a 10-20 minute walk down to Fishermans Wharf. We recommend taking the boat to Alcatraz, but you will need to book tickets well in advance (ie. a few weeks) because this is very popular. We also recommend hiring a bike from Fishemans Wharf and cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge down to Sausalito - but be careful handing over your credit card at Fishermans Wharf, there is a fair bit of credit card fraud activity down there and we got pinged. But back to the hotel - it was the highlight accomodation of our honeymoon. Our room was very comfortable and tastefully decorated, the king size beds were comfy, and the bathroom was a decent size. Overall, this hotel gets a big 5 stars from us (espescially for service), and we would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: jonathan443322
Reviews.Content: Omni was perhaps the best deal I have ever had with a hotel. I am not sure why it didn't cost twice what we paid--perhaps because we were there on a weekend. Great location, great room, perfect service. The only negative is the hig priced food (which we avoided).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimertoeur
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, the staff was extremely helpful and the hotel was beautiful! Rooms were extremely comfortable, great bed! If you like Indian food, highly recommend Amber for dinner. Couldn't have asked for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dmauney64
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with Omni hotels in the past and were not disappointed. The hotel is located in the financial district, yet perfect walking distance to many attractions and fabulous restaurants. I can't say enough of the wonderful staff! We were well taken care of in every aspect of our stay. The rooms were beauiful, clean and quiet! Even with a cable car line out front. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni-reffic!!!”
Reviews.Author: baruranch
Reviews.Content: Spring Break with kids to experience SF. This Hotel had everything. Beautiful room, comfortable beds. Great size bathroom with all the amenities. The staff are all wonderful. My kids knew we were in a 5star hotel that would bring milk & chocolate chip cookies each evening. The cookies were warm and delicious. Omni made our stay feel magical.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - wouldnt want to stay anywhere else in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: foodfascist
Reviews.Content: honestly the ratings for this hotel are completely justified - its great! Beds are amazing, service was excellent, location couldnt be beat and loved the way it was the perfect combo of history/authenticity and luxury - the doormen, the cable car outside the door - all felt very san fran, but also had the niceties of an international hotel. Defintiely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: caldasgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most exceptional hotels we've ever stayed at. The concierge and the rest of the staff are amazing. They are extremely helpful and very friendly. The pictures on the internet do not do this hotel justice. As most reviews have mentioned before the hotel has a wonderful from the time one walks into the lobby to the hotel rooms. The restaurant (Bob's) was very good but their servings were way too big. We asked Lex (the concierge) if he could direct us to a wine store as we were looking for a couple of rare wine vintages; Lex actually took the time to make probably dozens of calls on our behalf until he found the wine for us and had it delivered to the hotel. Both Lex and Sarah were amazingly helpful - they booked tours for us and suggested and made restaurant reservations for us. Our experience at the Omni was truly amazing and we are happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for an exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Maryland77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for four nights in April. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Even when we ran into one of the workers in the elevator, he chatted us up and recommended restaurants. The hotel is in a good location for walking and for public transportation. The room was a good size and they delivered chocolate-covered strawberries and champagne the first night, as we were on our honeymoon. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: marathon1231
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Omni San Francisco in the past. Our last reservation was off their website and we were treated very well, including an upgrade to a suite. Our most recent stay was a quick get away from Southern California for a weekend. We decided that we were not really picky on where we would stay, we just wanted a 4 star or above off Hotwire. Well, we ended up with our favorite, the Omni. When we checked in we inquired about utilizing our Select Guest privileges for the free internet. Not only did we get the usual Select Guest privileges, but we also got an upgrade. Can't stress it enough, join Select Guest and use it. We were once again impressed with everyone in the hotel we came across starting with the doorman who let us in to the maid as we were leaving. This is a well run hotel. Some people don't like that it is in the Financial District and out of the way of the tourist places. Well, we prefer that. It is quiet and, honestly, a nice walk to the Ferry Building, to Chinatown and Union Square. We like to walk the city and see what we can and do see. And when we are done and ready to sleep, we know that we have a nice quiet room with a great bed. HIghly recommend the Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aneja24
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, excellent service. Become an Omni "select guest" member (it's free to join) on the internet prior to your stay and enjoy complementary internet, bottles of water on your arrival, and complementary morning beverages every day (2 per person) among other services. We are celebrating our anniversary in SF and had mentioned this in our reservation. We were happy surprised with chocolate covered strawberries, roses, and a personal note in our room upon our arrival. We also were quite impressed with champagne offered to us upon check-in. The concierge are very helpful with directions and advise. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobRobs
Reviews.Content: The Omni is in a beautiful building the the financial district. The hotel completely eschews trendiness in favor of traditional decor and design, fitting the building in which it resides. The service is very professional yet friendly. The rooms are nicely appointed and very comfortable. The hotel is frequented by both business-trip types and well-heeled vacationers. If you want to stay in the heart of SF, want a quiet night's sleep, and want to avoid tourist kitsch in favor of traditional charm, stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: srabnavy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over the world, and we have never had a more pleasant Hotel experience than we had at the Omni-San Francisco. Beautiful room, gracious, friendly, and knowledable staff. They made our vacation to San Francisco a true memory. Will never stay anywhere else, and will now always look for an Omni Hotel when we travel for Business or Pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable hotel and value in SF”
Reviews.Author: MackLaJolla
Reviews.Content: Just spent a quick weekend in SF and was really very, very happy with the Omni SF hotel. The location is great - everything we wanted to do was either a 10 min walk or 10 min cab away. The staff was excellent very friendly - Daryl the doorman is one of the best that I have ever met and he personally was a big positive in our stay. It felt like several of the staff members were really looking out for us during our entire stay and everyone seemed to remember our name which was nice. The recommendations from the staff were all excellent and not once did we get a bum steer from anyone on the staff. The rooms were spacious for such a great downtown location. The bed was very comfortable and both days we overslept due to the comfort of the bed and the room in general. Can not say enough positive things about the hotel and the staff. The only downside we encountered in the entire trip was one night when we arrived back at the hotel late after attending the Wicked play - which we also very much enjoyed - the hotel restaurant was closed and the late night room service menu was extremely limited. We found something we could bear, but we were really wishing we had kept our dinner plans before the theater. It was our fault that caused us to miss our dinner plans before the theater, but we also thought that we would find a more extensive late night menu at the hotel. Overall though, this was a nit compared to the rest of the great weekend at the Omni. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: sailwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of March and everything was perfect. Warm, helpful staff, nice room and good location. Room was good size and extremely clean. Good restaurant recommendations for the front desk, gave us complimentary limo rides to a few places that were a short distance away. Got a 200 a night rate on the Omni website, sign up for their loyalty program and get free WIFI, morning coffee and paper on your first stay. We have stayed at many nice hotels and for the rate this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, elegant, convenient and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Bexthreekids
Reviews.Content: We are picky - we expect cleanliness, first and foremost., and appreciate the little extra touches of a first-class hotel...doormen waiting to let you in, pleasant employees at the front desk, friendly housekeepers, a nice restaurant, chilled citrus water and apples in the lobby, etc. We were not disappointed with the Omni. When we booked our room, the reservation specialist asked if we were celebrating anything, and we mentioned that it was our anniversary. Didn't think any more about it, but upon returning to our room after our first day in San Francisco, we were delighted to find a plate with 5 chocolate-covered strawberries, a bottle of champagne, our bed turned down, and robes and slippers laid out for us. What a thoughtful amenity! We were impressed. The room itself was clean and cozy; well-appointed, wonderfully comfortable bed, and peaceful and quiet. The hotel was convenient to Chinatown and just a short walk to Macy's and other shopping. I felt safe and comfortable, even walking in an unfamiliar town without my husband the first day. We will stay here again! Loved everything about it!

Reviews.Title: “Just right...”
Reviews.Author: dynamictravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for two nights (Friday - Saturday) with a great rate from Travelzoo.com (about $290 for two nights, which was a surprisingly good rate on this hotel). All of the previous reviews I had read about cleanliness, comfort, and friendly service were all true. We were given an excellent room on the 10th floor of the hotel. The bed was really comfortable which made for an excellent night’s rest. The bathroom was a perfect size, was very clean, and had fantastic water pressure. As in any city there was noise from emergency vehicles, but otherwise it was a very quiet hotel. The location was perfect for us to get to many destinations in the city and to catch public transportation when necessary. The hotel staff and concierge were extremely knowledgeable about the city, gave perfect directions, and were willing to answer any questions or address any concerns. Whether you are staying for business or for leisure travel, I highly recommend the Omni for your trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: pjce717
Reviews.Content: Omni SF is a lovely hotel with terrific service. Staff was always pleasant and greeted us warmly. Rooms are well appointed with large bathrooms. There was no noise problem here as noted at many other hotels. We were not disturbed by noise from the street or the weddings taking place there. we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cjnabq
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel. All staff - from front desk/concierge/valet/housekeeping/doorman - were friendly, polite, extremely helpful. A complementary half-bottle of wine and huge slice of chocolate cake - complete with candle and matches - were delivered to my room on our arrival in honour of my birthday courtesy of Debora Tjandra; it was a very nice touch. Great location, we could walk or take public transportation anywhere we wanted to go. Appreciated the discounted valet rate at the weekend - no other S.F. hotels seem to do that. Very quiet at night - no noise from the street below. There is nothing I can think of that would have made our stay any more perfect. We're looking at where we are going to have our next Omni experience - San Antonio is looking good . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mauvaisgarcon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 8 nights at the end of March 2010. I was in San Francisco for tourism, though it seemed to me that the Omni was mainly used as a business hotel. This did not at all detract from my enjoyment of the hotel though. My room was lovely and everything was spotlessly clean. I would wholeheartedly recomment this hotel without reservation. The hotel is expensive but the expense seems worth it when one considers the standards of customer service and attention to detail at the Omni San Francisco. All of the staff were very helpful though Stephen and Juan at reception were particulalrly helpful. Juan in particular spent a lot of time helping me on the phone to various airlines trying to sort out my online checkin I would like to point out - as others have - that it is well worth joining the Omni Select Guest program as this gives one free wifi (otherwise $9.95) in-room and complimentary drinks at breakfast, also free pressing of shirts etc. The bar/restaurant/breakfast is expensive and, personally, I would advise going elsewhere for such things. As a US point, as a Brit I should point out that prices in SF don't include sales tax (currently 9.5%) or tips (15 - 20 % is expected). I know this can be a bit annoying for Europeans, but you just have to accept it really.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: 6sturgi
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for our anniversary last weekend. We got a great deal online by using our Amex card to book. Our corner suite was VERY romantic. The king bed was super comfy with premium linens, the bathroom had a marble shower big enough for two and they even delivered complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries after we arrived. The concierge gave us great recommendations for dinner and the friendly doorman remembered us each time we came in. There were lots of little "extras" like apple cider and pears in the lobby. The location was so convenient that we either walked or took the cable car just outside the front door. Friday night was surprisingly quiet, despite being on the corner of California and Montgomery. Saturday, however, was another story with sirens, horns and partiers til after 3 am. Ugh. We never did hear any other guests above, below or next to us. Parking is steep at $40/day and internet access is another $9.95. If you join their Omni Legacy club, they waive the internet fee. And there are plenty of nearby garages with lower daily rates if you don't mind walking a few blocks. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mom2colbycate
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip here for his 40th Birthday. I had researched this hotel, location, and amenities. The best thing is the professionalism and knowledge of the front desk and concierge staff. They guided us every step of the way and were never wrong in their suggestions or recommendations. They definitely went out of their way from sold out tickets to Alcatraz to planning my husbands 40th birthday dinner at Waterbar. The location is perfect. A cable car, trolley or bus ride to anywhere. Also easily accessible from the BART at San Francisco International Airport. Definitely get the muni pass that includes cable car, trolley and bus service for 3 days for $20. It's worth every penny. Listen to the concierge they know the city backwards and forwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sandireg
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed into the Omni Hotel with a friendly staff, an apple and some apple cider. We arrived at 11 am to find our room ready! We were checked-in in a flash and into our room in no time! The room was beautiful with two full beds, flat screen TV, coffee set up, mini bar and large and beautiful bathroom. We were on the 16th floor and had a view of the courtyard below. The room was very clean and quiet. They have turn-down service which includes milk and cookies! The service was excellent. Juan, at the concierge desk was so nice and helped us find a reasonable Italian restaurant, called ahead for a table and walked us outside to point us in the right direction for the short walk. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The Hotel had transportation passes for purchase so we didn't have to spend time finding the few places that sell the passes. We bought a 3-day pass that was good for all the local public transportation. The location is the best! Right on Calif Street and in the center of everything. The cable car and bus stops are right out front as well as taxi service. The Hotel has a 4 star rating but should be a 5 star! We loved our stay at the Omni and will stay there again when we come back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: mstimc
Reviews.Content: We go to The City quite often but this was the first time we stayed at the Omni--they offered a great AAA rate. I was impressed from the moment I made the reservation--they cheerfully accommodated our early-check-in request. When we arrived at our room, we found it hadn't been cleaned yet. We called the front desk and they immediately offered to move us to another room or come up right away and clean ours. Since we were going out anyway, we asked them to clean the room--which they did impeccably. The entire staff was pleasant and nice--and not just in the "I'm being nice because its my job" sort of way--they really seem to enjoy making your stay pleasant. Now an uncleaned room isn't the end of the world, but the duty manager and concierge sent us as note apologizing for the mix-up along with a nice little glass of chocolate balls. It was a nice touch! The room was a little on the small size, but it has all the amenities, is very nicely decorated, and was as clean as I'd ever seen a hotel room--excellent all round. Plus the hotel is whisper-quiet. Great location--Chinatown to the west, Union Square to the south, and in the Financial District. We've stayed at several places in SF, but this will be our regular from now on! Hint--when you make a reservation, join the frequent stay club--you'll get in-room W-Fi free and a couple of other nice little perks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: The Omni in San Francisco is a dream hotel! The entire staff was helpful and friendly. When you walk into the lobby, which smells like fresh cut flowers, you are surrounded by marble, wood paneling, floral arrangements, and a wonderful staff. The room was clean and quiet, and the beds were comfortable. We received milk and cookies for the kids at bedtime. When we forgot something in our car (parked with the valet), a staff member offered to run to the car and get it for us. When we called housekeeping for something, we received it right away from a cheerful staff member. We never waited more than a minute for anything! The entire staff seemed eager to assist us with whatever we needed. The Omni San Francisco has the best staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. I travel quite a bit and this hotel exceeded all my expectations. It is a perfect place to stay in San Francisco, since the hotel is near Chinatown and Little Italy and a cable car runs right out front. This is truly an exquisite and delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am already planning our next stay here”
Reviews.Author: PVfirst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni last night for one night. We had a special package including free parking, breakfast, wifi and tickets to the King Tut Exhibit. Great Deal! However, the best deal was the hotel itself. The staff was wonderful from check-in to check-out. Extremely polite, attentive, helpful, nice, funny.... The hotel is beautiful. The room was perfect. Spacious, clean, with nice decor. No view to speak of, but very quiet. The bathroom was lovely, including the bow around the extra roll of toilet paper. Nice toiletries. The king bed was comfy. We became members (free) and enjoyed the complimentary shoeshine and pressing of 2 items of clothing as well as the room service of beverages of your choice in the morning. Wow, we felt so spoiled! :-) The breakfast in the restaurant was very good, the service perfect and the view of an occasional cable car coming by was a nice touch! Well, on our drive home I was thinking what a good reason would be to go back very soon. Yes! There is the Cartier Exhibit. Perfect, we'll stay at the Omni again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishka414
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Hotel for three nights with my husband, and could not have asked for a better experience!! The hotel is super clean and the lobby has the most wonderful smell. Our room was a good size and very comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We had never stayed at an Omni Hotel, and we fell in love with this hotel chain!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: r0ckhill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 8 nights and were extremely happy with the room, the staff, (courtesy and efficiency), and the location. Our room was spacious with lovely furnishings, linens, and bath. The view was the only thing that wasn't top notch. We had been concerned about the proximity of night time and Sunday restaurants since the Omni is in the Financial District, but with Tadich down the street and with Belden Lane (a jewel) and its restaurants a block or so away, we had no trouble finding good restaurants within walking distance. We did find the breakfasts expensive in the hotel, but there is a Starbucks right across the street in the Bank of America building. Actually, everything is quite conveniently located. There is the California cable car line right outside the hotel to get you up Nob Hill, and the Ferry Building is an easy walk away. China Town is quite close, and so is Union Square. The area around the hotel is also much quieter than the Union Square area--a plus for us. And speaking of quiet--the rooms are really quite soundproof. We heard only an occasional door being closed, but never anyone talking. The Omni is a wonderful choice for a San Francisco visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Quiet location. Only steps from everything SF.”
Reviews.Author: mkwayne
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the Omni and was impressed with the quality of service they provided. During the course of a crepe run in the morning, a button on my suit jacket fell off. Upon requesting the front desk personnel that it be repaired, and inquiring about the charge associated with such a repair, I was informed they'd be happy to do it at no charge, and would have it done within 30 minutes, as I was going to be heading back out for the day and needed that jacket. Doorman never let me open my own door, or hail my own cab. They also offered umbrellas if rain was expected and you didn't have one in hand. 11th floor room facing California, with a view of Montgomery, was quiet except for a fire truck one night. No other road noise was heard, even though the trolley goes by several times a day. Within just a few blocks is Chinatown, Union Square for shopping, Little Italy, Columbus Ave nightlife, and Embarcadara Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni has the best location!”
Reviews.Author: BordeauxBaby
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Omni--this hotel has a great location; it's walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, The Ferry Building, and so much more! The rooms are a nice size, extremely comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was very professional, helpful and very nice. This was one of the best hotel experiences I have had.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Omni Hotel San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: bnova72
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at an Omni Hotel and I must say that I was not disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly, professional, and helpful. I was always acknowledged and greeting by the housecleaning staff whenever I met one of them in the hallway. As for the ambiance, I must share that the hotel is quite elegant without being too pretentious. I was especially happy with the morning beverage service. It was delivered everyday exactly at the time I had requested. In short, this is a wonderful hotel which I plan to stay in again. I've already reserved a couuple more stays in the coming months. Thank you, Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Morris loved the Omni San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MorrisM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the financial district but it is an easy walk to the harbor. The lobby is beautiful and the staff is very courteous and interested in helping you. The in-hotel restaurant is a steak house and the tab runs high. The room was spacious and pretty, was well appointed and included amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints.All around clean, tasteful, and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: rccgeo
Reviews.Content: I always have a hard time finding a hotel that's near all of the places I want to go, in a safe location, and is a little on the luxury side, yet at an affordable price. This hotel met and exceeded all of those criteria. It is on the edge of both the financial district and Chinatown. I believe it took about 15 minutes to walk down to Union Square where all the shopping is located. Luckily Boudin's Sourdough bread had a location in the lower level of Macy's so I didn't have to deal with all of the craziness of Fisherman's Wharf! Everyone at the hotel was dressed appropriately and behaved with the upmost professionalism. The room was was tastefully decorated and very clean. I especially liked how quite the room was. I didn't notice any loud annoying noises (ie: toilets, neighbors, slamming doors, etc.) All around a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for enjoying the city”
Reviews.Author: travelhealthmaven
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. I first stayed 2 years ago with my teen daughter as a mid-week getaway. This time I went with my spouse who had one day of business in SF so we decided to do a long weekend. We checked in on a Thursday and left (reluctantly) Sunday. I love the location -- easy walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, the Ferry building. Also easy to take the cable car back up California Street from Embarcadero. Only caveat is, on the weekend. most of the immediately local sandwich/soup shops are closed, catering as they do to local business lunchers. Our room was very nice, if a little quirky. It was on the top (17th) floor and was a suite with a separate living room. I say quirky only because the windows were all small and very high up so they let in the light but you could not really look out. We didn't care -- to us it was charming and comfortable The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble and an extra large shower and some fresh roses in a vase - a very nice touch. We splurged on a breakfast at Bob's -- the Eggs Benedict were (was?) among the best I've had. Our room service breakfast was very good as well. We are part of the free Omni loyalty program. In 2008 this got you free internet, plus free continental breakfast. This year they cut out the breakfast, giving you only coffee and juice of your choice. Still nice. The lobby is beautiful and the staff always courteous and helpful. I also appreciated the hot cider they have in the afternoons. We used the gym which has a nice view of California Street and the cablecar. It's clean and well-equipped if small, but I will say the treadmill I used (the one on the right as you enter the room) was very noisy and I remembered I used the same one in 2008 and apparently it hadn't been fixed. I would definitely stay at the Omni again - it was a great value for SF and made for a very nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: KKinCali
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in San Francisco for my boyfriend's birthday, and the Omni was a great choice. The staff were overwhelmingly friendly, making sure check in was a smooth process, and handing us a glass of bubbly upon arrival. Everything about the hotel is nice - the elevators are fast and quiet, the hallway carpets are thick and soft, the flowers in the elevator lobby are fresh, you get the idea. Our room was pretty large, as was the bathroom and closet. The bed was extremely comfortable, but the pillows were not great for us. Otherwise, it was lovely. The tub was deep - made for a great bubble bath! There are many other little touches provided by the hotel - nice tea/coffee, a jogging map of the area, a desk with built in internet lines, etc. I would definitely look at their other hotels in other cities. Breakfast in the hotel downstairs was included in our package, but I wouldn't eat there if it hadn't been. It was overpriced for the quality - in such a great food town, you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Professional Courtesy”
Reviews.Author: exhotelguy
Reviews.Content: I was in the 5 star hotel business for 10 years (many years ago) around the world and now travel on business internationally on a constant basis, The Omni front desk team is one of the best I have seen anywhere in the world. They were the perfect blend of welcoming, informative, fast & professional. This hotel is exceptionally good value, it is welcoming, well maintained, in a great location and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. Thank you Omni San Francisco, you are one on the very best hotels in the USA and right up there with the best service I have had in the world. Can you tell we loved our stay at the Omni?

Reviews.Title: “Family luxury in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: fiveapplekeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King while our kids were in the adjoining Pottery Barn kids room. They loved it ... a kids dream come true! Our King room was clean and well appointed with old time luxury plus modern amenities. The kids had bunk beds plus a fold out couch, table and chairs, bean bags, a good library of books, TV with DVD player, and a mini fridge stocked with emergency snacks. Most importantly, they had cookies and milk delivered to their room every night! The Omni itself is beautiful, nestled between the Financial District and Chinatown, and is right on the California cable car line. Tremendous service that was kind and present, but never overbearing. One of our best hotel experiences ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: megan9927
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni San Francisco for 3 days for our 5 year anniversary. The hotel is in a great location in the city, walking distance to many attractions. The room was perfect and the service was outstanding. Reserve in advance on the hotel's web site for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: Vonce
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for four nights on holiday and was very impressed. Really nice hotel, nice rooms, very clean,very good bed, friendly staff and also in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price - better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 2far2point
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it is the little things that make the difference. While most hotels of "lesser" stars include in-room internet access at no-charge, the Omni charges for this service. The hassle to get it at "no-charge" was time consuming and in the end did not work. Add to it, the lobby internet access worked poorly if at all. Although friendly, the staff didn't seem too concerned about trying to resolve this. If you need to use the internet for business or email, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “CA Trip”
Reviews.Author: VenomViper
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, Close to everything you want to visit, staff extremely helpful, make use of the prepaid parking if you take a vehicle

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: buenasvacaciones
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and from the moment I arrived felt that I'd made the right choice. The location is perfect with both the main shopping district and the waterfront about 10 minutes walk away. My room was large,pleasantly furnished and well equipped. There was also a decent sized bathroom with a bath. The hotel offers complimentary coffee in the bar until 10am and in the afternoon there was fruit or biscuits and a seasonal soft beverage on offer - a nice touch. The hotel website has some good offers so it is possible to experience luxury with good service at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bookworm720
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Omni SF for two nights this week. We've been to SF many times but decided to spend extra time since we had people to visit in the Bay. We arrived on Sunday night and left her car with valet ($48/night). The man walked around the car with my sister and noted existing scratches and dings before taking the car. Checking in was easy, although there was a problem with our room. We reserved our room through Expedia and requested two beds. Our room had one king bed. I went to the front desk and asked for the room we reserved. Luckily, there was a room available with two beds, but was told that had the hotel been full, they wouldn’t be able to move us. I asked how come the hotel didn’t get my reservation right. He said that sometimes they don’t get all the details because we reserved the room through a third party and they tend to buy rooms in blocks. However, had they known that I’m a Select Guest member prior to my arrival, they would have gotten everything straighten out. He called our new room a few minutes later to make sure we moved okay. Tip: Sign up for the Select Guest program (Omni loyalty program). It’s free to sign up. We received free internet access ($9.95/night otherwise I believe), morning newspaper, and breakfast drinks (2 per person). The hotel is in the financial district. There were many ATMs nearby. I had to get some unexpected work done and luckily, FedEx Kinko’s and the UPS Store were a few blocks away. The hotel is walking distance to Union Square and two blocks from Chinatown. We walked to both. We also walked to the Cable Car Museum (free) and onward to Ghirardelli Square via North Beach and Russian Hill. Ghirardelli Square was a bit far for walking, but we wanted the exercise. We took a cab from Pier 39 back to the hotel ($10) though. I’ve stayed at many hotels and the Omni SF is definitely top 3. We loved the Omni and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: jsilverheart
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Omni in New York, it just made me appreciate this Omni so much more. The Omni in SF is fabulous - and Carmen Serra rocks! She is the front desk manager and she is always there to help. The location is amazing because it's quiet yet within walking distance from so many places. I will NEVER stay anywhere else when I go to SF, this is my favorite hotel by far. The rooms are wonderful, the service is wonderful and the location is wonderful. I love everything from the complimentary lemonade and fresh fruit in the lobby to the nightly turndown service. Highly recommend this hotel!!! This last trip, my best friend brought her two little girls, 2 months and 2 years. They gave Kate (2 year old) a backpack full of activities and sent up milk & cookies every night. She loved it! They also sent up a crib for the baby and she slept so well. The Omni is very kid friendly and wonderful all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: sruby
Reviews.Content: After a night of merry making, we returned to the garage only to find that it was closed and locked up for the night. Having to find a room on short notice the Omni Hotel hoked us up with a cheap room for the night. Justin who works at the front desk was very helpful, he gave us all the grooming supplies we needed. The room was clean and comfortable. We will be returning customers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: aztecgol4er
Reviews.Content: Planned on going to NYC for GF's birthday, but with weather, that fell thru. Found a good rate at the Omni's site and booked it. In the reservation, I left a little note about the birthday and left it at that. So we arrive to SF early (11am) and go to leave our bags at the front desk assuming we'd not be able to check in. We were not only able to check in, but we were upgraded to the top floor, with a view of the Bay...AMAZING. Additionally, we were given personalized gift bags...relaxation stuff for the misses, and random stuff for myself....major points. So we head out for lunch and come back sometime later when we get a call on the phone. The front desk tried to send up something, but with the privacy sign on the door, couldn't alert us. So we told them to come back up and they delivered a complimentary bottle of wine and homemade truffles. Perfect! All I can say is thank you to the Omni SF. This was the perfect trip and everytime I'm back in the city, this is where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “"A Jewel"”
Reviews.Author: dgraham61
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. First class. Perfect location, walking distance to many attractions. If you are not into walking, there are about 3 different types of public transportaion right outside the Hotel. Extremely safe area. Front desk personnel and door assistants are friendly and very knowledgeable about the area and the history of San Francisco. From the moment you step into the Hotel you feel welcome. Handwritten note from the housekeeping lady was a very special touch. Room service was amazing, try the creme brule' it is amazing. We were upgraded to a suite and it was incredible. Very big room, lots of windows and great views of the city. We loved everything about this property and will definitely go back. Sarah Crown is the Assistant Front Office Manager and she is delightful as well as Barney the doorman who everyone seems to know and love. As far as we are concerned this is the only place to stay in downtown San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anyplace else in San Francisco?”
Reviews.Author: LATraveller77
Reviews.Content: This is a five-star hotel at three-star prices. Terrific location. We walked to Chinatown; to the Embarcadero; to North Beach and all those great Italian restaurants. Great shopping & sightseeing nearby. The rooms are nicely maintained. When all is said and done, it is the service that keeps me coming back, for this, my fourth Christmas. The employees are always so accommodating, from Daryll at the door, to Sarah on the front desk. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: ZenBach
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice, in two different rooms. Both were HUGE by any standard, but especially for San Francisco. My room at the Hilton was about 1/3 the size. The bathrooms are AMAZING: large tub, lots of thick towels, and lots of space. The furniture in the room has an antique feel, but in that upper crust Euro way, not in that shabby chic kind of way. The beds are firm but comfortable, and the linens are soft. You can get down pillows or foam. Tons of room and a big picture window, and the place was quiet enough to get a good night's sleep--which is never my experience. During the holidays they gave my sister and I welcome gift bags and had a champagne reception in the lobby, which is also beautiful. But the best thing about the Omni was the service. Everyone was fantastic, from doormen to front desk staff. Helpful, courteous, and friendly. They let me check in early after my all night flight from Japan, gave us directions multiple times, helped us with parking, and kept our stuff for hours after we checked out. I will stay here whenever I'm in SF again. We liked them so much we brought them homemade cookies on our second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we returned”
Reviews.Author: seablu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving. We returned to use our tickets to the King Tut exhibit. The hotel is on a one way street. Not uncommon in SF.
