We pulled curbside to have our suitcases unloaded. In less than 1 minute, the metermaid was behind us. The doorman spoke with her and we avoided a ticket. We were self parking up the street. I pulled away to park after my trunk was closed by the bellman. I thought the luggage had been unloaded! I realized after I parked that only my family was at the hotel, not my bags! When I walked into the hotel, the bellman met me and offered to walk to the parking garage to help carry bags. Our room included the kids ajoined room. Their room was a full sized room with a bunkbed, kid sized robes, games, books, stuffed toys, and various treats. The bathroom had childrens cups and a stool and other goodies. The door even had a kids level peephole. Their refrigerator had cereal, milk, juices, and snacks. There is even a "suitcase" at the front desk filled with goodies. Also in the lobby, fresh fruit, and hot cider. Our room was spacious and clean. Our view, however, was of another office building where you could see people working! We never used our car. We either walked, took the taxi, or used public transport. Everything was close and easy to find. We walked to Union square, the Embarcadero to iceskate, and shop. Wifi and cell service in our room was excellent. The front desk went out of their way to help with everything. Customer service was outstanding. Like everyone says, join their select guest program for added perks. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Do It!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCelt
Reviews.Content: We selected the Omni based on all the reviews we read on Tripadvisor and we are so happy we did. We stayed there from Dec 19th -23rd and what a great experience. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly concierge, who offered us a glass of champagne and we knew we had made a great choice. The room was perfect with plently of space. Everyone here is so focused on the hotel's mission statement. It's location is excellent, a nice walk from Fishermans Wharf, Union Square and so on, yet it also has the convenience of having the "California Line" cable car outside the front doors. We did not eat in the Restaurant, but we did go down the street 3 blocks to San Francisco's oldest restaurant "Tadich Grill" which is another great reason to stay at the Omni as it's a great restaurant and a nice short walk back to the hotel. To sum up our stay at the Omni, I would say "Just Do It" - you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service of Any Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrnmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for a birthday and girls weekend. This hotel is not only comfortable and beautiful, the customer service is the best of any hotel I have stayed. Everyone is friendly and more than accomadating. They also gave us a bag of spa treasures. Free coffee and juice brought to your room if you are a select member. I will be staying at only Omni Hotels in my travels.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE SERVICE AND LOCATION JUST EXCELLET”
Reviews.Author: YANI55
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stay 3 days at the Omni Hotel, the services was excellent, the staff was super friendly and always there for anything you may need... The location one of the best in San Francisco..... I highly recommended this hotel to anyone thinking of traveling to San Fco, belive me you will not regreted......... EXCELLENT.....

Reviews.Title: “The best stay we've had in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LydiaTibbetts
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the Omni San Francisco outdid its competitors. The front desk was efficient and greeted us warmly, the bellman was helpful and gracious about the tip. For the first time I can remember we had a handwritten note from the housekeeper welcoming us. The hotel had responded to my request for a room on a high floor and , while one might expect them to be cynical since I know people are sometimes dishonest about a special event, a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, with another handwritten note from the concierge, was waiting for us on our first night.. We've stayed at five star hotels for years in SF but our knees will no longer climb (or descend) Nob Hill comfortably and the Omni was our choice because of that. We would recommend it to anyone and will seek out Omnis whenever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Base”
Reviews.Author: VikingDevon_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week and cannot recommend Omni highly enough. Very helpful and pleasant staff (particularly concierge) and luxurious feel to the hotel as a whole. Despite being in heart of CBD it makes a perfect walkable base to explore waterfront and Union Square areas - Xmas decorations in the city have to be seen to be believed.. "what recession?!" On a practical note take the BART from airport to Montgomery and walk the level 3 short blocks to the hotel. At $8.10 and 20 minute journey it is easy, clean and a bargain compared to pricey slow cab.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: klangsm84
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the hotle. The service and food were wonderful. Our room was a good size and it was very clean. It located in a very good location and would def consider saying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Wiz
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco a couple of times each year and have been fairly loyal to the Hilton Financial District which has a great location and wonderful views. I have had drinks in the bar at the Omni and thought it was lovely. This time, I found a terrific weekend price at the Omni and decided to try it. It was a great decision. From the moment I walked in the door, the service was uniformly outstanding. The doorman asks for the name on the reservation - and from there, they hand you off, by name, from staff member to staff member. I was particularly impressed when the next morning, the bellman still referred to me by name - good memory! The room I had was probably not the best location, but I didn't expect their best room for the price I paid! The room itself was lovely, extremely well equipped. It faced inwardly to other rooms of the hotel and a nearby office, but frankly that was wonderful because it was extremely quiet for sleeping. The location of the Omni in the center of town does not lend itself to views in any case. When I checked in, they gave me door tags to hang each night with a requested beverage (coffee, tea, juice, etc) for the morning. What I particularly liked was that on the back, you could also order small breakfast items - muffins, yogurt, etc. for a very reasonable price rather then ordering an expensive breakfast from the room service menu. If you were happy enough with coffee and a muffin for breakfast, it was possible for a very small charge. All in all it was a lovely hotel, I hope I can find another fairly reasonable offering in the future, as I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillery1954
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is lovely! We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and when we arrived they told us they'd upgraded us to a suite. It was a corner room and we had windows on both sides, a very nice sitting room, beautiful bathroom and huge bedroom. Everything about the room was first class. It was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. When we came back to the room after riding the cable cars around for a few hours there was a big piece of chocolate cake and a split of champagne waiting for us! We had dinner at Bob's, the hotels restaurant, and they gave us one of their intimate, private dining rooms. The food was wonderful! The hotel employees could not have been more helpful, welcoming and courteous. I can't say enough good things about our stay there and will definitely go back. I recommend it without hesitation!! Don't miss it, you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jogoderic
Reviews.Content: We were totally wowed with the service and comfort of the Omni. We live in the Bay area and go to San Francisco every few weeks for fun in the city. We have stayed at several hotels, and this was by far the best experience we've had. We were given Express check-in, which was amazingly smooth. All of the staff is super friendly and accomodating. We ordered breakfast each morning (very yummy blueberry pancakes) and got coffee and the New York Times promptly at 8 am, as requested. The room was huge, quiet and the beds very comfy. The shower was so luxurious -- my husband is 6'5", so a high, large shower head is something he really appreciates. The workout facility was also very impressive - high-end treadmills, eliptical machines and free weights. The location is unbeatable -- right across from the Bank of America and a few short blocks from Union Square and the Embarcadero. You absolutely can't go wrong with the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cwildrose
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Francisco over the Labor Day weekend with my husband and another couple. We got a great deal on the rooms - prepay for $106 per nite. Never having stayed there I couldn't resist. I'm glad we took the deal. The Omni is in a fantastic location - China town just around the corner, short walks to embarcadero, Union Square, and the trolley runs right in front of the hotel. Tadiche's is only a block away (one of my favorite restaurants). The Carnelian Room is across the street in the Bank of America Bldg. (go quickly - it is set to close at the end of the year) on the 52nd floor, beautiful views of the Golden gate and the bay. Go for a sunset cocktail. It's an intimate room so try to be early for the best tables. The hotel itself could use a little updating. The rooms are big enough, just not very contemporary. A little old fashioned decor-wise. Everything perfectly clean. Comfy bed. The food was great at Bob's in the hotel (love Bob's - we know it from its origins in Dallas) and the scene at the hotel bar was lively. We went every day for an afternoon toddy. All in all a great trip. Don't miss Fisherman's Wharf and the bay cruise - interesting and beautiful. We had an absolutely perfect day. September really is the best weather there. Eat a bowl of chowder out of the fantastic sour dough. MMMM making me hungry! Would definitely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - wish we could of stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: PierroSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights in Oct as part of a 2 week trip of the West Coast. We picked the Omni via the good reviews in trip advisor and were not disappointed. From the moment we entered the foyer we knew that the reviews were correct. Check in was quick and friendly, we had asked for a room with harbor views and a high floor and received both these requests. The room was good size with comfortable bed and loverly bathroom. We had room service the first night - which was delivered quickly and was of good quality. The dinner included a birthday cake and red wine for my wife. The cable cars run outside the hotel which is handy for trips to Fisherman's Wharf. Union Sq is about a 10 minute walk. Dinner the second night was in their Chop House restaurant , which is a must, especially for wine lovers as they have been voted as having one of the top 10 wine lists in the world. Steaks and Seafood were of high quality and service excellent. Our last stay was at the Monaco which was also good but at $100 night extra is not as good value as the Omni. We will certainly come back to Omni, next trip to the states.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: Picked the Omni after reading all of the reviews on TA. All as said before - great service, rooms, etc. In terms of location I didn't find it too far from Union Square, etc - 5-10 minute walk tops. I quite like the fact that it's in the financial district; means that local starbucks, cafe's etc are open nice and early for business (I'm a morning person!) although agree it's a little quieter in the evening once rush hour is over, but it's hardly dead. Walgreens, Mcdonalds, Starbucks and lots of cafe's are all within 100 metres of the hotel so you don't have to go far for anything. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel with an excellent staff. The rooms have everything you need with very comfortable beds. The bar is quite pricey downstairs and their breakfast and room service prices are absolutely ridiculously expensive. They would sell a lot more of each of those categories if they didn't charge so much. The location is unbeatable (unless you have the scratch to stay in the Ritz.). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sdgogreen
Reviews.Content: Really great place to stay in San Francisco. walking distance to cable cars, trolley, China town. The staff is incredible - very helpful and friendly. Beautiful hotel. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hodjafrapjort
Reviews.Content: Nice & attentive costumer service in front desk and very funny and attentive bell boy. We had ordered a king deluxe and we got a very big room with extremely good and huge bed and a very nice view. Free wifi and if you become a member of their club, which is free, there is free coffee and such brought to your door in the morning. The location is also very good - i was afraid that we had ordered a room in the financial district because it often means empty and scary neighbourhood after business hours, but it was just on the edge of Union sq. It is a bit on the expensive side compared to us prizes, but we thought the money was well spent... The valet is like 50 bucks or something.

Reviews.Title: “A Warn welcome To California”
Reviews.Author: RogeRowlandson
Reviews.Content: Following a long flight from the UK we arrived to a very warm welcome from the staff at the Omni. Check in was fast and loads of useful info was offered. The room was very comfortable. The bed had a memory foam topper which made it really comfortable. The toiletries were great and everything was spotless. We didn't have breakfast here as there is so much choice nearby, however the bar is a bit pricey for drinks and snacks compared to other bars. Overall a great choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Lnrbill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in financial district on California ave close to cable car, MUNI bus and trolley. The rooms are well appointed , the hotel staff are extremely out going. They know the area well and it's advised to ask for directions and input for dining etc. We enjoyed a relaxing stay and though it was our first experience staying at this hotel chain we cancelled our internary and stayed at Omni of LA,, Just a rubber stamp of what hotels should be and how staff obviously are in tune with helping there guests achieve the most out of there business or leisurely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: calpyro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Emerald Bowl 2008. It was fantastic. The staff was wonderful and always more than willing to accomodate any need. Probably the best thing about the Omni is their "club" program. If you sign up, they deliver free coffee/tea/cocoa to your door every morning. We were in SF during my birthday and came back to the room after the game to find a little birthday cake and a small bottle of wine waiting for us. It truly made a great trup even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, small rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: williate
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was nice. Room was small but clean. Bathroom was terrific and clean. Check-in was difficult. Reserved room several months in advance and requested room w/2 beds (traveling w/my adult daughter). Was given room w/1 king bed. Had to wait an hour for room to be reassigned. Was offered a coupon for a free breakfast to compensate for the inconvenience, but it was not offered until we were checking out and leaving for the airport! Consierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Housing keeping staff were friendly and prompt. Restaurant was very expensive and food was not what was expected for the $$ charged.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alwayshonest39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 3 nights and absolutely loved it! Service was excellent...location good (quiet on weekends...) but close to shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler032003
Reviews.Content: Attentive service, bordering on being too eager to help. Rooms are good size, with all the amenities. A plus for this hotel is a nicely appointed fitness center which is complimentary for guests. All in all, you will be quite happy here. Tip: Join the Omni Hotel frequent stay club, it entitles you to amenities including free newspapers, water, complimentary hot beverages delivered in the morning. Sign up is free. Another tip: Do not spend $48/night to valet park your car here. Best bet is not to have a car, if you must there are cheaper self-park alternatives (parking at corner of Sutter & Stockton is a municipal garage)

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, But a Good Stay and at a Reasonable Cost”
Reviews.Author: jsr914
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacation in the Bay Area frequently. Given the number of top-notch hotels in The City, we usually pick and choose a new one each trip. This time we landed the Omni on a discount website for about $125 per night. Given all of the good reviews on Trip Advisor, we were excited to give it a try. The location of the hotel is better for business than leisure. While I like the Embarcadero area for its proximity to BART and the ferry building, we found ourselves constantly trudging up-hill toward Union Square or Pacific Heights for dinner and sightseeing. We do a lot of walking when staying in the City anyway, so the additional few blocks (all uphill) was a bit of overkill. In short, we largely prefer staying in Union Square and probably will skip the Omni because of its location on our next stay. All other aspects of the hotel were well above-average -- our check in went smoothly. The staff was attentive and pleasant. Our room was clean and comfortable, although very average in size and accommodations. The lobby area is attractive and the hotel is a very good mix of luxury and value. Overall, we found the Omni to be an excellent value and a good choice for a home base while staying in San Francisco. Our only complaint was the location, but for a business trip it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service,fabulous breakfast,excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Bewitched007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 different hotels in San Francisco and this was by far the best value and a nice hotel with a good location. The room was spacious and comfortable. we were given through directions for locations we were seeking and good information on arrival. the price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel59
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the San Francisco Omni Hotel was excellent. The exterior of the hotel is very attractive and the interior is tastefully decorated. The rooms were nicely decorated; not too big and not too small. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is convenient to many tourist attractions and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: t_castillo
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got to the Omni hotel, eveything was perfect! My husband and I have never been to San Fran and we came with 5 others for fun. On the day we arrived we came in late from the airport and had 30 minutes to get to Pier 33 for the night Alcatraz tour. Thank goodness for Michael at the front desk, he not only checked us in, took all of our bags and had us all whisked away in time to make the tour. That was just the beginning! Every morning Joey at the font desk would greet us and ask whats on the agenda today. Well he made lots of suggestions and was very helpful in teaching us how to take the cable cars to the Piers, which was very easy. It picks you up right in front of the hotel and you take it to Powell street. On Powell you can either take the Hyde Cable car or the Mason. They both take you to the water at the different spots but the Hyde takes you to Lombard Street where you can get off and walk down the famous street and its only a couple of blocks to the Pier. For us taking the cable cars and walking around was the best way to see and experience the life down there. Parking would be crazy, so if your able to walk, that is what I recommend. We also did the Night cruise to Alcatraz. We bought our tickets a month in advance and believe me if we hadn't we would not of been able to go. It is definately worth the price and a great tour! We also top the Hop on Hop off Bus tour over the Golden Gate Bridge. It was ok I was a little disappointed that we got on the wrong bus and didn't get to go to Salsalito. Once your on they do no transfers so your stuck on the bus going where its going. It wasn't bad we went to the Exploratorium, the Presidio, over the bridge and the Pacific Heights Mansions. It was nice but really heard that Salsalito was a great town to go to! Other than that the Bread from Boudini's and the seafood is Awesome! We went to a show in North Beach, Beach Blanket Babylon and thought that it was great! Different, funny with great costumes and the humor was with all the current events that are going on today and Singing. If your up for a funny show you will have to get your tickets ahead of time for this too! Had no problems taking the BART to and from the airport. Hotel was just 5 blocks away. A special thanks to Joey and Michael at the Omni for always helping and going way out of their way to make our stay better! Definately planning a trip to go back with our kids next year and would definately stay at the Omni again! It was nice and quiet for us, the bed very comfortable (needs extra pillows, you can request) and the rooms very comfortable. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I booked the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Fernuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for 3 nights over the Labour Day Weekend based on Trip Advisor reviews. From the moment we stepped out of our taxis I knew we booked the right hotel. The hotel was beautiful, all the staff we fanastic from check in to bell boys, housekeeping were great asking us when passing in the corridor if we needed anything. A special thank you to Darryl at the door for the great service we received. Room was very clean and the bed was very confortable. Sign up to their guest programme on their web site as you get free internet, tea or coffee to your room every morning, newspaper etc. Would defintely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - and such a deal!”
Reviews.Author: GraceFoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for Labor Day weekend and it was terrific. The staff did everything possible to make our stay a pleasant one, with special kudos to Lex, the concierge, who so generously shared his knowledge with us. Our room was clean and very quiet, the bathrooms were large with plenty of amenities, the WIFI in the room acutally worked every time and the location was perfect for walking to the Ferry Building. And - the nightly rate was about half what we would have paid at comparable hotels in the neighborhood! Definitely join the (free) Loyalty program when booking to get a few extras. Note: valet parking is costly ($30 per day on weekends and $48 during the week) but necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Working Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Techrunner
Reviews.Content: This was an exercise in opulence. The room was gorgeous. the facilities were top notch and the hotel itself is centrally located just a stones throw from the financial district, and a great steak house on California Street ( I think it is). I even found a street vender that sld black roses..But that's another story..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cmsand
Reviews.Content: We found an outstanding price at the Omni San Francisco for Labor Day weekend. It is very centrally located so that we could (and did!) walk almost everywhere. The entire hotel staff from the door men, concierge, front desk, and housekeeping were friendly, helpful, and seemed to really enjoy working there. Our room was clean, cozy, and had a luxurious decor. We were very happy with our experience at the Omni and will definitely be back! We'll probably look for an Omni in other cities we travel too as well.

Reviews.Title: “Uspscale hotel with a moderate price!”
Reviews.Author: physiodude
Reviews.Content: I did book this hotel through priceline, but wow what a great stay!! I have never been in a hotel with such nice staff from the doormen, to the concierge to the cleaning staff there has been a lot of attention to detail. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed with higher thread count sheets, marble and brass fixtures and 9 ft ceilings. Our room peeked at the Transamerica Building but also a gray roof top but who cares there is lots to few out of the hotel. Location was perfect as you were in a quieter part of town but close to everything too. The cable car ran out the front door and you are 5 - 10 minutes away from Union Square, Chinatown and the Embarcadero. We didn't go to the Restaurant as we thought the menu was stuffy and way way overpriced for what else is out there around you!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, with impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal3481
Reviews.Content: This hotel far surpassed my expectations for the price. Beautiful lobby and rooms. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing more than you'd expect at the price”
Reviews.Author: vedev
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Francisco as part of a tour of the Western USA during the summer and stayed for three nights at the Omni. The location is excellent and the valet parking (at a cost) very useful in a city where parking is tough to find. Chinatown is a 5 minute walk and the trams up Nob Hill leave from basically outside the front door. The staff are friendly, courteous and very good at making you feel at home. Food at the in house restaurant is also good - I can highly recommend the breakfast! However, for the price you pay the rooms are small and nothing special (though bathrooms are good) and I just can't bring myself to give somewhere this expensive 5/5 as in reality it's not great value for money. A very pleasant stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: cdshoebe
Reviews.Content: We selected the Omni based on TripAdvisors reviews - thanks to all of you who take the time to post your experiences! We loved the location of the hotel which is walking distance to Union Square, the Embarcadero, China Town, etc. It is a business hotel though so don't look out your window and expect a great view of the city. We did have a few little glitches upon arrival, but Sarah, at the front desk, was very very helpful and more than corrected the situations. The staff's restaurant recommendations were very good. Our experience in the hotel's restaurant was not good - so I agree with a previous post that you should eat elsewhere. I have to give Sarah, and the room staff a big thanks. I had left some medication in the refrig and called to see if they had found it. They did and even though they didn't think they could get it out on that Friday, somehow they managed and it arrived at my home the next morning by 10 am. I was so impressed. We will stay at the Omni on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know other hotels, but...”
Reviews.Author: msspiderman
Reviews.Content: I suppose you'll get more comfort or luxury only at an even higher price...especially if you wanna stay close to Union Square. It's a 10 min. walk to Union Square and just around the corner of Chinatown so location is not bad but could be better. Rooms are very small and not offering much of a view, however, they are clean. The inhouse Restaurant is one of the best Steak houses in town and we liked it a lot! The staff is very friendly and helpful, they are used to tourists rather than business people and know everything about guided tours, rental cars (they act as an agent for Alamo/National) and so on. What I didn't get was the fact that they charge for the limo from the airport to the hotel some 130 bucks but when we asked for a cab from the hotel to the airport they offered the hotel limo for a flat fee of $50 -> so you somehow feel ripped off about the first ride... If we would go to SF again we will definitely check other 4 star+ hotels aswell and try to find a good deal with some of the more well known brands. We picked the Omni mainly because of the good ratings here at tripadvisor and honestly, we haven't been really disappointed but expected more based on the very good ratings.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act......”
Reviews.Author: Clubu
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni is an efficient, attentive, and welcoming group of individuals. The check-in took 2 minutes and the woman who checked us in paid attention to the simplest detail. She noticed my dress on a hanger and asked if we were there for a wedding. We casually explained that we were celebrating our wedding with our family on the West Coast. Upon entering our room after a quick jaunt shopping, we found champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a card in our room. The next day when my husband realized at the last possible moment that he needed his shoes shined, they were shined and returned in ten minutes! Every time we walked in we were greeted with a "Hello" and a smile by at least 3 staff members. If you want to be treated well in San Francisco you will be very happy here. Also, it is located in a great area which is convenient to many attractions, shopping, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent option to visit san francisco”
Reviews.Author: krisBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel, we make a 14 days in advance reservation and we got quite a good price. The location is really good, quite, you can walk to Union Square, Columbus Street and the Italian quarter, etc. You get coffee for free until 11 am but THEY CHARGE QUITE A LOT FOR INTERNET! This is something they should change and at least offer some minutes of cortesy if you are a guest in the hotel... Our room was really nice, big and SUPER CLEAN! Perhaps it's true that at the beginning we perceived a funny smell but we opened the windows and it was over after some hours..... If we visit San Francisco again, this hotel will be one of our first options for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MCOELHO
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our room and the staff were outstanding. Would come again. Very quiet and clean. Bed was so comfortable. They charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely #1 in San FRancisco”
Reviews.Author: razorHAWKll
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many top 4 and 5 star hotels in San Francisco and other large cities and this definitely one of the BEST I have ever stayed in. The lobby is wonderful, the rooms are large and tastefully decorated! My room included a great breakfast that could be served in the restaurant or my room and it was first rate. I hate to add this BUT: My only negative is the internet service that was a third party in house computer that was $5.95 for the first 15 minutes, this did not go with this first class hotel and needs to be replaced with a free service. They had a free service for airline check in that did not work--it took me about 8 tries to get one boarding pass printer, then I gave up!

Reviews.Title: “All the positive reviews are right on. A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: barney50590
Reviews.Content: Booked the stay with my husband for one night to celebrate our anniversary - largely based on the great reviews I read here. I have to say - we agreed! Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and well-appointed rooms. Great location. Quiet. We had a wonderful visit and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravel94303
Reviews.Content: Location - Perfect! Close to China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, etc. Service - Exceptional! Entire staff was remarkable! Room - Very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “This was even better than i expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: charibear09
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for our two year anniversary, i chose this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. Let me tell you, we were not dissapointed!!! from the minute we stepped out of our taxi we had doormen opening the doors, helping us with our bags and greeting us so warmly! Thecheck-in process was so quick i could have blinked and missed it! there were fresh flowers all over the lobby and it was so beautiful with all the marble an the crystal chandeliers. As we made our way up to the 16th floor(i had called beforehand and requested a view, our room viewed part of the building next to us but also a good view of the bay, we could see Alcatraz island from our room!) i noticed that even the elvator was nice, and i dont like elevators! When we got to our room, i was very excited becuase after looking at the hotel photos online i had seen a room decor that i really liked better than the others,an we were in that exact room! White sheets and comforter with gold accents in the room, beautiful! there was a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us, along witha card congradulating us on our anniversary. Even the beds exceeded my exepectations, i didnt think they would be so comfortable but i fell asleep so quickly and i didnt want to get up in the morning! we signed up for select guest, so we had coffee and tea delivered to our room each morning, and the coffee was really good! I would suggest getting breakfast at the little bagel shop right next door, they make really good breakfast sandwiches, but they were not open on sunday. We loved our stay here and we will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni blew us away!”
Reviews.Author: CAHappyGirl
Reviews.Content: From the second we walked in the hotel we were thrilled!! The front desk agents were friendly and efficient. As we made our way to our rooms, every employee we encountered was friendly and welcoming!! The rooms were very clean, the decor was nice and the bathrooms were lovely! Every time we left the hotel, the bellmen were a highlight, upbeat, friendly and at our service. The location is awesome, just a short walk to North Beach and Chinatown with easy access to the cable and street cars. I booked at the Omni for a weekend with 7 of my high school friends to celebrate our 40th. I signed up for the select guest program and we received comp beverages each morning. When we returned from our first day touring, they had put champagne, cake and chocolate covered strawberries in our room along with a lovely card!! It just started our trip with a bang and even without this we felt so welcome but this was over and above anything we could have expected!! I found a fabulous rate for all 8 of us on their website. They beat the rate of other luxury hotels by a long shot. We parked at St. Mary's around the corner and saved a mint. Between the employees and the beauty of the hotel, you won't go wrong with the Omni!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice old style hotel near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Ligers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of a week long California trip. The hotel was very nicely furnished - lots of tassles and oriental carpeting. The room was ok in size, but we did not have a great view (looked out onto an office building). I was glad that we were 2 blocks from Chinatown, but I didn't like the downtown office location (no one really walking around at night). It is right across from the Bank of America building where you can go up to the top floor for drinks and a nice view of the city on a clear night. We had room service, which the kids really enjoyed. Food arrived quickly and was still hot when it came. We were going to have breakfast in the hotel dining room, but the $25 charge for 2 eggs and bacon changed our mind. This is a nice hotel - accomodating to families. I'm sure there are better bargains out there. Valet parking was $48/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff, well located, great food, well maintained...what else can one ask for?!! 3 nights here and I had a wonderful time. Would come back here any time. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Will certainly recommend it. You have to have a meal at their main restaurant. It was a great experience. I had dinner on my first night and the service, food, wine, ambiance.....great!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a bit oppressive?”
Reviews.Author: LentonFamily
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the omni for just one night at the end of a long holiday , there's no denying the rooms were spotless, the hotel beautiful and the staff super attentive. For us however it was almost too attentive to be comfortable . Our double queen room was pretty small ( smaller than the room we'd had in the francis drake at the start of our holiday) and at the end of a long corridor through a closed door which my daughter found 'spooky , large dark heavy furniture and heavy drapes ( including around the bath) didn't help'. The location though close to chinatown is very quiet for walking from in the evening. I am sure it's a perfect hotel for many but as a family who like convenience as well as comfort it wasn't right for us. If you like to travel by taxi, want to be looked after and don't mind paying the very high prices for 'extras' it's a great deal .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for family of 4 with 2 toddlers”
Reviews.Author: London_UKNeil
Reviews.Content: Can't fault them, if a bit pricey - but you get what you pay for. We had a 4 night stay, 2 during the week regular and 2 'family package' continued on. The hotel linked the bookings to avoid room changing. The room was well equipped, with double bed and enough space for our 2 travel cots. Breakfast was great but not included, fantastic blueberry pancakes - better than naff UK/European breakfasts! Again expensive but it is a quality hotel. We found the portions big enough to share. There was a kids menu as well inc. pancakes, which our 2 year old loved. Overall the hotel were very attentive to our kids, they received a baby bag (backpack) with plastic milk cup and some kids items. Again the kids loved it. For us we could use the cups supplied for free milk refills in the hotel restaurant so could avoid using room service or finding a grocery store for whole milk. We also ran into a lovely small kids playpark just uphill past the Fairmount - very useful to keep the kids entertained between our sightseeing schedule. If we return to SF the Omni will be our first choice again - great stay and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with superb staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: emmet1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a trip to california for two and a half weeks.We chose the Omni SF for a three night stopover to savour the delights of San Francisco. Our choice of the Omni was based both on the wonderful experience we had last year in its sister the omni berkshire in new York and the excellent reviews kindly posted by other visitors to this hotel on trip advisor. And wow we were not dissapointed-from beginning to end the omni SF was excellent in every way . Astoundingly central location- walked everywhere ,to chinatown in five mins ,union square not much more,little italy in ten ,city lights book store and vesuvius bar in same.Brilliant and all safe to walk with no threat . The staff could only be described as superb and a credit to the Omni hotel .Welcoming ,accomodating ,helpful in every way and just generally cheerful and desiring to make our stay with them superb. From the concierge to the check in staff to the doormen and bell men they were outstanding. Our room was smart ,elegant and had everything we could ask for . Great downstairs bar too and lovely treats available for the kids to join us . It oozes class but not in an in your face way .Made our 19,17 and 13 year old kids feel comfortable without at all being ostentatious . This hotel has it in every way . Suffice to say two thinkgs. 1...I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel or recommend it to anyone. and 2...it was so good that we will not stay anywhere but an omni whenever we visit the states again . If anyone from the Omni SF is reading this -take a bow -you were brilliant and made our holiday and stay in sf supreme A thousand thanks from a happy irish family . well done

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and personal attention”
Reviews.Author: TallTaste
Reviews.Content: We traveled there on the last week of July on our first trip to San Francisco and were extremely pleased. The hotel lacks some amenities; but they make up for it with outstanding service and location. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: kayhawk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni SF was great, we enjoyed the hospitable service and the location. Having the Cable Car right outside the door is definitely convenient and the Concierge recommended getting the 3-day pass ($18) which allowed us to ride the cable car/street car/bus system anywhere in the city. Our room was a bit noisy with the elevator adjacent, but we became accustomed to the humming sound. The room was large with a king-sized bed and a sofa sleeper for our pre-teen. We found the turn-down service inconsistent and our son only received his "milk and cookies" one night of the 4 we stayed. Maybe you had to be in the room when the housekeeper came by? Room Service and housekeeping service were very prompt and courteous when called upon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great with kids”
Reviews.Author: gatorgirlforever
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right up there with the Ritz without the price. The staff was so nice, from booking the hotel to arriving and arranging cookies and milk to be delivered nightly to the kids. What a treat. The workout room was great. The trolly car stopped right out front. Considering we had children we decided it was good to ride the trolly car one day, but faster and cheaper to take a cap from that day forward. They have a store called Napa Ranch next door. Great for a small breakfast. Sear Fine Foods, up the street, was better for a large breakfast. The hotel staff was wonderful however, Taufique was very helpful. He helped with booking our rooms and making us feel welcome when we arrived weeks later. He helped with things to do and gave us great recommendations. From reservations to check out he was there. Thank you Taufique!!! The Omni in San Francisco made our week long trip great! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSB25
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff Elegant rooms and lobby Perfect housekeeping - the room was spotless (and I am very fussy!) Quiet and peaceful Good location near China Town and North Beach A faultless experience - the most professional, friendly staff we encountered on our trip to the USA

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its high ranking for SF!”
Reviews.Author: buttery
Reviews.Content: In spite of the fact that we were staying over a very busy weekend (the front-desk staff mentioned that the hotel was completely booked), everyone, from doormen to cleaning staff we happened to pass in the hall, was friendly, professional, and efficient. Our room met every expectation: it was exceptionally clean, spacious (for a hotel in the city), tastefully decorated, and had thoughtful little touches here and there – like the glass jar in the bathroom with sealed packets of cotton swabs and cotton balls, in case you’d forgotten to pack your own. And even though the hotel was full, the room was exactly of the kind I’d requested in my Select Guest profile. The room was also well soundproofed; once in a while we’d hear a door opening or closing in the hallway, but mostly there was silence, broken only by the occasional, lovely sound of the cable car bell as it passed up California St. The hotel is near the Financial District, which means that the area is quieter at night and on weekends. So if you’re looking for something at the center of the city’s action, then this is probably not for you. However, it was only a short distance away from the hubbub of the high-density tourist areas: about 10 minutes walking to Union Square & shopping, around 20-30 minutes to the SFMOMA and Asian Art Museums, and also has easy access to streetcars, buses, and the BART subway system. Hopefully they’ll equip all rooms with wifi at some point. For now, it’s only available on a few floors (with higher-priced rooms), and upon arrival we had some inconvenient fumbling with cables and such before we got the internet running. But even with this little exception, I’d love to stay here on my next visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Great Location, Excellent Staff, Great Rate, but Expensive Extras”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem0626
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for overall quality, downtown location, excellent staff, and amazingly comfortable bed. But calculate your "extras" ahead of time. $48/night to park your car; $20 for two scoops of ice cream, $26pp for American breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - thumbs up from our 2 year old.”
Reviews.Author: Sphrrt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great property to start with and then the staff adds a huge plus that few properties can match. We walked in the door with our two year old and one of the bellman rushed off and presented her with a "special backpack" filled with kids toys which was followed that evening by cookies and milk before bedtime, need less to say, our daughter was thrilled by the whole bit. For us, the hotel was located in an ideal location, not too busy, but easy to access the rest of the city via the California Cable Car line and any number of buses in addition to the trolleys and BART just a few blocks further away. The room was very pleasant and the bed was perfect, the only complaint at all was that we did get a bit of city noise through the windows, fortunately it was just enough to put and keep our daughter to sleep! All in all a real gem of a hotel in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lisaud
Reviews.Content: The service at all levels was superb and the room was comfortable and clean and rather elegant. We paid $207 per night (AAA rate) and it was well worth it. In fact, if it was a "view hotel" (it overlooks downtown), it would have undoubtedly been half again as much if not more. Nothing is perfect but given what we paid and the fact that its a four-star (not five) hotel, I really have no complaints whatsoever and would stay there again in a heart beat. Definitely sign up for the Select Guest Loyalty Program; you can get a number of complimentary items that would otherwise incur a charge and there's nothing to lose by doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phantom8
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I spent three nights here.  I have to say that it is the first time that we've had a flawless trip.  The hotel, and all of the staff, were certainly well above what we expected.  From the moment we arrived, we felt like we were royalty.  The doormen, bell staff, front desk staff, and restaurant staff, were all very friendly and helpful.  The room was nice and clean.  The beds were very comfortable, and we hardly heard any noise.  Housekeeping was very attentive, and did a fantastic job. The hotel restaurant was very nice and the food great. The hotel is located in the Financial District, and very convenient to San Francisco attractions.  I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citydetective
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in July at the Omni. Our room on the 17th floor was well appointed and very comfortable. Staff were extremely helpful, very knowledgable and nothing was too much effort for them. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the city on foot or by bus. I am very fussy and could find no issue with this establishment. If booking a trip to Alcatraz Island do as we did and book well in advance from home to ensure you secure the dates you want.

Reviews.Title: “bad restaurant, no room window, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: travelbagina
Reviews.Content: The restaurant was bad. Stay away unless you're starving or just want a beer. It seems that some rooms look into a hole between the neighboring building and the hotel. The roof at the bottom of this hole is slanted so if you're unlucky you could get a room with a window that's blocked. And at the very least all of the rooms that look into this hole don't get any sunlight. They don't ave wifi. I've never stayed in the 4 star hotel that didn't have wifi - and they try to charge $10 a day for wired internet access - rip offffff.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay - Fabulous service, lovely rooms, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mijama38
Reviews.Content: I am delighted with our stay at the Omni Hotel. We felt looked after - like it was home. We had 4 nights there only 1 week ago. From the moment we pulled up and were greeted by Darrell the doorman, who was warm and humourous to my son, to the time we checked out, I give this hotel top marks. It was easily 4 star+. The service was excellent - the doormen, the front desk, the conceirges, the bellman. Nothing is too much trouble. There are complimentary drinks & fruit in the late afternoons in the front lobby which we had when we checked in. It was the most welcoming check-in I think I have ever had. My son got milk & cookies brought to our room as well. Our room was beautiful, with 2 queen beds and a marble bathroom. As we had one 11 year old child, it was big enough for the 3 of us, (we hadn't found that in some of our other accomodation whilst in the US.) It was quiet & had dark enough curtains so we slept really well. It had great beds & linen, free internet, complimentary tea and coffee and a mini bar. We got great advice when we asked for transport assistance or places to eat. The location of this hotel is great for catching cable cars & getting to Union Square. It is in the financial district but that is one of the reasons it is classy and quiet after hours. (As opposed to Fishermans Wharf which was insanely noisy.) Even when we checked out, I had to wait in the lobby for 2 hours due to delays with our car rental. My luggage was supervised, I was checked on, I got the use of the phone at the conceige desk & was even entertained. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, we loved San Francisco and can't wait to go back. I can only echo the other raves about the Omni San Francisco. The rooms are lovely, the staff goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable, problem-free, and comfortable. The location is fantastic. We didn't have room service but did have a steak in the restaurant, which was quite good and equal to most NY steak houses (except Peter Lugers for you steak lovers out there).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, relaxing, catering and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed at the Omni for one evening before proceeding onto Palo Alto. This was our second stay at this Omni. From the moment you arrive, staff is outstanding and catering. They don't just talk service, they walk service! Fragrant flowers and a beautiful lobby greet guests. Our room was beautiful and quite clean. I would have given a five star (excellent) rating had it not been our room location, immediately off the elevators and on the Montgomery side. Guest noise from the elevators, a quite vocal and inebriated local shouting at the top of his lungs from midnight until 1am on the the Montgomery side and early morning (9am) vacuuming right outside our door (despite a privacy please sign), left us with a less than rest-filled evening. But, the location of this hotel (on the California trolley line), a short walk from the F line for quick access to the Wharf or, if you are inclined as were we, a longer scenic walk to the Wharf and onto Ghiradelli's, plus the hotel's catering staff and beautiful ambiance would lead me to it's doors yet again when I am in the San Francisco area. Also just a block away is a Walgreen's and, our favorite, Jamba Juice! A $50 per night parking fee (for your car) seems high but is likely the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: napple
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It's officially a four star but it's significantly better than may 5* hotels I've stayed in. It's almost at four seasons level for service and quality of amenities. The hotel is located on California street which is close to all the best of downtown San Francisco and it's lovely to come out of the hotel and see the historic cable cars rolling by. The public areas are very nicely finished and fell very luxurious. The welcome from the staff was also very warm. The room was a nice size and the bathroom was really beautiful. The bed was also extremely comfortable. The hotel has free wifi also which is welcome. On checkout, everything went smoothly and the door staff were very helpful. I booked this hotel on hotwire and it only cost $120 for the night. This was an absolute bargain for a hotel of this standard. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: mandlinsocal
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the previous reviews. We stayed 2 nights and did decide to go for the signature room which was beautiful. We were greeted at the curb upon arrival by friendly staff who we found helpful throughout the entire stay. They freely offered us suggestions, all of which we took. The guy who brought our bags up suggested a good breakfast place within walking distance and a place within easy walking distance where we could go for drinks at sunset before dinner that had a romantic panoramic view. The hotel is also right around the corner from Chinatown and the weather was nice so we were able to walk there and do some shopping. We had dinner (Filet and Sea Bass, both very good) at Bob's Steak & Chop House at the hotel which I recommend if you're not on a budget. Room service was also good. The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: 123DFW
Reviews.Content: The Omni is an amazing hotel. While the hotel itself is very luxurious, the staff, especially Sarah at the front desk, really set the Omni apart. They are unfailingly polite, helpful, smiling and enthusiastic to serve. Do yourself a favor and stay here. Everything works and the staff are really intent on making your stay at the Omni and in San Francisco something you will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in the City”
Reviews.Author: ServiceMinded
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Omni - the first time we were singularly impressed but thought perhaps we just got lucky. On this second visit, it was confirmed this is one of the best hotels in the City! The staff is dedicated, well-trained, genuinely friendly and helpful. They seemed sincerely interested in attending to your every need. The rooms were sparkling clean and well-appointed. The service, however, is what sets the Omni head and shoulders apart from other San Francisco hotels - much better than we received at The Palace, for example. We only stayed one night this second time, but this will be our hotel of choice on our next visit, and we are also so pleased that we are hoping to hold our next corporate retreat at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Start To A Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Izadora
Reviews.Content: We experienced a fantastic welcome from the staff from the very moment we stepped in the hotel after a very long flight from the UK. Fortunately for us, as we were honeymooning we were upgraded to a suite but the whole ambience of the hotel was wonderful. The hotel is ideally located, and main attractions are easily reached by either walking, tram or a short cab ride. I can only report positive things about this hotel, and was very sad to leave on the next leg of our journey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "grown up" hotel...but great for kids too!”
Reviews.Author: Bruin97
Reviews.Content: I am often surprised by how the nicer hotels make children feel unwelcome. I know some kids are noisy and unruly, but for the most part well disciplined children shouldn't be made to feel like they don't belong. The Omni was the exact opposite. Upon our arrival, we were greeted at the door by a friendly lady who presented little goodie bags to my two boys. Nothing fancy, but one of the toys in there kept my 6 year old son busy for much of our trip. It was a very nice touch. Also the cookies and milk left in our room the first night was very sweet. The hotel is beautiful, nice clean rooms and has a great staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the Trip Advisor Rating--Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria35
Reviews.Content: Half of the time I don’t trust a ranking on Trip Advisor. Everyone has a different opinion on what is important: free breakfast, spa services, pool, and parking. But we got a good rate at this hotel for a long weekend and I must say it deserves it’s high ranking. The rooms were very clean. The staff is excellent(I swear they were so polite and sorry when their cleaning carts were in the hall) front desk, bellmen, and front door people helping with the cars. The beds were comfortable, sheets and towels first rate. Big quiet room, except for the trolley car that runs outside—but once the noise was identified did not keep us awake. The other things that were high lights--- NO fluorescent bulbs, an actually 3-way regular light bulb so you could see to read. NO annoying cards asking you to save the planet and the hotel money by not washing your sheets and towels. A small spray starch bottle that came with a charge but it was appreciated. Not having to sign for coffee service. My husband is a member of the Omni club, and it is easy to join and you get some freebies—like newspapers and coffee. The only thing I can complain about is that the room didn’t have wifi—so only one laptop could be used with the modem in the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: Just want I expect from the Omni! Great service, super location, first class room. A real value for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: CWVirginian
Reviews.Content: This is a great location at the corner of Montgomery and California, directly across from the Wells Fargo headquarters. Hotel bar made me a killer Mojito, but it was a bit pricey at $14. Room rate was $200/night. My colleague was able to get his shirt dry cleaned at 10:00pm after spilling some red wine...he picked it up in the lobby the next morning at 9:00am. I can't think of ever having been able to expect that kind of service before. Take a taxi to the Embarcadero at night for about $10 each way, there are some great restaurants on the water.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in one of the best places to visit.”
Reviews.Author: GC_USA
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location: it’s only a five minute walk to Chinatown, a five minute walk to the shopping district and about 15 minutes to the ferry building (next to Pier 1). If you’re going further afield there is a tram stop directly outside the hotel and the regular bus service stops can be found within a block. The lobby and reception area of the Omni were modern and tastefully appointed, a theme which was followed through to the bar and restaurant areas. The hotel room itself was spacious, clean and fairly well appointed with nice decor, a modern flat screen LCD TV and cordless phone. The only negative point was that the housekeeping service seemed a little off the pace with drinking glasses not being replaced with clean items and in-room tea & coffee making facilities that were never fully replenished - I lost count how many calls I made downstairs in order to resolve these little niggles. Apart from that, the service given by the rest of the Omni’s staff was first class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni has it all.”
Reviews.Author: HazelEyesFromTN
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a trip through California with my mom. At the end of our trip we stayed 3 nights at the Omni. It was the BEST of all the hotels we stayed at and I feel I booked some nice hotels. There was always a doorman and Darryl is the best of ALL. They were polite and would say welcome back. Darryl would even ask how your outing was. The front desk always said hello to me and my mom as we descended the stairs in the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable. The bath was very nice indeed. The room service was excellent in taste and value. My mom liked the tea they used so much I had to go online to order some for her. I personally loved the blueberry muffins with honey. Some people might say $4 plus tax and gratuity is expensive but go try to buy one at another establishment. It would cost about the same and is not near the quality or quantity. I have traveled coast to coast about 45 times and abroad twice, some was business and some pleasure. Some of the hotel/motels cost $40 a night and some $500. In those stays I have NEVER encountered the service as I did at the Omni San Francisco. I even took mom inside 3 big name hotels at the Wharf to compare our value and we knew we had made the right decision immediately. None of the hotels had a doorman available, the concierge was either aloof or rude (and yes I asked for 'directions'), and no one said hello as we entered. Also, when we left, I noticed there was no one to call a cab. I will say that we got spoiled on a refrigerator to store goodies in along our trip - as the Omni has items stored in theirs to buy, but it is overall TRIVIAL and I can't see myself staying anywhere else the next time I visit San Francisco. Lastly, yYou must try Bob's Chop House in the hotel. My mom had the Halibut which she said was better than a leading restaurant we ate at the night before. I had the crab cakes. They were excellent and I must say that the scallop potatoes with onions and peppercorn gravy served with a huge glazed carrot was superb. Thanks for a wonderful stay. My mom said it was her highlight hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: MissyWAlbuquerque_NM
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and friendly. Great staff-doormen, front desk,housekeeping etc.The concierge went "above and beyond" to make arrangements for us to tour the city in a helicopter. The room (California Suite) #720 was great. Corner room with floor to ceiling windows. Bed and linens were way above average quality. Room safe simple to use. Most anything you might need was in the room.Robes,even an umbrella, but thankfully it did not rain. Did not eat here, so I can't comment on the food. Small business center available for printing boarding passes etc. Overall a top rate, first class hotel. Can't imagine ever staying anywhere else in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer care at a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mjtraveler22
Reviews.Content: I just finished my first stay in an Omni Hotel, and I am very impressed. This San Francisco hotel is marvelously located because you can easily walk to Chinatown, North Beach (the Italian part of town), the Westfield mall, Curran theatre, the Embarcadero & Ferry Building, etc. The trolley runs by the front door. And of course, there is a Starbucks every half block and a Jamba Juice nearby so you can get coffee as well as an oatmeal breakfast. The beds are very comfortable, the bathroom counters spacious, and bathrobes are provided. If you ask for a wake-up call, a real person calls you in the morning. The front desk is efficient and friendly. The doormen and valets are the same. The fitness center is well-equipped with Precor equipment including 5 treadmills, 2 recumbent bicycles, and several ellipticals. The key to having a really great stay is to join the Omni Select Guest program. Then you get internet free, and they deliver the NYT or WSJ in the morning along with coffee and juice. The downsides to this hotel are (1) parking with tax is about $54 per night, but that's pretty much a standard SF hotel rate. (2) The furnishings in the room are not top notch. The wall decor is pretty sparse, the Sharp flat panel TV has the slowest channel changer I've seen in a long time, and the nightstands are flimsy. (3) The rooms only have wired internet access. Wireless is only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best experiences ever.”
Reviews.Author: macdog67
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to the entire team at the Omni. We celebrated our anniversary at this hotel and what an experience. The hotel was beautiful and the customer service was perfect. I would recommend to anyone traveling and wanting to be treated like family.. we have always stayed at the Hyatt or Marriott. We will be back.. Thanks again....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location if you have young children”
Reviews.Author: michala
Reviews.Content: this hotel is comfortable, very clean, and well located in san francisco. We have three young children and our room had two double beds and a double sofa bed which meant we all slept comfortably with lots of room. We had two tvs/desk/safe/mini bar etc and an amazing bathroom with marble fittings. This hotel is quiet at night at the weekend and the financial area is clean and well maintained. Yet the cable car runs infront of the hotel/china town begins behind the hotel/union square is a 15min walk to the right and the ferry building/coit tower steps and the piers are roughly a 15min walk to the left. Seven minutes exactly straight on takes you to Market St and lots more Muni bus/Bart options. I have read on the forum that this location is not favourable but i totally disagree. Union Square was so noisy and with a tramp on almost every corner was not for young children. Fishermans Wharf was great if you like a Blackpool type area - we were glad we didnt stay there. If you like to be close but not too close to the main areas this is for you. Extra children's goodies included backpack with goodies in and first night cookies and milk. Tips negotiate a parking deal for around $30pn or park opposite sat/sun till 4am only for $7 per day. Join select guests to get free internet and coffee/juice in the morning. Could be improved by milk cookies every night for kids see their disappointed face when you get in on the second night and its not there - cruel. Cheaper parking automatically when you book why should you have to bargain for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lorilou88
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco May 21-26, 2009. The Omni Hotel, San Francisco was a great choice of hotel for us as this was our firt trip to San Francisco. We found it to be conveniently located, nicely decorated, polite and professional staff - and most import - clean, well maintained and really comfortable beds in the rooms! Staff was very helpful, and went out of their way to make sure that they were of assistance to us. You can walk to many of the city's attractions from this hotel (the hills are a killer!!) and the California Line trolley is right outside the door, walking distance to BART (which we took from the airport for $5.35 per person without any problem) and nearby to China Town and Union Square. One small drawback - the steakhouse- Bob's was very pricey and while we expected that to be the case, the food was really not quite up to the prices they charged. It was very good, the wait staff was wonderful. I would say the food, while the quality of it was above average, but certainly not outstanding and worth the price of the meal we had there. But, all in all, it was a very nice stay and I would most certainly stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: foodcritic2
Reviews.Content: We completed our honeymoon in San Francisco and looked forever to find the perfect hotel! We couldn't ask for a better find! From the moment we arrived the doorman kindly greeted us and wouldn't let us carry a thing! The hotel is absolutely beautiful (the lobby and the rooms). The location is perfect...easy walk to many fun spots. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Slobunny
Reviews.Content: The Omni staff is professional. They have courtesy down to a science. Our stay was too short. We have found our favorite hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Picked a Better Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIBPIB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the feel of a grand hotel. Its location is perfect. We got the kids suite after reading about it on this site. Its an adjoining suite with bunk beds and a puppet theater and kids sized robes and bathroom. MY KIDS LOVED IT and so did we. The charge for parking is ridiculous- but if you park across the street at St. Mary's it was only $7.00. Everyone in the hotel is super friendly and really professional.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels in SF”
Reviews.Author: kwongsangwho
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I come to San Francisco several times a year for work. I either stay at the Hilton, Financial District or Omni. My preference is the Omni. The view at the Hilton is better, but the Omni is more QUIET, clean and friendly. The service is far better than the Hilton. The rooms at the Omni do not have a modern feel, but the beds are extremely comfortable, and the bathrooms are extremely clean. The lobby is very impressive. However, I do have two complaints. The parking at the hotel is $50. If you do not need a car, do not drive to this hotel. Besides, the cable cars are right outside the hotel, or you can walk to many sights. The other complaint is that there is no shopping around the hotel. Everytime I come to San Francisco, I have a long shopping list from friends and family. After working all day, I don't want to travel too far to buy gifts. My wife is a chocolate and wine freak, and I have to walk over to Kearny and Jackson Street to buy Napa wines from this California shop.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: JTRSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights at the hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful giving hints and tips on what to see and where to shop. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet. Location is excellant near the Ferry Building, Chinatown and the main shopping area with good transport links. Only downside was the first meal in the hotel restaurant - expensive and not particularly tasty but lots of excellant restaurants nearby - especially Perbacco and Kokkari Esatoria.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Omni in SF and loved every minute of it. Worst part was the wedding party that got a little rowdy in the elevators, but my room was peaceful the entire time. Location was convenient to the Financial District. Breakfast was placed in front of my door every morning so that I could eat it when I wished but was not woken up by room service if I needed more sleep. Fitness center was all mine every day. Parking was a problem as there is none. I had to use a public lot. Room was smallish but elegant. I understand this hotel charges a lot more $$$ than it used to. For under $250/night it is a steal. Over that, I might consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Familytripper32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April and had a fantasttic time. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The doormen (particularly Barney) were very helpful - more like a concierge service. Bar and restaurant were a bit pricey but the food was very good and we really did not get the carrot thing! If we ever visit SF again we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: carabrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Fran. with husband and two children. Omni staff was helpful and very nice. Our room although on the small size (but expected that w/ a hotel) was very clean and the bathroom was spotless and large enough for our family. The location suited us just fine..no big hills to deal with when grabbing a quick bite for breakfast and easy enough with the baby in stroller. The complimentary starbucks coffee in the morning was a plus. We were close to everything and it was easy to get everywhere..we toured the whole city (mostly by foot..we live in NYC so are used to walking!) Again, the staff was extremely helpful especially when we rented a car and they helped us lug our car seat and stroller to the car. We were very very happy with our stay at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieBenean
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay at this hotel only bad thing I can say is the parking fee $50 from memory. Staff wonderful , rooms clean. In a business part of town walking distance to Chinatown but not close to Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home (or better)”
Reviews.Author: rhonda409
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Omni is elegant. The lobby, the elevators, the hallways are, to me, much like coming home to an elegant townhouse. The staff is excellent, the rooms are heaven. I don't often write reviews, but as I sit here in my room I just felt compelled to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice”
Reviews.Author: rrruby
Reviews.Content: I got in very, very, late due to a late flight. Even though it was late, staff was there to help me with my suitcase and with the door. Very, very good staff, and staff involved in the event were top shelf. Event catering was great, and the food was good! Great room with a great bed. Turndown service is standard, and staff leaves little notes on the stationary (using my name) wishing me a good day. In-room internet is free if you sign up for the loyalty program. If you're going to stay in San Francisco, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and room in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: gwizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at htis hotel for the 2nd time and it was as outstanding as our first visit. The location is great, within walking distance of everything and right on the cable car line. We booked a king room adjoining a kids fantasy suite. The kids room was outfitted by Pottery Barn. It had a set of twin bunk beds with kids bedding, blankets, quilts, etc. Bean bags, a comfy chair, a small couch, books, stuffed animals, small table and chairs, mini fridge with kid amenities all reasonably priced, stools for bathroom counters and mini robes. The doormen, Barney & Hugo, are very kind and helpful. The service at this hotel is very attentive. Rooms is sapcious and clean. If you stay in a room that does not face California street it is really quiet. Omni select member program provides dailey beverage and paper each morning, They also have a small breakfast selection that can be delivered with your beverage and it is less money and good quality for room service. Upon check in kids can receive fun bags. This is mostly a business hotel but has some amenities for families and is accomodating yet not over run with kids everywhere. You can walk three blocks to Chinatown, we walked all the way up and down Columbus to the Pier and visited parks along the way. Union square is about a seven block walk. I would recommend the California Academy of Sciences as a 1/2 day event. It is the new aquarium, rainforest, museum, planetarium and living rooftop exhibit. Great restaurants in the area: Hang An for chinese food on Clay, NorthBeach pizza delivers to the hotel, there is now a Cheesecake Factory in Union square, and many great Italian Places in North Beach to eat. Tried Tadich Grill, recommended as local spot near hotel....server was snooty, food was just average, prices very high. The steak was good but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay....Kid Friedly too”
Reviews.Author: jgc1972
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and daughter decided to all go together for a quick 1 day trip up to SF for business. My daughter (who is 7) had never been on a business trip with her dad or San Francisco for that matter...so I decided to try and find a place that was kid friendly. After searching many hotels I decided to try out the Kids Suite at the Omni. It was also located across the street from my meeting so it made sense at the time. As suites go the rate was comparable....as to value....priceless!!! When we arrived, the front desk described to me the way the suite was laid out...essentially two rooms joining each other through a common door. When we came upstairs and my daughter opened her room...she walked in with amazement. Bunk beds, stuffed animals, overstuffed couch, books, kid mini bar, bean bags, and the list goes on. She was immediately at home...and smiling...which made us smile. The next day when we decided to check out, we mentioned to the front desk how wonderful our stay was....and told them about Rufus...the stuffed dog my daughter fell in love with....a good touch to keep kids happy. We left to tour China town...about 3 hours later we returned and Justin (who was working the front desk at the time) noticed we came back for our bags...and when my fiancee came through the lobby about 10 minutes later before we got into the hotel limo...Justin handed her a key to the room and told her to go back upstairs and get "Rufus" the dog.....his reasoning was quite simple. "WE WANT OUR GUESTS TO BE PERFECTLY HAPPY" What a great way to end the trip. My daughter loves that dog....it made her experience in SF unforgetable...and we came home with a nice souvenir. We have decided the OMNI is our new home base in SF.... Thanks again Justin.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: realeyes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful Valentine's Day at the Omni San Francisco! We stayed in a gorgeous and spacious deluxe King room with City views. The room was beautifully appointed, and the bed was plush and comfortable! I loved the personalized welcome note from Marina the housekeeper. The door and bell staff, especially Sam, were all attentive and helpful. Taufique and Justin at the front desk were funny, friendly, and professional. They both made sure that a special request I had made to surprise my boyfriend was handled perfectly! The location of the hotel is perfect, walking distance to North Beach and Chinatown. And the recommendation for brunch at Cafe de La Presse was wonderful! Thank you for a memorable Valentine's Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: StuMcBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco in July / August 2008 after being in Berkeley for a few days. Since my girlfriend was on a conference in Berkeley, I travelled into San Francisco on BART one day and found my bearings and the Omni.
