We were planning on arriving before the advertised check-in time, so I thought I would inform the hotel and see if there was anything they could do for us? I was promptly informed that it would not be a problem and a note would be put on our booking giving us priority. When we actually made it to San Francisco we were greeted by a very friendly and courteous porter who took our bags and directed us to the check in desk. Check in was swift and as requested, our room was ready early. As the porter took us up in the lift he gave us some local information, this was much appreciated. Upon showing us the room, we were very impressed by the size and comfort. The room (standard) was quiet, serviced regularly (with evening turn-down) and very comfortable. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with everything from local information to cinema listings and restaurant reservations (The Cheesecake Factory). Never ate breakfast or any meals at the hotel restaurant as we wanted to explore and try local cafes and restaurants. Location was not a problem (in the financial district - a bit away from main shopping area), as we quite enjoyed navigating the hills / tram cars / grid system and exploring the city as we went! Would definitely recommend as a top hotel in San Francisco - can't wait for next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as Usual”
Reviews.Author: samsara3
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time we have stayed att his hotel and the service has been superb each time. My daughter, who is 8, loved the kid friendly attitude of the staff. The location cannot be beat because it is close enough to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach without being too far from Ferry Building and Market Street Malls. Also, it is very reasonably priced if you compare to other similar properties.

Reviews.Title: “Perect place to stay on your honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: bardel98
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni in late Ocotber'08 as part of our honeymoon and we can't speak highly enough of it. We arrived weary from our long trek from Ireland but once we got to the hotel the staff were lovely to us and they had upgraded us as we were honeymooners. We ordered room service shortly after checking in which arrived quickly and overall we found the staff could not have done enough for us. On our second night the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a lovely congratulaory card on our wedding. This was such a lovely gesture and another morning we were rushing for our alcatraz cruise so they organised a free lift for us to the pier. We loved every minute of our stay. Our room was fantastic so clean and comfortable, the staff were so lovely, the food so good that the Omni was the best possible place to start our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best New Year Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle0110
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the California Suite New Year's Eve and it was WonderFUL!! They were very kind and courteous. The staff was very attentive and helped made suggestions for dinner. Overall, it was the best new year ever!!! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four-Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently travel to San Francisco and usually stay in different hotels of the same chain but in different parts of the city. This time we wanted to try another chain and based on so many rave reviews the Omni received booked there. Usually I agree with Trip Advisor's contributors for the most part but not this time. This is what you should expect and what you pay for in a four-star hotel. If you like "old elegance" this is the place for you. The location is great and the area around the hotel is very clean. We booked a sigature room based on the reservations agent description of it. It was not worth the extra money. It was on the sixteenth floor and overlooked Montgomery St but was so high you couldn't see the street, just old rooftops. There was no advantage in being so high up but the major disadvantage was the long waits for elevators. We found the staff to be very nice. Housekeeping was OK- skipped our room once so we didn't have our room done until after we left for the evening. Some days we recceived the number of towels we should have and other days we didn't. We received the fresh fruit and bottled water two of the four days. There were not many hotel guests while we were there. When I booked our room I inquired about the "in-room" safe size and was told my 15.4" laptop would fit in it. This was not the case and everytime we went out we had to take it to the front desk to be locked in security and then wait again to retrieve it upon return - a major inconvenience. When we first discovered this upon checking in we spoke to the on-duty manager who said they were in the process of renovating the rooms and the renovated rooms will receive larger safes. He did not offer to move us to a renovated room nor compensate us with a complementary breakfast or the like for our inconvenience. The on-site restaurant is so over-priced it is comical. We had breakfast there twice and each time there was a major problem. We finally switched to room service - something we never do. . After we got home I checked our credit card bill and found some odd charge. I called the hotel and it was a mini bar charge, which we didn't use. Although it was immediately removed it was it was just another hassle. All in all we had a great trip but the hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in San Francisco. When we were there (fall 2008), quite a bit of rennovation was still going on in the lobby area so things like the restaurant and lounge were not totally available. However, despite that we really enjoyed our stay here. It seemed to be more of a place for business people. During the weekend we barely saw another person, but once Sunday night rolled around, it was crowded. We had a renovated room, which was stylish and comfortable. We had no complaints at all. Our view from the window was not good, but this didn't bother us. We were there during an unusually warm time and I felt the air conditioner could have worked better. It wasn't bad or unacceptable, but it was really the only non-stellar part of the stay. Since it was in the upper 80s, I doubt this would very often be any kind of issue. One great thing about the room besides the typical hotel amenities was that it had plenty of outlets so we could easily charge all our various electronics. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is totally convenient to the trolley cars and also some bus lines. We didn't have a car at all except our last day and had no issues getting around. This hotel does have somewhat high fees. The wifi was somewhat expensive (maybe $12) and the parking was very expensive ($20+ a day) so I would keep that in mind, but we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone desiring a comfortable and stylish base for their San Francisco trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BobandDeb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Emerald Bowl package which was fantastic! This included two tickets to the CAL football game and a very nice room. The staff was warm and friendly. We especially want to recognize Carmen who went above her job to make sure we had our questions about the game answered. The hotel bar was very nice, great bartender and waitress, but they do need a happy hour! If one existed, we weren't aware of it. The hotel is near many bars, restaurants, and shopping. We had a great time and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni...well it was pretty good anyway”
Reviews.Author: Ricardodesantaalbana
Reviews.Content: I booked through a conference website for $160/night including tax. The location is good, near to Union Square, China Town and the Coit Tower and on a tram line. I was initially not impressed since everything seemed expensive (e.g. $6 bottle of water in the room - I used the tap). Also I didn't bother with breakfast at $20 for continental and $26 for cooked (perfectly good Chinese deli next door). You just need to join "Select Guests" and not only do you get free internet access (not Wi-fi yet though) but you are also treated to a free 2 morning drinks (e.g. posh tea and grapefruit juice) and a "turndown" service (which I'd never heard of): you come home to find relaxing music on and ice in the wine cooler and a chocolate mint! Any problems I had were dealt with well (free internet help line) and overall a positive experience. I don't usually like these rather souless posh city hotels, but this was pretty good after early reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: arisis212
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel in a good location. Reasonably priced within financial district and short walk to Chinatown. Short distance to public transportation and cab rides are a short distance to tourist attraction. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: KingJohnUk
Reviews.Content: We are a little late with this review, we stayed during September 2008 We travel quite a lot for leisure and always try to find good value, we don’t expect quality to be compromised by the price, and this hotel did not fail in any way. We would have no hesitation is returning to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. We felt this hotel was quite special; we booked directly with the hotel and got a special rate. The hotel in a good location in the financial area, the cable cars pass the front door but it is only a short walk to most things. From the moment we pulled up at the front door we were made to feel welcome. The person on the door was friendly and helpful, looked after our luggage and introduced us to reception staff. In general we found all the door staff to be really nice. (Every time we entered or left the hotel there was a warm welcome,) Some hotels can be impersonal and cold, the Omni, however, was friendly and welcoming and although this was a reasonably large hotel we almost made to feel part of the family. Reception staff were lovely, as were all the staff throughout the hotel. The lady that serviced our room was cheerful, friendly, and professional in every way, The rooms were of a good size and were clean and tidy and well maintained, the bed was very comfortable, we had fantastic nights sleep, the rooms air conditioning was good and there were plenty of fluffy towels. The water in the bathroom was piping hot and the shower had plenty of pressure. All in all there are no complaints about this hotel but for us the staff made it an extra special place. We really want to thank for staff for their great work that made us feel so at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: MissTravel11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in an upgraded room, and it was heavenly! The bed.. oh my god.. I would love to have one at home, everything was perfect. The friendliness at the reception, the bell boy, door man, the bar... I cannot compliment them enough. We got some excellent dining tips from the lady at the hotel bar, and had one of the best meals I ever had in my life! I forgot my lap top in a taxi, and everyone helped me to get it back. The door man even lent us his mobile phone and sent ut to the bar while we waited for the taxi company to call us back. And, I got the lap top back, how lucky wasn't I??? Thank you so much for the best nights I ever had in a hotel, and I travel alot.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni is beautiful with great accomidations.”
Reviews.Author: ChadB70
Reviews.Content: I would say the front desk staff was very helpful getting us there over the phone. Check-in and check-out was very smooth. Overall they were very helpful and accomidating. Valet was great and they were very prompt both taking and bringing our car. We stayed in a really nicely furnished Suite. The internet was fast and had no problems the entire stay. Two flat screen tvs and a very nice compact stereo. The Room was spotless and the house keeping staff did a great job keeping the room up and helping us with special requests. I will definitly stay at this property again. My compliments to the Management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 8 nights. I knew about this hotel from when I lived in San Francisco and worked in the Financial District. We booked an entire vacation on Hotwire and paid a little more to stay at the Omni only because I'd always wanted to stay there. Little did I know what an experience we were in for. We checked in on Saturday night. Crystal at the front desk immediately upgraded us to a concierge floor room. She was genuinely friendly, professional and outgoing. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was elegantly furnished. The only drawback was that it seemed small. We were there for eight nights and we found that it lacked storage for all of our clothes. I think for a shorter stay, the room would've been absolutely perfect. From the bellman to the front desk attendants to the valets to the doormen to the room service people, the service was nothing less than spectacular. Everyone remembered our names, what room we were in, had our car waiting for us in a timely manner. We had breakfast at Bob's Steak House one morning. The french toast is to die for and the portions are big. Though the food seemed expensive, the portion size made up for the price. The room was appointed with a plasma TV, king size bed with down comforter. We had turn down service nightly with water and fresh fruit waiting for us when we returned from the day out. We had drinks of our choice and newpapers waiting at our door every morning. The hotel was originally a bank that was gutted and rebuilt in early 2000's. It was beautiful on the inside and out. It didn't seem overcrowded at all. As a matter of fact, it seemed nearly empty most of the time we were there. It is located on California Street @ Montgomery, on the California Street Cable Car Line and in the heart of the Financial District. I liked this location because it was out of the way of all of the tourist traps and it was nice to come home at night to a quiet, much more relaxed environment. Though we are planning to move back to San Francisco in the coming year, I do believe that I will stay at the Omni again before we move and I will definitely, definitely suggest it to anyone coming for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marbellany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 4 days and we had an excellent experience. Room was fantastic as well as service. Great location, I would definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: oklahomasooner00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Omni in San Francisco for 3 nights while we went on a wine tour in Sedona. The service was good, the rooms were fine, and it was an overall good experience. I have stayed in nicer hotels, but this was in a good location to sight seeing and shopping. The rooms were quiet and the beds were confortable enough. We did, however eat at the restaurnant downstairs for dinner and breakfast and had some issues. The food was good, but the service was not. Waiters were slightly rude and one night at dinner we had to go find the hostess to be seated. We stood there for over 15 minutes. Across the street there is a stop for the trolley and the bellman was good about helping us hail taxis. One night they even had the hotel car take us to the pier for our alcatraz tour. Overall we had a good experience at this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni - so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LondonHolidayQueen
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Omni. Everyone was so friendly and remembered our names:o) Check in was a breeze. Lovely, spotless hotel room. 2 nice beds and nice size bathroom. Greeted with a bottle of champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate as it was a birthday celebration - great touch! Housekeeping were never seen but left the room clean and tidy every day and left chocolates by the bed in the evening with the TV on a chill channel. Lex and the staff were always on hand for information, directions / hints and tips. Debora was also a star performer. Darryl the doorman was great - always took an interest in what we were doing and where we had been. Made suggestions of places to go to and places to avoid. Always very friendly and made us feel special. It made the hotel a welcome sight after being out all day. The hotel was in a great location - close to everything, walk to Union Square, Ferry Building, we walked to Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square, cable cars run past the front door etc. I wasn't too keen on the Pier 39 location - good to visit and see the sealions and found there were a lot of homeless people around Union Square area so this suited us just fine. Can't comment on the food in the hotel as we never ate there. Noah's do a great bagel in the morning - just along from the cable car turnaround. If I return to San Francisco - I'd stay here again like a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kk_2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on last leg of our honeymoon from Hawaii. Hotel was clean, comforatable, central location & 24 hr room service. All staff are very friendly...from the front desk to housekeeping leaving personal thank you notes from the tip we left in the room for her. Lex, the concierge is very knowledgable and helpful. They even gave us a late check out to 5pm no charge because we had a late flight. Its not a huge hotel with all the ammenities such as pool/spa, but its everything we needed. Bob's steak house which is attached to the hotel was very good...expensive, but good. We dined at both the restaurant as well as the bar. I signed up on Omni's website to be a member...well worth it...we received free coffee, juice, and newspaper every morning. Cable car is out front of the hotel and easy to get anywhere from this location. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaBG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni from October 24th to October 29th. We arrived very late on the 24th and were thrilled at the quick and easy way the whole check-in process was handled. Everyone we came in contact with were very happy and willing to help you in any way they could. Need to make a reservation for dinner, day trip, tour? All you had to do was ask the people at the front desk and they were very happy to provide all the information you might want and and make the arrangements for you. Had a partial bay view room, very nice size, perfect size bathroom didn't have any complaints about that at all. The hotel is in walking distance to the ferries that will take you over to Sausalito. Union Square, and Chinatown are within walking distance too. If you needed to catch a cab all you had to do was ask one of the doormen and you had one in a flash. There are always town cars out front too if you prefer a little more plush ride somewhere, not much more expensive than a cab and a lot nicer. I have to say I don't know what anyone would have to complain about when staying at this hotel. Would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cazi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept for 2 nights location, rooms and the staff where all excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JMdigital
Reviews.Content: This place has quickly become my hotel of choice in San Francisco. It's a wonderful location, and the staff is exceptional, top to bottom. From the start of your stay and your dealings with the front desk, through check-out and having the door man hail a cab, all in all you're treated with great care and attention to detail. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class in everything”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel with excellent location. Elegance and personal touch make this hotel the best choice in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!! It was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: MissyLZIllinois
Reviews.Content: Service, service, service!!! It was phenomenal. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. It was so very nice to be treated to such wonderful service. Another wonderful recommendation from previous Trip Advisor guests and one that I will highly recommend to others. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and when we got to the hotel, our room had been upgraded and I was handed a long stem red rose. Later on that night we received complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries that were left in our room. The concierge new perfect spots for us to try in our afternoon travel on foot. We were close enough to walk down to the warf and enjoy the open air market Tons to see and do we enjoyed every minute!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: Virg777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights (9/27 & 9/28) and had a most wonderful hotel experience. The rooms are on the small-ish side but the service and housekeeping were stellar! The front desk and concierge also went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. We arrived at noon, earlier than the 3pm check-in time, and the front desk found us an available room so we could check in right away. All our housekeeping concerns (requests for extra towels, pillows etc.)were addressed almost immediately. Would love to stay here again! More photos at my blog: virgbee.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine - but not didn't set the world on fire”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel that is period USA - well situated in downtown San Fran, all staff without exception were excellent and very helpful. Gym facilities good and clean. The hotel has 1 bar which is more like a small TV longe and a steak resturant that is like a traditional old style steak house. Meat was of an excellent quality and cut but the Chef did a weird thing with a 8 inch whole carrot that was stuck in the middle of the plate........???? Really not sure what was going on there ! This place is absolutely fine and ideal for down town shopping location, im quite suprised it makes the top 6 in the trailfinders list but hey ho !

Reviews.Title: “More like Oh my”
Reviews.Author: SSpade
Reviews.Content: Booked Omni on Trip Advisor recommendation during busy/expensive period in San Fran. Yes, clean, quiet,comfortable,convenient for Union Square. But bland. Creepy handwritten messages from Faye in housekeeping everyday, assumed angling for tip but maybe management think this is being welcoming? Concierge helpful but a bit like a robot on speed (no doubt having to say the same things day in and out) Strange check in lady did not listen that we wanted to split the bill ; intolerable male check out desk guy lectured us when we complained that Omni had deducted whole amount from my card BEFORE we had checked out. Told us that in 30yrs of the hospitality industry he had never heard of guests paying when checking out. Funny that, the 4 Seasons in Vegas we stayed at afterwards, had no problem! (nor the many hotels we stay in internationally) We stayed in the Orchard a few days later; definitely prefer for service.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is very nice....”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-and-Emma
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Omni in September and had a fantastic time. The hotel is convenietly located in the Financial district within walking distance of Union Square, Fishermans Warf etc. Our room on the 5th floor did not have a great view but was very quiet and well worth sacrificing the view for. The rooms are in excellent condition, and the maid service is first class. The staff are very helpul and courteous at all times, ensuring our stay went without a hitch. The only small complaint we have is that the one and only bar in the hotel (Bobs bar) is very small and gets very crowded from approx 5pm onwards, and getting a seat was almost impossible around those times. However it is no reason not to stay here. When we first arrived after our lengthy journey from Scotland, we were informed that our room (booked and paid for 8 months previousley) had been cancelled by Octopus travel who we had booked the room through. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful in rectifying the situation. San Francisco is well worth a visit and has plenty to offer for all. We would recommend visiting Alcatraz and taking the coach tour of the city, however book your Alcatraz tickets online as far in advance as possible to ensure you get the dates you require. We also hired bikes from Blazing Saddles and rode over the Golden Gate bridge to Tiburon via Sausilto. This is a fantastic way to see the bridge and surrounding area (weather allowing). Sausilto is a must see when you are there and can be accessed by Ferry if you prefer not to bike it, dining is recommeded at Angelino's while you are there. We also took a wine tour to Napa valley etc and would recommend this trip, with plenty of samples included in the day ensuring the hoilday spirit was flowing. Union square is packed with all the usual big name shops, but visit the hippy district at upper Haight street for some of the funkiest shops available. We visited the zoo but found it to be dated and shabby with many of the animals not available to view. Of course you must take a ride on a tram while you are there, we would advise getting a day pass for 11 bucks, which allows you to hop on and off all day at your leisure. Finally Lombard St aka the most crookidest street in the world is worth a look with camera in hand. We had 2 days of cloud followed by 8 days of glorious sunshine while we we there. Book it up, you will enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taintor
Reviews.Content: Just back - hotel was marvellous. Every member of staff went out of their way to help you. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Fran - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPollyanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 4 nights at the tail-end of our honeymoon - it was perfectly suitable. I great base for tourists. Convenient for the cable car, bus, China Town, North Beach etc. Felt safe walking around at night. The room was delightful - clean and tastefully decorated, falt screen TV, light and airy feel. Nice big bathroom. Robs Steak House was quite nice, although a bit pricey. They did give us free dessert when we mentioned we were on honeymoon, which was a nice touch. Receptionists were generally very helpful, as were the doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Wooshi
Reviews.Content: Good location - is on a cable car run, is near the business district which I felt it is a safe area and is also walkable to say Union Square for breakfast. The service is great - Joey Nubla made reservations at restaurants and was always pleasant and helpful. Cabs were hailed on my behalf etc. by the doormen. The rooms are large, and clean - beds are turned down each evening with a chocolate left, and TV set to a "chill out" channel. Bathrooms are good and clean, with a great shower and plenty of clean towels. Only thing missing are complimentary slippers - a small point! I was out before breakfast started on tourist trips but coffee is available in take out cups at reception which is just perfect. Would definitely recommend to business and holiday travellers alike, and if I were to return would definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and accomadtions”
Reviews.Author: FTL55
Reviews.Content: At the time of our arrival we were greeted by a very friendly doorman. After a very pleasent check in we were taken to our room by the bellman. He infromed us of all the services avavilable at the hotel. We had a wonderful dinner at the hotel's restaurant followed by after dinner drinks in the lounge.Next time we come to San Francisco we will stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient but not great value”
Reviews.Author: Pinaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of a trip travelling around California. When we started our trip we stayed at the excellent Donatello, but unfortunately they had no rooms available when we returned to the city. The Omni was expensive and although it did everything it is meant to do it did it without any soul. We booked through Priceline a room with two double beds. On arrival Reception said that as this was booked through a third party it could not be guaranteed and so we had to have a bed made up for our daughter. I have no criticisms of the room, apart perhaps that everything being a bit too frilly - not really our style. I was irritated to have to pay $10 for access to the hotel wifi - why do the cheaper hotels and motels provide this free and the more expensive hotels charge for this? The breakfast was over formal and as their is no buffet we ordered dishes that were OK, but extremely over priced. The staff were efficient and the doorman friendly, but I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: KYVettegirl
Reviews.Content: We were very pickey about where we would stay for our wedding celebration. The Omni exceed all expectations. The front desk was fabulous--all concierge staff which is very smart. But, one person was extra special--Lex. He even met us at city hall as we were going in to be married to give us a very touching, hand-written note honoring our momentous occasion. Yes, he was off the clock, on his own time. While the entire facility was wonderful, including the upgrade to a suite, excellent room service, picnic lunch for the limo, contact for flower bouquet, etc.,--it is the PEOPLE that make this hotel truly special. We are already making plans to return for our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sus52
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby - I was a little concerned when we arrived because I had booked a discounted rate through an online booking site and thought we might get an inferior room - but to my delight, we got a great room. The concierge was awsome, with details about restaurants (reasonably priced too!) and a great place for a drink with a view across the street. We were there on a Saturday when the hotel arranges a free 2 hr.morning walk with local historians. (different people each week) The hotel is located on the California cable car route (the front desk can sell you 1,3 or 5 day passes which cover all public transit and are a great value). Don't miss the cable car museum - free and really interesting - for kids from 1 to 100! Don't go for breakfast at the hotel - unless you want to pay $25 for bacon and eggs and don't drink the bottled water in the room - it had a price tag of $6.99 on it! Go to the fitness room where you can pick up a small bottle for free that fits nicely into your handbag! Also they have fresh fruit in the lobby - and if not there, then in the fitness room again! We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just wonderful -- cannot recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: giulietta429
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel has been great. We arrived around 11 am on a Saturday and were able to check in early. The room was large and clean. (We had two double beds, a table, a large dresser with a flat screen TV inside), a comfortable bathroom with really high ceilings. In the evening, the room was turned down with chocolates placed next to the bed, together with a personal note from housekeeping. We are Select Guest members, so we got free breakfast drinks and newspaper delivered to the room. Everyone we encountered has been nothing but pleasant, helpful, and accommodating. The hotel has fresh fruit and very tasty lemonade in the lobby in the afternoon. One of the nights, when my fiance and I were coming in, the concierge presented me with a beautiful red rose (my fiance did not order one, this is just a completely random, nice gesture -- many thanks to Omni for that!). The lobby is good size and beautifully furnished. The location is convenient. We had a great time and are sad to be leaving tomorrow morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beauitful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennypenny349
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly beauitful! We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend and had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk everywhere only having to take a cab once or twice. The service was phenominal, and I loved how room service happened in the afternoon instead of the early morning hours. The only down side was that when we needed to print out our tickets for a cruise they charged an insane amount of money to log onto the internet and use their printer (I believe it was $10 for just a few minutes and one sheet of paper!). All in all we would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: maimurray
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not deserve to be voted number 1 hotel in san francisco. I stayed in 2 hotels in san francisco and this one was much the poorer of the 2, the other hotel was the intercontental. This was also twice the price of the intercontenental, and i booked on the recomendation of tripadvisor. (a mistake!!!!!!!) The room was on the fifth floor facing a very busy road and was very noisy. The room was small and shabby. the toilet flooded the first night. The dinner in the restaurant was overpriced and over cooked. Not a hotel to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Cantjr5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Francisco Omni twice during my 11 day trip to N. California. I have never stayed at an Omni, even though I travel 5-7 times a year. I loved this hotel, specifically because of its superb service. When traveling for pleasure I prefer B&B because of the hospitality, local flavor, attention to service. I have to say that the folks at this Omni treated me and my wife as if we were at their home. We were always graciously greeted by the doorman, front desk, and concierge....they actually remembered us. It is such a surprise to get this level of attention in such a big city, in the heart of the financial district. The rooms were very, very clean. As I was there twice during my trip I was able to compare 2 different room types. Both times, the rooms were impeccably clean. All of the amenities you would expect for a business hotel are available. The hotel is located very close to the Ferry building and Chinatown. Being located in the financial district makes the hotel close to San Francisco's excellent restaurants including, Aqua and Perbacco. We ate at Perbacco and would recommend to anyone. We used the concierge services extensively and they were always courteous, quick, and thorough. It just wasn't the concierge that helped us. Everyone in the hotel goes out of their way to help. The lady that checked-us in, Crystal, was superb!!!They made a number of reservations for us and provided excellent recommendations. It's not close to the touristy areas near Fisherman's Wharf, but I wasn't looking to be in the heart of a tourist haven. If you are looking for a great hotel, with excellent service that makes you feel like you are at home this is the place to be. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What makes this hotel so great is the staff, amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: ives
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Omni for a week during a vacation to San Francisco in August 2008. The Omni is very well managed and their staff top notch. The concierge, the front desk staff, housekeeping, security and Darryl (the Omni's very cool doorman who helped us secure transportation from the Outer Lands concert at Golden Gate Park to avoid the crowds) are pleasant, responsive and knowledgeable. We had a wonderful time in San Francisco and the folks at the Omni played a huge role in making it so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced fare for standard experience”
Reviews.Author: Davidwhatshisname
Reviews.Content: Our flight was canceled and we couldn't get out until a day later, and the Omni was very nice about canceling the missed night without a fuss; we did have to shell out $50 for valet parking each night, which is a bit excessive, and our room, while large and comfortable, had a close-up view of the windows of the business offices next door. The staff was extremely courteous, but in a way that made us feel that they were fishing for tips - not warm, just perfunctory - fake smiles all the way. All in all, it seemed very much like a business hotel, not a 4 star luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: xgirl76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in July this year. It was our first trip to San Francisco, so we weren't sure of which area to stay in, but the Omni turned out to be perfectly located for us. It's in the Financial District, so it's quiet at night, but we felt perfectly safe walking there after dark. It's also on the cable-car line, within easy walking distance of Chinatown and the Ferry Building and if you don't mind walking a bit further, you can easily walk to the Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf areas from here. The hotel itself is lovely and the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. If I had to pick one thing to fault the room on, it would be the fixed-head shower. I didn't have a particular problem with it, but it was just ok - investing a little money in the shower would really bring it up to the standard of the rest of the accommodation. Staff at the Omni were very friendly and helpful, from check-in, where they offered to help us book any attractions we wanted to see, room service bending over backwards to make us happy when there was a slight problem with our order, the concierge recommending places to eat, right through to the doorman offering us the hotel car when we were leaving for the airport (at only $5 more than the taxi fare, this was a nice option). In addition, when we had an issue with the guests in the adjoining room holding an impromptu party late one night, hotel security dealt with it very quickly. We joined the Select Guest program online for free and this entitled us to complimentary tea, coffee, hot chocolate and juice every morning, as well as complimentary WiFi access and a daily newspaper. We ate breakfast twice in the hotel restaurant, which was somewhat expensive, but excellent quality and really tasty. There was complimentary fresh fruit (peaches, apricots, plums etc, not just standard apples) and juice or iced tea in the lobby every afternoon, which was nice when returning from sightseeing before going out to dinner. And the gym provided complimentary bottled water and apples and bananas too. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return if we are ever in San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a wow”
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Omni, both on business. The Omni is a nice 4 star hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are of average size, but quite adequate. The furnishings are in good condition except for the carpet which is very tired and in need of replacing. The worn state of the carpet really detracts from the rest of the room. The internet connection, although it uses a wire, was fast and reliable ($10/day). The staff was very friendly and helpful. For example, they set up transportation for me on multiple days without a hitch. The hotel food is only average in quality, but very expensive. The hotel is located not far from anything, but not close to anything either; a geographical compromise. I timed the walk to Union Square at 15 minutes via Montgomery, hang a right at Post (note this way is flat, no hills). San Francisco hotels are very expensive for what you get. The Omni is better than both nearby Hyatts. I would stay there again, but will likely try another hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Travelmedic
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful 4 day in San Francisco, and 3 nights at the Omni Hotel San Francisco was a treat. I aways stay there now, and the accommodations, amenities, and staff are the best of any hotel I know. it is well-located and to me it is paradise away from home in America's favorite city. Martin I. Laichtman, M.D.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_4x
Reviews.Content: The Omni hotel is nice enough, and tries to offer decent service. But the rooms are definitely hit or miss and it is quite random whether you will get a nice accommodation. On the plus side, the hotel is conveniently located downtown in the financial district. A bit far from the convention center or tourist destinations but great if you are in town for work. The staff is generally professional and helpful. The lobby is a bit small and it can be difficult to get past all the doormen to get to the desk. Mind you, they are friendly and willing to help, but often there are 3 standing right in front of the doors, sometimes one is on the staircase leading into the hotel, so it feels like you are sneaking past the Secret Service every time you enter the hotel. At some hotels the doormen quickly open the door and get out of your way but here they are usually in conversation and don't notice you until you are already past. Speaking of small, the rooms are on the small side as well, which is not too uncommon for an older property. Don't waste your time on a "premium" room as the extra square footage is mostly in a long hallway that isn't useable. On paper these rooms are larger but they end up feeling the same size. Premium rooms also have two televisions but unfortunately the Omni is one of those hotels that has upgraded to 'high-def" TVs but not high-def programming. Everything on screen is stretched wide to fill the wider screen, which ends up making everything all distorted - all the actors look squat and fat. Some hotels allow you to set the TV back to the regular aspect ratio to fix this, but not the Omni. I guess they don't want the black bars on the sides of the screens. But the result is that they can claim to have high-quality TVs while the picture quality is actually worse than your average Holiday Inn. Premium rooms offer "a courtyard view". Be aware that this means you will probably get some light through the window but the actual "view will be of a wall, or large machinery. Definitely nothing you would take a picture of if you aren't an HVAC engineer. If they are busy don't gamble on a smoking room unless you really don't mind the smell. The Omni gets a lot of heavy smokers so those rooms truly reek. The hotel restaurant is okay, basic big-city hotel food (at very high prices) but nothing to get excited about. All in all, if you can book during a slow period when you can easily change rooms to find one more to your liking then the Omni is an acceptable downtown hotel. But when reservations are scarce you are better off at a more reliable property.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful omni”
Reviews.Author: fusspots4
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of 3 nights at The Omni with our family of 4 including 2 teenage girls one of whom uses a wheelchair. The staff at the Omni could not have been more helpful and friendly and although there were not many families that we could see staying I highly recommend this place to families looking for an up market experience. Milk and cookies were delivered every night for our girls and every time we passed through the lobby they returned with red roses, a toy cable car, chocolates, postcards, an unused cable car pass left by a previous guest, and best of all a big smile. The service was quite simply fantastic and very personal. I must give a special mention to Lex the conciege who was great and even helped us when he saw us looking at the map when he was off duty and we were shopping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - it won't disappoint. The location was quiet and yet within reasonable, relatively flat walking distance of everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: marieshannon
Reviews.Content: My family of six recently spent two wonderful nights at the Omni San Francisco. The Omni was our last stop on a two week long family vacation. We enjoyed our stay immensely. We loved the location as well as the terrific service we received at the Omni. At first I regretted my decision not to stay in the Fishermen's Wharf area but I came to find the Omni's location to be the perfect spot to explore the whole city. We walked as well as rode the cable cars (there is a stop right in front of the hotel) as well as the F Line street cars to get around. I highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: mikekauffman
Reviews.Content: All of the prior reviews are true - the Omni is excellent. It may have been the nicest hotel we have ever stayed in - definitely in the top two. We stayed for two nights at the end of July. We had a 15th floor room with a partial view of the city. The rate we paid included valet parking for each night, normally an additional $48 per night charge. The room was large and very clean. The bathroom had a double sink with a very large countertop. The hotel was very convenient to Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf. The entrance to Chinatown was only a short walk from the hotel and the cable car route to Fisherman's Wharf stopped right in front of the hotel. Our rental car was parked on Friday afternoon and we did not retrieve it until we left on Sunday. The service had the hotel was exemplary. Each employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The hotel concierge gave us a great overview of the area and the doormen provided excellent dining tips. As members of Omni's Select Guest program, we were treated with complimentary beverage service each morning, consisting of a pot of coffee and tea and a choice of several fruit juices, along with a choice of three newspapers. This service was very prompt - we requested 8:00 each morning, and the beverages arrived by 7:30. This service allowed us to enjoy our coffee and tea and newspaper before heading out to breakfast. Two excellent breakfast locations within walking distance were Lori's Diner and Sears' Fine Food. As several other reviewers mentioned, there is free bottled water and fruits available in the 3rd floor Fitness Center. One local feature not to be missed is the lounge located on the 52nd floor of the Bank of America building, located across the street from the Omni. The nighttime view of the city through the lounge's wall of windows was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni SF, for four nights, in a standard room. Very clean, well furnished and we were very happy. It is clear by the fact that most of the other guests were in suits, it is more for the business person, but although we did feel out of place in our shorts and t-shirts, we were made to feel very welcome by the very friendly staff. The restaurant was over priced for the food, in my view. Better to eat out. Overall, a great stay, and a great location, with a Cable Car route right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Omni was great!”
Reviews.Author: BaileyBooNewYork
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed 10 days at the San Fran Omni in late April 2008. It is a great hotel. It was very clean, the room was a nice size, bathroom was large, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There was internet available in the lobby for a fee. In the future, I will always look for an Omni hotel to stay at, especially when in a large city. It has a restaurant and a separate bar/grill also. The restaurant served huge portions, everything was cooked to perfection, we ate there twice during our stay. The bar/grill was nice also, nice menu selections, such as crab tacos (yum), burgers, sliced steak. It is in the financial district and on the cable car line also. Close to Chinatown. We also ate at Houston's, across from the Ferry Building, excellent, especially the ribs, it was pricey but well worth it. The highlights of the trip for us were Alcatraz tour, Napa Wine-tasting tour, and Monterey-Carmel tour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Fabulous Anniversary!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MElena2
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect from the time I made my reservations until the day we left. We made reservations to celebrate our anniversary and do a quick in-town getaway. The Omni is located in the financial district, but is close to many great neighborhoods. We were able to walk to the Embarcadero, North Beach, and Chinatown. It is also really close to public transportation, including BART and the Cable Car (for real tourists). Originally I was going to just spend one night in a suite, but the reservationist suggested that since we were coming for our anniversary, we consider their "Hearts in San Francisco" package. We decided to do this instead for 2 nights. It included a deluxe room with King bed, champagne and chocolates in the evening, and breakfast either at the restaurant on site or served in your room. I called ahead to see if they had any suggestions for a special anniversary dinner and they made us reservations at Aqua. We checked in online and simply had to pick up our keys and go straight to our room upon arrival. When we got to the room, housekeeping had put a heart of rose petals on our bed. Within 20 minutes our champagne and chocolates arrived. There was also a reminder letter with our key to give us directions to the restaurant which is only 2 blocks away. I also called for suggestions of somewhere to go after dinner and was given the perfect spot at the Bubble Lounge. The next day was just as wonderful and with the same treatment of the room the next night was completely romantic. Everyone at this hotel is friendly and helpful. It all started with Joey Nubla (concierge), to Darrell at the front door, to our bellmen Adam and Joey, our fabulous housekeeper Maria, the room service staff and John and Justin at the front desk. Thank you all for giving us the perfect getaway for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: RonT58
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location near Chinatown, very friendly staff, beautiful and tasteful room. Excellent breakfast! We felt at home right from the start and would certainly return. A Chinese couple next to us just got married and half of their party came with them to celebrate an after party in the middle of the night. Luckily this did not take too long. We loved the handwritten note of the housekeeping lady, thanking us for giving her the opportunity to clean our room. It's typical to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: herbkim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July 07 for a business trip so a little late in posting feedback but thought I should still contribute. OVERALL I completely failed to see why this hotel is rated so highly. The location and checkin were good but everything else from the lobby, room and broadband were poor. I cannot recommend this hotel especially with other good options nearby. In particular, the Mandarin Oriental is nearby and is often priced competitively which means you'll be paying similar money to the Omni but for a VASTLY superior hotel. Let me emphasize that I do not feel the Omni is bad. The problem is that it is just ok and that there are options. GOOD Fast checkin. Pleasant staff. Decent location. BAD Small room. Front lobby unimpressive. "Broadband" speeds slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: gangi
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in financial district, an easy walk to North Beach, Chinatown, Union Square, SFMOMA, BART, etc. Beautiful lobby. Truly outstanding service with gracious, well trained staff. Room was large with extra room for a writing desk and a good sized sitting chair. Bathroom was clean, modern, and recently remodeled. High-quality mattress on the bed; room had a small flat screen TV (37 inch?). Decoration is in a traditional style. Breakfast in downstairs restaurant was OK, but nothing special, for example the OJ was not fresh. Only real complaint was the carpet in the room was a little tired - not disgusting - but no longer new and starting to show its age.

Reviews.Title: “We Love The Omni”
Reviews.Author: sixsome
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco staff made me smile every day of our stay in June. Our check in was great. My husband mentioned that we were celebrating our 30th wedding aniversary (15 years a piece) to Justin Seeto, the Guest Services Manager. Although he was not able to upgrade our room that night, the following afternoon we were moved to a lovely upgrade with a good bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us. That is when I really started smiling! Lex ,at the concierge desk was delightful. He took time with us to find out our interests before making some great recommendations for dining and entertainment. If you haven't done it the Alcatraz cruise is a must. We loved Golden Gate park with the De Young museum and the Tea Gardens. A short walk from there is Haight Asbury, interesting. Good restaurant, Cha Cha Cha, Caribean tapas. We loved Mamacita, gormet Mexican and the Boulevard is a must do. We were lucky enough to catch the Frida Kalo exhibit at SFMOMA which we also loved. I digress, in short everyone we encountered at the Omni was friendly, personable and seemed to be enjoying making guests happy. The dorrmen were sweethearts, with a cold water in hand on an uncharacteristically warm summer day, the housekeepers were terrific and I had a great chat with a maintenance guy on the elevator. They all made a difference and made our stay at the Omni an absolute delight. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: daverrco
Reviews.Content: From the moment the front door was opened on our way in to check in to the time the front door was opened on our way after check out, my girlfriend and I were treated like royalty at the Omni. I've been to San Francisco many times and the Omni is the BEST hotel I've stayed in. The service is exquisite. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff is exceptionally friendly, always upbeat, and very helpful. The hotel itself is very clean, elegant, and conveniently located close to Chinatown, North Beach, and the Financial District. The California Street Cable Car line runs past the hotel's front door, and the BART station is five blocks away. The room was large, clean, and well maintained. There was a nice flat screen TV and DVD player in our upgraded "signature" room, though not every room may be equipped similarly. Every morning our housekeeper would leave us a handwritten note wishing us a pleasant day. We'd write her back telling her of our travel adventures and leave her a well-deserved tip for her service. She even recommended a great place to try authentic dim sum! Staying at the Omni was definitely the key to a most enjoyable San Francisco adventure! I'll be back to San Francisco soon and, without a doubt, will be staying at the Omni again!

Reviews.Title: “loved the omni”
Reviews.Author: j6point7
Reviews.Content: The omni was a great location. The hotel was nice, with nice rooms. What made the stay so great was the service. All the staff were really grade a from beginning to end. The things I didn't like was that the room was very small, with only two double beds, not queen. The food prices were very high, even for san francisco, so eating at the hotel was not an option. Would have been convenient to eat at hotel for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I can see why the Omni is rated so high.”
Reviews.Author: TexasAggie9800
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there at the end of June then again in early July while vacationing in San Francisco. The service was excellent, from the check in to the doorman. Everyone makes you feel very welcome. The beds are very comfortable with large plush pillows. The bathroom are immaculate and clean. The location is central to everything, you can walk to Union Square, North Beach, Little Italy, the Bart (subway) in no time. I would definitely recommend the Omni to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “10 in all areas”
Reviews.Author: sunarkin
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most enjoyable hotel experiences I have had in years. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was more then accomodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the San Francisco area.

Reviews.Title: “Omni was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: thegreendoor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over the 4th of July weekend (got a great rate at $169 a night)! We enjoyed everything about our stay there. From the doormen who were super, to the front desk staff and everyone in between--fabulous service. We liked the fact that it was not in the middle of everything, because San Francisco was crazy over that weekend! The financial district is very quiet on weekends, which, like another poster said, we liked. We were at the end of a 10 day trip out west and thought the Omni was the best hotel we stayed at, and we stayed at nice hotels! We checked in early, no problem, and when we were leaving they held our luggage all day because our flight wasn't until 10:00 that night. We loved all the personal touches and luxurious bedding and robes! As an added tip, we joined their hotel rewards program when making the reservations (it's free to join) and that got us extra perks like coffee/juice/paper in the morning, get fit kit and the room and a few more things. I would recommend this! This was our first visit at an Omni hotel and would look for an Omni property again when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4-star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cili_padi_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 3 nights. Our room was available when we checked in at noon and we had a late check-out at 2pm. The check-in staff are friendly and very prompt. The room is a good size, the bed is comfortable, and the amenities are good. The decor is a bit tired, but clean and tidy. Wi-fi is $9.95 for 24 hours. There is a turndown service every evening, which is a very nice touch. The staff at the concierge desk are knowledgable and very helpful. They sell tourist muni passports which is excellent (1 day for $11), and a very helpful female staff showed us how to get to the various attractions. There is complimentary lemonade and fruit late afternoon in the lobby. The location is excellent. The Ferry Building to the right, Chinatown to the left and Union Square to the south. Tadich Grill, an SF institution is 4 blocks right of the hotel, and we stumbled upon it by a very fortunate mistake. Unwittingly, we were in SF for the Gay Pride parade, which we happily attended. The atmosphere was fantastic. We booked through Expedia.co.nz, and paid NZ$266 per night (including taxes) which was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary Stay was Terrific”
Reviews.Author: BCCajun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels all over the world. The Omni service was exceptional which is why this hotel is so highly rated. The "premium" class room on the top floor (17th) was large with the usual first-class amenities - king size bed, armoire holding the TV - mini-bar-drawers for clothing, a writing table and a chair. The room was very much like other major UPSCALE hotel chains but nothing palacial. The room was accurately described as having a "partial view" so I was not expecting more than this. I could see the bay but I also saw a lot of the side of the L-shaped Omni itself. The only hotel that I saw there that I would like to investigate next time was the Intercontinental Mark (somebody). It is a high rise on Nob Hill which is elevated already so I am sure the views were pretty spectacular. I am sure the price is as well. We had brunch at the Top of the Mark which is - you guessed it - on the top floor and we saw the view ourselves. Spectacular. But back to the Omni... When we told the concierge that this was our 20th Wedding Anniversary, they immediately arranged to have champagne and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room - complimentary. Having a bottle of champagne around just changes the whole mood of a hotel room - I highly recommend it. I am not suggesting that you lie about it being your anniversary, though. I had the 3-1/2 days in San Fran very well scheduled before we arrived because I wanted to make the most of our short stay, so I took the wind out of the concierge's sails when I showed him my calendar chart of restaurant reservations, Alcatraz cruise, Wok Wiz Chinatown tour, etc, but I would have missed the opportunity of eating at the Slanted Door if the concierge had not pointed out that they were in fact open for lunch (I had seen information indicating they only opened at 5 and could not work it into our evening time slots.) Tiger prawns, Vietnamese crepes, beef short ribs. WoW! One complaint: when you stay at the hotel that is rated #1, any little thing that is wrong will seem like a big deal. For instance, I had to take the coffee service tray out of the armoire and set it on the table and then I had to crawl under the table to reach the electrical outlet just to get it plugged in. I found myself getting quite indignant (silly pride) at the effort I had to personally exert just to hook up the thing. I have done this before in other hotels and not been nearly as bothered. Lesson: limit your expectations and you will always be more satisfied. Also: This is in the Financial District. While we never felt like we were out of the main part of town, it does get quiet on weekends. This was pleasant to us. You are still only a few blocks from Union Square, the Ferry Building, and Chinatown and you have cable cars running directly in front of the hotel. You will not feel isolated in the least. The location was perfect and in no way diminished our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, service sucked!”
Reviews.Author: eljayVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself was nice, if not bit pricey, the service was not. There was a conference while we were there and a disco had been set up right below our room for the conference attendees. The floor was shaking the music was so loud. As the hotel was oversold we couldn't be moved and the only thing they offered to do for us was pay for a cab to another hotel, no offer of rooms elsewhere or anything. Oh...we did get a "free" overpriced breakfast out of it. Don't eat in the dining room, way overpriced for what you get...$25 for Bacon and Eggs? Would not stay there again, not for the amount we paid and the service we got.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay - Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Coquitlam_Mary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a birthday week-end at the Omni San Francisco. This was our first stay at an Omni property and we were so impressed that we actually checked to see if there was a hotel in Fort Lauderdale which is where we'll be vacationing next (We have a reservation at a Hilton property but would have switched to the Omni given the wonderful experience we had with them in San Fran.). The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. We were quite impressed with Crystal who not only answered our questions about hotel amenities but she also anticipated our needs and made arrangements to have them met. We were always greeted with a friendly hello by all staff we passed - be it at the front door, in the elevator or in the hallways. There appears to be a seamless team effort to provide polite service at all times and this was quite refreshing to experience. There were personal touches added to the room which we really appreciated. The linens were fresh and clean. Our only disappointment was that there was not much of a view from the room (perhaps because we had requested a quiet area of the hotel?). The hotel is in an excellent location, albeit sedate on the week-end as it's in the Financial district within close proximity to the shopping area on Market street, Little Italy and Chinatown. BART and MUNI are available nearby. We hope to be returning guests.

Reviews.Title: “It was purdy good”
Reviews.Author: drewism
Reviews.Content: This hotel was purdy good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service/Wonderful amenities”
Reviews.Author: 1618HazelnutsPres
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a four night stay at the Omni San Francisco to celebrate our Anniversary. The Customer Service and attention to detail was outstanding. They took care of our every need and far exceeded our expectations. We had such wonderful celebration and stay as we knew if we needed anything, they we be there for us. We felt so pampered, we almost hated to leave. When we inquired how to get around by car, cable car and even buses, where to mail letters, packages the Front Desk and Conceirge staff provided every detail. When we needed to send a package, they gave us a box, the tape and even shipped it for us. The had every amenity we could need and more. When we inquired as to where to eat or get a bottle of wine to celebrate, they gave us all the help we could possibly need. The Valets and Bell hops were on top of every thing, even when we just needed to find out where to stand to catch the cable car. The location of the hotel is wonderul to get around the city and see the sites, as you are in the middle of it all. The bed was heavenly and the room was quiet. We look forward to the next time we will be able to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the pool??”
Reviews.Author: DaSaint
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel but contrary to the reviews, its not fantastic. Someone rated their pool as above average. Foolishly, I didn't look into it as i actually wanted to use the pool. I was surprised on arrival to find out that they don't actually have one!!! The staff are very friendly but that is usually a standard american thing in a high star hotel. The rooms are all nice and reasonably spacious for the price although a little stuffy for some reason (maybe the weather) but again, not all that fantastic as the reviews seem to suggest. The location is great in the center of town, the breakfast and the food average, the bed was okay, not fantastic. I've definitely stayed in better

Reviews.Title: “This is what every hotel should aim to be like”
Reviews.Author: Maria232
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late after a long drive from Vegas as part of our honeymoon tour of CA, and were greeted by exceptionally friendly helpful staff, unbelievably clean rooms, excellent facilities...need I go on. An absolute must for an extra special city visit.

Reviews.Title: “would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmmica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a recent visit to san franciso and would highly recommend it, from start to finish the service was impeccable and i could not find one thing to fault. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the friendly porter and directed to the front desk where again the welcome was great (but not overwhelming) and check in was quick and efficent. Room was excellent - very comfortable with a huge bed and excellent bathroom (good shower). For me it was the little touches that made the stay so enjoyable - the chocolates, the ice bucket that was refilled every night, the weather forecast by the phone; as well as the attentive and friendly staff. As we spent most of our time sightseeing we only ate room service one night and never ate in the restauarant - both restauarant and bar looked very nice though. Location is great - walking distance from all the sights though can be a bit quiet on a sunday. If im in san francisco again this is where ill be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchymama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni hotel after reading all the reviews on Trip advisor. I have to say that they were true! The Omni hotel is a great place with a very friendly staff. We arrived early (10:30a) and a room was waiting for us. After signing up on their website, we ended up with coffee and juice delivered to our room every morning. We also had breakfast included. The restaurant was great. The staff there welcomed us each morninng and we had the choice as far as menu. I had steak and eggs one morning. Just fabulous! The meat was very tender. We will definetely stay there again. Perfect location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWitt
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience. I am 40ish and my daughter, 20. We went to SF for girl's trip. Omni staff was absolutely excellent. Genuine smiles, friendliest & kindest staff..even our housekeeper left hand-written notes daily. Clean & beautiful lobby, halls, & room. Special touches everywhere. Every single person we came in contact with was genuine and helpful. Great location two blocks from Chinatown. Paid $209 one night and $199 the other. Room size was also good for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Made My 1st San Fran Trip a 1st Class Joy!”
Reviews.Author: TrueTaurusGuy
Reviews.Content: As always, I checked TripAdvisor first when planning my first trip to San Francisco and based on the No. 1 rating of the Omni from previous travelers, I decided to give it a shot. Was I ever impressed. It is a lovely hotel in the Financial District of the city and very near Union Square. Not only are the common areas and the room truly beautiful, each member of the staff that I encountered was extremely courteous and sincerely willing to ensure that I was having a great time. I plan to return to see more of the city and will definitely be staying at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is a good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rlp815
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco this past weekend. We found the staff to be extremely friendly. We didn't walk through the lobby once without a "how are you?" or "Is there anything I can help you with?" The room was on the small end but still very nice. The location was good but required a short walk to get to the tourist locations. The price was reasonable for San Francisco. The only downside in my mind was that we were charged $48 / day for our rental car to be parked in the garage. Seemed a bit steep. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is perfect. The location is superb, near the sights but quiet at nightime with a trolley stop almost outside the door. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff are amazing, everyone of them went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. One of the best hotels I have stayed in, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Social and fun staff..”
Reviews.Author: masonite10
Reviews.Content: I received a great rate in a middle tier room. I reserved the room on the companies website and requested the best (and highest room available) for my room rate. They gave me a great room on the top floor with a great view of the city and bay! The staff was very social and helpful making us feel at home! I would go back and stay at this hotel for the staff alone!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey”
Reviews.Author: allsportsfanG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights we booked through Hotwire. We paid like $730.00. The room was average. They need to update the t.v.'s.It was just an okay stay. I would have rather stayed at the Westin Market street. The concierge is extremely helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We had only two nights at the Omni in May. We were on our way home to NZ after 6 weeks travelling in Europe laden with luggage! What a pleasure it was to arrive at the Omni after negotiating the chaos of Los Angeles Airport! We arrived at 8.30 am and our room was not available but hotel reception couldn't have been more helpful in storing bags, offering bathrooms and recommending places for coffee or breakfast. The manager personally hurried up the availability of our room and had us safely ensconced by 10am. Our room was a standard king but so spacious by European hotel room standards. It was immaculately clean and well appointed. Our only negative comment would be that there was no kettle for boiling water for a cup of tea. There was a coffee maker available but to just boil water in that took forever! The bed was large and firm with comfortable pillows and crisp linen. Nice range of toiletries in the bathroom which were replaced twice daily if needed-a nice touch. Our room was facing into a central area so only view was of other buildings. The upside of this was that we got no road noise whatsoever-Lovely and quiet so would probably request same on return visit. Hotel is in financial area so if here on holiday as we were, not too many restaurants or cafes in the immediate vicinity. This was a bit of an issue especially as we were there on a Sunday night and a Monday which was a public holiday so virtually nothing around. North beach though is only a short taxi ride away. The strength of this hotel though was its outstanding staff. They were respectful, extremely helpful and willing to answer all queries and wishes in a friendly courteous way. Wold we stay here again?---A resounding yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: CGLCHatsworth
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Omni San Francisco over the Memorial Day holiday. Although there was no view, our room was well appointed and clean. Staff was friendly and service was above average. Service technician replaced our television set becuase it was not working. Location, in the financial district, was good even though rather dead on Sunday and Memorial Day. Close to the Embarcadero and ferry building where restraunts were open on Sunday afternoon. We would stay here again on another trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: islandtraveler65
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a great find for the price. We paid an average of $180.00 a night. It is a about 2 blocks off the beaten path but in a nice safe area. The great thing is that the California trolley line goes right in front of the hotel so transportation is easy. We walked to the North Beach district and to Union Square. Fisherman's warf is easy to get to by trolley. (buy the daily pass for $11 p/p) The rooms were very clean and updated as was the lobby. It is small but has a restaurant and a small bar that serves a small menu. If you want a very quiet room but with no view, request an inner courtyard. I have stayed in both and the street side rooms have the view to the street if you don't mind the city noises - not bad though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful, and amazing customer service at the Omni.”
Reviews.Author: polytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco for my dad's 65th birthday. My family was so impressed with the hotel. Not only were the rooms immaculate, the bathrooms were so clean you could eat off the floor. Omni's customer service was amazing... Everyone was so helpful in suggesting local restaurants, where to order pizza, etc. The concierge was GREAT and even surprised my dad with a small birthday cake and more. I consider myself to be a hotel snob and cannot say enough good things about this place. The location was GREAT too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Kids Room, Great City...”
Reviews.Author: denverfour
Reviews.Content: A great classic and classy hotel. The service is outstanding. The atmosphere is luxurious, and extremely kid-friendly in a city that is not really kid-centric. We were lucky enough to book the Kid Fantasy Suite for my kids (ages 9 and 11) with an adjoining King room for my husband and I. While there is much more the decorators could have done to make it a true kid "fantasy" room, it made my kids feel like they were special. Bunk beds, bean bags and nightly milk & cookies -- what more could a kid want?! (Well, a pool would have been ideal, but they didn't mind too much). The restaurant in the hotel, Bob's Steak House, was fantastic. A little pricey, but typical for the city and the food was worth it. There are several outstanding restaurants within an easy two block walk of the hotel. We were there over a long weekend, and it seemed many cafes and smaller restaurants were closed for the weekend, or had very limited hours. (The closest McDonald's was completely closed on Sunday -- not a big deal unless you have a 9-year-old craving a Happy Meal) But the location was great in regards to the ease in getting to public transportation. Also, there are a ton of things within walking distance -- China Town, the Ferry Building, Union Square. The service at the Omni is wonderful! Everything from the front desk staff to the housekeepers to the room service attendants. I could go on an on about this hotel, but to simply summarize: if you are going to San Fran, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Solid and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: hatster31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend. I got a great weekend rate at $169 a night. LOCATION: The location could not be any better. We took the BART and walked 4 blocks (10 minutes) to the hotel. Just make sure you don't have too much luggage. The hotel is also within walking distance of Union Square and Chinatown. There are also Muni lines and cable car lines very close by. HOTEL: I knew that it was an older hotel, but I guess I expected the rooms to be nicer. It is very clean, but there was no "wow" factor that I have seen at other hotels like Novotel Singapore or Venetian in Vegas. It was a regular room with regular t.v. with nice amenities but nothing ultra-modern. The bed was very comfortable. The rooms were very quiet, although you could hear some hallway noise, but nothing from outside the building. I guess that is why they are not considered a 5 star hotel. Minus one star for the room. SERVICE: The service was very good overall. Check in was quick and all the staff were extremely friendly. We are a select guest, so we get morning beverage service (you are supposed to get a card outside your room and you hang it out with your beverages). Since this is our first stay, we had no idea how this worked. We never got a card and got no beverages in the morning. When I called the front desk, they forwarded me to room service, and I got my beverages. I also told front desk that I didn't get a beverage card, just a room service, when they asked if I hung it outside. Well, for a #1 rated Tripadvisor and 4 star hotel, I would expect a select guest beverage card the following night, but no. So, minus one star for that. However, when I wanted coffee the next morning at 11:00 a.m. (they have a pot of coffee in Bob's every morning until 10:00 a.m.), the staff got me one, so add one star. Overall, this is a great hotel with great service. I can see why it is not 5 stars, but the service really makes it above the rest. HOTEL TIPS: Get free water and fruit in the fitness room. There is also free fruit in the afternoon and free lemonade in the lobby. There is free coffee in the morning at Bob's bar until 10:00 a.m. But, you get free beverage service delivered to your room if you sign up as a selected guest.
