RESTAURANT TIPS: We found two great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Both are highly rated on yelp. The first is Bix. It is on Gold St., which is about 5 blocks north of Montgomery (10 minutes walk). It's in a small alley, and the food is awesome and moderately priced (entrees $25 to 35 range). Their appetizers are incredible, and the atmosphere is very nice. The second is Great Eastern in Chinatown for dim sum. This place is located on Jackson St. by Kearny. It is very clean compared to the other Chinatown places, and you order off of a menu with pictures (no carts). Service is a bit slow, but if you are looking for an adventure in Chinatown, definitely try dim sum there. Go early (before 11:00) to avoid the crazy crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ngabbay
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby, and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights in March. I've never experienced such great service. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with great hospitality. The lady that checked us in even asked if she could hold our baby and played with him for a little while. it was really cute. We were upgraded to a suite, which was beautiful. Any questions we had, or service, we needed was handled with genuine kindness and efficiency. My baby's blanket was accidentally taken by the cleaning staff. Omni took all measures to locate it, and then refunded 1 night off the bill and treated us to a free breakfast. We thought that was really nice. We have great memories, and can't wait to stay there again. We tell all of our friends who visit San Francisco about this experience, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: mom2cutekids
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Extremely clean (even the hallways smelled clean). Large rooms, windows opened, extremely comfortable bed (most hotels are lumpy and over used), great selection of snacks and other amenities, mints, sleep balm, cards, anything you desire! Wonderful extra friendly staff, always available to help. Went as a surprise for my husband's 40th birthday and they sent up a complementary cake, champagne and birthday card. Great location, 1 block from China Town, Easy access to cable cars! We will definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear79
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to San Francisco for a girls weekend and had the best time. The hotel was fantastic. From greeting us with roses and first class service upon checking in, to our beautifully appointed room. It was a deluxe room with two double beds, marble bathroom, with no real views but very comfortable. We are wary of hotels but felt right at home at the Omni, as everything was clean and comfortable. I have stayed in Fairmonts and nicer hotels, and I would say that this hotel was at par with a 4+ star, it was great. My girlfriend celebrated a birthday during our stay and we only mentioned it to the front desk clerk when asked why in town, after dinner one night they sent up a bottle of champagne, two small birthday cakes and a personalized card. It was perfect! The gym was great, tv's on all the equipment and was never full, or even half full. Get your water there as there is complimentary water, and the bottle in your room is $6. Oh and there is also fresh fruit in the gym, which might be a nice snack as the mini bar and room service are quite pricey. Which isn't too much of a problem since the Omni is near alot of nice cafes, restaurants etc. (right beside the Omni there is a cafe which has everything and makes delicious panini's.... which are worth the trip back to San Francisco). We never ordered anything from the hotel.... except a bagel and fruitplate in the morning.... and it wasn't outrageous. No pool, no views, but what the hotel lacks in those areas, it completely compensates for in friendly helpful staff. It is close to China town, Union square, North beach and across the street from the Carmelian room which has amazing views while you dine. Become an Omni select guest member (free online) and you can get a complimentary morning beverage and paper, turn down service and upgrade after so many stays. Being on California street, alongside the cable cars, the Omni makes it easy to get around without a rental car. I would actually say avoid renting one if possible as parking in San Francisco is expensive and hard to come by. The hotel charges $45 I believe. So we rented one to drive up to win country, and returned it the same day, just to save us the hassle of paying for parking and returning it the next day. San Francisco is a fantastic city and the hospitality extends far beyond the hotels and tourist areas. Everyone is so nice and made our trip so enjoyable. The Omni is a great hotel in a great location. We will return and as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: australian73
Reviews.Content: Beautifully located walking distance to North Beach for restaurants, Union square and fishermans wharf. Brilliant, friendly service - nothing was a problem. The service team went out of their way to help me - I felt like a King! The rooms are spacious (I had a king bed), and bathrooms are good size and have high quality finishes. The gym has all the gear you need, about 5 treadmills, some new resistance training gear and is very well presented. Whether you are staying for pleasure or business, this hotel is first class, highly recommend - it was also outstanding value!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Russ G
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door at the Omni, the staff could not have been more helpful. John on the front desk, gave us maps with directions to all the tourist areas, recommended restaurants and because the bellman was very busy even brought our luggage up to our room himself. The location was great a 15 minute walk to union square and a pleasant 20 minutes walk to Fisherman's wharf. If you don't like walking the cable car stop is very close to the hotel. The only mild disappointment at the Omni was the high prices in the restuarant especially for breakfast. The trip to alcatraz from pier 33 is must, so remember to book in advance online as it will be very difficult to get tickets on the day as there tends to be a wait of several days. San Francisco was very enjoyable, and it helped to have such friendly staff at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mackey500
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever been in. It is centerally located only a block away from china town and a couple from union square. The staff are the most helpful and friendly I have ever seen. From check in with a lady called Crystal she supplied us with maps gave good advice and was very helpful. Another member of staff from meeting me once remembered my name everytime he saw me. Its not the cheapest place but it is a very nice hotel and you wont regret booking here. The food is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable welcoming”
Reviews.Author: treetravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the great reviews. It is all true. The decor is lovely, the beds are really cozy and the fitness room is adequate. Best of all is the welcoming staff that is always available to offer suggestions or provide directions. We also really liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Webb
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this delightful hotel at the beginning of April. When we arrived we had to wait about 5 mins before the check-in staff were able to attend to us and this resulted in my wife being given a rose and also an upgrade to a very comfortable suite. Although the hotel is in the financial area which is a bit quiet at the weekend, it is ideally situated for most of the tourist areas. Public transportation is also very accessible from the hotel. The hotel has a very pleasant restaurant and bar, however I feel the cost of the meals in the restaurant was a bit excessive and the signature giant honey glazed carrot which seemed to accompany most of the meals was a bit wasted on us. On the last night we decided to stay in the bar as we had spent the day on a very enjoyable wine tour to the Napa valley. On this occasion we chose a bar meal which was extremely tasty and far better value for money. Although the cost of the rooms is expensive during the week, it is possible to get a good deal for Fri/Sat/Sun nights but I would recommend contacting the hotel directly. I would certainly stay at this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen75LosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: This was overall a very nice hotel, in the financial district, which was nice, as it is much more mellow on the weekend. Service was very good, but I would say this hotel is probably a bit overrated. Some sites mistakenly say it has a jacuzzi, which it DOESN'T. The rooms are nice (old world style), room service is very helpful (as were all the people at front desk, bellmen, valets etc.) but the sheets were a bit on the rough side, the shower was average (and I'm being nitpicky here). Don't get me wrong: this is a VERY nice hotel. But if you're expecting the ultimate luxury with the very soft sheets, fancy bathrooms, for those aspects, I'd say it wasn't quite up to par with a five star hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: kguerra
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 2 night stay at the Omni last weekend. The hotel is very beautiful and historic from the outside and the location is excellent to explore the city. We easily walked to Chinatown and Embarcadero. Broadway, which offers the nightlife, is also a short distance away. Public transportation is also very accessible from the hotel. The lobby is really very pretty. The staff is very sweet and helpful. They always have a smile on their face. Our room was clean and very comfortable and tastefully decorated. It also overlooked Montgomery, which was nice. The only downfall about the hotel was the internet connection. WiFi was only available if you took your laptop to a certain location in the lobby. If you wanted a connection in your room it had to be done with a cable connection in the desk and the cost was $15 per day. We never ate at the hotel so I cannot comment on the quality of the food. But overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Omni. I would not hesitate to stay there again when I return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not dazzling”
Reviews.Author: dolpear
Reviews.Content: Meh. After reading all the glowing reviews here, I expected more during my two week stay. The good: The member program is well worth signing up for -- the hot chocolate from complimentary morning beverage service is dense and European-style and comes with whipped cream and cinnamon marshmallows. Umbrellas in the lobby when it's raining outside. Gym is solid, with ellipticals and free weights. Get Fit kit. Most of the staff is attentive (hit or miss though). Seem way more responsive to families with little kids. Great location, decent steakhouse downstairs. The bad: Wireless internet connection blows. Can't leave tip on credit card. My shower curtain had mold on it. O.J. is not fresh-squeezed. Inconsistent housekeeping. Room set up in such a way that trying to close the door of TV armoire resulted in almost knocking over the lamp on nearby desk. Overall, can definitely tell the difference between a four star and a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: TXBluebonnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday night, the first day of our vacation at the Omni. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking California St. It was quite comfortable and quiet although I don't know if it would be as quiet during the work week with much more traffic going by. Easy walk to Chinatown and the financial district. The California Cable car line runs right in front of the hotel. Easy connection to the Hyde and Powell line which takes you to Fisherman's Wharf area, Chinatown and Lombard Street. You can buy a day pass at the front desk. Our $200 rate included a Deluxe Room and valet parking ($45 otherwise.) and we thought this was reasonable for San Francisco. We were quite comfortable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveler7777
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at this hotel and found it to be a very pleasant place, particularly for San Francisco. Everything is gleaming, and in good taste. The staff is excellent; when we asked to have the feather pillows and feather blanket removed due to my wife's allergy, someone was completed the task rapidly and pleasantly. The location is great, with about a bazillion restaurants an easy walk from the hotel. The concierge knows what he's talking about and was very helpful. The apples and apple cider available in the late afternoon was very welcoming. You get street noise if your room faces california Street, so I would ask for a quiet room in the back and/or a room on the top floors. I would also self-park at the St. Mary's garage a very short walk away to avoid the steep valet parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from an excellent 10 day stay at a truly world class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TruthYouveGotIt
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day family vacation to San Francisco where we enjoyed 2 connecting rooms at this exquisite hotel. Every moment spent at the San Francisco Omni Hotel was truly a pleasure! I could not have expected more from our entire experience at this hotel. From the timely communication about the reservation and on-line check-in options, the attentive and warm reception received from each staff member at the time of arrival, the wonderful daily amenities received as simply being a member of the FREE Select Guest program, impeccable housekeeping, exceptional dining through room service and Bob's restaurant, the special kid's program that allowed my daughter to feel just as special as we did each and every day...this hotel has all the bases covered! If you wish for your stay in San Francisco to be a true pleasure for both business and personal travel, you will not be disappointed by staying at this truly world class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: jgenyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Omni for 2 nights during spring break. They upgraded us to 16th floor which was supposed to have free internet but it was not clear how to get this and we got free internet through their Select membership (another great tip from TripAdvisor), it was spotty but not too bad. The room was not big but nice. Comfortable beds, outstanding linens and blankets. The shower pressure was good too. Nice touches like chocolates, bathrobes, good San Francisco map in the room. I tried to share the bed with my 6 year old, but didn't sleep well, and on the second night I requested a rollaway bed. It was also very nice and they didn't charge us for it. The toilet paper holder broke but was promptly fixed. We didn't go to the restaurant, too expensive. Cafe de la Presse, recommended by one of the reviewer, is a nice spot for breakfast, or you can walk to the Ferry building marketplace. All in all, I might have given it 4 stars if we had really paid the average price listed here, but we paid only $144 a night through Expedia, and compared with other CA hotels where we stayed during this trip for similar price, Omni was clearly in a different league.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lombrm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for four nights and had a great experience. I was attending a business conference, but arrived a day early to see the sights. My husband also came along, and we both loved the service at the hotel. All members of the staff were very attentive and accommodating, from the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping. The room was clean and comfortable and very quiet - no problems with noise. I would definitely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, stay on a weekend!”
Reviews.Author: abbeyn
Reviews.Content: The lobby is opulent and the staff were lovely. The bedroom was spacious and the decor is high end and not shabby but a little old fashioned. The bed was very comfortable and very quiet ensuring a good nights sleep. We stayed for four nights over a weekend period and when we asked about extending our stay for a further night (Tuesday night) we were disappointed to learn that the rate was double what we had paid for our previous four nights and resulted in us checking into another hotel in the San Francisco area. The buffet breakfast is expensive (breakfast for three cost €90). The bar is lovely and very well decorated and a little music would have created an ambience here. However, overlooking this we had a lovely stay in this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: france200710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for two nights (3/20 & 3/21) and were immediately impressed by the service upon our arrival. Also, the lobby of the hotel was magnificent. We had a Deluxe Room/Parking arrangement which was very economical ($200 per night plus Expedia fees which were a little high) and our request for a quiet room was certainly honored. The downsides: while the staff at the Omni is Excellent (with a capital e), it is obvious that they've been a victim of the "more with less" phenomenon currently plaguing the U.S. There was a false fire alarm which occurred which, while not they're fault, delayed our sightseeing as we had locked our camera in our room safe and the safe refused to open. When we informed the front desk, they assured us security would be up shortly. This took almost half an hour and two more calls. It would have been much better if we'd been kept advised as to the progress of security. More importantly, though, it would have been much better if there had been more than one security person available. This became a recurring theme of our stay. We had plumbing issues and it took, again, about half an hour for someone to come. I asked the front desk about whether one of our bags had arrived; they said they'd call me to advise me. When I never got a call, I had to call them again and inferred, from the desk clerk's apology, they'd forgotten to call me. Lastly, while our room was quiet, it was a bit run-down (carpet frayed/stained); is this how these "discount" rooms become available to the common masses?

Reviews.Title: “Omni Hotel, 500 California”
Reviews.Author: LovesVacations94
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Omni for our spring break this year which was March17th-21st. Great service, excellent location in San Francisco and a clean and wonderful room. Our kids, ages 11 and 7, loved the attention from the staff. We loved the location to all the attractions in San Francisco. I would highly recommend the Omni. Only down side was the water pressure in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “loved the omni”
Reviews.Author: hodg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in December 2007. Overall it's a great location, the rooms and general decor in the hotel is of a high standard. The hotel staff are really helpful. The breakfast is very good and the bar in the hotel is popular and good value

Reviews.Title: “Great place to give your car a chance to be stolen”
Reviews.Author: JRCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel may have received a top rating for service overall, but the front of the house service is sorely lacking, the doorman, the valet and bell service. One of the jobs is to keep the area in front of the hotel open for guests checking in. When we arrived the area was full of empty limos and service people not doing much of anything. We parked further up and had to walk back to get help with the car and it seemed like I was putting them out. The real problem occurred the next day when we leaving to go shopping to find the car at the curb, (furthest from the front door) unlocked with the keys in the visor and the only staff around was the doorman, who was busy on his cell phone, not paying much attention to anything. When asked, why my car was out there, he said "I don't know, someone must have called for it". No one was concerned or seemed disturbed that my car was out front unlocked with the keys in it, not even the manager who was on duty at the time. I was told that they got the number wrong when someone else called down for their car, the radios have static. I was assured that there was no way that someone else could have taken my car, they check the numbers. The next day when I checked out, I called for the car, I gave them the number, no one asked my name, no one referred to me by name. When I went out front to retrieve my car the valet asked and pointed, "Is that your car?" He never asked my name or checked the number. Now, tell me, how safe to you feel leaving your car at the Omni in San Francisco? Do you feel lucky? My next trip will find me back at the Mark Hopkins.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni and SF!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom
Reviews.Content: This review is late in coming but as it was one year ago today that we were in SF for our anniversary it made me think of it. I LOVED the Omni (not super modern) and the service was excellent. They upgraded us to a top floor room, with rose petals and wash clothes in the shape of a heart for our anniversary with no charge. The only complaint was the kids in the room next door hanging out their window, smoking half the night. But that was not the Omni's fault. The door men were great and the location was convenient to most of what we wanted to see. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: kobesmom
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. This hotel from start to finish was amazing. By far the best service I have ever experienced anywhere. The reservation process was smooth and easy and it just got better once we arrived. The staff at the Omni really goes that extra mile to impress their guests. It was my mom's 60th birthday and they had champagne and a lovely piece of cake waiting for us when we returned from our day in the city. The door man was so charming, he handed my mom a rose and told her happy birthday. The check in process was quick and efficient. We arrived early and had no problem getting our room. I requested the lowest floor available, the man at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. The beds are super soft and the bathroom was very nice as well (huge tub, nice bath products!). The hotel provided a black towncar to take us to dinner, the driver was helpful and also very nice. My only regret was that we only had one night at the Omni. I can't wait to return with my husband on our next trip to SF. We visit the city 3-4 times per year and the Omni is most definitely my favorite hotel ever. It is a very short walk to Union Square (about 10 minutes) and the cable cars run in front of this hotel. North Beach is also very close. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and would highly recommend staying here! It just goes to show you that there are still places out there that put the customer first and go that extra mile to make their guests happy. Bravo Omni..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but no internet...”
Reviews.Author: bajabob
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend getaway planned and were looking forward to our stay at the Omni. The valet parking is 51.00/day but we were directed to a garage up the street for a weekend rate of 7/day. Nice downtown location withing walking distance of shopping and dining. Lobby and restaurant were very nice. My wife's martini was $15 and my beer was about $7. Don't drink too much there. The room we had had a great king bed, super comfy. Old style TV set looked out of place but worked fine. Immaculate rooms and very nice appointments. We were disappointed that our in-room high speed internet did not work. Called customer support 2x but no dice. Mentioned it to the front desk people and they shrugged it off as no big deal and didn't offer to try to make it right for us. Needless to say we didn't get any work done in the evenings but I guess that it wasn't meant to be. So all in all we had a good time at an upscale hotel with crappy internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Well run property”
Reviews.Author: LeoLion69
Reviews.Content: Spent a two night stay at the Omni San Francisco in January 2008. As a member of their frequent guest program I was sent a coupon for 1/2 off the weekend rate and was able to use it. The staff is excellent. From the on-the-spot front doormen to the absolutely perfect front desk clerk (Bridget? not sure but hope that's correct) I couldn't have been more impressed. Because it was our first stay at this property we were upgraded to a Signature room. The room was beautiful and spotless. Very upscale furnishings and fabrics. The Pecksniff's and Moulton Brown toiletries were much appreciated. Mornings we received complimentary coffee and fresh squeezed OJ delivered to the door along with a newspaper. That perk is yours if you sign up with Omni's frequent guest program online. Overall the hotel was in top notch condition and kept spotless. We enjoyed breakfast both mornings in the dining room. As it usually is with hotel dining rooms the prices were pretty steep for breakfast. However, it was convenient for us and worked out fine. Having lived in San Francisco I would say that the location is definitely geared to the business travelers. It is located in the financial district and is a short walk to the more touristy areas, such as Union Square. The Omni offered us complimentary town car service to Davies Symphony hall which was a very nice surprise! Overall we were treated very well. This was one of the finest properties we've stayed in and it's no surprise it's rated number one in San Francisco. Would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Why I'll never stay at another Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DesignrLA
Reviews.Content: Just a short note to explain to you why I will never stay in another Omni Hotel. I reserved a Signature Room at the Omni San Francisco Hotel through Hotels.com for 4 nights, arriving August 31 and leaving September 4, 2007. When I arrived at the hotel I was informed that they had over-booked their rooms. I was told that I would be put in a lower cost standard room, a room without the Signature Room complimentary services. Needless to say, I was not happy about paying the Signature price for the lower cost room, this because I had paid in advance. When I complained, I was offered a free breakfast. After I refused to accept the room they had offered, I was finally given a Signature Room. No doubt some other poor schmuck got stuck paying top dollar for a standard room. A first-class hotel would never have suggested downgrading a paying customer, regardless of how or how much they paid. But then, Omni isn’t a first-class hotel. Once I had checked into my Signature accommodations, everything was fine except for one minor detail. On Monday morning, September 3, while entering the bathroom in my suite, I stepped on a carpet nail that was protruding upward out of the carpet in front of the bathroom door. I didn’t think I needed to be concerned about walking barefoot in my own room, not in a first-class hotel. I wasn’t as angry about being injured by Omni’s negligence as I was by their response. When I contacted the front desk and explained that a nail had punctured my toe and that I was bleeding profusely, their staff offered me a band-aid. Given the fact that I was in pain and limping, given the fact that I now had to contact my doctor to find out when I last had a tetanus shot, given the fact that I now had to worry about catching some horrible disease from the last person who impaled themselves on their carpet nail - I would have expected a first-class hotel to be more consolatory than to offer me a band-aid. After I returned to my room, the Omni staff sent me a note stating that they were unable to find the nail that had injured me. They insisted that I point out the nail to their building engineer, which I did. As their building engineer was pounded the offending nail back into the floor, he stated that he discovered 2 more nails protruding upward out of the carpet in the same general area. I wasn’t aware that I was entering a “mine field” when I checked into the Omni hotel. But the final straw occurred as I was checking out of the hotel. The desk clerk inquired as to my stay. I explained the whole sordid tale, the nail, the blood, the limping, everything. I then asked what was the best way to get to the Oakland Airport. To add insult to injury, she suggested that I walk 4 blocks to the BART station. Once I returned home, I contacted the Omni management to complain. The hotel manager promised to send me a voucher for several free nights stay. This never happened. A first-class hotel manager would have been a man of his word. But then, Omni isn’t a first-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a luxurious feel - Not really for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: This property feels very luxurious, and the rates aren't bad either. Nice lobby, accomodating and friendly front desk staff. Rooms are very comfortable with soft beds and great bathroom amenities. The shower was great too (good water pressure, which I find is often a problem). Decor was classy. Windows in room don't keep out any street noise, but at least they opened to let some fresh air in. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to tourists - it's in the financial district and I found I needed to walk quite a bit to even find restaurants that were open for dinner past 7:00 PM I had trouble with the in-room internet - the hotel was not helpful. Other than that, I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Seattlecarol
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a one night stay - the Front Desk staff was extremely accommodating and allowed us early check in (and late check out). The room was lovely and very comfortable. The Concierge was great! He recommended wonderful restaurants in the area for our lunch that day. We had an evening performance 6 blocks away (all up hill) and he arrranged a complimentary towncar ride to the event. The Omni has a computer room and allowed us to do electronic flight checkin and print our boarding pass at no charge. Our breakfast in the Hotel restaurant (Bob's Steak House) was fantastic with the service rated above a 10. An early dinner in the Bar prior to leaving for the airport was equally marvelous. Best steak I have ever had (albiet quite pricey). Worth every cent. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat and, in fact, may plan a trip back in the spring and will definietly stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful/Quiet”
Reviews.Author: hthr1
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel is beautiful and quiet. Now this isn't the Four Seasons, but it is still along the same lines. Rooms were spacious and elegant and very comftoable and inviting. They even have turn down service in the evening, which is an added bonus. The best thing about this place was the gym. All I can say is awesome!!!! The lighting is great, the equipment was top notch, well taken care of by staff, stocked with towls, headphones, water, etc. AWESOME! Only drawback is that it is a little pricey to say the least. Items in room are a plenty, but it will cost you. My suggestion is to leave those kinds of things alone. LoL I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mvsteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got to escape our lives and children for one night thanks to Grandma. We decided to stay at tripadvisor's #1 pick. We agree. The Omni is truly remarkable. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was spectacular. The shower had two heads plus two coming off the wall. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the place was super clean. We got the California Suite / Sweet deal. They brought us amazing chocolates while we were napping. Then we showered and went out for dinner. When we came back, the bed was made and our used towels had already been replaced. They left even more chocolates by the bedside. I've never been treated so well and we stay at a lot of nice places. This place is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “They surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: FanFicGuru
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review recently regarding my stay last year in September and as you can see, the experience was amazing. After such a great stay I knew that I had to come back to the Omni, and I am so glad that I did. Let me share my wonderful weekend with you. We came to celebrate my fiance's birthday. I made sure to let the Omni know during my reservations and when I spoke with the concierges to arrange for some cider to be sent up to the room. On our way to the hotel I realized we would like a DVD player in our room and when I talked with them I was informed that we wouldn't have to worry about asking for a DVD player because we had been upgraded to a suite (which included a DVD player)! The weather was pretty nasty the day we arrived, but we made it there (sopping wet, but still...). Greeted warmly by the door-man I got my keys and we headed to our suite. It was on the 7th floor, and at first I was disappointed because I had requested a high floor, until I opened the door to our room. The suites have a separate sitting room with a couch and two sitting chairs, as well as a desk and entertainment system set-up (I will post pictures shortly after the review is posted). The stereo was turned on, playing some soft classical music as we entered the room. The ambiance was magnificent. On the table were THREE separate greeting cards, wishing warm birthday wishes to my fiance', inviting us to ask for anything we need to be comfortable, as well as a personally written greeting card from the general manager! This is why the Omni San Francisco won top honors for best service in the United States! Within minutes of settling in there came another knock at the door. My fiance' and I were both surprised to see in-room dining had sent up a slice of chocolate birthday cake! It was very good and we were wondering if they planned to spoil us rotten all weekend. While there were no more additional amenities, the Omni, as always, was very fast and professional with any and all requests that I made. The night that we arrived, for example, I called the front desk to ask for recommendations for a good italian restaurant. The concierge I spoke to (Justin I believe was his name) was very friendly and recommended the North Beach restaurant/area, stating that there were numerous italian restaurants in the area that we could choose from. We took him up on it and sure enough we found a charming little place called Franchino's to have dinner. Our room also came with free breakfast each morning we were there. I've heard mixed reviews about the restaurant from other people, but I thought that the breakfast was very good. Granted that it came with my room and I didn't have to pay anything except for the tip. I'm not sure I would say the same if I actually paid the 25 dollars for the breakfast. Still, as an amenity to a hotel-room package, the breakfast is very good. If there was one thing that I had to say that was not the best experience during this last stay, it was that Cabs were hard to come by this time. I heard something about local taxi services boycotting the Omni, but I'm not sure if that was true or not. Whatever it was, many cabs dropped off their customers and just sped off rather than pick up people waiting in the cab line. So, my fiance' and I did a lot more walking than we probably planned to. Still, if you requested a copy of the 2007 rewards for hotels, you will see the Omni San Francisco won a number of honors. Ranking in at #34 worldwide in Luxury hotels, #3 in U.S Luxury Hotels, Best in the San Francisco Destination (of the top 25), #4 in World- Customer Service and #1 in U.S- Customer Service. That's not the chain, it's this branch! To any Omni San Francisco staff reading this review, thank you so much for making my stay so memorable and I can't wait to come back and visit you again. To anyone visiting San Francisco in the near future: Make your reservations! I can't stress enough how great this hotel is. Affordable luxury, amazing customer service and a great location makes the Omni San Francisco your best bet in this very large city. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Brian-SK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in Jan 08 on the way home from a business trip. The reception was excellent, rooms and bahrooms are very good indeed and all the staff set out to please. Its a bit away from the main tourist areas (Union Square and the Wharf) but thats no bad thing. Its a 10 min walk to Union Square, and approx a 30 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf through North Beach. Its also about 10 mins walk to the Ferry Builiding where you can pick up the F Line tram. The California line cable car stops outside the door so transport is not a problem if you don't want to walk. I booked through the hotel web site directly as this offered the best deal ($169 per night) I also ate at Bobs Steak and Chop House (the hotel restaurant) on the first night. Very good but not a cheap option (approx $70-$80 a head for two courses and a couple of drinks). San Francisco is a great city and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, the Omni San Fransisco.”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We did a 4 week tour of the USA over December/January 2007, with 3 older children (girl, 22, boy, 19 and boy, 18), going to San Francisco [Omni Hotel], Miami (South Beach) [Beacon Hotel], Orlando (Disneyworld, Pop Century Resort), Chicago [Drake Hotel], New York (for Christmas) [Beacon Hotel - unrelated to the Beacon in Miami], Boston [Omni Hotel], New York (again) [Roosevelt Hotel] (including New Year’s Eve at the Renaissance Hotel overlooking Times Square), and a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was sometimes very cosy - sometimes downright stressful - with the kids. Anyway, here are my accommodation reviews. I’ll mention side trips and tours too. Sometimes the accommodation was arranged through a travel agent, but on a couple of occasions I organised it direct. The Omni was arranged through a travel agent in Brisbane, though as usual I had checked with Trip Advisor, and then asked the travel agent to book it when I was satisfied. He got me better rates than going to the hotel direct, too. We were also staying at an Omni in Boston, and as I'd joined the Omni's Select Guest program (free, via the internet), there were advantages to be had. Plus, we'd previously stayed at the Omni in Washington and it was spectacular (my favourite of the 3 Omnis I've stayed in whilst in the USA), so we thought it would be good. We weren't disappointed. Fairly large rooms (we had a double and a triple, though the kids weren't particularly happy at 2 of them having to share a double bed - but then, they're not paying!); interconnecting which was useful. Free internet (I had a laptop) for Select Guest members (if you stay at the Omni, the Select Guest program is recommended - free juice/coffee and newspaper delivered every morning). Very reasonably sized bathroom. In all, very comfortable. It's a grand building with an impressive foyer. We received a lovely sincere welcome from the bell captain on arriving. The hotel is not all the conveniently located, but we were happy to walk and find our way around. Finding cheap restaurants (try feeding 5, including 2 big boys, for 4 weeks straight - you won't be eating at the hotel restaurants very much!) was a bit of a task, but not impossible. Speaking of meals, we fell over Francis Ford Coppola's Italian cafe in Kearney Street on the way back from climbing the Coit tower - it was great. Google it if you are interested. I brought some of the wine back to Australia. We decided to eat there purely on the basis of the menu and the look of the place, then found out who the famous owner was. Recommended purely on the Italian food and the venue, if nothing else. We did a tour of the city (booked through the travel agent), which was absolutely worthwhile. Stopped at good views of the city (from a high lookout), and another spot for views of the Golden Gate Bridge (which the bus drove over). It also included a harbour cruise from Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf, which went under the Golden Gate Bridge and circled Alcatraz Island. It's a good way to see the highlights. Our time at the Omni in San Francisco was good - nice rooms and ambience, but not budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: liylu
Reviews.Content: This hotel & its' staff gives hotels a good name. It is why i love hotels; the staff is friendly/helpful/courteous/kind (& probably thrifty, brave, etc) from the desk staff to the concierge, bellmen, doormen & maids. The lobby IS like walking into the Titanic (as noted in another review). There are milk & EXCELLENT choc chip cookies left in your room each afternoon plus cider & cookies in the lobby. The rooms are beautiful (in contrast to the Madonna Inn where we had just stayed for a night), the beds are comfy & warm. The parking is EXPENSIVE, ($45/day, i think) but i got a deal on Expedia that INCLUDED parking for ~$10/day. The parking is a block or 2 away but only had to wait 5-10 minutes for the car to be brought around. The area has expensive restaurants (Tadich grill, cafe tiramisu) and less expensive ones (House of Nanking); a terrific place for breakfast is Cafe de la Presse a couple of blocks away--reminds me of Paris. You can walk to everything. I want to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarysPlace
Reviews.Content: This was a very classy experience staying at the Omni. I stayed in the California room and which overlooked the city. It was so beautiful. You are also within in walking distance of Chinatown, and Union Square. The staff at this hotel are very attentive and make you feel special. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford to stay here. Although even if you can afford to stay here, it can be competitive at times to find a vacancy. When I return to San Franscisco again in the near future I will definitley stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value - impeccable and great location”
Reviews.Author: agoura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights (Fri and Sat), taking advantage of the weekend rates. The Omni was a very pleasnt surprise as it is a short few blocks from Union square across from the Bank of America tower. We were able to walk to North Beach for dinner. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with marble countertops and shower. Decorated with great taste throughout. The staff was attentive to details and housekeeping keeps the room absolutely impeccable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: AjasTravels
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Omni for 1 night. I found the cheapest rates on the Omni Hotel's website. Unfortunately nothing else was cheap. $45/night for parking with unlimited in and out privileges. $70 for a steak. $34 for 3 cocktails. $70 for 3 mediocre martinis and 2 appetizers. The onion rings were pretty bad. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, but $10 for an internet connection in your room. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. All of the staff were very nice and courteous when we arrived. Security was very helpful when my fiance got locked in the stairwell (you can get into the stairwell, but you need a key to get onto the floors). There was complimentary hot cider and cookies for the guests in the lobby. I especially liked the gingerbread men. The rooms were very nice and spacious (for SF) with marble countertops and high thread count bedding. I loved their bathrobes. When we went back to our room at the end of the night the maid wrote a welcome note and left mint chocolates on the nightstand. The hotel is located in the Financial district so lots of people go to the lobby bar after work. It's a few blocks from Union Square so we took a cab to get around town. I would have given the Omni 5 stars but some of the rates for food were ridiculous and the maids knocked on our door 4 times to clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice, whether you're there for business or for romance”
Reviews.Author: OperaOnTheTurnpike
Reviews.Content: It may sound a bit strange, but I think it's true. Perfect for business and for romance too (not so for singles, partiers, families with kids and so on). Elegant, quiet, perfectly located in a very good part of town ... I think the Omni really has it all. It's obsviously not an inexpensive choice, but their rates are very reasonable for what you get. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms extremely clean, quite large and very comfortable, with incredible beds and bathrooms wonderfully appointed with marble and green and black granite. Room service was very good and front desk staff was efficient. One of the definite pluses of the hotel is the express check-out. So efficient, as you bypass the usual check-out procedures (unless you disagree with the price to pay). You gave them your credit card when checking-in, so finding your final bill in an envelope at your door room the final morning and simply leaving is always a great thing. The restaurant is average and quite overpriced, but I guess this is somewhat usual in this kind of properties. It was definitely what I like the least. You don't need to pay such prices for breakfast or dinner, especially considering you will find plenty of fantastic places to eat at reasonable prices in nearby North Beach and all over the city. The location is the very best I could personally ask for. I understand that those who visit San Francisco for the first time usually prefer to stay in Union Square (which, by the way, is within walking distance) or in Fisherman's Wharf (which I would never recommend), but, for me, the area around the Omni is the very best. for the following reasons: a) The area is very nice and you're within walking distance to places such as Union Square, North Beach, Chinatown, the Embarcadero, the cable car turntable, and so on. b) It is very quiet, as it is located at the edge of the financial district. So, when I have enough budget for it, the Omni is, for all those reasons and more, my personal choice in San Francisco, my very favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay part was great, marred by concierge and steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: HotelLuvvingFamily
Reviews.Content: We were there the day after Thanksgiving. It had a nice upscale feel for a reasonable rate of about $160 for a regular room (Thanksgiving weekend). Perfect if you want something nice that is kid friendly. Our family had a room, and the other family we were traveling with had 2 rooms with connecting doors. Both of our families have children ages 5 to 11. We loved the pretty hotel, decked out for the holidays. We loved its proximity to Chinatown (5 mins walk), and around 10 min walk to Union Square. It was a block away from a Walgreens and McDonalds, which is convenient if you have kids. The children loved their Omni backpacks and the complimentary milk and cookies. The staff is nice and attentive, they clean the room 2x/day. Downside is the concierge. They gave wrong information on restaurants twice - once they gave the wrong address to a restaurant they recommended at the Fisherman's Wharf. Another time they assured (and refused to double check) that a restaurant will be open for Thanksgiving dinner. When we got there, the restaurant was closed. They also were not aware of a fun pack that the Omni loans to kids that contains games and activities and such. For the restaurant in the hotel, Bob's Steakhouse... It was "ok". One thing a steak purist would frown on is that the steak comes to you with a humongous giant single carrot right in the middle of the plate as if it is the main dish. The steak and the potatoes are to its left and right. Also, the carrot was dripping in glaze that contaminated our steak. When we inquired about this, they said that it is a Bob's Steakhouse signature (putting the carrot in the middle), but you can always ask to put it on the side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: EssEffMD
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni for a long weekend, we are former residents of San Francisco and are well acquainted with The City and all it has to offer. The Omni is ideally located, within walking distance to Union Square (great shopping), Belden Place (great dining) and the Cable Car stops right outside the front door of the hotel. We found the staff to be friendly, accommodating and quite professional, the hotel itself has the feel of a smaller boutique hotel and is an excellent choice for lodging. Definitely plan to stay here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Top San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poshexpert
Reviews.Content: Two nights on business. Second time at this excellent hotel. Consider this one of the best chain hotels I've stayed in and one of the best in Sand Francisco. All requests made during reservations are met by the Omni. On the way to airport left cell phone in limo and Lex Doherty, the excellent concierge, arranged for the phone to be sent by FED EX to my home the following morning. Hotel has added touches such as a creative way of giving you a semi-complimentary continental breakfast... coffee and juice are free... with minimal charges for extras. CB is delivered to your room with newspapers without all the formality of room service. They leave at door so you don't have to answer immediately early in the AM. Excellent location and very convient and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel A+”
Reviews.Author: cm2race
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the location could not be more perfect! However it is the staff at the Omni that makes this hotel above the rest. Upon our arrival the front desk assisted my daughter and myself to plan tours, directions and transportation for our stay. Joey "suggested" not pushed on several choices based on our interests. As we were in the first few minutes of unpacking in our room, Joey sent complimentary refreshments via roomservice. The extra attention the entire staff including the housekeeping service was beyond our expectations. Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance. Other transportation we purchased the 3 day muni pass and rode the trolley and cable cars to every destination on our list. The suggested tours of Muir Woods and Napa Wine Country were awesome. Tower Tours picked us up from the hotel front door, they were well worth every cent. The tour guide named Will was outstanding. It is recommended 100%. We will certainly return to the Omni for our next visit to this fantastic city and would not even consider another hotel. Although we did not dine at Bob's, I regret not having done so. It will be on the list the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Scousemooncat
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of our Honeymoon (having already been to Vegas and Hawaii) and we were looking for a relaxed atmosphere and comfort and we struck gold again!...The hotel was lovely and clean, the staff friendly and the food excellent in the attached Bobs Steakhouse...hint - try the Massive onion rings..mmmmmm.... just in the right place for you to get to the embarcadero for the F-trams or walking, or turn right to tackle the big ole hills (well worth it!)... Cant fault the place at all!...a perfect end to a perfect honeymoon... S

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleolily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni in San Francisco 11/10/07 for 1 night. I have been to San Francisco many, many times and this rates as one of the best hotels I've stayed at. They have a great location, the rooms were above average, and they have a restaurant that is definitely better than most hotel restaurants. (Bob's Chophouse) What prompted me to stay at this Omni for the first time in San Francisco was a free upgrade room pass I received for my horrible stay at the Omni in Austin, TX. I swore after that experience that I wouldn't stay again at an Omni, but wanted to use the upgrade and liked this location. Well, the upgrade (and what I was told I'd receive when I made the reservation) would have been an upgraded courtyard view. That didn't happen...we were given the inferior room anyway with an alley view so they didn't even utilize the upgrade or give us the room promised. If that hadn't occurred my experience would have been rated as "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debs582
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel a family of 4 including 2 small children, for 2 nights. On arrival my children were given a backpacks with gifts from the hotel which they were delighted with, checkin was also very quick and staff friendly. Our room was a deluxe room it was very comfortable, classically decorated and very nicely finished. The lobby area of the hotel is also very grand with beautiful chandliers and staircase. The hotel is a very short walk from china town where we enjoyed a meal one night, the only downside to the hotel was the valet parking, A call had to be made to request your car 20 minutes prior, we did this 4 times during our stay and twice had to wait another 10 minutes also. Parking rates are expensive at 50 dollars a night. This aside the hotel and our room were lovely and all dealings we had with the staff , we found them to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Librarianone
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel were superb. Customer service from every staff member was amazing - recommendations for dining and attractions were right on - never too busy to help. The location of the hotel was terrific for walking to many of the prime tourist areas - safe and secure. Our room on the 5th floor was opulent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Management, OK Location (for us)”
Reviews.Author: Indianpass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni based on reviews and overall pricing compared to other similarly rated large Hotels in San Francisco. We arrived quite late on a Thursday evening (9:30pm Pacific) due to our flight from Atlanta. We had booked online and I had asked for an upper level no-smoking room. There was no availability for either unfortunately I was told and initially we were placed in a smoking-permitted floor and room. I called the front-desk to ask if any accomodation could be made. The night manager, a wonderful person named Ellen K., indicated she would have us moved to another deluxe room that was non-smoking if we didn't mind moving to another room on our third day/night's stay. This was fine with us. Ellen subsequently called back a few minutes later and said the third night would be an upgraded deluxe suite room on an upper floor because of the trouble (at no extra charge of course). The entire stay was extremely nice, the BellHop area held an extra bag for us for three days while we went to Big Sur in a Miata and provided the bag as needed. Overall a great customer service environment. And the rooms/beds/furnishing was top-notch. The only possible knock is that the hotel is in the financial district. The night-life areas, such as Union Square and North Beach, are within a few blocks walking distance so this is a minor point-of-note. Don't wear heels like my wife did though.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownSteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel was top notch all the way. From express check in upon late evening arrival, to complimentary coffee, juice and paper delivered every morning to the room. The room was elegant and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic with wonderful toiletries. The workout room was private, just the right size and had complimentary water and fruit at all times. To top it all off, upon checkout they offered to take us via their Lincoln Town Car to our car rental agency in lieu of us taking a taxi. Would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience with the Management”
Reviews.Author: jke79
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Omni San Francisco started out poorly when I requested a double room (with two double beds) but received a queen room (with one queen). I asked for a rollaway bed, and ages later received a ridiculous inflatable bed not suitable for a comfortable night’s sleep. I managed, but it was very uncomfortable. The worst part, however, came after my stay when I had a $300 charge on my credit card. I called to inquire about the charge and they proceeded to tell me it was for room damage. I had no idea what they were talking about and after further investigation, they told me there was a hole in the wall of the room we stayed in. I of course asked for the manager to call me, and was extremely taken aback at how I was treated. He was pompous and rude and immediately accused me of putting the hole in the wall. He assured me there was no way his staff would have missed the hole and rented out a room in such a state. I told him that they did, and that my friend (who I immediately phoned afterwards) actually saw the hole – but forgot to mention it to me (it was at the bottom of the wall near the baseboard in the hallway near the door, making it easy to miss). After I relayed this to the manager, he made a snide remark about how guests of his hotel are high-class and would call and complain if they received a room with a hole in the wall. Having no idea of the consequences of not reporting the hole, my friend didn't feel he needed to say anything and thus I never knew about it. The manager was horribly condescending and from his last remark implied that I was not a high-class guest and ‘didn’t belong’ at his hotel. I again assured him that the hole was not from me and he had no proof. He again insisted that his staff does not make mistakes and would never rent out a room with a hole in the wall. I was not going to budge and insisted that he reverse the charge. After going back and forth for awhile, he finally succumbed and reversed the charge. However, I was left with a bad taste in my mouth. I should not have had to defend my honor, and I knew he thought I was lying even after he reversed the charge. Even though I got the charge reversed, I still didn’t feel like I won. This hotel should not be four-star, as four-star hotels would never treat their guests like this. The Omni San Francisco is a third-rate hotel with mediocre customer service and horrible management. Yes, it was bad luck that I got that room, but my experience with the management was enough to make me write this review and encourage travelers to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Oyster4
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am probably one of the most pickiest individuals with food and service. I will say the Omni surpassed my expectations. The rooms are nice enough (the beds, furniture, and TV) could be updated with more modern furnishings, but after that, the hotel is not only in a great location but their staff is extremely customer oriented and surpasses what you would get at any other hotel. I had one small problem with a smoker being in the room before me and the staff bent over backwards to get the problem corrected and comped a breakfast (with me asking) for the hassle. The check in was very easy and the food and drink in the bar was very good. I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: scuff66
Reviews.Content: Omni is in the business district of San Francisco on California St. The room was very comfortable for 2, clean and quiet. Service was excellent. Bob's Chop House had breakfast that ran $25 but there is a Subway across the street. The restaurant seems to cater to the Business Lunch crowd. The concierge recommended a 3 day transit pass for $18. We walked out the door and literally stepped on a cable car. In other areas people were waiting 20 minutes to do the same. Concierge also recommended we take a city tour from Tower Tours . It too was excellent I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Work2TravelUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel lived up to the Omni reputation from check in through to check out. Room was clean and standard high - toiletries were top notch!! Location is in the financial district so not too much on the doorstep but all within easy distance and trolley right outside the door. No panhandlers outside which for SF is a blessing! Restaurant looked good and is recommended in guides but we didn't eat there as it is very pricy. The bar was expensive too but cosy and relaxing. Staff were very helpful and you could even buy a MUNI pass (highly recommend for value and convenience) at the desk. We were celebrating our 10th anniversary and at check in I was given a red rose and in our room was complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Beautiful touch and greatly appreciated after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Property”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: Great location on California Street, centrally located to the financial district, Chinatown, and Union Square. It's right across the street from the Bank of America building, which helps you find the hotel if you're not familiar with San Francisco streets. Check in was very professional and courteous. I was able to secure an early check in at 10:00 am. It's a mid-sized property, compact, yet business smart and understated luxurious. Getting from your room to one of the conference rooms takes only a couple of minutes at most. Elevators are fast. Rooms are average sized, very comfortable, with nice bedding. Lighting is excellent for in-room working. Bathroom was upscale with granite counters, marble floor, large mirror, nice lighting, make up mirror, scale, and a roomy bathtub. Upscale bath amenities are provided. The banquet food was excellent and well-prepared. Did not try room service or restaurants. Express checkout made my departure smooth and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: thmaesbe
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms. Very efficient and friendly check-in and check-out. Excellent value. The steaks at Bob's downstairs are indeed terrific, and so are the views from the top floor of the Bank of America building opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Cranleigh
Reviews.Content: After two weeks travelling we stayed for three nights here. Uniformly good service from staff. Rooms were welcoming & spacious without being too impersonal. Teenagers got cookies each night, we got an ice-bucket filled and chocolates.Good clean bathrooms. Interconnecting rooms a plus. Surprisingly quiet for central location. Walkable to main shopping & to China town restaurants. On cable car route. Don't bother with valet parking it is only one block to easy parking. Take a cable for the internet. Small but pleasant bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlpetrillo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Omni in San Francisco and we were so impressed with this hotel, we were compelled to write about it. The price is so affordable that you really don't expect to be 'wowed' by the hotel. But our expectations were far exceeded. The service of every staff member we came in contact with was exemplary. The Front Desk personnel were so helpful in recommending restaurants, transportation, etc. They even booked a (future) dinner for us at a restaurant in Napa Valley, which was the next leg of our vacation. The Front Desk personnel, Bellboys, the Doormen, the Housekeeping staff---every single person treated us like royalty. Our room was perfectly clean when we arrived, the front desk staff went out of their way to see that we had a room with a view, and they always followed up by phone to make sure we received whatever service we had requested. Additionally, the location of the Omni is ABSOLUTELY excellent. We walked EVERYWHERE. To the Ferry Building every day, to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, to Ghiaradelli Square, to Lombard Street, to dinner each night. We never had to take a taxi or other type of transportation. Granted, some of the walks were steep uphill climbs, but that was part of the inate charm of the city. What a fantastic, albeit short time we had in San Francisco. And many thanks to the Omni for making our stay so thoroughly enjoyable. Steve and Tammy Lunn, Laytonsville, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: noelmal
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location - we walked to North Beach, China Town, the Ferry building and shopping in downtown and felt safe in the area. They switched out their room service menus 1/2 way through our stay and the prices went from reasonable to pretty expensive. R/S was always on time and they were friendly. Our room was small with two double beds, one chair and a desk but it was well kept and housekeeping was very good. Our room was by an elevator on the 8th floor so I was a bit worried that it would be noisy but it was very quite. Service was good in the hotel but sometimes the door staff was a bit too casual. We ate one night in the bar off of the lobby and the food was good as was the service. We also ate at the Market Bar down by the Ferry building twice - once for lunch and once for brunch. It was great and had inside and outside seating available. The Ferry building also had some great gourmet food stores and retail shops. We had dinner at Home in the Lower Haight area and it was very good. It had simple food and a nice atmosphere. Overall the hotel was a great jumping off location to most points in the city and it was a hassle free stay in a safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_charlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 3 nights at the Labour Day weekend. It was the last stop of our honeymoon to the US and we couldn't have made a better choice. We were upgraded to a Bay View Room on the top floor (17th floor). My wife was given a rose at check in, they brought us a bottle of champaign and chocolate-coated strawberries and had arranged our bathrobes with another rose the first evening. Room service was simply outstanding. I highly recommend joining the free OMNI Select Guest programme which entitles you to complimentary WIFI, beverage and newsparer service. Staff was charming, attentive and helpful with the exception of one gruffy bellman. Dined once at Bob's Steakhouse (belonging to the hotel), waiters so so, but great food, had a perfect filet mignon. Cable Car line runs just in front of the house. The only minor drawbacks: - WIFI service doesn't work on the 17th floor which they "somehow forgot" to mention at check-in (however, as Select guest you can use the cable internet free of charge) - walls are quite thin (the same old story everywhere...) - parking: as usual in SF, street parking is a mess and the hotel charges a hefty 40$ valet fee for 24 hours + 6$ city tax. Hotel is within walking distance of Ferry Building, Embaracadero, Coit Tower, Market Street, Chinatown and SOMA. Would highly recommend and always return there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for one night as an anniversary weekend getaway. The hotel was clean and the lobby is gorgeous. Reminded me of the Titanic movie with its 1920's decor. The rooms are spacious...a bit old, but very clean. The front desk was friendly and the hotel really does go out of its way to make you feel welcomed. Upon check in, my husband I were greeted with a rose for me and congrats on our wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to the 17th floor and given a room with a view of the bay. Nice! Then hotel sent a martini glass full of chocolate truffles and a small bottle of red wine with a card that wished us happy anniversary. Totally cute and a pleasant surprise. The hotel is defintely worth its value.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is heaven”
Reviews.Author: worldtravler_7
Reviews.Content: The Omni was great! The room was clean, comfortable and the service at the hotel was second to none. We loved the coffee/juice and paper deliverey to the room each morning. The evening turn down service was perfect at the end of a long day! I very much recommend the Omni and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiquita2007
Reviews.Content: I booked the Omni based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the Hotel was even more amazing than all of the reviews would have you believe. The rooms are beautiful, the staff is friendly, attentive and helpful and the room service was fantastic. It's also extremely convenient to the cable car and Chinatown. I would definitely return to the Omni San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel But with a little more soul than most”
Reviews.Author: drabs
Reviews.Content: This could be just a standard downtown hotel, but it's better than average. The staff is friendly, the housekeeping staff leaves you cute notes, they gave us a rose because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary... The location is very central. The cable cars stop outside and it's only five blocks to the Ferry Terminal Building. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Omni Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Balconylove
Reviews.Content: I love staying in wonderful hotels, so when my boyfriend and I chose to escape the Los Angeles heatwave and enjoy a romantic getaway in San Francisco, The Omni was the perfect choice. We drove and arrived at 3:00 am and were greeted even in the wee hours with a perfect check in and a smile. Our room was on the 16th floor and had great architectural views of nearby buildings. The room was elegant and cozy with top notch Molton Brown bath products. The hotel location is close to everything and you can walk to all points of interest such as Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, SFMOMA, Yuerba Buena Gardens, etc. Weather was perfect, concierge made dinner reservations to the Carnelian Room for us on the 52nd Floor of the B of A Building which has spectacular views of SF. It was perfect. We took a trolley from the wharf back to the hotel and were dropped off right in front of the Omni. It doesn't get much better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: yankeedoodledandee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, on a cable car line, near to china town and opposite a great restaurant in the bank of america builing. Our room was of good quality fixtures and fittings, staff were very helpful, with a nice bar area looking onto the street. Hotel is about a 10 minute waalk to union square for shopping, 15 minute walk to the nearest pier area and bay bridge. Fishermans wharf is a cab or bus ride. Book alcatraz prison tour before you arrive in san fran. Open top otur bus of city worth doing as well. No free parking at hotel, have to use car parks opposite, which are not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel and amazing steak restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGWolverhampton_Uk
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for three nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel looks very elegant and the front desk staff are extremely welcoming. They are very happy to offer you advice about 'the sights' and will make every effort to make you feel a valued customer. The price, which is not excessive, was justified in the quality. I'd told them that it was our honeymoon when I booked the room. When we arrived we had been upgraded to a beautiful room on the 16th (out of 17) floor. When we got to the room we were greeted with huge strawberries dipped in dark chocolate, chilled sparkling wine, red wine, fresh fruit, mineral water all dressed with orchid heads and a hand written note congratulating us. It was really wonderful. The room was a very good size, bathroom fantastic - Molton Brown products. Bed was extremely comfortable with very good quality linen. The whole hotel was very clean and the housekeeping staff clearly took pride in their work. There was even a note welcoming us to the hotel from the member of staff responsible for our room- very nice touch. We had breakfast and dinner in Bob's Steakhouse. The breakfast was nice but nothing outstanding. Service on both occasions was good. The steak however was simply the best either of us have ever tasted! We both had the fillet mignon, it was cooked perfectly to our request. Fabulous. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will happily book hotels within this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: maverickdog
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco really was absolutely wonderful. We got a great deal on their website, and we were really thrilled with the room, the lobby, the bar, and the location. The hotel is just a short cable car ride to almost all the tourist attractions, while also in a very safe area. We were very impressed and would definitely recommend it. As an added bonus, I accidentally left my wedding band on the nightstand the morning of our checkout, I finally noticed it when we were driving down the coast on the Pacific Coast Highway...I called the front desk, they connected me to housekeeping, and housekeeping overnighted it to our next hotel in Monterey that very day. Exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to various sites: Union Square by muni, cable car, BART”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaNative
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor, we used HotWire for our one night at the Omni, at a reasonable rate. (less than $200). We experienced the same outstanding service as previous posts mentioned, so I will try not to repeat information, except to recognize our concierge Justin Seeto who sent chocolate-covered strawberries and champagne to our room while we were out, to congratulate us on our anniversary. We called the Front Desk to thank him for the treats. Later, (most likely) our concierge also surprised us with a small bottle of wine, along with more chocolates, probably delivered during turndown service. I had also signed up for Omni's free Select Membership benefits online: i.e.complimentary morning newspaper - notify Front Desk which one, complimentary morning beverages - write on Breakfast menu tag and hang outside door before going to sleep, late check out - after 12 noon but notify Front Desk, evening turndown service, etc. We parked at St. Mary's Garage (entrance on left-side, 1/2 block before California, while driving north on Kearny). $32 for 24 hrs. No in-out privileges, but we didn't need our car since we could take public transportation everywhere, or walk a few blocks to Union Square/Chinatown/North Beach/Market St. We walked less than 10 min. to the Embarcadero stop on the F line (SFMTA's Muni ) to Pier 29/Chestnut St. to enjoy a dinner & show at Teatro Zinzanni. We enjoyed this European-style cabaret, focused on fun through comedy, music, Cirque du Soleil-style feats, audience participation/interaction, and a 5-course dinner. Since the seats are arranged in concentric circles, all views are good. We hardly noticed that 3 hours had passed when the show ended as we ate dessert. We also saw the da Vinci exhibit at the Metreon (4th/Mission, south of Market), closing Dec. 31. The range of inventions displayed and re-created was astounding, especially the precursors to modern inventions. If you show a BART ticket until Aug. 31, you get a $4 discount off the adult admission price. We may take our kids next time for an Omni stay, or go by ourselves again!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay, Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Travler322111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was and absolutely exquisite place... The Lobby was beautiful, and the Hotel Restaurants were GREAT!!! Recommended even for families with children! Also, it was in a great part of San Fransisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Class”
Reviews.Author: MineralKing
Reviews.Content: From the minute you step into the lobby and the eager (but not overly) front desk staff greet you, you know you're in for a great stay. The lobby is beautiful with seating areas for cocktails or dining... all sparkling and impressive. Great steakhouse and bar located in the hotel too... Right on California Street on the Nob Hill cable car line, you can close the double glazed windows and not hear a thing, or slide em up a little for some ambient SF street noise... it's great. The room I had was a king bedded room in front of the hotel on the 11th floor with a view of the Bank of America building. Great pillows! Firm but comfortable bed. The bathroom was marble and antiqued. The amenities were awesome (Pecksniffs) and just everything about the room was classy. It is a very smart choice in SF compared to some of the other long standing Nob Hill establishments who have seemed to take a turn for the worse in recent years (Stanford Court, Fairmont, Huntington). A great business or adult getaway hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: nancycel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend visit to San Francisco celebrating our 36th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Omni. The room was beautiful and impeccably clean. The service and accommodations were wonderful. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Since it was our anniversary, the maid had arranged towels in the shape of a heart with a nice little heart shaped note beside it. Our concierge Vida Lau at check-in congratulated us on our anniversary and said that something would be sent up to us later. Well, upon our return after a little walk in China Town there was a small bottle of champagne "chilled" with glasses along with some chocolate covered strawberries. And Vida had sent along a little note. Whenever we wanted to take a tour or ask about transportation either the doorman or the concierge were so very helpful. We had our breakfasts and one dinner at Bob's restaurant there and the meals were wonderful and so was the service. My husbnad and I agree that this by far was not only one of our favorite vacations but these were the best accommodations and service that we have EVER had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Likes2Travel00
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience! Staying at the Omni was the cherry on top of our stay. Excellent service, impeccable room, and fabulous location. The staff is really great too. They even left my daughter a cookie and milk in the room our first night there. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for luxury in San Francisco. Short walk from both Union Square shops and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Completely exceeded our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: LoriMu
Reviews.Content: We just returned after spending several days at the Omni. We booked the hotel based on in part the reviews we read here. The hotel is quite beautiful, as we expected, but what we didn't expect was the service. We've stayed in many beautiful hotels, but no one has ever treated us as well as we were treated here.
