The glazed carrot that they serve with every steak oozed it's glazing onto my steak. Not the best taste combo. For weekend travel you might find a better place to stay. The Omni is in the Financial District, so a lot of stuff is closed during the weekend. However, you can walk anywhere, even, but it might take a little bit longer to get to the other parts of the city. I really enjoyed my stay at The San Francisco Omni, and I would stay there again. It was a terrific room.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though we live in the East Bay, we like to play tourist in San Francisco. Discovered The Omni while participating in the annual "Dine About Town" this past January. From the moment we walked in the door, we were transported to another era. Loved walking EVERYWHERE...Ferry Building (and the Saturday Farmer's Market), Red's Java Hut, a walk to SBC Park, SOMA, The Irish Bank, ending a full day at Bimbo's 365 Club for a fabulous concert, and of course a walk back "home". Have and will continue to recommend The Omni to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel remote location unless in town on business...”
Reviews.Author: Nalrud
Reviews.Content: Omni Hotel in San Fran... is beautiful however it is a bit remote if you are not in town for business. During weekdays you are in a bustling business district full of places to eat, have coffee or people watch however during evening hours and especially on weekends the area is quite empty. On Sunday morning we stopped by 3 different starbucks stores that are located in the 2 blocks radius of the hotel until we found one (4th) that was open and that one obviously had a line outside... The staff at the hotel is very accommodating. The hotel lobby is stunning and the room was lovely, a walk-in closet was a plus. No complains about large windows or spaciousness of the room however the bath while quite nice and clean, lacked a hand shower or a flexible enough top shower where you can point it to the wall when needed. A squeaky pocket door separating the room from the bath was not the best either but that is an easy fix (call the staff resolved in minutes)... Overall, very nice hotel however if you are in San Fran... for pleasure pick a different area...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DnKCumbria_England
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from San Francisco and we spent 3 of our nights in the Omni. It is an excellent hotel, very clean and with very helpful staff. The location is also very good, within the financial district and right outside is the California Street tramline. This line did not appear to be used as much as the Powell/Hyde and Powell/Mason lines which made jumping on and off very easy. Our only minor gripe is the bar, we thought it was little pricey, $14 for a glass of wine. But, all in all we had a great stay here and would definately return.It's easy to see why it is number 3 on the rankings.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulos Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excelent stay at the Omni. The room was on the thirteenth floor and was actually named. My only complaint was the rooms were to yellow.The rooms were spatious and warm and the TV shows a lot of great channels. The only thing is they don't have many channels.Again I say I had a great experience at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Abosultely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Becky139
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It has a great location. We could walk to Chinatown, the shopping district, and many other places. They have a wonderful lobby and the doormen are excellent. The concierge was amazing and went out of their way to help us. The room was also great. It was spacious and the bathroom was great. I would reconmend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The location was great! You literally are right in between Chinatown and fisherman’s wharf! There is a trolley stop right in front of the hotel and a subway across the street. The service was wonderful and the rooms overwhelmingly exceeded my expectations. There room service is ok, but like any hotel they way overcharge you for food and water. There is a Walgreen’s a block down Montgomery street and you can get a six pack of water or one large water for about 1/3 the price. The concierge was excellent and very helpful. Defiantly buy the Muni pass they offer it WILL save you a lot of money! My husband and I are just average people and we thought that since this was the Omni that maybe we would be treated poorly but not at all. We received excellent treatment. When my husband and I return to SF we will defiantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Omni is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: RealtiyCheck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni on Dec. 22-24 with hubby and two small kids. Service was great from the get go. My kids were delighted on receiving goody bags filled with toys and candies upon arrival. We were there on our anniversary and noted that on our reservation. When we arrived in our room, we had champagne and chocolate covered stawberries (and lots of it) waiting for us. Very, very nice. They really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. This was truly the best hotel experience I or my husband have ever had. I did not have a single complaint during my entire stay. I will definitely stay there again next time I'm in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Chicamundo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I booked this hotel for one night using Priceline. I asked for a four star hotel for 75.00, and it was confirmed within minutes! The hotel website shows their rack rate rooms at 245.00 a night. Beautiful room, with bathrobes in the closet, Huge bathroom and the most heavenly beds! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a luxury room at a very low price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJQuick
Reviews.Content: We've had great experiences at Omni Hotels. Why change when we've always had great experiences in different cities. This hotel had what I expected. A beautiful room, it was nicely furnished and was a good size. We arrived at the hotel before check in time and the staff offered to hold our luggage so we could begin exploring San Fran. We were able to check in later on. We were within a 5 minute walk to Chinatown and the cable cars went directly in front of the Omni. Top notch hotel. Highly recommended. We would stay here again if we visited again.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: pants8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I ran away from Christmas this year and stayed at the omni for 4 nights. we stayed at the W when we were in San Francisco in October and even though the Omni isn't as stylish the service is better by far. Every thing with our room was great until the 3rd night when we got new neighbours, it was an adjoining suite so the sound and the cigarettes escaped over to our side. We still aren't sure if they were supposed to be smoking in there or not...anyhow the staff were great, they moved us to another room, no problem, and even sent us a little bottle of wine with our room service christmas dinner. Christmas dinner room service was burgers and beer which were delicious. My only service complaint actually happened that same day - after wandering around in the rain all day we stopped in the bar for a cocktail before going up to our room, but we never did get served, not even a hello or "i'll be right with you", nothing. That was quite surprising given the service throughout the rest of the hotel. Anyhow, we had a great getaway in San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WORTH every cent! the very best hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Psboston7
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for this hotel through priceline but I must say after our stay I think I will never stay at any OTHER hotel when I am in San Francisco. Being that my background is hospitality and hotels in particular, (used to work for and open Marriott Hotels, Starwoods, Sheratons and Forte) when I say this it the VERY BEST HOTEL that I have stayed in EVER that is saying a lot. Customer service was ABOVE AND BEYOND Fantastic. To clarify yes the valet is $45.00 (in line with city parking) however we parked at the Chinese Catholic Center on Jackson st & it was $24 not far from the hotel either. The location is close to Chinatown & North Beach, although it sits in the heart of the Financial District the cable car stop is right outside your door so really no need to rent a car unless you have to also the Front Desk sells all day muni passes for $11 which is a really good buy if you will be traveling the city it is good for the cable cars as well as the buses. The rooms are spacious, nicely appointed the amenities are luxurious, linens are DIVINE, housekeeping associates were friendly and consistently available. Room service was expensive but the late night menu was delicious and they even allowed us to order desserts from the regular menu (although it was pass the cut-off time) Front desk associates were attentive & VERY, VERY helpful (Carmen in particular) complimentary in room wireless internet, complimentary business center with internet access, do yourself a favor & do as a reviewer before me recommended & sign up for the omni hotel frequent guest program the check out is at 5:00pm & every morning they bring up complimentary newspapers and beverages of your choice they do this also in the evening with milk & cookies (although I think this was done becuase we traveled with teenagers) Saying all this I was very impressed with the Omni Hotel and think that perhaps there is hope for our Hospitality industry in the Customer Service department since the past 6 years I have seen a decline this hotel has renewed my inspiration for our Industry. WELL DONE! Respectfully Reviewed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that's just a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: tdandmd
Reviews.Content: This is a great "smaller" hotel that is in the Financial District and therefore quite a bit quieter than the usual Union Square, Fisherman Wharf, etc. locations yet super close to all that and more. The hotel is a converted/refurbished old business building and you would expect it to be dark and cramped but the common areas were beautiful and the room was decent size and very clean and modern. The bathroom was nice with great soaps and things. The room also came with robes, a safe and umbrella. As I noted, after about 6:00 the Financial District is pretty much deserted, but you are only about two blocks from China Town, four blocks from Union Square (by way of some great shopping streets in and of themselves), a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, a couple blocks to North Beach, a couple blocks to the Metreon, a couple blocks to the new Ferry Building. Plus, you have a great bar/restaurant right in your own hotel and the Carnelian Room (for the view) across the street in the Bank of America Building. And on top of all that, the cable car goes right by the front door so you can hop on and be on Nob Hill in no time without hiking up the hills yourself. The only negative that we have to say is that the parking was $45, which is just ridiculous. If we hadn't been so pressed for time when we arrived late, we would have parked it ourselves up the street at the St. Mary's garage for $20 (which is what you know the hotel is probably doing.) Of course, the good part was that we got this through Priceline (I had a good idea this was the hotel I was bidding on so I went for it) for $75 for a Saturday night at Christmas shopping time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SLOJJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Saturday night stay at the Omni with our two year old and were extremely pleased with the hotel. We have stayed in several hotels in San Francisco and our room at the Omni was by far the largest. We used Priceline and got a rate of $80, then upgraded at check-in for another $25 to a very spacious room that worked well for the three of us. I was really surprised to get such a reasonable rate in the middle of the holiday season in the city. We followed the advice of a reviewer and skipped the $53 valet parking fee by parking one block up at the St. Mary's Square garage (on Kearney) for $6.50 for 24 hours. Hard to believe you can park anywhere in San Francisco for $6.50, but parking on the weekend in the Financial District was a great tip. The other tip we used was to enroll in Omni's preferred guest program on their website before we checked in. Not only did it get us complementary beverages and a paper in the morning, but it allowed us to check out anytime before 5 p.m. the next day. We were able to do some shopping (and eat dim sum in Chinatown) on Sunday morning, then return to our hotel room and let our toddler take a nap before leaving town. The staff were very friendly and gave our little one a welcome bag of goodies when we checked in, and we were pleased to see other children at the hotel, although the rooms were very quiet. The Omni is ideally located within walking distance of Chinatown, Union Square, and the Ferry Building. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had high expectations, and we were not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TP1234
Reviews.Content: My family spent five nights at the Omni San Francisco during the Thanksgiving week, and we had a wonderful time. I have been in many hotels in San Francisco before but never at the Omni. I’ve heard great things about it from my colleagues and have read consistent, good reviews on the web. I decided to give a try for our family vacation, considering someone in the family is usually picky about hotels. The room was very clean and well equipped with everything, including bathrobes. The marble bathtub was sparkling and the bed was very comfy. The entire staff was very nice. The room was serviced twice a day, and a complimentary beverage was delivered in the morning - with our choice of beverages and delivery time. There were two computers in a small room at the hotel lobby for guests to use the Internet though the guest rooms also have free high-speed Internet. Overall, I had better experience at the Omni than I had in other 5 or 4-star hotels I’ve stayed in SF, thanks to its personalized service. All the good things you read from the reviews are true. Besides service, another reason we picked the Omni is its location. It is in the middle of everything and right on the cable car line. It is two blocks from Chinatown – very convenient for getting fresh Chinese pastries in the mornings. A few advices if you decide to stay at the Omni: (1) Sign up for the Select Guest program before you make the reservation. You can read the benefits on omnihotels.com. (2) Take public transportation (BART/MUNI) instead of renting a car. If you have to rent a car, rent it in the city and try to return on the same day, since overnight parking can be pricy. I like the MUNI Passport (for 1, 3 or 7 days), it is convenient if you ride cable cars a lot (we had to do that to make our 3-yr-old happy). (3) The hotel is big on great guest services, not on impressive architecture (like the Atrium of the Hyatt Regency) or in-house amenities/activities (such as a swimming pool) which is not a problem since it is close to many attractions anyway. Want be treated well on your next SF trip? Try the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “parking was outrageous”
Reviews.Author: janet_and_rex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend the weekend after Thanksgiving, in order to shop in the area. The rooms were very nice, and the Fitness room was very clean and modern. I also found the service to be top notch, very friendly and personable. However, the $53 a day fee to park your car was really obsene. I was pretty upset about it, and there really wasn't any place nearby to park your car yourself. This fee should have been told to us when we made our reservation, as it adds a hefty fee to your bill.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven...”
Reviews.Author: RWHannaway
Reviews.Content: This is a classic beautiful hotel with a wonderful location near the base of Nob Hill. Step out the timeless entry and onto a cable car or take a walk in nearly any direction to find delicious restaurants. Less than a five minute walk to incredible dinning and shopping. The Hotel itself is fantastic with large luxurious rooms and truly impressive customer service. Each and every staff member down to the housekeepers was friendly, professional and fun. Within minutes we felt as though the Omni was our hotel and that we had stayed there many times (despite this being our first trip). Should anyone decide to take a trip to San Francisco and want a wonderful hotel to stay in, I give the Omni my highest recommendation possible!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChucknJoany
Reviews.Content: Hi, Spent two nights at the Omni San Francisco at the start of our holiday (see Hilton Hawaiian Village, Waikiki(fab) and Holiday Inn Express, Hollywood (not so fab) reviews. Booked the holiday through Lastminute but ended up booking most of the components myself after reading the reviews of the hotels here on Tripadvisor they planned to book me into. The Omni was a top notch hotel, very elegant,comfortable, welcoming and fantastically friendly staff. They even arranged their driver to drive us to the airport in their limo when we asked for a taxi (paid the same as the taxi fare but were much more comfortable). The cable cars run outside so you can use them and tick it off of the list of things you must do there. We had a late flight and asked if they could store our cases so we could do a bit of shopping but they insisted that we keep our room on until it was time to go at no extra charge. Will Smith was filming outside the hotel for the three days we were there so that also made our visit a little special. We are from Glasgow so we are used to the cold but even to us hardy souls San Fran was bitterly cold, considering it was the middle of September. Unseasonably so by all accounts ten degrees lower than normal. So hap up well if you are planning a visit. Took in some tours using allsanfranciscotours couldn't fault them. Alcatraz was excellent especially using the audio tour. Wee funny here - I phoned home from 'the rock' and with the time difference missed my son who had gone to work but managed to wake my niece who in her sleepy state picked me up wrong and told her mother I was phoning from jail, big panic all round!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies
Reviews.Content: This is simply one of the best City hotels we have ever stayed at. The location was superb right in the heart of the financial district and within walking distance of everything. The staff were courteous and friendly and the free internet access was a nice touch and always accessible. It was all the nice touches that made you want to stay night after night including the turndown service,mints and lovely bathroom products. This was our first stop as part of a west coast tour and it started off our vacation. We WILL definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beejerry
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night at the Omni and second at the Hyatt Regency. Omni is at all levels, including service, decor and location, beats the Hyatt. Room is small but adequate and the bathroom is luxurious. They even provide bathrobes and morning newspaper. Service are great, people working there always carry a smile. It is a couple of blocks from the Union Square and Chinatown. The only complaint was that guests across the hall was noisy! Would go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: zuberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus 12 year old daughter stayed for three nights at the Omni and had a lovely stay. The hotel is entrance is extremely impressive with lovely marble floors and lots of wood etc. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful with all our requests - Joey on the front desk was particuarly charming and remembered my name with no problem at all. Our room was extremely comfortable, at the end of a corridor with a welcoming note and fresh fruit and chocs left each night. Location is not bad either. Just over a block to walk into China town, Union Square 20 mins or so, and a good walk to Fisherman's Wharf - about 25 mins (this was no problem as we enjoy walking when we have the time!) Cable car does stop outside but we did not really try to catch as preferred to walk each day. Having tried to stay at the Argonaut down at Fisherman Wharf (fully booked and on seeing the hotel during our visit) I am really glad we chose to stay at the Omni. The hotel is extremely comfortable and offers a quiet and distinctly elegant stay. Whilst in San Fran we had an excellent meal in China Town at the Empress of China (recommended by the front desk) and also at the Stinking Rose (Garlic Restuarant) which I think was in Little Italy. Also breakfast at Mamas was well worth the queue outside. One tip is if you want to go to Alcratraz book on line prior to arriving in San Fran as this was totally booked up when we arrived which meant we could not go on the trip. Also had a fabulous tour with Mr Toad's tours in a 1920's wooden open bus and the trip over by Ferry to Solsalido was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights in early August, having made the booking based on the recommendations of this site. The hotel and staff were extremely welcoming, polite and efficient. Our room was of the highest standard in terms of furnishings, facilities and cleanliness - and quiet! The location was reasonably central for most attractions and was a short walk from Union Square and Chinatown - cable cars traverse the street in front of the hotel. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel as we prefer to eat outside for a broader experience and there were many eating and drinking establishments nearby to choose from. We hired a car for part of the stay and found a car park across the street at a reasonable rate. The local transport systems are also adjacent to the hotel and offer a good range of services. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home when in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Highway1Star
Reviews.Content: The first time I walked into my room at the Omni with my family we all gasped because the place was so beautiful. The room was tastefully decorated, the beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was stunning. Plus we had nice views and we were right on the cable car line that runs up California Street to Nob Hill. The people at the front desk were nice. The lobby was elegant and inviting. Be warned that valet parking will set you back nearly sixty dollars a day so leave the car at home. I have returned to the Omni with my family and we all just love it. You are going to like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and beautiful rooms. Also enjoyed the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “great location + Great rooms...”
Reviews.Author: neversummer
Reviews.Content: I was planning a 2 night stay in SF, and using tripadvisor...Omni turned out to be the best bang for the buck. So, i want to return the favor and put in my 2 cents since i was able to save a lot of $$$. First off, if you want to do a weekend getaway... I would suggest Sat, Sun and check out Mon..instead of Fri-Sun... the biggest money drain is the parking...$45/night...if you park at St. Mary's parking...it is $30/nite..M-F...but only $6.50 during weekends! So...by going on Sat, Sun..you save quite a bit. Ok..the good: Very nice, clean, and classy hotel...service and attitude were top notch...doormen were friendly and eager to help... ladies on the desk were knowledgable and efficient. The room is average size, but the bathroom was very classy. No motel quality here...the shower is tiled natural stone...(marble or granite)...sink was nice granite, and huge framed vanity mirror...fancy shower curtains and nice tiled floor. I hate cheap crappy plastic bathrooms... The bed was a double queen...it was pretty good as well...ive slept in better beds but this will do. Overall the room was very clean and well appointed. Signing up for the Omni select guest is worth it...you should do it well in advance so you get the additional coupons for upgrades and discounts. You must do this in advance to activate them... Location wise...it is very ideal...next to chinatown 2 blocks, 4 blocks to Union square and 4 blocks to Embarcadero center and 3 blocks to columbus ave bars.. china town is up the hill but if you can make it to st. mary's parking lot...you can make it to chinatown. Honestly though, I think getting a hotel by fishermans wharf wouldve been a better location...but then, you'd get a Motel quality place for a Hotel price tag... i chose the hotel...If you have a baby or kids... fisherman's wharf would be a better fit. But if you like bars..i think Omni would be great since Columbus ave bars is just next door...very cool place. Awesome chinese food (dimsum also) at Harbor village in the embarcadero. (order the nobleman's chicken $80..a day in advance. Its called Beggar's chicken in Hong Kong...absolutely amazing) RG lounge is also good chinese food that's walking distance... peking duck is good...but Harbor village takes all the awards. If you like steaks...and not afraid to drop $50+...Bob's chop house is awesome. I loooove steak... breakfasts/lunch is more reasonable.... but they have all the best cuts at night. Defintely worth going to. The BAD.. No swimming pool or spa... after walking up hills and blocks of concrete pavement... you'd want a spa to relax in. None. Bummer for kids. Hotel was sold out...so my select guest coupons and discounts were useless for upgrades...so call in advance. Parking is highway robbery.. they should have discounts for guests.. Overall... it is still a good experience. its no resort...its a business hotel, and maybe not a good pick if you have kids...but if you want a good place to sleep with your wife or girlfriend...close by to bars and great food. And without all the other complaints of moldy bathrooms, smelly beds, and crappy A/C... a nice respectable hotel like this is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni on Aug 12-14. We were starting a ten day tour of the California coast and celebrating our five year anniversary. Our stay at the Omni was a perfect way to start this very special vacation! I had researched several B&Bs and hotels through Trip Advisor and decided on the Omni. We got our room for $135 for night one and $140 for night two - woo hoo! I had concerns of hearing outside noise in our room, the location being far away from things we'd want to see (we had never been to San Francisco), and the price of the mini bar. Here is what we found: We never heard any outside noise in our room. I am a very light sleeper, and no outside noise could be heard. The location was excellent! We could get to the Wharf in 20 minutes walking. The front desk will tell you how to avoid the hills. We only rode the cable cars once to say that we did it. We also rode the bus once to Haight Ashbury (Golden Gate Park) which was a very interesting trip. Our favorite section was the Italian District, lots of great places to eat and cool little bars! A very easy walk to/from the Omni. Don't hesitate to ask the front desk how to get places. They are very helpful! The Omni is located in the Financial District, so on the weekends the sidewalks aren't crowded. Finally, we never even opened the mini bar because of some of the reviews that we had read. There is a Trader Joe's close by where we purchased some wine and snacks. From reading a past review I joined (free) the Select Guest Program. This is a must! Just go to --- and fill out a quick form. We signed up just days before our trip. Because I signed up late, I emailed the Omni our guest number just to make sure that they had it on file. This is an unbelievable program - for free! All of our requests were granted! You'll have to go to the site to check this program out...and sign up! We had a perfect stay at the Omni and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart at the Omni San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Paradegirl_nyc
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Omni from a deal another travel site. WOW! 5-star service all the way. The hotel is beautiful and the service is definitely 5-star. We had a king room on the 14th floor and it was perfect! Beautiful marble bathroom with great toiletries. Compliementry robes and fluffy towels! The housekeeping staff leaves notes each day for you and provides turndown service each night with fresh towels (our favorite!). As a select guest, they offer complimentry morning beverages and a cheaper in-room bfast menu. We had cheeseburgers from room service one night and they were very fast and ver good. We had bfast one day in the restaurant - which is very expensieve (but so is the normal Omni rate, so we understood). The business center is free 24-hours a day in the looby. The front desk/conceirge is fantastic and helped us get around on the trolley, the cable car (which runs outside) and the even use their town car! They also booked us a city tour which was great! VERY HIGHLY Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new #1 choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: thehups
Reviews.Content: We've been happy with Omni properties previously and with the "Phenomenal Fridays" rate that we got, couldn't pass up trying this one. Our biggest regret is that we didn’t extend our weekend another day for more time here! From the time we arrived, the service was very personable and great. Check in took less than two minutes and upon arriving in our room, found a welcome note on the bed. The hotel was clean and even the smallest request was granted without asking. One example was when going out for our anniversary dinner, it was obvious we were dressed up for a special occasion. Instead of hailing us a cab as requested, he had a town car brought over to take us to dinner, complimentary. A very nice touch! My two recommendations to anyone staying here would be to sign up for "Select Guest" so at the very least you will bet a free juice and paper in the AM (and a big discount on a bagel/muffin). The other would be to verify your room size at check in. Traditionally, we have found corner rooms at the Omni to be of larger size so we try and request those. Here, it was an odd configuration (and a bit smaller) with part of a wall impeding the entry. Not a big deal since we probably only spent 4-5 hours in our room outside of sleeping but thought I would pass that along if. If you want a snack, there is a Subway across the street, a Mrs. Fields on the next block and a convenience store just around the corner. We bought drinks there and put them in the ice bucket; ready to drink when we got back from the day. They even added fresh ice when both when cleaning the room and at turndown. Location couldn't be better as we walked to Pier 39, Union Square and a very small hill (more of a grade) up to Grant Street and Chinatown. The bar was perfect for what we were looking for at the end of a long day, not a major party scene and not completely empty. We could carry on a conversation, hear the cable car as it went by and just enjoy the evening. Service was quick and the drinks were actually priced good for a hotel bar. Once again, very friendly and accommodating. I'll also have to second the Italian restaurant that the concierge recommended as it was perfect for a not too expensive dinner and was a walk of only 2-3 minutes. I'll also have to second the Italian restaurant that the concierge recommended as it was perfect for a not too expensive dinner and was a walk of only 2-3 minutes. I think the best compliment came from my wife when she said, “I figured it would be nice but really had no idea it would be THIS nice.” Sure. getting a good rate helped but I’ll be back again and would still be just as happy paying full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Irvinista
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Omni in August. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite because the guest staying in the room the night before decided to stay another day. The suite was handsomely decorated and good sized. Service was impeccable, with very helpful and courteous staff. The hotel is centrally located. We were able to walk to Union Square (3 times in one day!), Chinatown, North Beach and Embarcadero within 10 minutes; Fisherman's Wharf in about 20 minutes. I've been to SF many times and by far this is the best hotel in my experience. We will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dominicinco
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco from July 29th-31st. We chose the Omni because of its great reviews and rank on here. It met both of our expectations in terms of service, quality, and cleaniness. The hotel was easy to find, right on California St and the cable car stop was across the street from the hotel. Check in was fast and friendly. We were upgraded to a bay view room in the highest floor. When we stepped into our room we both were pretty satisfied with it. Our room was a very good size considering what we've heard about SF's hotel room sizes. Our bathroom was very modern and elegant. They even included bath salts, which was a nice touch that we both enjoyed. Closet size was decent, includes full length mirror, plenty of hangers, two bath robes, ironing board with ironer, etc. The hotel offered turn down services both in the morning and evening. The housekeeping even left us a little friendly note wishing us a nice stay in SF. The hotel offers complimentary drinks in the morning with newspaper of your choice. Another plus which we thought was hard to come by was the complimentary high speed internet access, since we've stayed at other hotels that offer internet access but charge $10 and up per day. Good hotel to stay in for business or pleasure, maybe even family's with young children since the hotel tries to cater to them with goodie bags as I've seen. However the feel does not give that vibe. Front desk also acts as a concierge to direct you around the city. Overall, we were satisfied with the Omni and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surpise”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Nashville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights in Jul & was pleasantly suprised. I am a huge fan of the Kimpton hotels & always use them when in SF. This time I decided to try the Omni & was very pleased. The public rooms are lovely, the bathrooms nicely appointed & the room itself more than adequate. The buffet breakfast is very good, but as is the case usually in hotels, pricey. The location is great very near the Trans American building & Chinatown. The staff really shined though. Everyone I came into contact with spoke to me & was very pleasant & helpful. They gave me a wonderful suggestion for an Italian restaurant just around the corner. I would suggest this hotel to anyone. Free use of the business center, internet & printer was great! Kim Ann AAA Travel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidkillip
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended - We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights towards the end of July and were very impressed with the hotel. We had a good sized room with two double beds, nicely decorated with a good sized bathroom which was nicely fitted out. The only downside was the restaurant was not family friendly, it looked more suitable for business dining. However the breakfast was very good but quite expensive (if you went for the full American). The location of the Omni is also very pleasant - it is at the bottom of the Nob Hill area / start of the financial district with a cable car route passing in front of the hotel. The front office staff were very helpful and helped us find our way around. The free internet access was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of July. I thought the hotel was pretty good, but perhaps did not get the quality of service I expected due to the fact it was booked as a last-minute deal. We requested a King room on a higher floor (also called and confirmed the day before) and ended up in a double room on the 3rd floor. Not what we wanted (trust me -- doubles are small!) but still very nice. The staff was great at the front desk. They provided maps and told you the best way to get there. Very friendly and helpful. In addition, they recommended a place for dinner which turned out to be close, good and reasonably priced. Watch out for the hotel bar -- a drink and a piece of cake cost the same as a full dinner for two people at the aforementioned restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the Mini bar price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend and location and hotel itself are very good but one issue I did have was the minibar. After a days sightseeing we fancied a drink to finish the evening off and ordered some room servivce. Couldn't find a mini bar tariff so presumed (incorrectly) that it wouldnt be far off the room service price. Checked bill on TV the next day to find we had been charge 60 dollars for 2 cans of coke and a half bottle of wine which would have cost 30 dollars through room servvie. When I asked at reception they said that the prices were clearly explained on the tariff - when I explained that my room didnt have one the receptionist didnt believe me and offered to come up to the room to show me!. At this point i was extremely angry and asked why the mini bar was double the price of room service (which i had called for somthing to eat anyway) the reponse was again amazing - everyone knows how expensive the minibar is so you should have known. Coming from the Uk where the mini bar price is roughly the same as room service I pointed out how the hell was I to know. I asked for the manager who quicky dealt with the situation apologised for the manner which I was spoken too and knocked off 50%. As I say nice hotel but certain members of staff spoiled it slightly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 days and loved it. The hotel was clean and the service was amazing. The rooms were big and nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge too. Great hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat. The only issue, if any, would be that the restaurant was a bit pricey. The bar serves the same menu as the restaurant so there really is no place to get a small meal at a decent price. We ordered Room Service instead and that was delish. But overall, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sune
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 11 nights at the Omni San Francisco, first 8 nights May 30 – June 7, and then another 3 nights June 16-19. I was very pleased with my stay at the Omni San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the 24 hours business service; which means free internet and free access to Microsoft word, Microsoft PowerPoint and even a possibility to make PDF files as well; was very valuable for me. The room was big (400 sq. ft.), clean, quiet, enough with TV channels, and the turndown service with ice and some chocolate in the evening was very nice. During my second stay I was happily surprised when I came back to my room since the manager had given me some nice chocolates as a gift since I was staying a second time at Omni San Francisco. Before I went to San Francisco I sign up for Omni Hotels Select guest service and it meant that you every day during your stay received some complimentary water, soft drinks, coffee or tea in the morning. I also had a complimentary late check out until 5 pm without any problems. When I gave some tip to the housekeepers they wrote a thank note. I was very pleased with the excellent service at Omni San Francisco. The Omni San Francisco is located in the financial district and is about 15 min walking to Union Square, and 35 min walk to fishermans wharf. Two blocks away up on a steep hill is Chinatown located with its many restaurants. There is a Walgreens one block away on Montgomery Street and it is a MacDonalds two blocks away as well. One block away on Kearney Street is a good Thai Restaurant (Bangkoks best). One of the reviews I read about Omni San Francisco said that it was boring and another review says that they should not stay at Omni again because the bar at Omni was not lively enough. If you are in San Francisco and is looking for a hotel there you should party, Omni may not be your kind of hotel. However, if you are like me, that you appreciate a hotel with friendly and helpful staff, excellent service, 24 hours free internet and business service; big, clean and quite rooms, good location, and close to many restaurants, you should consider staying at the Omni San Francisco. I highly recommend Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A really great experience”
Reviews.Author: dalangdon
Reviews.Content: Having worked in the hotel business for ten years in a previous career, I am pretty jaded by hotels and their marketing hype. The San Francisco Omni, however, exceeded the hyperbole and provided me with a very pleasant stay in a city not necessarily known for exemplary hotels. My room was large and handsomely appointed, with a nice selection of amenities. The staff was friendly, gracious and unobtrusive, and the bar and restaurant were elegant spaces with good food. What more can you ask for? All in all, this was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in San Francisco. Definitely worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, centrally located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay in the financial district, but I'm very glad I did! My original reservation was in Fisherman's Wharf, but it's too crowded and touristy for my taste. This beautiful hotel is located right on the California Cable Car line. I was able to walk to Chinatown, Union Square, and North Beach. The one time we went to Fisherman's Wharf was just a cable car or bus ride away. I loved the marble bathrooms and bath amenities. Nice to take a soak after climbing the hills all day long. The staff was friendly and eager to please. The one mix-up I had regarding my package was taken care of quickly and they profusely apologized. I would not hesitate to stay there again. The Omni has spoiled me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: akcotham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni in San Francisco this past weekend with a friend for just one night. It's beautifully and centrally located, just above Union Square, lovely hotel, everything seemed very clean and neat, and the staff was quite friendly. However, there were, in my opinion, three minor strikes against our particular stay. They all felt like problems that wouldn't typically happen, but maybe because there was somebody new & inexperienced on staff or something like that. Nevertheless: 1) Reservations were under my friend's name. She called the day before to confirm. However, when she checked in, they told her that they had scheduled us to stay there on OCTOBER 11, not June 11. ??? Fortunately, she had the confirmation printout and they accommodated us immediately. 2) My friend is highly allergic to animal products, and while confirming, she requested that they remove any & all down products from the room--synthetic pillows & blankets only. Well, when we settled in for the night, she started wheezing, tearing up, sneezing. (She wasn't even in bed yet--we were just sitting around, chatting & watching TV.) Sure enough, they hadn't removed the down pillows or duvet. She called, told them she was unhappy and had to request another blanket, which they brought up immediately. 3) We ordered hot chocolate, and it came up to us extremely... lukewarm. So, the service seemed good, but... some of this stuff shouldn't have happened in the first place. I'd stay there again, but if I had any special requests, I would follow through immediately. And I'd send the hot chocolate back.

Reviews.Title: “attention to every detail”
Reviews.Author: cbareTallahassee_Fl
Reviews.Content: I was so happy we chose the omni hotel in san francisco. We were so please with all the attention to detail. It was a good size room with a very nice marble bathroom. We had fresh fruits waiting for us at arrival and a hand written note to welcome us to the hotel. The staff was wonderful and the location was great. It was within walking distance to union square and fishermans warf . Oh, one thing I forgot to mention the bed was so wonderful, I slept like a baby....We really didn't feel like we were at a hotel,we felt at home. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and we will choose this again for our next stay in san francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: ferdy7
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel if you want to be in the heart of San Francisco and yet away from all the traffic noise. This is in the Financial district which is only a few blocks away from Union Square. So on weekends everything dies down and you can enjoy peaceful suroundings. Very well appointed rooms, excellent service and way cheaper than some of the other big names that are not as nice on the interior. We had some loud partying neighbours and finally called the front desk at 11:45 pm and they took care of it immedately. Only issue is that Valet parking fee is $51 per 24 hrs - WOW! Suggest street parking on weekends which is free or the St Mary's Garage close by which is $6.50 per weekend night. You are out of luck on weekdays as parking is expensive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: dieselgirl_77
Reviews.Content: this hotel is worth the money we spent! we got a great deal through expedia. it's a little higher priced (more than $100 per night) but it was worth it! my review: 1. we were upgraded to their signature room when we checked in. it's located in the higher floors with high thread count bed linens, an "amazon" shower head, great "roomy" room with luxurious features & design 2. hotel itself is centrally located. if you don't mind walking about 4-5 blocks to: chinatown, nob hill & union square. you can also catch cable car which is right outside the entrance! cable car will take you to most major touristy sights in san fran, including fisherman's wharf. 3. staff extremely helpful & friendly. the disadvantage of staying in this area is it's in the financial district so there are really no restaurants right outside the hotel. but the hotel's steakhouse (bob's) i understand is one of the best in the city. another thing is the parking! since it's downtown, parking is expensive or hard to find. if you park with the hotel, they'll charge you $40+ for valet!! there is a carpark building across the street which charge about $30 for 24 hour parking (or overnight). there's hardly any street parking. but if you're not driving, it won't be a problem. there are cabs readily available & of course the cable car. overall, omni is one of the best hotels i've stayed in =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is Excellent. The staff went way above and beyond what i expected to make our first trip to the city great. The Omni was a thousand times better then 5 and 6 star hotels we have stayed at in the past. The Hotel was decorated in marbel and wood throughout. A high class hotel that also looked beautiful. Also conviently located to everything in the city. We will always stay at the Omni in San Francisco The best hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: dje
Reviews.Content: Just back from a (2) day stay at the Omni. After being a bit hesitant to stay at the property, only on the account that I prefer the newer, more contemporary decors of the W or Westin, I was pleasantly surprised. On arrival, we were welcomed as first-time tenants of this particular location (my wife is a Select Guest Gold member). This minor recognition was a nice touch. An even nicer touch was when we arrived in the room and found a bottle of wine, some chocolates, and a nice letter of welcome from the Select Guest manager. We were sold! Room was great. Excellent corner location. Bathrooms were amply supplied with towels and well-lit. There was a sound system and DVD in-room as well. Valet was ultra efficient in retrieving our car within 15 mins. A bit expensive (~$45), but not more than any other hotel in the area. 5 stars for the Omni. With their personalized service, they have made me a repeat customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading everyone else's review, I felt confident about choosing the Omni. It was fantastic!!!! The room was huge and extremely clean. The staff was very friendly, professional, and accommodating. It's an upscale hotel, without the "snooty" attitudes. I felt comfortable there, and enjoyed how quiet my room was too. Location was perfect. Just expect to pay a $40 cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is excellent for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: jcrickbc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Omni. I travel a lot and have very high standards for service, location and room quality. The rooms at Omni are nice and spacious and very clean. I especially appreciated the hand written note each day from housekeeping. Another nice touch was that when four of us arrived to check in at the same time, the bellman jumped right in to check one of us in. He has a little basket of reservation information with room keys all ready to go. After a quick credit card imprint, we were on our way. It's not often you see hotel staff able to do each others' tasks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hanapepe
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant to stay at a hotel in the financial area instead of Union Square. But we were pleasantly surprised. No busy crowds. The hotel was very conveniant to all the major attractions, Embacadero, Ferry Bldg., Columbus Ave, Chinatown and Union Sq. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The standard room was of good size. Register at Omni's preferred guest on line and you will get newspapers, coffee and juice delivered to your room each morning gratis. Many nice restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet and Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: ambmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days in April and enjoyed our stay very much. I am picky about hotels, especially bathrooms and I didn't have one complaint about this one. The bathrooms were all marble and the cleaning staff did a great job keeping our room clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, this being our first trip out to San Francisco, they had good recommendations for places to eat and were helpful with directions. The hotel was much more of a business type hotel with business clientele, being in our twenties we often felt like the youngest couple there, dressed much more casually than the rest of the hotel patrons. Nonetheless, it was a good location, with chinatown being 2 blocks away, Union square 5-6 blocks away, and we often walked to Fisherman's wharf and ghiradelli square for dinner and rode the cable cars back. This is a hotel where you can do all you want during the day and have a nice place to relax when you are return. ***Advice: Bring comfortable walking shoes and a light jacket***

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Service”
Reviews.Author: babalootie
Reviews.Content: Lovely elegant room, not large, but nicely appointed with marble bath, minibar, free dsl. In-room CD player with a library at the front desk, could be more extensive, but hey. If you join the frequent stay club before you go, they will provide you with free morning beverages delivered to your room, reasonably priced room service (who ever heard of that!) and a newspaper. Parking is simply outrageous at $49 a night...I got rid of my rental car, and instead of returning it to the airport was able to drop it a few blocks away thanks to the quick intervention of the front desk personnel. The doormen, desk staff, housekeepers, all wonderful. I did have a nonfunctioning bathtub drain which wouldn't shut; a repairman was dispatched who said it was installed incorrectly and offered to change my room; after a call he kept working and pronounced it fixed. It wasn't fixed. Alas. The extraordinary amenity bath salts from Institute Swiss, down the drain...but that was the only hitch. All in all a wonderful stay in a well-located downtown property. A few blocks from the hot embarcadero center, and I even found a wine shop open Sunday at 7PM. You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Pick in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Mrbigjerk
Reviews.Content: While my wife and I normally stay at newer, trendier properties, the San Francisco Omni won us over with it's friendly, professional staff and convienent location. While our 17th story King room didn't offer the best views (think portholes for windows), the room itself was clean, quiet, well appointed, but not spectacular. Housekeeping did a fine job maintaining the room, but neglected to ensure a second roll of toilet paper was available. The mints offered during the evening turndown service were a nice touch. The hotel is more of a business hotel than resort property...no pools, spas, activity rooms, or even a small gift shop to be found. The business center did offer computers with complimentary high speed internet access, and the health club offered a variety of workout machines. Located midway between the Wharf and Union Square, and on the California street cable car line, the S.F. Omni is nicely located in the center of the financial district...seemingly hundreds of ATM's within a couple of blocks. Most attractions are easily within walking distance...but beware the hills, they can be a full blown cardio workout. Parking though is simply outrageous. $45 dollars a day puts the Omni well above neighboring garages...after the first night, we found cheaper near-by alternatives. Overall, the Omni staff impress you with their friendly demeanor and efficency...and although the property won't make you say "wow", it's one of the better hotels we've ever stayed at. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say whenever we stay at the Omni It is above par. The entire experience is awesome. The comfortability of the bedding at the relaxing atmosphere is unbeatable. I can't say the same for the Grand Hyatt i stayed at in Union Square. Never will i make the same mistake. I am forever in debt to the Omni staff for making my stay the best of any hotel. Thank you again. You should all be commended. Ohh and give yourselves a raise.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Top This”
Reviews.Author: Golfer919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Sunday night in March. Doorman was fantastic, and front desk staff were amazing. Its in the financial district, so that night there was hardly any street traffic. The next morning we walked to Union Square and its about a 7 block walk. Everytime we entered the lobby from the elevator or front door, we were always greeted cheerfully by name. This is a smaller hotel than the big monsters like the St.Francis, so there is not a gift shop, but a Bob's Steak and Chop House Restaurant. We were familiar with Bob's from Texas, but never ate there. We had planned to move the next day to the Monaco to be closer to Union Square, and noticed an immediate drop in service level. The rooms at the Omni are average size, and have a nice marble bathroom. They could use a separate shower. The room we had on the top floor, had a fruit basket and fax machine. Upon checkout, we were teased about leaving after just one night, and asked if they had done anything wrong. We replied Omni Service was great. During our stay in San Francisco, we went to the Ferry Market on Tue when they have local farmers kiosks set up. We also took a tour of the city with Great Pacific, a local small very nice tour company. Also drove one day over to Sausalito. Dined at Scoma's on the Wharf, Tadich Grill, Sam's Grill, and the Cheesecake Factory on Union Square. For lunch, there is a very busy In N Out Burger on the Wharf. Very good meals at all of them. The Cannery shops seemed to have fizzled since the 70's, and now the action has moved to Ghiardelli Square and Pier 39. We really loved our stay at the Omni, and talked about it on the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Ohhhhhh the Omni”
Reviews.Author: MissJaynesjourney
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a wonderful Hotel. I am always made to feel like a princess when I stay here. Service here is on par with a Four Seasons! Internet access is complimentary there is even a complimentary business centre. The rooms are spotless, classic well equipped. I definitely recommend this hotel for business and pleasure, A short walk to the Ferry building (San Francisco's new dinning hub) and the all time classic the Taditch (the oldest restaurant in San Fran) I have only stayed on the 16th and 17th floors (upgraded rooms) These have down comforters, Luxury linens fruit basket etc. All employees at the Omni go out of their way to ensure you stay is Memorable

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - all round top choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni with my wife and boy for 2 nights prior to Christmas. Have stayed in several SF hotels before and Omni certainly stands out. Room was v comfortable, albeit standard size, but bed huge, plenty of room for cot, good closet for all the bags and a smart bathroom. Room service exceeded our expectation and food was of a high quality whilst not being extortionately priced. As far as location goes if you are a visitor and given SF is a city to sample using your feet the Omni is in a great spot. Plenty going on up and down California to watch and get the feel, 10 mins to Union Sq, Chinatown is around the corner (although up the hill, but then where isn't in SF?) and you can walk to Fish Wharf in around 30 minutes or so via Colombus and North Beach. All round the Omni is a comfortable, classy, great place to stay, from which you can sample a wonderful city.

HotelInfo.Name: Omni San Francisco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 500 California Street, San Francisco, CA 94104
